1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Gather the ingredients.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Roast the poblano chiles under a broiler or directly over the burner of a gas stove until singed on all sides. Remove the skins, stems, and seeds.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Cut the flesh of the roasted chiles in very thin strips or chop them into pieces of about 1/2 inch / 1-centimeter square.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Place about 1/3 of the chile strips or pieces into a blender and add the salsa verde, cilantro, and the crema. Process until completely blended.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d If you have decided to fry your tortillas, pour oil into a skillet until it is about half an inch (1 centimeter) deep. Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Using tongs, place one tortilla into the hot oil for about 2 seconds, turn, then leave 2 more seconds. The tortilla should not change color or become hard.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Remove the tortilla from the oil, shake it over the skillet to drain off excess oil, and place it on a plate. Continue in this way until all the tortillas have been briefly fried.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Place the tortillas (regardless of whether they have been fried or not), onto a cutting board. Cut them in two, forming half circles. Preheat the oven on to 375 F / 190 C.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Pour the blended sauce into a wide, shallow bowl. One by one, lift a piece of tortilla with the tongs and place it into the sauce, turning it over once so that both sides get covered. Place it in the bottom of a lightly greased glass or metal baking dish that measures approximately 8 inches (20 centimeters) square. Continue in this way until the bottom is completely covered (which should take 5 or 6 tortilla halves).
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Place half of the remaining poblano chiles, half the chicken, and half of the vegetables on top of the tortillas in the dish. Sprinkle on one-third of the shredded cheese. Top with a few spoonfuls of sauce.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Repeat the procedure to form another layer of sauce-covered tortillas topped with chiles, chicken, veggies, and cheese. Create a final layer of sauce-covered tortillas. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top, and distribute any remaining sauce around the sides of the baking dish.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Bake for about 30 minutes, until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is slightly browned. Allow to sit at room temperature for 15 minutes so that it can firm up a bit.
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Use a sharp knife to cut your dish into squares and a spatula to dish portions onto individual plates.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Gather the ingredients.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c In a medium-sized saucepan, heat oil over medium heat. Add the fresh onion and sauté for 1 or 2 minutes until softened and translucent.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Add the dry rice and continue sautéeing, stirring frequently, for about 5 minutes or until rice becomes a golden brown color. Do not allow the rice to burn.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Add the garlic to the rice and sauté for one more minute.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Take the pan off the heat; add the chicken broth and tomato sauce, plus the parsley and/or vegetables, if using. Stir, return pan to heat and bring to a boil. Turn the heat to low and cover.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Let simmer for 20 minutes without taking the lid off. After 20 minutes, remove the lid and carefully insert a spoon into the cooked rice. (If the bottom of the pan is dry, your rice is done; if there is still some broth visible, allow it to cook for a few more minutes.)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Once the rice is done cooking, remove it from the heat and let it sit, covered and undisturbed, for another 10 minutes or so.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Fluff your rice with a fork before serving. Use your delicious homemade rice as a side for almost any savory Mexican dish.
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Serve and enjoy!
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Gather the ingredients.
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Heat the oil or lard in a medium-sized saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onions, garlic, and fresh chile pepper; sauté for 2 or 3 minutes, stirring occasionally so that the ingredients soften but do not brown.
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the tomatoes and cook for 5 or 6 minutes, stirring once in a while, until they become soft. (Roma tomatoes may need a little more time, as they are not as juicy and do not “wilt” as readily.)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Add the oregano, ground chile (if using), and salt to taste; simmer for about 5 more minutes.
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Use sauce as-is if you like the texture or let it cool down and process it in a blender (straining after blended, if desired) if you prefer a smoother sauce.
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Enjoy!
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 Warm the oil in a medium saucepan. Saute the garlic briefly to release its flavor.
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 Add the tomatoes and onions and cook over low heat until the tomatoes soften about 20 minutes.
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 Add the jalapeño pepper, olives, oregano, capers, water, and salt to taste. Simmer for an additional 20 minutes.
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 Serve your delicious Veracruz Sauce over grilled or pan-fried white fish or chicken breast. Accompany this with white rice, if you like.
6eabfaa0-56ae-41aa-977d-f019142f28ea Salt the rim of a chilled beer mug.
6eabfaa0-56ae-41aa-977d-f019142f28ea Pour tequila into the glass.
6eabfaa0-56ae-41aa-977d-f019142f28ea Tip the glass and slowly pour the beer on top.
6eabfaa0-56ae-41aa-977d-f019142f28ea Garnish with a lime wedge.
339173f8-be46-4c5a-ac9c-4bf51e00e801 Gather the ingredients.
339173f8-be46-4c5a-ac9c-4bf51e00e801 Whisk together chili powder, Hungarian sweet paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, chipotle pepper powder, dried oregano leaves, and salt until evenly combined.
339173f8-be46-4c5a-ac9c-4bf51e00e801 Place Mexican spice mix in an airtight glass jar and store in a cool, dark place.
339173f8-be46-4c5a-ac9c-4bf51e00e801 Use within 3 months. Shake before each use to re-combine.
330558d9-f5a1-4325-a4c3-91afb8419030 Grab a handful of cilantro leaves from the top of the bunch and pull them out firmly to get mostly leaves. If a few stems are in there, that’s fine.
330558d9-f5a1-4325-a4c3-91afb8419030 OR do as Mexican taco makers do and don’t even bother to take the leaves off the stem; just cut the roots off the bunch and chop leaves and stems together.
330558d9-f5a1-4325-a4c3-91afb8419030 Mix all ingredients until well incorporated.
330558d9-f5a1-4325-a4c3-91afb8419030 Eat immediately for the freshest flavor or refrigerate overnight.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Gather the ingredients.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Chop the onion and place it in a strainer. Rinse it for a few seconds under running water. Shake off water and set aside. This rinsing of the onion is done in order to soften its flavor without sacrificing texture in the finished product; omit this step if you prefer a strongly onion-flavored salsa.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Cut the roots off the cilantro. Chop the cilantro, leaves, and stems together.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Cut the stems off the chile peppers. Open them up and remove the seeds and veins if you prefer a milder salsa; leave them if you would like it very spicy. Dice the chile flesh.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Place all the chopped ingredients into a blender or food processor. Add the cranberries, sugar, lime juice, olive oil, and salt. Pulse (turning the device on and off rapidly) a few times, until all the ingredients are very finely chopped. Stop before liquefying completely. Move the ingredients around with a spoon between pulses in order to get a homogenous blend. Work slowly and patiently to achieve a good salsa texture and to avoid ending up with a spiritless puree.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Pour your salsa into a glass jar or ceramic serving dish. This can be served immediately, but I always find it tastier after having sat for a few hours or overnight to allow the flavors to meld. Store your delicious cranberry salsa in the fridge. Take it out and let it sit at room temperature for half an hour or so before serving.
3f67e86e-7911-4553-9d48-c91fe27a8c68 Enjoy.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Gather the ingredients.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Combine the flour and water in a large bowl and mix to form a dough.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Knead for a minute until smooth and then cover with a kitchen towel and let rest for 30 minutes.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Roll the dough into small balls between the palms of your hands and press firmly in a tortilla press. It helps to line the press with plastic wrap so the dough doesn't stick. You'll likely adjust the size of the balls as you get the hang of it.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Heat a griddle to medium-high. Once each tortilla is pressed you can warm it on the griddle for about a minute on each side, or maybe a bit longer depending on how light or dark you want them.
c70d8d72-ba1e-4e92-be39-c999174a8d91 Serve as a wrapping for your favorite tacos!
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, beat the oil, sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until combined. Add the eggs to the sugar mixture one at a time and beat on medium speed until fully incorporated. Stir in 1/2 cup of milk, then gently fold in the flour mixture a little at a time.
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Pour the batter into a lightly greased cake pan or baking dish, and bake the cake at 325 F for 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in several locations comes out clean.
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Let the cake cool in the pan to room temperature. Turn it out onto a platter with raised edges. Pierce the cake with a fork 20 to 30 times. Let it cool in the refrigerator for an additional 30 minutes.
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Make the cream syrup while the cake chills. Whisk together the three milks and the rum or brandy if desired. Slowly pour the liquid over the cooled cake. Refrigerate it for 1 hour, periodically spooning the milk runoff back onto the cake.
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Make the whipped topping just before you serve the cake. Combine heavy cream, vanilla, and sugar in a chilled mixing bowl. Beat it on high speed until peaks form. Spread a thin layer of the whipped topping over the cake.
e237a98d-91ee-43a5-9b2b-cf5322a88c06 Top it with a sprinkle of cinnamon or garnish it with fresh berries.
4abbf954-7daa-48b5-8344-a41b7da203fa Gather the ingredients.
4abbf954-7daa-48b5-8344-a41b7da203fa Grind the annatto, coriander seeds, oregano, cumin seeds, peppercorns, and cloves in a spice mill or with a mortar and pestle. You also can use a coffee grinder to do this, but as it will leave the seasoning flavor behind, make sure you do not plan to use the grinder for coffee again.
4abbf954-7daa-48b5-8344-a41b7da203fa Place the ground spices and the salt, the garlic, and the bitter orange juice in a blender and process until it is smooth.
4abbf954-7daa-48b5-8344-a41b7da203fa Store your achiote paste in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Use as instructed in your recipe.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Heat a large saucepan or pot over medium-high heat and add in the cooking oil. Swirl it around to coat the bottom of the pan or pot.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Sprinkle the flour over pieces of chicken and rub it in evenly over the surface.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Carefully place the chicken pieces one at a time into the hot pan and let it sizzle for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until it's browned nicely. The idea is not to cook it, but to sear the outside to seal in the juices.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Place the chicken in a slow cooker.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c One at a time, sprinkle with the ground cumin, chili powder, oregano, garlic, and salt.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Add the cans of chopped green chiles, and the can of tomatoes. You can pour them right on top of the chicken.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Peel the onion, and chop it into 1/4 pieces or smaller. Add those in as well.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Pour the water or chicken broth into the bottom of the crockpot, it should come up at least an inch or so on the bottom of the crockpot. You don't want the liquid to come up too high, or it will be soupy.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Cook on low for 7 to 8 hours. After the time is up, the chicken should be fork tender and fall apart easily. There should be barely any liquid in the bottom of the pan and what is left should be of a gravy consistency.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Use two forks or a slotted spoon to remove the chicken from the crockpot.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Place it on a platter and top with the chiles and tomato mixture.
c95b109f-e917-4c03-be02-48014aceea1c Serve it with a stack of hot tortillas and toppings such as chopped onion, chopped cilantro leaves, and hot chili sauce.
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Gather the ingredients.
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Divide the masa into 10 evenly sized balls. Roll each ball between two pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper to form a disc about 4 inches across (or use a tortilla press, if you have one).
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Cut the cheese into 10 slices and place one in the center of each tortilla. Add a small spoonful of the additional fillings, if using. Fold the tortilla in half and press the edges with dampened fingers to seal it.
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Pan fry (or deep fry) the quesadillas in batches in about one inch of hot oil or lard, turning once or twice until the masa turns golden brown on both sides and gets slightly crispy.
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Drain the fried quesadillas on a rack or several layers of absorbent paper before serving, and eat with your hands. Alternatively, lay the quesadilla on its side and gently break it open longitudinally at the top, dab sauce to taste over the exposed filling. Be careful, the filling will be very hot.
cd731785-a46d-48aa-a7fc-dd1bb69e8da9 Enjoy!
9ee25481-c5cf-4cfa-865d-60e5d36afcac After chiles are roasted and peeled, cut the stem area off, and make a cut down the side of the chile. Open it up, and scrape the seeds out with a spoon.
9ee25481-c5cf-4cfa-865d-60e5d36afcac Blend chiles in food processor until chunky.
9ee25481-c5cf-4cfa-865d-60e5d36afcac Add in remaining ingredients and process until smooth.
9ee25481-c5cf-4cfa-865d-60e5d36afcac Use the finished sauce immediately, refrigerate it for 2 to 3 days, or freeze it for up to 6 months as desired.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Gather the ingredients.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Lightly coat a large frying pan with the vegetable oil; heat it over medium-high heat until the oil shimmers.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Spread the tortilla chips in the pan.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Quickly pour the salsa over the chips and reduce the heat to medium-low. Simmer the chips in the sauce, undisturbed, until the chips absorb some of the liquid and soften, for approximately 10 minutes.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Divide the chilaquiles between two plates; sprinkle half of the cheese on each and drizzle with half of the crema.
c7ef1c4c-f70d-4dc0-b841-f1b7a2438879 Serve and enjoy!
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Gather the ingredients.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Leave the tortillas out in your kitchen, uncovered, overnight.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Cut them into wedges using a knife or pizza cutter. Three cuts will make 6 chips from each tortilla. But you can stack them and do 2 or 3 at a time.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Heat the oil to 360 F. The oil will bubble around the tip of a wooden spoon.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Add enough chips to cover the bottom of the pan in a single layer, without crowding or overlapping.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Fry for 2 to 3 minutes or until the chips have turned lightly golden brown and are quite crisp and firm. Flip them occasionally with a pair of tongs so that they cook evenly.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Remove each chip from the oil with your tongs, letting excess oil drain back into the pan, and transfer to paper towels, sprinkle with salt, and then repeat the process until all the chips are cooked.
9314327f-e535-4119-81ca-84a3f6ac73ce Serve warm with fresh homemade salsa.
d7cb56af-d71d-48a8-ae7a-3cf75f54299e Heat the oil or lard in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Saute the onions and chilies for 2 to 3 minutes, or until they turn fragrant. Add the rice and cook it, stirring frequently, for about 1 minute, until it turns translucent.
d7cb56af-d71d-48a8-ae7a-3cf75f54299e Add the chicken and garlic and cook it for about 2 more minutes, stirring once or twice. Pour in the broth, tomato puree, and salt and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat immediately until the liquid barely simmers.
d7cb56af-d71d-48a8-ae7a-3cf75f54299e Cover the pot and let it simmer undisturbed for 25 minutes. Take the pan off the heat and let it sit, without lifting the lid, for an additional 5 minutes (or up to half an hour).
d7cb56af-d71d-48a8-ae7a-3cf75f54299e Serve arroz con pollo with a garnish of chopped onion, cilantro, or diced chilies.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 Gather the ingredients.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 In a large mixing bowl mix the masa harina with the warm water or broth. Allow the mixture to sit for about 20 minutes to soften somewhat, then beat with an electric mixer on low speed until a dough forms. (You now have masa.)
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 Sprinkle the salt, onion powder, cumin, and chili powder over the dough, if desired, and mix again until well combined.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 In a separate bowl, whip the lard with an electric mixer for about three minutes or until fluffy.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 Add the lard to the dough, beating in a little at a time, until well combined.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 Your masa should be about the consistency of peanut butter. If it’s too dry, mix in a little more water or broth; if your dough is too loose, add more masa harina until you get the desired texture.
d64890e4-5dfe-4e1a-89c3-3007bf8852d6 Use your masa immediately or cover and store it in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours. Your tamale dough is ready when you're ready to make tamales!
7e80b45a-5d31-4bfb-a05f-c873a1c1b41d Gather the ingredients.
7e80b45a-5d31-4bfb-a05f-c873a1c1b41d In a large bowl, use your hands to mix the ground pork, chili powder, paprika, oregano, cinnamon, cloves, cumin, salt, garlic, and vinegar, until well combined.
7e80b45a-5d31-4bfb-a05f-c873a1c1b41d Use immediately in your favorite recipe calling for Mexican chorizo, or refrigerate or freeze the sausage in an airtight container for later use.
7e80b45a-5d31-4bfb-a05f-c873a1c1b41d To cook, fry the chorizo in a large skillet over medium heat. Break up the sausage with a spatula or fork as you go so that the finished product is loose and not chunky. Drain off any excess fat.
7e80b45a-5d31-4bfb-a05f-c873a1c1b41d Serve and enjoy.
036bd95d-878a-451f-97aa-83d14c25d27d If you would like to salt the glass, place a generous layer of salt on a saucer or small plate.
036bd95d-878a-451f-97aa-83d14c25d27d Take a lime wedge or a bit of triple sec and rub it around the outside edge of the glass to moisten.
036bd95d-878a-451f-97aa-83d14c25d27d Turn the glass upside down and press the rim into the salt.
036bd95d-878a-451f-97aa-83d14c25d27d Return glass to an upright position and continue with the recipe. ​Note: The salt should be on the outside of the glass so that it comes in contact with the lips but does not mix in with the drink itself. This same treatment can be done with sugar if you desire a sweeter cocktail experience.
036bd95d-878a-451f-97aa-83d14c25d27d Shake the tequila, triple sec, lime juice and sugar in a shaker, or stir ingredients vigorously with a spoon. (Alternatively, you can process the mixture in a blender, if you prefer.) Pour over ice (crushed or cubes). Garnish with a slice of lime, if you like, and enjoy!
80bc6bee-b2ed-448c-be7e-9c94e12085fb Mix chiles, cheese, chile sauce, corn and sugar in a medium bowl.
80bc6bee-b2ed-448c-be7e-9c94e12085fb Place about 2 tablespoons of filling down center of a tortilla and roll it up tightly.
80bc6bee-b2ed-448c-be7e-9c94e12085fb Secure with a toothpick and place seam side down on a plate.
80bc6bee-b2ed-448c-be7e-9c94e12085fb Roll up all of the flautas and fry 3 or 4 at a time in 350 F hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
80bc6bee-b2ed-448c-be7e-9c94e12085fb Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Gather the ingredients.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Heat the lard or oil in a medium skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Sauté the onion and serrano chili for about 20 seconds.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Add the machaca and cook for about 1 minute more.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Mix in the tomatoes and seasonings. Remove the mixture from the pan and set aside, keeping it warm.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe In the same pan, scramble the eggs until they just barely set.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Remove the pan from the heat and fold in the tomato and machaca mixture.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Let the eggs sit in the hot pan for an additional minute to finish cooking.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Serve machaca con huevos with hot flour tortillas and refried beans, if you like. Garnish with a scoop of smashed avocado and tomato slices.
37f944ec-36cd-45bc-9830-0c8b34431cbe Enjoy!
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 Gather the ingredients.
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 Rinse beans and check for debris. Place the beans in a large pot and fill with water (approximately 7 cups). Add epazote (if using). Bring to a boil, then cover the pot and reduce the heat to a slow simmer. Cook for about 2 hours and leave the beans in their cooking liquid.
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 When beans are extremely soft, prepare a large skillet by heating the bacon drippings, lard, or oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and chile (if using). Sauté until the onion and garlic have softened. Remove the chile at this point for milder spice or leave them in if you want spicier beans.
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 Using a slotted spoon, add in about 1/2 cup of the cooked beans. Mash the beans with the back of the spoon, a fork, or a potato masher. If the mixture seems thick, add a tablespoon of the cooking liquid from the beans.
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 Continue to add the beans and mash them together, adding more of the cooking liquid as necessary. Season with salt to taste.
13b58135-bb7f-455c-9f92-331c70c25b20 Serve immediately. Store leftover refried beans in the refrigerator for up to a week or freeze in a sealed container for up to two months.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 In medium bowl, mix masa harina and salt.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 Slowly add water until the dough becomes smooth and firm, not sticky.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 Turn dough out onto board and divide it into 12 equal portions. Roll into balls.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 If you have a tortilla press, follow the tool’s instructions for flattening the tortillas.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 By hand, place a tortilla ball between two sheets of wax paper. Use rolling pin to roll dough out into a thin tortilla shape.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 To cook, place one tortilla at a time in a large ungreased frying pan. Cook over moderate hot heat for about one to two minutes on each side, or until each side is lightly browned.
5ac03806-443c-451a-b758-4d38fe742216 When finished cooking all the tortillas, wrap them together in aluminum foil and place in warm oven (about 300 degrees F) for 5 minutes.
a9662617-9f6a-4daf-a042-539cac8a214f Gather the ingredients.
a9662617-9f6a-4daf-a042-539cac8a214f Peel the avocados, and remove their pits. Mash the flesh of two of them with the back of a fork or other mashing utensil. Dice the other two into 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch cubes.
a9662617-9f6a-4daf-a042-539cac8a214f Mix the mashed avocado with the diced onion, chile pepper, and cilantro. Fold in crema or sour cream and lime juice. Add salt and pepper to taste.
a9662617-9f6a-4daf-a042-539cac8a214f Fold the diced avocado and tomato into the mashed avocado mixture.
a9662617-9f6a-4daf-a042-539cac8a214f Use immediately or cover with plastic wrap (making sure the plastic completely touches all surfaces of the guacamole so that air exposure is minimized) and consume within a few hours.
5ac2d07a-d2f5-4b31-a3d9-7cf36692ef61 Heat the oil in a medium-sized pot over medium heat and saute the diced onions. When the onions have turned translucent, add the shallots, rice, jalapeno pepper, and green onions. Saute, stirring frequently, until the rice begins to turn golden.
5ac2d07a-d2f5-4b31-a3d9-7cf36692ef61 Add the chicken broth, tomato sauce, chile sauce, cumin, and oregano; stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then turn it down to a simmer. Cover the pot and continue to simmer for about 17 minutes, following the cooking instructions on the package of rice.
5ac2d07a-d2f5-4b31-a3d9-7cf36692ef61 When rice is cooked, remove from the heat, leaving the lid on. Let sit for 20 minutes.
5ac2d07a-d2f5-4b31-a3d9-7cf36692ef61 When ready to serve, fluff your delicious spicy Mexican rice with a fork and dish out with a large spoon.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Gather the ingredients.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Heat the lard in a large skillet over medium-low to medium heat.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Add the onions and garlic and cook until the onions turn translucent, about 8 to 10 minutes. You do not want the onions to turn brown; adjust the temperature as necessary. When the onions soften enough to drape over your spatula, set the skillet aside.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 In a blender, purée the roasted tomatoes with the peanuts or peanut butter.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Add the oregano, cinnamon, anise, peppercorns, thyme, clove, and cocoa powder, and blend to make a smooth paste.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Add the sautéed onions and garlic to the blender container and purée again.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Add the chiles and raisins and blend into a smooth paste.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Pour all of the chicken broth except for 1/4 cup into a large saucepan.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 In a separate small bowl, make a roux by whisking the masa with the reserved 1/4 cup of chicken broth.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Stir the roux into the broth and whisk until smooth.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Add the puréed ingredients to the pan. Cover and simmer for 1 hour.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Uncover and continue cooking until the mole turns thick and aromatic.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Use your homemade mole as a sauce for chicken or turkey or chunks of pork, sprinkling toasted sesame seeds over each portion as you serve.
a1415207-5c1c-4d3c-b29c-f3818a4ae4c1 Any leftover mole tastes delicious spooned over rice or fried eggs or used as an enchilada sauce.
9d36ecb6-04de-4a37-b7f5-b7716c34b34e Gather the ingredients.
9d36ecb6-04de-4a37-b7f5-b7716c34b34e Roast the chiles and bell pepper by placing them under a hot broiler or on a hot grill or on a hot comal. Turn them frequently until all the skin is charred.
9d36ecb6-04de-4a37-b7f5-b7716c34b34e While the chiles are blackening, slice the onion into 3 to 4 large slices (discard the stem and bottom piece) and place under the broiler or grill until browned (not blackened.)
9d36ecb6-04de-4a37-b7f5-b7716c34b34e Remove the charred skins from the chiles and pepper as well as the seeds and the entire stem. Place in a food processor with the rest of the ingredients and pulse until the ingredients are finely chopped and well incorporated.
f7cd3495-4bbc-4bb2-abd2-74d05af1a15c Gather the ingredients.
f7cd3495-4bbc-4bb2-abd2-74d05af1a15c With a whisk, mix together the milk, mayonnaise, and sour cream in a mixing bowl until smooth.
f7cd3495-4bbc-4bb2-abd2-74d05af1a15c Add the dry ranch dressing mix and the remaining seasonings; whisk again until smooth and all seasonings are blended evenly.
f7cd3495-4bbc-4bb2-abd2-74d05af1a15c Place mixture in a covered container and refrigerate at least 1 hour so that the dressing can thicken and the seasonings have time to release their flavors.
f7cd3495-4bbc-4bb2-abd2-74d05af1a15c Spoon into one or more small pitchers or serving bowls. Pour onto salads or use as a dipping sauce.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Gather the ingredients.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf To begin, place the masa harina in a large bowl. Sprinkle in the baking powder, and use a fork to toss together the mixture well.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Add the warm water to the masa.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Use a spoon or fork to begin mixing the water into the masa harina mixture until the mixture becomes too thick to continue mixing with a utensil. Then, use your hands to mix and knead the dough several times until it forms into a soft ball.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Divide the dough into 12 portions by tearing off a small portion of the dough, and rolling it between the palms of your hands until you form it into a ball about the size of a golf ball.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Place the rolled ball of dough on a baking sheet or pan while you roll the remaining dough, and cover with a damp towel or plastic wrap to keep the dough from drying out —it will become crumbly and impossible to roll out if dried out. Repeat this process until you have used all of the masa.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Place a cast iron skillet over medium heat.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf While the pan is heating, begin rolling out your first tortilla. A tortilla press will make things faster, but you can easily roll out the tortillas by hand: collect two large plastic sandwich bags and lay them flat. Place one of the rolled balls of dough on the middle of one of the sandwich bags, and cover it with the other.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Place a large, round, flat surface on top of the top plastic bag like a cake pan, or round dish. Press the dough into a flat circle of 6-inch diameter.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Peel the pressed tortilla from the plastic bags, and place it in the hot cast-iron skillet. Cook the tortilla for 45 seconds to one minute on each side, until it is no longer doughy.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Place the cooked tortilla on a plate, and cover with a damp towel to keep from drying out. Carefully continue the process to cook the remaining tortillas. If you feel comfortable enough with the process, you can quickly roll out one tortilla at a time while the previous tortilla is cooking in the pan.
f228938c-91e7-411a-a98e-655247203fbf Enjoy!
3cd23ba5-0477-4360-8438-9826af5600a7 Beat eggs, crema, salt, cumin, and garlic powder together.
3cd23ba5-0477-4360-8438-9826af5600a7 Heat oil or lard in a medium round frying pan over medium heat. Pour in the egg mixture and turn heat to the lowest setting. Let the egg cook until almost set. If egg browns, the pan is too hot. Next, flip the omelet over.
3cd23ba5-0477-4360-8438-9826af5600a7 Place cheese and salsa on half of the omelet. Fold the top over to help melt the cheese. Cover with a lid or a piece of foil for about 3 minutes to finish melting the cheese. Remove from pan and serve immediately.
3cd23ba5-0477-4360-8438-9826af5600a7 Slide out of the pan onto a plate and then place the pan upside down on top of the plate. Turn pan and plate over so omelet falls back into the pan to cook the other side.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Gather the ingredients.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Roast the green chilis either in a broiler or over an open flame for about 10 minutes.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Remove the chilis from the heat source and place into a bowl. Cover the bowl with saran wrap to help capture the steam and let sit for 10 minutes. This will make peeling them much easier.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 When the chilis have cooled off enough to be able to handle them, use a piece of paper towel to gently scrape off the charred skin. Place to the side.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Add onions, jalapeño, and tomatillos into a food processor and pulse 4 to 5 times.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Add in remaining ingredients and pulse until desired consistency.
85a886f7-54f8-43b5-9f3d-2f7405e008c8 Salsa verde can be served immediately but it is better when it sits in the refrigerator overnight to let the flavors meld.
92e62399-baf7-4739-92e0-ab4f64873b2f Gather the ingredients.
92e62399-baf7-4739-92e0-ab4f64873b2f Mix all ingredients and refrigerate overnight to enhance flavors.
92e62399-baf7-4739-92e0-ab4f64873b2f Serve with tortilla chips or on top of carnitas.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Gather the ingredients.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Cut one half of the onion into 3 parts.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 In a large soup pot, place the cut up onion and the chicken into the broth and boil gently for about 30 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Skim off and discard any foam that rises to the top of the cooking liquid.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Remove the chicken and allow it to cool enough to handle safely. Remove the pieces of onion from the broth and discard them. Shred or chop the chicken into pieces that can fit onto a soup spoon. Discard any bones, fat, or cartilage.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Return chicken to the broth and add garlic and cumin.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Empty the prepared hominy into a strainer. Rinse it under running water, then drain.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Add the hominy, salt, and epazote (if using) to the broth. (Although epazote is optional, use it if you can, as it adds a wonderful rustic note to the soup.)
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Allow the broth to boil gently for 20 to 30 minutes so that the flavors can meld.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 To prepare the garnishes, cut the cabbage into chunks that are no bigger than 2 or 3 inches long on each side. Shred each chunk with a grater or cut with a sharp knife into thin slices. “Fluff” the shredded cabbage with your fingers so that the slices separate from one another. Place the cabbage into a serving bowl.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Cut the stem and tail off of each radish. Cut radishes into halves or quarters, then thinly slice each piece.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Dice the other half of the onion. Cut limes into halves or quarters.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Place the sliced radishes, diced onion, and cut limes on a serving plate or in a bowl.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Place the dried oregano and powdered chile pepper into a small serving dish—either together side-by-side in a shallow bowl, or in separate small condiment dishes.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Before serving your pozole, taste it and add more salt, if necessary. Hominy dishes often need more salt than you would think.
a32c5b57-b630-4629-baea-454d768b2fa7 Serve the pozole very hot in deep bowls; remember, room temperature garnishes will be added, which will significantly cool the soup.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Gather the ingredients.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Place the chipotle paste, ground cumin, oregano, cloves, and tomato paste in a large bowl and mix thoroughly.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Cut the brisket into large chunks, add to the marinade and stir to ensure the meat is well coated. Cover with plastic wrap and leave for 3 to 4 hours, or overnight if possible.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c When ready to cook, heat a large skillet, add the oil and then add chunks of beef a few at a time and sear on all sides.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Once browned, remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and put to one side and repeat until all the beef is seared.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Add the chunks of onion to the same skillet and stir well. Cook the onion over medium heat until softened. Add the garlic and cook for five minutes more.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Put the onions into the slow cooker and place the beef on top.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Reheat the skillet, add the lime juice and apple cider vinegar and bring to a boil.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Reduce by half, then add the beef stock. Stir well to scrape up any bits of beef or onion from the bottom of the pan.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Bring to a boil, then pour over the meat in the slow cooker. Add the bay leaves, cover with a lid, and cook on low for 10 hours.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c After 10 hours, the beef should be tender and falling apart, and the sauce much reduced and thickened. If the sauce is too thin, pour into a saucepan and reduce before adding back to the slow cooker.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Cool the barbacoa and then pop into the refrigerator overnight. (The meat improves in flavor if left in the fridge for a day or two.)
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Before serving, reheat thoroughly. Once hot, using two forks to gently break up the meat, it will shred easily. Check the flavor and add salt and pepper to your taste.
c1756ce7-0fda-46ba-9a47-074f0011657c Enjoy!
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Gather the ingredients.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 In a large bowl, combine masa harina and salt. Stir in 1 1/2 cups of the warm water. Knead until mixture forms a smooth ball without lumps. If it feels a bit dry, add some more water to achieved the desired consistency.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Divide the dough into 12 portions. Shape into 2-inch diameter balls and cover with plastic wrap or a wet kitchen towel to keep the dough moist and pliable. Keep a small bowl of water next to your working area. If the dough begins to stick to your hands as you are rolling and shaping the balls, occasionally dip your fingertips into the water to lightly moisten the dough.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Working one at a time while keeping the other balls covered, place one of the balls of dough between two sheets of plastic wrap.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 If you have a tortilla press, gently press down to make a flat 1/4-inch thick disk, about the thickness of a pancake. It will be much thicker than a tortilla, so do not flatten all the way down. If you do not have a tortilla press, use a glass pie pan to evenly press down the dough into 3-or 4-inch circles. Repeat with all 12 balls of dough.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 On an ungreased griddle or large sauté pan, cook the dough circles over medium-low heat for 2 minutes on each side until the dough is just set and can be turned without sticking. Work in batches of 3 or 4 circles at a time.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Remove the circles from the heat and quickly pinch the edge of circles to form a 1/2-in. rim all the way around. Set aside until all the circles have been gently cooked and pinched. Be careful to protect your fingers as you are making a rim around each sope. If they are very warm, use a thin kitchen towel or paper towel as you form and shape the sopes.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Add a small amount of oil to the pan and return the shaped sopes to the pan. Cook in batches until lightly browned and cooked through, about three minutes.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Place the sopes on a paper towel lined plate as you finish the whole batch.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 In a small saucepan, combine the shredded cooked chicken breast and 1/2 cup of the salsa. Cook over medium-low heat until heated through, stirring occasionally.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 To assemble, layer each sope with some warmed refried beans, and the warmed chicken mixture. Sprinkle each sope with shredded lettuce and queso fresco. Top with remaining salsa.
750b2711-7ea7-4bf4-8e16-ac5c214fd796 Serve immediately and enjoy! If eaten the same day, they may be kept wrapped in a clean kitchen towel. Cooked sopes can also be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and then reheated. Sopes can also be frozen and then thawed and reheated later.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Gather the ingredients.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Cut the kernels from each ear of corn until you have 4 cups of fresh kernels.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the jalapeño pepper and sauté for 2 minutes.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Add the corn kernels and season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until toasted and golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Remove from the heat and allow the corn to cool for about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add the crumbled queso fresco, Mexican crema, chopped cilantro, lime juice, and chili powder. Stir to combine.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Transfer the esquites to your serving dish and garnish with additional fresh cilantro and queso fresco. Serve with lime wedges. Dust with cayenne pepper, if desired.
b749103f-d686-4139-be4c-2abb898efa6d Enjoy warm or at room temperature. The corn can be cooked up to a day in advance and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Bring to room temperature for about 15 minutes before assembling the salad. Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Gather the ingredients.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Pour the water into a tall glass.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Before cutting the lemon, roll it back and forth on the counter while pressing down firmly. Rolling like this for about 10 seconds will help loosen up the juices inside and get the most juice out of your lemon.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Slice the lemon in half and squeeze the juice into the water.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Stir in the sugar or add sweetener to taste.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Add the chia seeds. Stir the seeds into the lemon water and let it sit for about 10 minutes. During this time, the seeds will absorb the water and become gelatinous. Stir the limonada occasionally if the seeds seem to be floating or falling to the bottom.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 To serve the chia fresca, add a slice or wedge of lemon and/or a sprig of mint to the glass for garnish. You can also add ice or place in the refrigerator to chill.
e030b886-c56c-4c80-977c-1a2fd7e87bf6 Enjoy!
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Gather the ingredients.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Pour the water into a large mixing bowl and sprinkle the yeast onto the surface of the water.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f In a separate mixing bowl, mix the flour, salt, and sugar.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Add the flour mixture to the yeast and water a little at a time, mixing until a dough forms. If a cohesive dough does not form with this ratio of flour to water, add additional flour, one tablespoon at a time, until a stiff dough forms.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a towel or cloth, and leave to rise in a warm place for about an hour.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Remove dough from bowl, punch it down, and knead on a lightly floured surface for about 10 minutes, until smooth.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Divide dough into 10 balls.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Cover with a towel and let loaves rise again for about 30 minutes. For oval-shaped rolls (the usual bolillo shape), roll the balls between your palms for about 5 seconds to make a cylindrical shape, tapering slightly at the ends. Place pieces on one or more baking sheets.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Preheat oven to 375 F / 190 C. ​Brush each dough ball with egg white. Score each roll longways on the top about 1/4-inch deep.
4aaeb133-aacc-4314-a0cb-8ae47714c96f Bake loaves for about 30 minutes, or until browned and cooked through. Remove from the oven. Cool slightly and eat warm or let cool completely and store tightly covered.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Gather the ingredients.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e In a large Dutch oven, place the tripe, knuckle, water, onions, garlic, salt, coriander, oregano, crushed red pepper, and black pepper.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer, covered, for 3 hours, or until the tripe has a clear, jelly-like appearance and the veal is very tender.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Remove veal knuckle from the pot. When cool enough to handle, remove the meat from the bones, discard the bones, and chop the meat.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Return the chopped meat to the soup along with the undrained hominy.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer, covered, for 20 minutes longer.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Portion into heated bowls and serve with pequin chiles or crushed red pepper to taste.
04dee4ce-7002-4bbd-b385-3660d10f960e Garnish with lime wedges. Serve and enjoy!
b2663a4d-ac3b-4455-8b41-da35f59a7d0d Mix together ingredients thoroughly and store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place such as a cupboard.
b2663a4d-ac3b-4455-8b41-da35f59a7d0d Use as needed.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Gather the ingredients.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Boil 8 cups of water and let the dried chiles soak in it, for about 15 to 20 minutes.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Roast the fresh red chiles over high heat (or in the broiler or on a grill) often turning, until the skins are blackened and blistered.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Remove the fresh red chilies from the heat and let them cool to the touch. Peel the blackened skin off as well as removing the stems and scraping out the seeds. Roughly chop the remaining flesh and set aside.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Remove the soaking dried chiles from the water, remove the stems and seeds and cut them into pieces. Set aside.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Add the oil to a large pot and heat over medium heat. Add the onion and cook it for 5-7 minutes or until softened and translucent. Add the garlic, and all of the red chiles to the pot. Continue to stir while you add the water, slowly and carefully. After the water is in, add the vinegar, oregano, cumin, and salt.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c Cover the pot and simmer the sauce for 20 minutes over low heat.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c At this point, if you have a hand-held blender (stick blender) you can put it directly in the sauce and blend until smooth. If you plan on using a standard blender (pitcher style), then you need to let the sauce cool quite a bit, nearly to room temperature, before attempting to blend it.
5d374d68-a115-4523-a6b4-0fe72b85281c After the sauce is completely blended (this takes a minute or two) you can use it as-is, or you can pour it through a strainer to make it smoother.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Gather the ingredients.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Place the chicken breasts between two sheets of waxed paper and gently pound them with a rolling pin or the flat side of a meat mallet until they are 1/4" thick. Be careful to not make holes or weak spots in the chicken.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Then peel the avocado and cut it into four lengths. Place one piece on each chicken breast. Fold the chicken over to enclose avocado.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Mix the flour and salt on a plate. Combine milk and egg in a shallow bowl. Then mix the cayenne pepper, oregano, and breadcrumbs on another plate.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Coat the filled chicken bundles with the flour mixture, then dip in the egg mixture, then dip into the crumb mixture to thoroughly coat. This part gets messy, but it's crucial that the chicken is thickly coated with breadcrumbs.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Chill the coated chicken in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours, up to 8 hours.
5e864458-62e3-4668-99c2-027bf990f5ab Preheat oven to 375 F. Place the chicken on a baking sheet. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until the chicken is thoroughly cooked to 165 F. Serve with salsa if desired.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Gather the ingredients.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Pour 3 cups of boiling water over the hibiscus flowers.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Let the flowers soak in the water for about 20 minutes.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Pour through a strainer into a large pitcher. (Discard flowers or save for another purpose.)
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Add the sugar and stir for 1 to 2 minutes or until sugar is dissolved.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Pour in remaining 6 cups of water and taste for sweetness. Add more sugar or water if necessary.
ff465516-abe1-4842-97e1-141b8ed91758 Serve and enjoy!
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Gather your ingredients.
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Preheat the oven to 400 F.
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Brush the tortillas lightly with the oil using a pastry brush.
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Place the tortillas in a single layer on two cookie sheets and sprinkle with salt and/or chili powder, if desired. You also can sprinkle them with optional spices like cayenne pepper, cumin seed, or cumin powder or fresh herbs like oregano or cilantro.
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Bake the tortillas for 5 minutes, then turn the tortillas using spatulas or tongs, rearrange the cookie sheets, and bake for 3 to 6 minutes longer until the tortillas are crisp and light brown. Use right away or store for later use.
06417f47-eca8-408c-9f1a-d257de61edfa Enjoy!
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Gather the ingredients.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Cut the stem off of the pumpkin. Cut the pumpkin in half and scrape out the seeds and stringy parts, saving seeds to make pepitas, if you like.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Leaving the rind on, cut each piece in half lengthwise again and again until you have 8 to 10 long strips of pumpkin. Leave pumpkin in strips or cut it into smaller pieces.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Zest and juice the orange.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df In a large saucepan, bring orange zest and juice, piloncillo or brown sugar, water, and cinnamon sticks to a boil.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Carefully add in the pumpkin pieces and reduce to a simmer. Cover and simmer for an hour or two, until pumpkin is fork tender and the rest of the ingredients have reduced to a thick glaze.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Remove from heat and let cool. Allow a long strip or two—or several smaller pieces—per portion.
b0def52c-f43d-4488-984e-05b158adf4df Serve at room temperature, spooning a little of the glaze over the pumpkin pieces. Eat with a spoon, leaving the inedible outer pumpkin rind (and any cinnamon sticks) in the dish.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 In a large, heavy pot, heat two tablespoons of the lard or oil. Brown the meat, turning to brown on all sides.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 Take the pot off the heat and add the orange juice. Pour in enough broth to cover the meat. Add the garlic, the bay leaf, and the chunks of onion. Place the pan back on the stove and bring the liquid to a boil.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 Turn the heat down and let the meat simmer, covered, for about 2 and 1/2 hours. At the end of the cooking time, take off the lid and turn up the heat to help evaporate the excess liquid.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 When the liquid is gone and just the meat and fat are left, remove the bay leaf and any remaining pieces of garlic or onion. Use tongs to break up the meat into smaller chunks (golf ball-sized or smaller) and allow them to fry, adding a little more lard or oil when necessary. Sprinkle salt on the meat as you fry it to season your carnitas and help keep spattering fat to a minimum.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 Your delicious little meats are ready when the edges of the chunks of meat become browned and crispy. You can serve them as-is (in larger chunks), or you can remove the pieces from the pot and chop them up into smaller morsels—or even shred them—to use as a filling for tacos or burritos.
9a0fb01a-b6c1-46a4-894f-72d09072aad3 Store any leftovers well covered in the refrigerator; reheat slowly in a pan on the stove (they will probably not need any more oil added) or in a microwave oven.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Gather the ingredients.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Bring half the water to a boil in a large pot over high heat.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 While you are waiting for the water to boil, prepare the tamarind pods. Remove the brittle outer shell and pull off as many strings as you can. Discard the shell and strings.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 After the water comes to a rolling boil, remove it from the heat and place the inner portion of the tamarind and the sugar in the water. Let the tamarind soak for about 1 hour and 30 minutes.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 At this point, the water will have cooled down. Use your fingers to squeeze out the hard tamarind seeds and remove the remaining strings; discard them.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Place the liquid and remaining pulp in a blender and process until the pulp is fully blended into the water.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Run the liquid through a strainer, if you wish, or leave it pulpy.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Pour your delicious agua de tamarindo into a pitcher, add the rest of the water, and refrigerate until cold.
d53e6d78-e48b-4417-8443-d9ac113fdb05 Serve over ice, if desired.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 Gather the ingredients.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 Rim a chilled margarita glass with chili powder: Wet the rim with a piece of citrus fruit, then roll the rim in a small dish of chili powder.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 In a blender, combine the ice, tequila, orange liqueur, tamarind nectar, and simple syrup.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 Blend until smooth.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 Pour into the prepared glass.
4d355334-c053-48dc-aece-b78ddcd37f51 Serve and enjoy.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Gather the ingredients.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Pulverize the rice in a blender until it reaches a floury consistency.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Toss it with the cinnamon stick and lime zest, and let it rest in an airtight container at room temperature overnight.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Put the rice mixture back in the blender and blend it until the cinnamon stick pieces get fully broken down.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Add 2 cups of water to the mixture and stir it.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Put it in the refrigerator to soak for 2 hours.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Strain the liquid into a pitcher or bowl through a fine sieve or a few layers of cheesecloth, squeezing frequently to remove as much of the milky rice water as possible.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Add the remaining 3 cups of water and the sugar; stir until the sugar dissolves.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Refrigerate the horchata until completely chilled.
074282a2-6acd-45ff-8e46-482dc0759d14 Serve it over ice, if desired.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Gather the ingredients.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Cut the avocados in half and remove the flesh from the skin and dispose of the pits. Add the avocados to a large bowl and toss with the lime juice. Don't skip adding the lime juice in this step, it will help slow down browning.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Mash the avocados as much as you would like with either a large fork or a potato masher. You can leave it as chunky or mash as smoothly as you would like. Typically, Chipotle’s guacamole is on the smoother side.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Add the chopped cilantro, red onion, jalapeno, and salt to the bowl.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Mix in the chopped vegetables and herbs until well combined. Taste and add more salt as needed.
16dc9fcf-a6aa-4c96-bd9e-ca4fe75ce887 Serve with your favorite chips or on top of tacos, burritos, or rice bowls.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Gather the ingredients.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Cut the Velveeta cheese into roughly 1-inch cubes and place the cheese into a microwave-safe bowl.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Add the can of Rotel tomatoes and chiles, including the juice from the can, to the cheese. Then, add the pumpkin puree. Stir gently to just combine.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Chop the chipotle chiles into a fine dice and add them, plus 2 teaspoons of the adobo sauce from the can, to the cheese mixture. Stir the mixture.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Place the bowl in the microwave and heat for one minute. Remove from the microwave carefully and stir. Microwave for one minute intervals, stirring in between until the cheese has completely melted and is hot.
e82a1b9e-da43-4fb0-a8ae-921afb27eb75 Serve the queso with tortilla chips or vegetable sticks. If the cheese becomes firm after serving, simply microwave for another minute.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 Gather the ingredients.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 Lay the tortilla chips into a pan or plate that is oven-proof and that you want to serve from. Use one larger pan or plate or two medium pans or plates for individual servings. Preheat the oven to 425 F.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 Add the shredded rotisserie chicken to a microwave-safe bowl. Stir the taco seasoning into the chicken and microwave for 2 minutes or until the chicken is heated through.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 Top the tortilla chips with the chicken mixture and then the cheddar cheese. Place into the preheated oven and bake for 5 to 7 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the edges of the chips are crisped.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 While the chips are baking, prepare the queso. Add the diced tomatoes and green chiles and the Velveeta cheese to a medium-sized, microwave-safe bowl. Microwave for 2 to 3 minutes or until the mixture is totally melted. Stir to combine.
74673bf6-b71e-4ae0-901a-10ea7f21e2f9 Drizzle the queso over the top of the baked chips and then top with guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and jalapeno.
be1801f5-9867-4b63-87db-d8c5dec468b2 Gather the ingredients.
be1801f5-9867-4b63-87db-d8c5dec468b2 Combine all of the ingredients except the cream in the top pan of a double boiler—or use a slow cooker—and heat gently until the cheese melts completely. (Stir occasionally during this period.)
be1801f5-9867-4b63-87db-d8c5dec468b2 Immediately before serving, stir in the crema or sour cream.
be1801f5-9867-4b63-87db-d8c5dec468b2 Pour your delicious hot queso dip into one or more serving bowls and serve with homemade tortilla chips.
be1801f5-9867-4b63-87db-d8c5dec468b2 Enjoy!
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Gather the ingredients. Pre-heat oven to 500 F.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Roast the jalapeno pepper over an open flame, turning frequently until the skin has blistered all over. Use tongs to help you turn the pepper so you don't burn your fingers.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Place the pepper in a plastic storage bag and allow it to steam in the bag on the counter for a few minutes.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Add the quartered tomatillos, garlic, and red onion to a sheet pan. Toss with the olive oil and roast in the pre-heated oven for 3 to 5 minutes, or until the tomatillos are softened and slightly browned.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Remove the tomatillos from the oven and allow them to cool slightly while preparing the rest of the dip.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Remove the skin and stem from the jalapeno. If you want the salsa to be spicy, leave the seeds. If you want a milder salsa you can remove the seeds. Add the jalapeno, roasted tomatillos and onions, and avocado to a food processor. Then add the cilantro and begin blending.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Drizzle in the lime juice as it is processing and blend until completely smooth. Add in a few tablespoons of water for a thinner texture.
aec20562-1e6e-4fe6-ad1f-88ffffae37e8 Add salt and pepper to taste, and serve immediately. Serve with chips, additional lime wedges, and more jalapeno slices and chopped onion.
d0b8b31c-6e2a-44e9-bf8f-b11b213a5b2e Gather the ingredients.
d0b8b31c-6e2a-44e9-bf8f-b11b213a5b2e In a large bowl, combine all of the ingredients and mix well.
d0b8b31c-6e2a-44e9-bf8f-b11b213a5b2e Taste for seasoning. Place in an airtight container in the fridge for at least 2 hours to let the flavors blend.
d0b8b31c-6e2a-44e9-bf8f-b11b213a5b2e Serve in a medium-size bowl alongside chips.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Gather the ingredients.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Melt the mozzarella cheese in a microwave-safe bowl in thirty-second increments, stirring in between until completed melted.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 With a whisk or fork, quickly mix the dry ingredients into the melted mozzarella. You can whisk together the dry ingredients before adding them to the cheese if you want to make sure they are completed blended. Knead the ingredients with your hands until it forms a soft dough.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Since you can’t use flour to dust the surface, roll out the dough in between two sheets of parchment paper to prevent sticking. Roll out the dough as thin as you can. The thinner the dough, the thinner the chip. The chips will puff when baked.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Cut the dough into triangles using a pizza cutter. You can make them whatever size you like.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Place the triangles onto a parchment-lined baking sheet. Make sure they are slightly apart from each other. All of the chips should fit on an average-size baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes, flipping halfway through until golden brown and crisp on both sides.
4f7adb2f-8a50-48d7-bc1a-e72e466cb4b1 Allow them to cool slightly and serve with your favorite dips like guacamole, salsa, or queso.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Gather the ingredients.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Use a fork to smash together the masa harina with the lard or shortening, mixing until well combined.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Add the sugar, salt, and baking soda and mix well.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 In a small bowl, use a fork to beat the egg yolks with the water until you achieve a homogenous mix. Add the egg yolk to the masa harina mixture and stir, first with a fork and later with your hands, until all the ingredients are well combined and you achieve a soft, smooth dough. Add a little more water, if necessary, to create a manageable dough.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Use your hands to form balls of dough of about 1 (3 cm) inch in diameter. Use your fingers to press this ball into a disk about 2 inches (5 cm) in diameter and a little less than half an inch (1 cm) thick. Note: Keeping your hands wet will greatly facilitate your work with the dough.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Place the disc of dough on a comal or anti-stick skillet over medium heat. Allow it to cook for 2 or 3 minutes. When the edges of the disk look dry and the dough starts to puff up a bit, use a spatula to turn it over to cook on the other side. Once your griddlecake has browned on both sides and looks cooked, take it off the heat; place it in cloth- or paper-lined basket or bowl where it will stay warm.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Continue with steps 4 and 5, cooking several gorditas at a time, until all the dough has been used.
50e36ae7-d19f-4f20-a36d-e1605386a9f6 Eat your delicious warm corn griddle cakes dry, or top with syrup, cajeta, jam, or a bit of sweetened, condensed milk. Serve with atole, café con leche, or Mexican hot chocolate, if you wish. Any leftover griddle cakes can be stored at room temperature in an airtight container.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Gather the ingredients.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Peel the sweet potatoes and chop into 1-inch pieces.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Boil them, covered, in the chicken broth over medium heat until they are soft, about 20 to 30 minutes.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 While the sweet potatoes are cooking, finely chop the onion and garlic. Melt the butter in a saucepan and saute the onion and garlic until soft, stirring often, and taking care that they don't burn or turn too brown.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 When sweet potatoes are soft, remove from heat and let them cool a little bit. Place them, together with their cooking liquid and the milk, in the blender and process until smooth.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Pour this mixture into the saucepan with the onion and garlic.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Add the fresh or dried epazote. Stir well to combine all the ingredients. If soup is thicker than you would like, add a bit more milk—but not too much, so as not to kill the delicate flavor of the sweet potatoes.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Test your soup and add more salt if necessary. Heat, stirring frequently, until soup begins to simmer but not boiling.
f9d45d24-c157-4fa4-b236-ade94919e976 Serve in cups or small bowls. Decorate each portion with a sprinkling of dried parsley or a (very small) amount of additional dried epazote, if desired.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Gather the ingredients.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Place the tomatoes, onion, garlic, and salt into a blender and process well.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Heat the lard or oil in a medium-sized saucepan. Pour the pasta directly from its packaging into the hot fat. If the pasta is long, break it up somewhat with your hands as you are doing this.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Fry the pasta, stirring continuously until most of it has turned light brown in color. It’s easy to burn pasta, so make sure you are giving it your full attention during this step.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Add the chicken broth and tomato mixture and allow your soup to boil gently for 15 or 20 minutes.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Taste your liquid soup and add salt, if necessary. Serve in bowls. Provide lime halves so that each person can squeeze juice to taste into the bowl.
ebc0f4bf-a554-4048-810a-54af25e4400f Enjoy!
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f Gather the ingredients.
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f Place the cashews into a medium sized bowl and cover with one inch of water. Allow the cashews to soak at least 2 hours, up to 3.
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f After the cashews have soaked about 1 hour, preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit and line a medium sized baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Arrange the carrots, bell pepper, and garlic onto the baking sheet and roast for 30 to 40 minutes, or until carrots are tender and you can easily remove the skin from the bell pepper. Allow to cool 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are easy to handle.
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f Peel the skin from the bell pepper and place into the pitcher of a blender or the bowl of a food processor along with the roasted carrots and garlic.
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f Drain the soaked cashews and place into the pitcher of a blender or the bowl of a food processor. Add 1/2 cup nondairy milk and blend until smooth, stopping and scraping down the sides of the blender container as needed. Add the salt, nutritional yeast flakes, chili powder, and lemon juice, as well as the remaining nondairy milk and blend once again until very smooth. Feel free to add up to 1/4 cup additional non-dairy milk to thin to your desired texture. Transfer to an oven safe bowl and fold in the jalapeño pepper, cilantro, and minced chives.
9f1bd84f-06db-48b1-89f2-d7be2872ae3f Warm in oven or enjoy cold with tortilla chips (makes fab nachos!), on top of cooked pasta, or as a veggie dip. Store leftover salsa con queso in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 4 days.
80c674d7-e050-49f9-93e5-d966081c75df Gather the ingredients.
80c674d7-e050-49f9-93e5-d966081c75df Mix tomatoes, onions, chilies, garlic, cilantro, and oil until all items are coated in the oil.
80c674d7-e050-49f9-93e5-d966081c75df Mix in lime, water, and tequila.
80c674d7-e050-49f9-93e5-d966081c75df Leave as is for a chunky style of salsa or puree in a blender or food processor for a smooth, paste style.
80c674d7-e050-49f9-93e5-d966081c75df Add salt and pepper to taste.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Gather the ingredients.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Start by preparing the filling. If using chicken, put the chicken breasts in a medium saucepan and cover with water. Boil the chicken, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes until it is cooked through.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Drain the liquid and use two forks to shred the chicken and add to a large bowl.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 In a saute pan, add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and the chopped onions. Cook until the onions are slightly translucent.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Add 1/2 cup water, cumin, chile powder, and garlic to the chicken. Turn heat to low and simmer until all liquid is absorbed. Let mixture cool for 15 minutes.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Place mixture into a bowl and add the chile sauce and shredded cheese. Toss mixture in a bowl until all ingredients are thoroughly incorporated.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Preheat oven to 450 F.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 To roll the tacos, first brush each tortilla with a light coat of oil and warm it on a hot comal or griddle until the tortilla is quite pliable but not too hot to handle.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Place 3 to 4 tablespoons of filling lengthwise in the tortilla.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Roll the tortilla around it.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Place seam side down in a baking dish.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 When all the tortillas have been rolled and placed in a single layer in the dish, put them in the oven and let them bake until they are crispy approximately 15 minutes.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Use tongs to place hot baked tacos briefly on paper towels to drain a little, if necessary.
b0dfa08a-4503-4922-9354-ddbea5b051f0 Serve 4 per person for a main dish, or 2 each for an appetizer. Serve with fresh salsa, sour cream, guacamole, and/or your favorite Mexican table sauce or other condiments.
d9b8e153-e3f6-4a51-a195-36c9974ba4b5 Lay out shrimp in the bottom of glass baking dish.
d9b8e153-e3f6-4a51-a195-36c9974ba4b5 Pour lemon and lime juice over them and refrigerate for 3 hours. The juice will "cook" the shrimp.
d9b8e153-e3f6-4a51-a195-36c9974ba4b5 Toss with remaining ingredients and refrigerate for one more hour or longer.
d9b8e153-e3f6-4a51-a195-36c9974ba4b5 Enjoy with tortilla chips or as a topper for grilled fish!
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Gather the ingredients.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Heat oven to 350 F.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Heat the oil in a large, deep skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat. Cook the ground beef, stirring and breaking up until it is no longer pink. Add the refried beans, tomato sauce, chopped bell pepper and onion, and the taco seasoning mix to the pot and simmer for 10 to 12 minutes.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff While the beef mixture is simmering, arrange the tortilla chips in a shallow casserole dish.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Spoon the hot mixture over the chips.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top and transfer to the preheated oven.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Bake the nachos for 20 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and is lightly browned.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Serve the nachos hot from the oven along with sour cream and other condiments, as desired.
078bdf8a-a225-4cee-a66e-ce4d5b920dff Enjoy!
e92b66ff-0d4b-4e32-ab00-30f96188df25 Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and chopped onion. Cook, stirring and breaking the ground beef up into smaller chunks until the meat is no longer pink.
e92b66ff-0d4b-4e32-ab00-30f96188df25 Transfer the ground beef and onions to a 3 1/2 to 5-quart crockpot.
e92b66ff-0d4b-4e32-ab00-30f96188df25 Stir in the dry taco seasoning mix, diced tomatoes, and tomatoes with green chilies, pinto beans, chili beans in chili sauce, and corn.
e92b66ff-0d4b-4e32-ab00-30f96188df25 Cover the pot and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours.
e92b66ff-0d4b-4e32-ab00-30f96188df25 Sprinkle each serving with some cheese and tortilla chips or strips.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e In a saute pan or medium saucepan medium-low heat, melt butter. Cook the onion until tender and translucent, stirring frequently.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e To the pan, add the tomatoes, chiles, and salt, mashing tomatoes with a fork. Simmer, stirring a few times, for about 15 minutes.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e Add the cheddar and American cheeses to the pan, stirring until cheese is melted. Stir in cream.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e Continue to cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e Serve the dip hot from a chafing dish, slow cooker, or fondue pot.
d6351721-b617-45ef-93e4-2f08aa4d084e Serve chile con queso dip with corn chips or vegetable dippers.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Gather the ingredients.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Cut two rounds out of each tortilla using a small biscuit cutter or tracing around the edge of a small glass with a paring knife.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Heat the canola oil in a dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot to 375 F using a candy or frying thermometer. Add 5 to 6 tortilla rounds to the hot oil. Fry for about 3 to 4 minutes, flipping them half way through cooking. They should be lightly golden brown and crispy. Remove with a slotted spoon and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with all of the corn tortillas.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Preheat the oven to 425 F.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 After the tortillas have cooked combine the refried beans with the garlic powder, salt, and hot sauce.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Place about 1 to 2 teaspoons of the refried bean mixture onto the top of each fried corn tortilla round. Spread it evenly, almost completely to the edges.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Top each mini Mexican pizza with a sprinkling of the shredded cheese. Place the completed Mexican pizzas on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake in the oven for 5 to 7 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the edges are slightly browned.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Drizzle each pizza with the taco sauce. It's helpful to put the taco sauce in a small squirt bottle.
3f306833-623c-4fe7-85a8-5b6b781896d8 Add a small amount of sour cream to each Mexican pizza and sprinkle them with the chopped cilantro and scallions. All three garnishes are optional, but they make the pizzas look pretty and add a pop of flavor.
a7ffb8e4-3f94-4caa-ba6a-cfe3ffe0320f Turn your broiler on high to pre-heat. Heat the beans in a small saucepan over low heat until bubbly. Remove from heat.
a7ffb8e4-3f94-4caa-ba6a-cfe3ffe0320f Set half of the chips in a single layer on an ovenproof pie plate and cover with half of the shredded cheese. Carefully place the rest of the chips over this base layer and top them with the remaining cheese.
a7ffb8e4-3f94-4caa-ba6a-cfe3ffe0320f Place your pie plate under the broiler for about minutes until cheese is melted. Carefully remove the dish from broiler and drizzle the beans on top of the cheesy chips. Add any of the optional ingredients, if using, at this point.
a7ffb8e4-3f94-4caa-ba6a-cfe3ffe0320f Drop spoonfuls of guacamole over your nachos or sprinkle on the diced avocado. Add the sour cream in small dollops, and sprinkle on the diced tomatoes.
a7ffb8e4-3f94-4caa-ba6a-cfe3ffe0320f Serve your delicious nachos in the same baking pan in which they were heated. Each person will serve himself, pulling off the cheesy chips to eat with his hands.
b5fc2d94-7bfc-40d3-9736-868228f77fa2 Gather the ingredients.
b5fc2d94-7bfc-40d3-9736-868228f77fa2 In a small dish or bowl, combine the soymilk and vinegar and allow to rest for 3-5 minutes or until thickened slightly. Mix in cornstarch or arrowroot, stirring to dissolve. Set aside.
b5fc2d94-7bfc-40d3-9736-868228f77fa2 In a blender or food processor, process the cashews until finely ground. Set aside.
b5fc2d94-7bfc-40d3-9736-868228f77fa2 In a small saucepan over medium heat, combine water, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, spices, and tahini. Stir in ground cashews and soymilk mixture until well blended. Stir in prepared salsa and salt. Cook until desired consistency, keeping in mind that mixture will thicken slightly as it cools. Salt to taste.
b5fc2d94-7bfc-40d3-9736-868228f77fa2 Serve warm, at room temperature or cold with tortilla or pita chips, or use as a sauce for tacos, quesadillas or burritos.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Place chicken tenders in shallow baking dish.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Combine 1/4 cup water, cilantro, sliced jalapeno, lime juice and olive oil in a blender. Blend until smooth and season to taste with salt and pepper.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Pour marinade over the chicken tenders, coating completely. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Preheat the grill.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Remove chicken from marinade and grill until cooked through, about 6 minutes.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Brush the onion and eggplant with oil, sprinkle with a little salt and pepper and grill for about 4 minutes, turning occasionally.
