a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Wrap tortillas in foil and place on the top rack of the grill, while you cook the other ingredients.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Mix cheeses together in a bowl.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Remove everything from the grill.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Place about 1/4 cup of cheese on half the tortillas.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Top with chicken, one slice of onion and one slice of eggplant.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Top with another tortilla, as you would make a sandwich.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Place on grill and cook over low heat until cheese is melted and tortillas are a nice golden brown.
a0c91aa2-4c3f-47b9-bea2-3df58cd927ba Cut Grilled Chicken Quesadillas into quarters and serve with sour cream.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Gather the ingredients.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Slice jalapeño peppers in half lengthwise; remove seeds. Combine the cream cheese and cheddar, mixing until well blended. Fill the jalapeño pepper halves with cream cheese mixture and press halves back together.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Put milk in a shallow bowl.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Combine the salt and flour in a shallow bowl.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Put breadcrumbs in a shallow bowl.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Dip the peppers in the milk, then in the flour, coating thoroughly. Set them on a sheet of foil or waxed paper to dry for about 15 minutes.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Dip the peppers in the milk again, then in the breadcrumbs. Let them dry again for 10 to 15 minutes. If necessary, dip again lightly in the milk and again in the breadcrumbs and let dry again.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Meanwhile, heat oil in deep fryer to 370 F.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Deep fry the breaded jalapeño peppers in batches for about 3 minutes, or until they're golden brown.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Transfer jalapeño poppers to paper towels to drain.
732a92ba-f2d0-490f-a5af-f30d5dafa3c9 Let cool for a minute or so and enjoy!
a56ec2d1-b451-4326-9e34-d3148aaccb17 Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Toss to blend.
a56ec2d1-b451-4326-9e34-d3148aaccb17 For best flavor, cover and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours.
a56ec2d1-b451-4326-9e34-d3148aaccb17 Remove from refrigerator about 30 minutes before serving.
a56ec2d1-b451-4326-9e34-d3148aaccb17 Serve corn salsa with grilled meat, fish, or poultry.
38ed1d8c-6b4a-46f6-aa2c-053e0092e931 Cube Velveeta cheese and place in slow cooker.
38ed1d8c-6b4a-46f6-aa2c-053e0092e931 Cover and heat on low for 30 to 60 minutes, until melted, stirring occasionally.
38ed1d8c-6b4a-46f6-aa2c-053e0092e931 Stir in tomatoes with chilis and taco seasoning. Cover and continue heating 30 minutes.
38ed1d8c-6b4a-46f6-aa2c-053e0092e931 Serve hot with tortilla chips or corn chips.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Gather the ingredients.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Heat the oil in a large saucepan and sauté the onions and garlic for 1 minute.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Carefully add the broth, oregano, and the chicken.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Bring to a boil, then turn down to a simmer for 1 hour.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Remove the chicken from the pot and use two forks to shred it.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Return the shredded chicken back to the pot. Add the salt.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Chop the cilantro, tomato, and avocado and add to soup. Let sit for 10 minutes before serving.
366861fd-58fe-46db-a32b-2f11fff6382a Serve your delicious chicken avocado soup with lime halves, if you like, so that each diner can squeeze juice to taste into their portions.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Gather the ingredients.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Brown the ground beef and onions in a skillet or sauté pan over medium heat until beef is no longer pink and onions are softened.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Add green bell pepper, chili powder, cumin, refried beans, and tomato sauce. Simmer over low heat for about 15 to 20 minutes. Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Heat oven to 375 F.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Spread some of the beef and bean mixture on each chip and arrange the chips in a single layer on the large baking dish or ovenproof plate, or use smaller ovenproof plates or dishes.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Sprinkle the layer with a little of the diced tomato, sliced green onions, and jalapeño peppers.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Sprinkle each chip with some of the cheese and make another layer of chips.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Repeat with the tomato, green onions, peppers, and top with more cheese.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Bake for 8 to 12 minutes, until the cheese, is melted and bubbly.
ae2536bb-1cdf-442d-a6f5-fb884f6b1eef Serve and enjoy!
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Gather the ingredients.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Select the normal sauté function on the Instant Pot and add the vegetable oil. When the oil is hot, add the onions; cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the onions are softened. Add the garlic and jalapeño pepper and sauté for 1 minute longer.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Add the boneless chicken pieces, the chicken stock, enchilada sauce, tomatoes, corn, drained beans, chili powder, cumin, oregano, pepper, and about 1/2 teaspoon of kosher salt.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Secure the lid and turn the steam vent valve to the sealing position. Choose the pressure cook or manual function, high pressure, and set the time for 10 minutes. When the time is up, allow the pressure to release naturally for 15 minutes. Carefully turn the knob to release the remaining pressure. For other cookers or different models, check the manufacturer's directions for pressure release instructions.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Heat about 1/2 inch of vegetable oil in a deep skillet over medium heat. Use a pizza cutter or knife to cut the tortillas into thin strips. When the oil is hot but not smoking, add a handful of tortilla strips. Fry the tortilla strips for about 1 to 2 minutes, or until crisp. With a slotted metal spoon, remove them to paper towels to drain. Repeat with the remaining tortilla strips. Sprinkle lightly with salt.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Ladle the soup into bowls and top with tortilla strips and your choice of additional garnishes.
a8ea600e-4397-421b-8db9-96dc5b72572b Enjoy!
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 Gather the ingredients.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 In a blender or food processor, combine all of the marinade ingredients until completely smooth.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 Add both the marinade and chicken to a bowl with a lid. Refrigerate for at least an hour or for a maximum of four hours. If you marinate for too long, the lime juice will actually start to cook the chicken.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 When you're ready to cook the chicken, heat your grill pan on high heat.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 Sear the chicken on both sides, then turn the heat to medium-low and cook until the juices run clear, or the internal temperature reaches 165 F.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 Remove the chicken from the grill pan and turn off the heat. Allow the chicken to rest for at least 5 minutes.
5cd43614-7505-4be8-826b-788847232a81 Then chop the chicken to your desired size and serve it on top of the rice along with any of the other toppings, like salsa, guacamole, beans, and shredded cheese.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Gather your ingredients.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Whisk together the garlic powder, paprika, Sriracha, salt, pepper, lime juice, and olive oil in a bowl. Throw in the shrimp and toss until they are completely coated.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Grill the shrimp on high heat until cooked through, about 2 minutes per side. You can grill on an indoor griddle if you don't have an outdoor grill, or simply cook the shrimp in a large saute pan.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Gather the coleslaw ingredients.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Add the mayonnaise, sour cream, salt, pepper, garlic clove, Sriracha, and lime juice to your blender or food processor. Blend until completely smooth. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper as needed.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Toss the dressing with the coleslaw in a large bowl until completely coated. Cover and refrigerate if you aren't using right away.
b1d1197c-3287-424e-a595-b184f146d11a Place the shrimp on top of the tortillas then add the coleslaw, cotija cheese, and cilantro. Then squeeze a little lime juice over the top. Dig in and enjoy!
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Gather the ingredients.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Peel the red onion and slice off the ends. Cut the onion in half lengthwise and slice each half thinly. In a small bowl or jar, combine the sliced onion with 1/3 cup of lime juice, 3/4 teaspoon of kosher salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper. If desired, add 1 teaspoon of finely chopped cilantro. Set aside.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Pat the pork shoulder dry with paper towels, and cut it into large chunks.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Choose the high sauté setting on the Instant Pot and add 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Working in batches, brown the pork in the hot oil (about 8 minutes total).
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Cancel the sauté function, and put all the browned pork in the pot. Add the oregano, cumin, and 2 teaspoons of kosher salt. Toss with the pork, then add the jalapeño rings, quartered onion, and bay leaves. Cut the 2 oranges and 2 limes in half and juice them; add the juice to the pot along with the chicken stock.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Lock the lid in place, and make sure the steam release valve is in the sealing position. Select manual (or pressure cook button), high pressure, and set the time to 40 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally (this will take about 20 to 30 minutes).
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Line a large baking sheet with foil. Preheat the broiler.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Remove the pork pieces to a cutting board using a slotted spoon. Shred or chop the pork, and arrange the pieces in a single layer on the foil-lined baking sheet. Broil the pork for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the edges are crisp.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Arrange the pork in tortillas and garnish with the pickled onion, cilantro, salsa or diced tomato, and radishes, if desired.
ca9180a3-ddb0-45d5-b396-514077aa7687 Enjoy!
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Gather the ingredients.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Place the poblano peppers on a large roasting pan. Place under the broiler until blistered and charred all over, turning as necessary. This will take about 8 to 10 minutes all together.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Once the peppers are roasted, place them in a large bowl and cover with plastic wrap to steam and loosen the skin. This will take about 5 minutes.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 When cooled, remove the stems. Run the peppers under cold water and peel off the blackened outer skin. Remove the seeds and ribs from the center of the peppers.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 In a large saucepan over medium, cook the chorizo until crumbled and no longer pink. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 F.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Remove the cooked chorizo from the heat and allow to cool slightly. Mix in the crumbled queso fresco and oregano.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Spoon the chorizo mixture into each of the prepared roasted poblano peppers.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Pour half of enchilada sauce into an 8-inch square baking dish.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Place three of the chorizo-filled peppers on top of the enchilada sauce.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Repeat with the remaining sauce and peppers.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 In a large bowl, beat the eggs until very frothy. Whisk in the cheddar cheese, whole milk, flour, and baking powder.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Pour the egg mixture over the peppers in the baking dish. Bake until the casserole is set in the center and the cheese is bubbly and golden brown, about 1 hour.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Remove the casserole from the oven and allow to rest 5 to 10 minutes before cutting and serving.
a3da2d0f-192f-43d8-8c58-d84797d208a0 Enjoy!
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Gather the ingredients.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Place the chipotle paste, ground cumin, oregano, cloves, and tomato paste in a large bowl and mix thoroughly.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Cut the brisket into large chunks, add to the marinade and stir to ensure the meat is well coated. Cover with plastic wrap and leave for 3 to 4 hours, or overnight if possible.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 When ready to cook, heat a large skillet, add the oil and then add chunks of beef a few at a time and sear on all sides.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Once browned, remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and put to one side and repeat until all the beef is seared.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Add the chunks of onion to the same skillet and stir well. Cook the onion over medium heat until softened. Add the garlic and cook for five minutes more.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Put the onions into the slow cooker and place the beef on top.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Reheat the skillet, add the lime juice and apple cider vinegar and bring to a boil.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Reduce by half, then add the beef stock. Stir well to scrape up any bits of beef or onion from the bottom of the pan.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Bring to a boil, then pour over the meat in the slow cooker. Add the bay leaves, cover with a lid, and cook on low for 10 hours.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 After 10 hours, the beef should be tender and falling apart, and the sauce much reduced and thickened. If the sauce is too thin, pour into a saucepan and reduce before adding back to the slow cooker.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Cool the barbacoa and then pop into the refrigerator overnight. (The meat improves in flavor if left in the fridge for a day or two.)
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Before serving, reheat thoroughly. Once hot, using two forks to gently break up the meat, it will shred easily. Check the flavor and add salt and pepper to your taste.
5f97dd0d-752f-47df-bfa9-db91164eb637 Enjoy!
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Gather the ingredients.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Heat a cast-iron skillet over medium-high heat. Season the short ribs with kosher salt and add them to the pan. Brown for 5 or so minutes per side, undisturbed, to develop a nice crust. Some fat will render from the meat and aid in browning.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 When the meat is well-browned remove from the pan and turn off the heat. Deglaze the pan with the pomegranate juice, scraping the bottom of the pan.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Place the meat and juice in a slow cooker set to low. Add the ancho chilies, cinnamon stick, and bay leaf. Put the lid on the slow cooker and braise the short ribs for 6-8 hours until the meat is tender and the bones release from the meat.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Turn off the heat, remove the bones, bay leaf, and cinnamon, and allow the meat to cool in the braising liquid.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Prepare the pomegranate pico. Mix the pomegranate seeds, jalapeño, lime juice, and pepitas in a small mixing bowl.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Roughly chop the meat with the ancho chilis, mixing them together. Taste and season with salt accordingly. If needed, heat the mixture in the braising juices to serving temperature.
4fcf2384-23e0-4653-b57f-01cc8e63ee07 Warm your tortillas to make them soft and pliable. Plate the tacos or serve family-style, allowing guests to plate their own.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Gather the ingredients.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Preheat the oven to 350 F.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Make the pico de gallo: Combine the tomato, onion, jalapeño, garlic, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper and stir.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Use a 3-inch cookie cutter to cut out 4 small taco shells from each tortilla. Save the scraps and toast them for a crispy garnish for salads or soups. Warm the tortillas for 10 to 20 seconds, covered, in a microwave, or wrap in foil and heat in a warm oven until pliable. Brush both sides of the each tiny tortilla using 2 teaspoons of oil and sprinkle with salt, keeping them covered and warm in between. Press into the openings of a mini muffin tin. Repeat with 11 more little tortillas, lightly reheating if needed to keep them pliable. Don't let the tortillas dry out.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Repeat with a second mini muffin tin or repeat after cooking the first batch of mini taco shells for a total of 24.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Meanwhile, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 teaspoon of oil followed by the ground beef. Cook, breaking up into small pieces, until no longer pink. Use a spoon to scoop out any excess oil.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Add the picante sauce, chili powder and cumin. Season with salt and pepper and stir. Simmer for about 5 to 10 minutes, or until the sauce is mixture is no longer watery. Taste for seasoning.
8709edcb-3d6e-4673-9990-a31a5cfc3b1c Add a heaping spoonful of the beef mixture to each tortilla shell followed by a dollop of crema, a scoop of homemade pico de gallo, and a sprig of cilantro. Serve and enjoy!
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Gather your ingredients.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Brown the chorizo in a large saute pan on high heat. Remove the chorizo using a slotted spoon, and leave the fat in the pan.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Add the onions and hash browns to the same pan. Saute until the onions have softened. Add the taco seasoning and remove it from the pan. Place it in the same bowl as the chorizo.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Add a tablespoon of olive oil to the pan and add the beaten eggs to the pan. Softly scramble them. Don't overcook them, since they will also be cooked inside the enchiladas. Remove them from the the pan and add them to the bowl with the other filling ingredients.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Mix together the chorizo, potato and onion mixture, eggs, and the cup of shredded cheese in the large bowl until completely combined and the ingredients are evenly dispersed.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Fill each tortilla along the middle with a few tablespoons of the mixture.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Roll the tortillas and lay them seam side-down into a greased casserole dish.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Whisk together the enchilada sauce and sour cream.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Pour the enchilada sauce over the top of the tortillas.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Cover with foil and bake in the oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until bubbly.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Remove the foil from the pan, and return the dish to the oven for another 15 minutes or until the top is lightly browned.
cdbdcabf-f88b-4c34-8839-60539078627c Top with chopped scallions, salsa, sour cream, and more shredded cheese if you wish!
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 425 F with rack in center position.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Cut the peppers in half, remove stem and seeds, then slice into 1/2-inch thick strips. Trim ends of onion and slice into 1/2-inch strips. Add both peppers and onions to rimmed sheet pan.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Toss with 1 tablespoon oil and 1 teaspoon taco seasoning to coat evenly.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Bake 15 minutes, until peppers begin to soften.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f In a medium bowl, toss the chicken with remaining taco seasoning, 1/2 the cilantro and 1 tablespoon of oil.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Add to pan with peppers and onions. Bake 15 minutes more, until chicken is cooked through and peppers are tender.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Cut the lime in half. Juice one half and cut the other into four pieces.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f In a small bowl, whisk together the sour cream with 1 tablespoon water and 1/4 teaspoon salt until smooth. Set aside.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Cook the tortillas in a small skillet over medium heat until warmed and lightly browned in spots, 1 to 2 minutes each side. Transfer to plate, and cover with towel to keep warm.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f To serve, divide the chicken, peppers and onions between the tortillas. Drizzle the crema on top, and sprinkle remaining cilantro.
ce139beb-858b-45c0-aa3c-289ea59bd10f Serve with lime wedges and rice on the side, if using.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Gather the ingredients. Set the oven to broil.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Place the sliced onions in a cast-iron skillet and put the whole Roma tomatoes on top. Place under the broiler close to the flame. Turn them periodically so that the tomatoes have a light char on all sides.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Remove from the oven and place the tomatoes and onions into a large bowl. Add the chipotles, chopped garlic, and bay leaves. Toss to combine.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Put the skillet you used for the tomatoes on the stove over a high flame. Add the oil. When hot but not smoking, add the chicken thighs. If necessary, cook the chicken in batches to avoid overcrowding the pan. To brown well, keep the meat in a single layer and leave undisturbed for a couple of minutes before turning.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Add the browned (but not cooked through) chicken to a slow cooker. Scrape all the pan juices into the pot as well. Add the tomato, onion, garlic, chipotles, and bay leaves on top.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Put the lid on the slow cooker and cook on the low setting for about six hours.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Stir the contents of the crockpot and remove the bay leaves. All the ingredients will be quite soft. As you stir, the chicken will shred. You may have to exert a little effort breaking up the tomatoes.
47dc559a-a05e-4e1e-a2f3-7e81349a0483 Season the stew with a splash of vinegar and salt to taste. Serve immediately.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Gather the ingredients.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Heat about half of the pork lard or vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add the sliced onion, and sauté, stirring occasionally for about 12 minutes, until the onions are cooked and just starting to brown.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e While the onions are frying, use a sharp knife to very carefully cut the grains of corn off of the cob(s). Note: Fresh, tender sweet corn gives a wonderful crisp flavor and texture to this mix. If fresh is not available, you can substitute 1 cup canned or frozen corn kernels, but their texture will be chewy in the final product, rather than crisp.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Take the onions out of the skillet and set aside. Allow the other half of the lard or oil to heat in the skillet, then add the corn kernels and diced pumpkin. Sauté over medium heat, stirring frequently, for about 8 minutes, until both the pumpkin cubes and the corn are cooked but still firm. Turn the heat up and continue to sauté for another couple of minutes or so until all the liquid has evaporated
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Remove the mixture from the heat and add the chile poblano strips, the reserved onion, and the salt. Toss gently to mix. (At this point, the mixture can be refrigerated for use up to four days later.)
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e For each quesadilla, place one tortilla on a comal or griddle and distribute a little of the cheese on it. Spoon one fifth of the pumpkin mixture over the cheese, then sprinkle with a second layer of cheese. Place another tortilla on top of everything. Toast over low heat, turning over once, until the cheese has melted and the tortillas have browned to the degree that you desire.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Remove the quesadilla from the griddle and allow it to rest at room temperature on a cutting board for about 4 minutes so that it can firm up a bit.
7634f6b1-0908-41f2-89fd-aab580837d8e Cut the quesadilla into fourths or wedges and serve. If desired, offer guacamole or a red or green Mexican table sauce so that each person can garnish his or her quesadilla to taste.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Gather the ingredients.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Cut one half of the onion into 3 parts.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 In a large soup pot, place the cut up onion and the chicken into the broth and boil gently for about 30 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Skim off and discard any foam that rises to the top of the cooking liquid.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Remove the chicken and allow it to cool enough to handle safely. Remove the pieces of onion from the broth and discard them. Shred or chop the chicken into pieces that can fit onto a soup spoon. Discard any bones, fat, or cartilage.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Return chicken to the broth and add garlic and cumin.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Empty the prepared hominy into a strainer. Rinse it under running water, then drain.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Add the hominy, salt, and epazote (if using) to the broth. (Although epazote is optional, use it if you can, as it adds a wonderful rustic note to the soup.)
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Allow the broth to boil gently for 20 to 30 minutes so that the flavors can meld.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 To prepare the garnishes, cut the cabbage into chunks that are no bigger than 2 or 3 inches long on each side. Shred each chunk with a grater or cut with a sharp knife into thin slices. “Fluff” the shredded cabbage with your fingers so that the slices separate from one another. Place the cabbage into a serving bowl.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Cut the stem and tail off of each radish. Cut radishes into halves or quarters, then thinly slice each piece.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Dice the other half of the onion. Cut limes into halves or quarters.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Place the sliced radishes, diced onion, and cut limes on a serving plate or in a bowl.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Place the dried oregano and powdered chile pepper into a small serving dish—either together side-by-side in a shallow bowl, or in separate small condiment dishes.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Before serving your pozole, taste it and add more salt, if necessary. Hominy dishes often need more salt than you would think.
831deed5-6a61-4f45-be78-3bd8c7f2bc74 Serve the pozole very hot in deep bowls; remember, room temperature garnishes will be added, which will significantly cool the soup.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Gather the ingredients.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Roast the poblano chiles under a broiler or directly over the burner of a gas stove until singed on all sides. Remove the skins, stems, and seeds.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Cut the flesh of the roasted chiles in very thin strips or chop them into pieces of about 1/2 inch / 1-centimeter square.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Place about 1/3 of the chile strips or pieces into a blender and add the salsa verde, cilantro, and the crema. Process until completely blended.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b If you have decided to fry your tortillas, pour oil into a skillet until it is about half an inch (1 centimeter) deep. Heat the oil over medium-high heat. Using tongs, place one tortilla into the hot oil for about 2 seconds, turn, then leave 2 more seconds. The tortilla should not change color or become hard.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Remove the tortilla from the oil, shake it over the skillet to drain off excess oil, and place it on a plate. Continue in this way until all the tortillas have been briefly fried.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Place the tortillas (regardless of whether they have been fried or not), onto a cutting board. Cut them in two, forming half circles. Preheat the oven on to 375 F / 190 C.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Pour the blended sauce into a wide, shallow bowl. One by one, lift a piece of tortilla with the tongs and place it into the sauce, turning it over once so that both sides get covered. Place it in the bottom of a lightly greased glass or metal baking dish that measures approximately 8 inches (20 centimeters) square. Continue in this way until the bottom is completely covered (which should take 5 or 6 tortilla halves).
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Place half of the remaining poblano chiles, half the chicken, and half of the vegetables on top of the tortillas in the dish. Sprinkle on one-third of the shredded cheese. Top with a few spoonfuls of sauce.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Repeat the procedure to form another layer of sauce-covered tortillas topped with chiles, chicken, veggies, and cheese. Create a final layer of sauce-covered tortillas. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top, and distribute any remaining sauce around the sides of the baking dish.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Bake for about 30 minutes, until the sauce is bubbly and the cheese is slightly browned. Allow to sit at room temperature for 15 minutes so that it can firm up a bit.
09eb5a62-360e-4770-a7f8-6bd0a2e06e0b Use a sharp knife to cut your dish into squares and a spatula to dish portions onto individual plates.
913bef3d-260e-4c59-8e30-f65509eefe6d Preheat oven to 350 F.
913bef3d-260e-4c59-8e30-f65509eefe6d Combine onion pepper, garlic, salsa, cumin and black beans in large skillet and bring to simmer over medium heat. Cook, frequently stirring for 3 minutes.
913bef3d-260e-4c59-8e30-f65509eefe6d Arrange 6 tortillas in bottom of 9 inch x 13 inch baking dish overlapping them as necessary. Spread half of bean mixture over tortillas and sprinkle with half of cheese. Repeat layering process with remaining tortillas, bean mixture, and cheese.
913bef3d-260e-4c59-8e30-f65509eefe6d Cover dish with foil and bake 15 minutes. Carefully remove foil and serve warm.
913bef3d-260e-4c59-8e30-f65509eefe6d Garnish with tomatoes, sour cream, and olives.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Turn your oven on to 375F / 190C so that it can preheat while you are preparing the ingredients.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Wash the cilantro; chop off and discard the roots. Shake cilantro vigorously (or run it through a salad spinner) to eliminate as much water as possible. Chop it, both stems and leaves together. Set aside some whole leaves to use as a garnish on the finished dish, if you like. Chop the onion and garlic. Dice a little of the onion, if you wish, and place it with the reserved cilantro for garnish.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Melt the butter in a medium-sized skillet. Sauté the chopped onion and garlic in the butter for about 5 minutes, stirring often, until the onion is translucent, but not browned.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Place the sautéed onions and garlic, the cream, the salt, the lime juice, and the chopped cilantro into a blender. Process until you have a soft green sauce.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Lightly grease a glass or metal baking dish. Place the white fish fillets in the dish in a single layer. Pour the sauce over the filets. Move each filet slightly so that some of the sauce gets in under the fish, between the filet and the baking dish. Bake, uncovered, for about 25 minutes. Baking time will vary according to the thickness of the filets; watch your dish closely so that the fish does not overcook. Fish is done when it can be easily flaked with a fork.
495413d6-202d-47d9-b5c5-102e4d064b76 Take your delicious fish in cilantro sauce out of the oven and use a spatula to dish it on to individual plates. Adorn each serving with a little of the reserved cilantro and onion, if you like. Serve your fish with white or red rice or boiled potatoes.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c Gather the ingredients.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c In a large bowl, toss together cooked rice and fresh chopped cilantro, and drizzle with a bit of fresh lime juice. Heat in the microwave or on the stove just until hot, and give it a quick stir.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c In a separate large skillet, sauté the garlic and onion in vegetable oil or olive oil for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the onion is soft.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the black beans or pinto beans and season with the chili powder, cumin, and hot sauce, stirring to combine. You can add a bit of salt if you'd like, but you shouldn't need too much with all the other seasonings. Allow the beans to cook until heated through, about 5 minutes.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c Spoon the cilantro-lime rice and the black bean mix onto lightly warmed flour tortillas, and add any additional toppings you want.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c Wrap the burritos: Fold the short ends in, then fold one long side over the filling and gently push to ensure the fold is tight before rolling up the remainder of the burrito.
cbc0cee4-f1fc-4508-a935-57c16d76328c Cut in half, and serve immediately.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 First, prepare the pulled pork filling. Place half a sliced onion in the bottom of your slow cooker.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Stud the pork roast with cloves and season with salt and pepper.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Place roast in slow cooker on top of the sliced onion. Add the remaining sliced onion and add enough water to cover.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Cover and cook on low 8 to 12 hours, or until the pork is very tender and falling apart.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Remove roast. Remove and discard cloves, bone and fat, as well as any water, onions and grease remaining in pot.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 When pork roast is cool enough to handle, use a fork or your fingers to pull it apart until the entire roast is shredded.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Return the pulled pork to the slow cooker. Add the chopped onion and BBQ sauce and cover. Heat on high for 1 to 3 hours or until the onions are soft and the mixture is very tender
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 When the pulled pork is almost ready, prepare the cornbread taco shells. In a bowl, combine cornmeal, all-purpose flour and salt. Then add milk and the egg, and stir until mixture is nicely incorporated. Don’t overwork the batter—some lumps are okay. You want a pretty thick consistency, but still a little runny. If the mixture seems too dry, add a little more milk; if it seems too wet, add a touch more cornmeal.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 Grease a small skillet with oil and place over medium heat. When the pan is very hot, spoon a small amount of batter into the skillet. Cook the cornbread taco shell 2 to 3 minutes on the first side, then flip, and cook 1 to 2 minutes more on the second side. The taco shells should be soft and flexible. Repeat with remaining batter. Depending on the size of your tacos, recipe should yield 4 to 8 taco shells.
1f4a91b5-a85c-4aab-801d-3e0a1bbacf78 To assemble tacos, fill taco shells with the pulled pork, coleslaw, jalapeños and drizzle with lime juice. Serve immediately.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Gather the ingredients.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Heat oven to 400 F. Pour 1 cup of oil into a medium-sized saucepan and heat until it's hot, but not sizzling. You want to warm the tortillas in the oil, not fry them.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Using tongs, dip each tortilla, one at a time, into the hot oil until it is warmed through and pliable. Remove tortilla from oil and drain it briefly on a paper towel.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Pour just enough sauce in the bottom of a 13x9 inch glass baking dish to cover it. Pour the rest of the sauce in a large bowl. Dip a warm tortilla into the sauce and then place it in the bottom of the baking dish.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Place a little less than 1/4 cup of cheese down the center of the tortilla. If you are adding meat, use a little less cheese. Fold half of the tortilla over the cheese, then the other half, so that the tortilla is rolled around the cheese. Turn it over so it is seam-side down and the weight of the cheese will help keep it in place.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Repeat each of those steps for each of the tortillas making two layers of enchiladas in the dish, if necessary. Pour any remaining sauce over the top of the enchiladas. Sprinkle the Cotija cheese over the enchiladas.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Bake for 20 to 30 minutes or until enchiladas are hot throughout and cheese is melted.
932cf3f5-29a4-4f44-b91c-36824838de28 Serve your enchiladas with a spatula, four to a plate, and enjoy!
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Gather the ingredients.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 In a large, heavy-duty freezer bag, combine garlic paste, lime juice, cumin, and olive oil. Seal and shake to combine.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Place skirt steak, bell peppers, onion, and cilantro sprigs into the bag. Squeeze out the air, and turn to coat the meat, distributing vegetables evenly.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Refrigerate at least 2 hours or overnight to allow marinade to penetrate.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Heat the gas or charcoal grill to high heat. While the grill is heating, remove skirt steak from the marinade and place on a platter, shaking off the liquid and reserving marinade with the vegetables.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Heat a heavy skillet to the smoking point. Drain vegetables and cilantro, and quickly stir-fry over high heat until slightly charred and softened, but not mushy. Set aside and keep warm.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Grill the skirt steak over high heat until medium-rare—about 2 minutes per side.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Slice meat into strips against the grain.
179fed83-aa7f-438b-bded-ae69660f4723 Serve immediately with warm tortillas (2 per serving), the seared vegetables, and the toppings of your choice.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Drizzle the oil into a large skillet and heat it over medium-high until the oil starts to shimmer.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Add the onions and jalapeños and cook, stirring occasionally, about 3 to 4 minutes or until the vegetables start to soften. Move them to one side of the skillet.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Put the ground beef in the cleared area of the skillet and use a spatula to separate it into a few large chunks. Let it cook undisturbed for about 3 minutes.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Break the beef into smaller pieces and toss them around in the pan, combining the meat with the vegetables. Reduce the heat to medium. Continue to cook for another 7 or 8 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the beef starts to brown but some pink remains.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Add the garlic and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Add the remaining ingredients and decrease the heat to low; continue to cook for another 10 to 12 minutes or until the tomatoes and onions begin to fall apart and combine with the other ingredients.
e39fa725-8849-4d50-ac48-59cdb5ae9215 Optional: Fry the potatoes in the oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet, flipping occasionally until the potatoes turn evenly brown. Drain the potatoes on paper towels or brown paper, then fold them into the beef mixture.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc Gather the ingredients.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc Whisk together the mayonnaise, sour cream, cream, and lemon or lime juice.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc In a separate bowl, stir together the onions and cilantro. Set this garnish and the cream sauce aside for the moment.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc Heat oil in a small pan and sauté the tuna, stirring often, until tuna is heated through and very slightly browned. Take the pan off the heat.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc If using soft tortillas, heat a griddle over high heat and place them on it. Heat the tortillas, turning once or twice in the process, until they are very hot. For hard taco shells, place them on a baking sheet and heat until crispy.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc Place 1/4 of the tuna mixture onto each tortilla, then top each with some of the onion-cilantro mix, and a drizzle of cream sauce.
657a391e-8286-4db4-9fee-93ecb26f7bfc Serve tacos immediately. Offer Mexican table sauce, bottled hot sauce, or other condiments of your choice.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the chopped onion; cook for 2 minutes.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Add the ground beef or turkey and cook, stirring and breaking up, until no longer pink. Drain and transfer to the crockpot.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Add the corn, black beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and taco seasoning; stir well.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Cover and cook on LOW for 4 to 6 hours or on HIGH for 2 to 3 hours.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Top servings with tortilla chips or strips, shredded cheese, sour cream, or chopped fresh cilantro or green onions.
92237546-6ade-47bd-af8f-30a09e26ded7 Serve the soup with freshly baked cornbread or crusty bread.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Gather the ingredients.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Place the tomatoes, onion, garlic, and salt into a blender and process well.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Heat the lard or oil in a medium-sized saucepan. Pour the pasta directly from its packaging into the hot fat. If the pasta is long, break it up somewhat with your hands as you are doing this.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Fry the pasta, stirring continuously until most of it has turned light brown in color. It’s easy to burn pasta, so make sure you are giving it your full attention during this step.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Add the chicken broth and tomato mixture and allow your soup to boil gently for 15 or 20 minutes.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Taste your liquid soup and add salt, if necessary. Serve in bowls. Provide lime halves so that each person can squeeze juice to taste into the bowl.
2879c7bd-d5c7-4e23-ac94-b99306ea380e Enjoy!
f31fdf03-cd9d-4d55-a741-d0404d135c33 Heat the oven to 350 F /180 C.
f31fdf03-cd9d-4d55-a741-d0404d135c33 In a large skillet over medium heat, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic until meat is browned and no longer pink, stirring often to break up meat. Drain well.
f31fdf03-cd9d-4d55-a741-d0404d135c33 Return to heat and add chili powder, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper; simmer for 10 minutes. Add refried beans and 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce. Heat thoroughly.
f31fdf03-cd9d-4d55-a741-d0404d135c33 Wrap the flour tortillas in foil and place them in the preheated oven; heat for 10 minutes. Spoon about 1/2 cup of the ground beef mixture onto each tortilla. Roll tightly and place seam-side down on serving platter lined with shredded lettuce.
f31fdf03-cd9d-4d55-a741-d0404d135c33 Spoon the remaining enchilada sauce over tortillas. Garnish and serve with toppings.
c39b44a2-acde-4228-beb4-fe15883dd669 Lightly grease a 2 1/2 to 3-quart baking dish. Heat oven to 350 F (180 C/Gas 4).
c39b44a2-acde-4228-beb4-fe15883dd669 Slice the tortillas into strips about 1 1/2 to 2 inches wide. Arrange half of the strips in the bottom of the baking dish. Set the remaining strips aside.
c39b44a2-acde-4228-beb4-fe15883dd669 In a large skillet, brown the ground beef, chorizo, and onion, stirring, until beef and sausage are no longer pink. Add the jalapeño peppers and burrito seasoning and stir to blend. Stir in the refried beans and continue cooking, stirring, until hot and bubbly.
c39b44a2-acde-4228-beb4-fe15883dd669 Spoon the hot filling mixture evenly over the tortilla layer. Sprinkle with the diced tomatoes, green onions, and cilantro. Top with the remaining tortilla strips then sprinkle with the cheese.
c39b44a2-acde-4228-beb4-fe15883dd669 Bake for about 10 to 15 minutes, or until the cheese has melted and the casserole is bubbly.
545eee52-75e0-4612-851c-46e77a7dae86 In a large pot, simmer the pork in the water or broth, covered, for 2 hours. During the last 20 minutes of cooking time, ladle out enough liquid to cover the dried chiles in a bowl. Let the chiles soak in the liquid until they are soft, then remove and discard their stems and seeds. Set chiles aside.
545eee52-75e0-4612-851c-46e77a7dae86 When the pork is done simmering, you must drain off the liquid, reserving 1 cup. Pull the pork into bite-sized chunks. Heat the lard in a large pan until melted. Fry the pork in the lard until it browns. Remove the pork and set aside.
545eee52-75e0-4612-851c-46e77a7dae86 Cook the onions in the lard until translucent. Remove them from the pan and set aside to cool slightly.
545eee52-75e0-4612-851c-46e77a7dae86 Place the chiles, onions, vinegar (optional), cumin, oregano, garlic, salt, and reserved (1 cup) water/broth in a blender. Blend until smooth.
545eee52-75e0-4612-851c-46e77a7dae86 Drain most of the lard from the pan, then put the pork into the pan with the blended chile sauce. Simmer for 10 minutes or so to thicken the sauce and bring the flavors together.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Gather the ingredients.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Turn your broiler on to high so that it can pre-heat. Heat 1 tablespoon of the oil or lard in a large pan over high heat. Brown the chicken pieces on each side.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Cover chicken with chicken broth and water. Bring to a boil. While the chicken is heating, slice the top off of each tomato and place them, cut sides down, on a cookie sheet along with the onions. Drizzle the other 2 tablespoons of oil over them. Place the cookie sheet under the broiler and leave it until the tomato skins become very wrinkled and shriveled.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb While the tomatoes and onions are broiling, bring the chicken broth to a strong simmer and add the chile powder or paste, garlic, oregano, cumin, and cocoa powder.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb When the tomatoes are ready, remove from broiler and let cool for about one minute. While the tomatoes cool, turn the chicken pieces in the pot. Peel the skin off of each tomato and use a spoon to remove the seeds from the middle. Using your fingers, mash the tomato a little and add into the sauce in the pot. Separate the onions and stir into the sauce. Let the sauce reduce, boiling gently and uncovered, while the chicken finishes cooking.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Cook until the chicken reaches 170 F/ 77 C inside. If the liquid cooks off too fast, add about a half cup of water and continue cooking, repeating if necessary.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Serve your Pollo Rojo with corn tortillas and white rice or Mexican rice, if you like. Be sure to refrigerate any leftovers for future use, as they are delicious.
377ff795-02b6-4192-aee9-0f3f38166fbb Enjoy!
0ca6b7d4-fe87-4a2b-b971-c95edd454aa8 Place all of the ingredients into the slow cooker.
0ca6b7d4-fe87-4a2b-b971-c95edd454aa8 Cook on the medium or high setting for 5-6 hours or on low for 7-8 hours.
e3f5e370-4afc-46de-bd3a-0624a2b01f84 Gather the ingredients.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Coat large saute pan with oil. Season chicken with salt and pepper.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Brown chicken over medium heat, allow 7 minutes each side or until no longer pink. Sprinkle chicken with cumin, garlic powder, and Mexican spices before turning. Remove chicken to a platter, allow to cool.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Saute onion and garlic in chicken drippings until tender.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Add corn and chiles. Stir well to combine.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Add canned tomatoes, saute 1 minute.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Pull chicken breasts apart by hand into shredded strips. Add shredded chicken to saute pan, combine with vegetables. Dust the mixture with flour to help set.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Microwave tortillas on high for 30 seconds. This softens them and makes them more pliable.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Coat the bottom of 2 (13 by 9-inch) pans with a ladle of enchilada sauce. Using a large shallow bowl, dip each tortilla in enchilada sauce to lightly coat.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Spoon 1/4 cup chicken mixture in each tortilla. Fold over filling, place 8 enchiladas in each pan with seam side down. Top with remaining enchilada sauce and cheese.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Bake for 15 minutes in a preheated 350 F oven until cheese melts.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Garnish with cilantro, scallion, sour cream and chopped tomatoes before serving.
3ed3758b-2077-4867-86c8-2a68ccbbbc7e Serve with Spanish rice and beans.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae If using raw chicken, put it in a pot with 2 cups of water. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook until the chicken is cooked through, 15 to 20 minutes.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae While the chicken cooks, in a small frying pan over medium-high heat, toast the pepitas: Cook, stirring, until they start to brown and "pop" as they toast, about 3 minutes. Transfer the toasted pepitas to a mortar or medium bowl. Set aside to cool.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Transfer the chicken to a plate to cool and the cooking liquid to a bowl. Once the chicken is cool enough to handle, tear it into shreds from the bones.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae While the chicken cools, peel and chop the onion. Return the pot to the stove and heat over medium heat. Add the oil, onion, and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft, 3 to 5 minutes.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae While the onion cooks, remove de-stem the chiles (you can remove their seeds, too, if you want to mitigate their heat) and chop them. Peel and chop the garlic. Add the garlic and chiles to the onion.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Peel and rinse the tomatillos. Roughly chop them and add them to the pot. Cook, stirring frequently, until they soften a bit, about 3 minutes.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Add the chicken broth and the reserved chicken cooking liquid (or, if you're using already-cooked chicken, use 2 cups water). Bring to a boil.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae While the soup comes to a boil, roughly chop the cilantro. Add most of it to the pot (save a handful for garnish).
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Take the pot off the heat. Add the epazote or oregano, if using. Use a hand-held immersion blender to whirl the mixture smooth; or, working in batches, whirl the mixture in a blender until smooth, and return it all to the pot.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Add the chicken and hominy and bring the mixture to a simmer.
69add957-1584-49d5-9b5e-52eb94a84fae Grind the cooled pepitas in the mortar with a pestle, or pulse them in a spice grinder, coffee grinder, or food processor until finely ground. Stir them into the pozole.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Gather the ingredients.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 In a large heavy freezer bag, combine the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, lime juice, cumin, oregano, garlic, and cilantro.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Add the chile pepper, bell peppers, sweet onion, and London broil to the marinade. Seal bag and toss to coat all pieces. Reopen the bag, squeeze out all the air, re-seal, and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Soak wooden bamboo skewers in cold water for 1 hour prior to assembling kebabs.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Preheat grill or broiler.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 To assemble kebabs, thread two skewers through the beef and vegetables, beginning with the beef and alternating with the vegetables. (Double skewers make the kebabs easier to turn.) You should be able to get about 5 to 6 beef chunks per pair of skewers. Reserve marinade for basting.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Grill kebabs over medium heat, basting and turning to cook all sides, until the beef is medium-rare, about 15 minutes.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Serve fajita kebabs over cooked rice with an accompaniment of warm tortillas, salsa, guacamole, and sour cream. Garnish with additional cilantro sprigs.
a8c86ef8-cc47-4fd9-9d41-1de99e6de385 Enjoy!
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Remove excess fat from pork. Place pork in 3 1/2- 6-quart slow cooker; arrange onion on top. Mix barbecue sauce, salsa, herbs, and spices; pour over pork.
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Cover and cook on low heat 8 to 10 hours or until pork is very tender.
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Remove pork; place on large plate. Use 2 forks to pull pork into shreds.
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Pour sauce into a large bowl; stir in pork.
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Sauté pepper strips in a skillet in about 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
20b8f36f-ad8e-4d3c-8181-77338135b9d0 Spoon filling onto tortillas; top with a few pepper strips, and roll up.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Gather the ingredients.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown chicken breasts. Remove and drain.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed In the same skillet, sauté onion, green bell pepper, garlic, and jalapeno pepper just until tender.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Put the chicken breasts and onion mixture in the slow cooker.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Add mild chile peppers, tomatoes, oregano, and cumin to the slow cooker; stir to combine.
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Cover and cook on LOW 6 to 8 hours (HIGH 3 to 4 hours).
32afe8f0-2c7e-4951-8d10-2efc060b15ed Serve with warm flour tortillas, shredded cheese, and salsa, along with your favorite toppings and condiments. Guacamole or sour cream would make a nice garnish with sliced green onions or diced tomatoes.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Gather the ingredients.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Toss together the chicken, chiles, cheese, and 1 cup of the chile sauce.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Dip a tortilla in the oil to soften in or you can brush each tortilla with oil.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Bake in a 400 F oven for 5 minutes to soften them.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Lay a tortilla flat and fill with about 1/4 cup of filling down the center.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Bring the edges over the filling to close it.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Lay the tortilla seam-side down in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Repeat until all of the tortillas are filled.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Pour remaining sauce over the top and sprinkle with the cotija.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Bake for 20 minutes at 300 F.
2a2a4b4d-6bff-458a-bc95-56dcbece6492 Serve and enjoy!
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Roast the fresh green chilies on a grill or under the broiler until the skin looks blackened and bubbly. Let the chilies cool enough to handle, then cut off the stem, peel off the skin, and scrape out the seeds. Discard the stem, seeds, and skin.
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Blend the chilies with the water, vinegar, and 1 teaspoon salt until smooth. Set aside.
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Heat the lard or oil in a large skillet over high heat until shimmering. Cook the chicken or pork chunks, in the lard or oil, turning them as necessary to brown all sides. Drain the meat on a paper towel or brown paper bag.
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Combine the browned chicken or pork, green sauce, and tomatillos in the insert of a slow cooker or a large saucepot or Dutch oven on the stove. Simmer for 2 hours, covered, on low.
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for an additional 2 hours. Check every 30 minutes and add hot water as necessary to keep the meat submerged.
5e19acb5-3539-4277-8f02-ac0d920197fe Serve chile verde with hot tortillas and rice and beans.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 Gather the ingredients.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 In a large skillet or frying pan over low heat, combine the black beans, salsa, and cumin powder, stirring to combine.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 Add the pre-cooked or leftover rice and allow it to cook just until hot. Alternatively, you can mix the ingredients in a microwave-safe bowl and then heat in the microwave.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 If the tortillas are cold and just taken out of the refrigerator, you may want to warm the tortillas quickly in the microwave on a hot skillet. This will make them more pliable for rolling. Spoon the rice and beans mixture onto the flour tortillas, dividing evenly.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 Top each tortilla with grated cheese, sour cream, lettuce, two or three slices of avocado, a splash of hot sauce, or any other toppings you'd like.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 Wrap your burrito and serve hot.
5498bf41-6be2-49db-a8f5-39b96814b6c0 Enjoy!
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Drizzle one tablespoon of olive oil into a large saucepan.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Heat it over medium-high heat and add in the onions.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Saute the onions until they become translucent, about 2 minutes.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Lower the heat to medium and add in the garlic.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Add in the tomatoes and green chiles and continue to stir and cook them.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Reduce the heat again to medium-low and add the remaining ingredients, except for the fish. Simmer the sauce for 10-15 minutes.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 While the sauce is simmering, heat another pan over medium heat and drizzle the bottom with the remaining one tablespoon of olive oil.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 Place the fish in the pan and lightly season each piece with a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook for 3-6 minutes on each side, or until it is cooked through.
17fdbae0-3ddd-482d-8e1d-886605e24a74 The cooking time will vary depending on the thickness of each cut of fish. When the fish and sauce are ready, place a piece of fish on a plate and top with 1/4 of the sauce.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Gather the ingredients.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Begin by splitting the cemita in half with a serrated knife.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Using the back of a spoon, press down on the interior sides of the bun so little indented pockets form to hold all the sandwich ingredients in.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Add a half tablespoon of adobo sauce to each side of the bun and then add half the chipotle peppers on top of each half as well.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Add the pork to the bottom half of the bun and then add the papalo (or cilantro), queso Oaxaca, tomato, and avocado to the top half.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Close the sandwich and wrap tightly in butcher paper.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Slice it down the middle and serve.
c97e56f3-ee8f-47cb-878a-7066d328a894 Enjoy!
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Heat oven to 350 F.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan over medium heat and cook the onions for about 1 minute.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Add the spinach and cook it for about 5 minutes until leaves are wilted.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Fold in the chicken and green chiles. Set aside.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba In a saucepan, heat crema, evaporated milk, 4 oz of cotija and half of the chile sauce over low heat until sauce is smooth.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Prepare a 9x13 inch baking dish by coating the bottom with a thin layer of sauce.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Dip a tortilla into the warm oil to soften it and place it into the pan.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Place about 1/4 cup filling down the center of the tortilla and sprinkle with a tablespoon of Asadero or Queso Quesadilla cheese.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Roll the tortilla up and place seam side down in dish. Repeat until all tortillas are used.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Pour remaining cream sauce over the top, then top off by drizzling the remaining green chile sauce over the top and then sprinkle with the 2 oz of crumbled cotija.
71dfad6d-44a9-4afe-8f34-a217e4df03ba Bake dish for 15 minutes to melt the cheese.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Begin by mixing the cumin, chile powder, salt, garlic power, and smoked paprika in a small dish.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Form the meat into a patty shape, pressing down in the middle so that it's got a dent in the middle. Sprinkle all sides with the seasoning salt and set aside,
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Grill or heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the seasoned beef patty and cook for a few minutes on each side, trying to only flip once, until the burger is cooked to your likeness.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 When the meat is done, remove the cast iron from the heat, leaving the patty inside - and place 2 slices of the pepper jack cheese to the top of the patty, cover with a lid or tinfoil and let the residual heat melt the cheese for a few minutes.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Once the cheese starts to soften and ooze down, place the green chiles on top of the burger and put the lid back on.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Meanwhile, toast the bun under the broiler - being extra careful not to let the brioche burn.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Once the bun is toasted, smear each interior side with a half the mayo and add the green chile pepper jack patty to the bottom of bun. Top with tomatoes, a sprinkle of salt and the top half of the brioche bun.
6248531e-2da0-499f-98a1-6a623181f542 Serve immediately and enjoy!
bac5a052-8fca-4677-b5c4-f91a18133270 Gather the ingredients.
bac5a052-8fca-4677-b5c4-f91a18133270 In a medium sized bowl, mash the avocado.
bac5a052-8fca-4677-b5c4-f91a18133270 Add remaining ingredients and stir until well mixed.
bac5a052-8fca-4677-b5c4-f91a18133270 Spread 2 to 3 tablespoons of this mixture onto lettuce leaves and wrap.
bac5a052-8fca-4677-b5c4-f91a18133270 Serve and enjoy!
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Gather the ingredients.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Roast the chiles on a hot grill or under a broiler on high heat. Use tongs to turn them occasionally, roasting until the skins are blackened and charred, about 20 minutes.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 When the skin of the peppers is sufficiently charred and blistered, remove from the heat, place in a bowl with plastic wrap, and let them cool to room temperature. Once cool, remove from bowl and peel the skin from the cooled chiles, rinsing your fingers if they become sticky. (Do not rinse the peppers themselves, as you will be washing away most of their flavor.) Be careful to not tear the chile while peeling it.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Remove the seeds by making a small slice into the side of each chile, about 2 to 3 inches long, just big enough to get a spoon into. (Don’t hesitate to use an existing tear if there is one.) Delicately insert the spoon into the pepper and scrape the seeds and the white membrane out, trying as hard as you can to not tear the flesh, as it can tear easily.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Place 2 ounces of cheese into each pepper; work slowly, delicately, and without forcing. Don't over-stuff the chile, making sure the open edges of the pepper still come together.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Place the flour on a large plate. Put a chile on the flour and sprinkle the rest of the flour on top. Rub your finger around on the surface of the pepper to make sure that it is completely coated, then dust off any excess flour and set chile aside. Repeat this procedure with each of the peppers.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 To prepare the batter, whip the egg whites in a chilled bowl until they are stiff.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Briefly beat the egg yolks in a separate bowl.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Then slowly and gently fold them into the beaten whites with the pinch of salt.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Heat the oil in a frying pan to 350 F. Test it with a drop of batter before putting a whole chile in; if the drop sizzles and floats to the top, it's the right temperature. If it sinks, the oil is not ready; let it heat a little more.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Once the oil is hot enough, hold the chiles one at a time by the stem and support the bottom with your fingers or a spoon. Dip the stuffed pepper into the batter and coat completely.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Carefully place it into the hot oil to fry. Repeat with more chiles if there is room in your pan (don't overcrowd the pan). Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, turning over halfway until the batter is a crisp golden brown on all sides. Fry in batches if necessary.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Remove the chiles from the oil and let them drain on paper towels until all the peppers have been fried.
92f5675f-1c3b-46c3-9107-caa026bef312 Serve chiles rellenos immediately. Enjoy!
76480c53-43bd-4fab-8717-c452797059fc Combine all ingredients and mix well. Let mixture stand for 5 minutes before using.
76480c53-43bd-4fab-8717-c452797059fc Marinade meats as follows: red meat and pork, 4 to 12 hours, chicken and other poultry, 2 to 6 hours, fish, seafood, vegetables, and meat alternatives, 15 to 30 minutes.
76480c53-43bd-4fab-8717-c452797059fc If making ahead of time, store in an airtight container in the fridge for no more than one week after preparation.
b4d14ae0-8ce5-4d61-a65c-3272c30f8447 Rinse and pat meat dry. Combine lemon or lime juice with spices and oil Pour over meat and rub down so it's completely covered with marinade. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.
b4d14ae0-8ce5-4d61-a65c-3272c30f8447 Cook on grill over medium-high heat for 20 to 25 minutes or until center is slightly pink.
b4d14ae0-8ce5-4d61-a65c-3272c30f8447 Serve carne asada in large pieces as steaks, or thinly slice on the bias (perpendicular to the grain of the meat) for fajitas.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae Gather the ingredients.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae First, pre-heat the oven to 375 F and lightly grease a baking sheet (depending on the size, you may need two baking sheets or to work in batches).
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae Next, add the oil to a large skillet over medium heat and cook all of the green, red and yellow bell peppers in oil. While the peppers are cooking, add the cumin, sea salt or kosher salt, a bit of fresh ground black pepper and the lime juice and cook just until peppers are just soft, about 3 to 5 minutes; do not overcook.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae Place four of the flour tortillas flat on a lightly greased baking pan to assemble your quesadillas. You may need two baking pans for this. Place a large spoonful or a thin layer of peppers on a flour tortilla. Add a thick layer of cheese and cover with another flour tortilla, and assemble all of the veggie quesadillas in the same manner.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae Bake your bell pepper quesadillas at 375 F for about ten minutes, or until the cheese has fully melted.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.
701cbaa0-e3b8-41d9-9d70-43e59bb5adae To serve, slice each quesadilla into fourths or, cut 6 pie pieces, like a pizza. Top with salsa, sour cream or serve with guacamole on the side if you'd like.
52aae50b-8c4a-4752-8080-b7f80bcec456 Gather the ingredients.
52aae50b-8c4a-4752-8080-b7f80bcec456 Set a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the oil or butter. Once hot, add the riced cauliflower. Cook, stirring frequently, until the cauliflower is tender, but still has a little bite, about 5 to 7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
52aae50b-8c4a-4752-8080-b7f80bcec456 Remove from heat, add the lime juice and chopped cilantro, and toss to combine. Serve immediately.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Gather the ingredients.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Cut the kernels from each ear of corn until you have 4 cups of fresh kernels.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the jalapeño pepper and sauté for 2 minutes.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Add the corn kernels and season with salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until toasted and golden brown, about 10 to 15 minutes.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Remove from the heat and allow the corn to cool for about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add the crumbled queso fresco, Mexican crema, chopped cilantro, lime juice, and chili powder. Stir to combine.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Transfer the esquites to your serving dish and garnish with additional fresh cilantro and queso fresco. Serve with lime wedges. Dust with cayenne pepper, if desired.
78d5a396-542b-478a-8422-71dcc6b8f948 Enjoy warm or at room temperature. The corn can be cooked up to a day in advance and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Bring to room temperature for about 15 minutes before assembling the salad. Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Gather the ingredients.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Roast the peppers, either under a broiler on high or over an open flame (this can be done on a grill or over a stovetop gas burner), until the skin blisters on all sides, about 10 to 15 minutes.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Let them “sweat” in a plastic bag for another 15 minutes.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Then peel them, remove the seeds and stems, and cut the flesh into 1/2-inch strips.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Heat a large, heavy pan (cast iron, preferably) over medium-high heat and drizzle in the oil. When the oil begins to shimmer, add the onions. Cook, stirring occasionally​ until the onions turn translucent and begin to brown on the edges, or for approximately 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to low.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Add the peppers to the onions.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Stir in the cream, salt, and pepper and cook everything over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until the cream heats through.
6da738c0-6ecc-419b-9be5-11d34ad358f1 Add the cooked corn, stir, then serve and enjoy!
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Gather the ingredients.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Peel the sweet potatoes and chop into 1-inch pieces.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Boil them, covered, in the chicken broth over medium heat until they are soft, about 20 to 30 minutes.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d While the sweet potatoes are cooking, finely chop the onion and garlic. Melt the butter in a saucepan and saute the onion and garlic until soft, stirring often, and taking care that they don't burn or turn too brown.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d When sweet potatoes are soft, remove from heat and let them cool a little bit. Place them, together with their cooking liquid and the milk, in the blender and process until smooth.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Pour this mixture into the saucepan with the onion and garlic.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Add the fresh or dried epazote. Stir well to combine all the ingredients. If soup is thicker than you would like, add a bit more milk—but not too much, so as not to kill the delicate flavor of the sweet potatoes.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Test your soup and add more salt if necessary. Heat, stirring frequently, until soup begins to simmer but not boiling.
b69a725a-78e9-4e63-a89d-2676b3d0378d Serve in cups or small bowls. Decorate each portion with a sprinkling of dried parsley or a (very small) amount of additional dried epazote, if desired.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Gather the ingredients and preheat a grill to medium heat.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Roast the corn on medium heat until sweet and tender, about 15 minutes.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Husk the corn toward the end of cooking and char corn directly on the hot grill for extra flavor and color, about 3 minutes.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f In a medium bowl, bring together the sour cream, mayonnaise, and lime juice.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Using a microplane or a garlic press, grate the garlic into the mixture. Add the salt and whisk to combine.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Spread the mayo mixture onto a flat plate. Combine the Parmesan cheese and queso fresco on a separate flat plate.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Roll the corn in the mayo mixture to completely coat each ear. You can use corn on the cob holders to help you roll them; tongs will also work. Do the same in the cheese mixture and set the corn aside on a platter.
4d79c084-438d-4cc7-8690-813f7492215f Top the corn with chopped cilantro and a sprinkle of chili powder. Serve immediately.
73517cd7-b27f-436b-bcb6-a8fc78e8b4c2 In a large skillet, melt the butter until slightly browned over medium heat. Add the corn, zucchini, garlic and oregano. Season with salt and pepper and sauté for about 6 minutes until the vegetables are crisp-tender.
73517cd7-b27f-436b-bcb6-a8fc78e8b4c2 Serve hot, topped with the Cotija cheese and the fresh cilantro leaves, if desired.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Gather the ingredients.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Preheat the oven to 375 F.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Grease a 2 1/2-quart or 9-by-13-by-2-inch baking dish.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef and cook, stirring, until the beef is no longer pink.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Add the chopped onion, garlic, and bell pepper; cook for 2 minutes, or until just tender.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Pour off excess fat.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Stir the tomatoes, corn, and seasonings into the ground beef mixture and simmer for about 5 minutes longer.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Mix 1/2 cup cornmeal with 1 cup water. Stir into the ground beef mixture in the skillet. Cover and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Add the sliced olives to the beef mixture and stir to blend thoroughly.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Pour the beef mixture into the prepared baking dish. Set aside while you make the topping.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 In a medium saucepan, heat 1 1/2 cups milk with 1 teaspoon salt and the butter. When the milk is hot, but not boiling, gradually stir in the 1/2 cup yellow cornmeal. Continue cooking until thickened, stirring constantly.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Remove from heat and stir, then add the cheese and beaten eggs. Stir to blend.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Pour the topping around the edge of casserole.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes.
b33278a3-8390-4552-bfb8-f44cf96f0462 Serve and enjoy!
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Drain the entire can of black beans and rinse them thoroughly. Toss the beans with the thawed corn kernels. Set them aside while you prepare the other ingredients.
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Chop the plum tomatoes, red onion, and jalapeno into a small dice, leaving in the jalapeno seeds and vein if you want a spicier salsa. Mince the clove of garlic. Chop up the cilantro and set aside.
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Toss the plum tomatoes, onion, jalapeno, and garlic together with the black beans and corn.
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt in a measuring cup.
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Pour the lime juice mixture over the black bean mixture and gently toss, being careful to not break up the beans. Top with the chopped cilantro.
79d527dc-8c36-4a08-a88e-a3ffd50365ed Allow the salsa to sit covered in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes so the flavors can mingle and meld. Serve with tortilla chips or on top of tacos.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 Trim away any tough edges of the cactus pad. Cut the pad into planks as wide as the height of the fill line on your jar (e.g., for most half-pint jars, that's about 4 1/2"). Cut the planks into 1/2"-wide strips. Place in a large nonreactive bowl and toss with a liberal amount of kosher or sea salt. Let stand at least an hour. Rinse thoroughly with water and pat dry. Repeat if desired.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 Prepare your water bath canner and wash 4 half-pint jars and lids with warm, soapy water.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 Trim the top and root end of the onion, halve, and cut pole-to-pole into 1/4 strips.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 Trim the stem end off the jalapeño, halve, and cut into thin strips. Remove the seeds and membranes to reduce the heat if desired.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 In a nonreactive pot, combine the vinegar, salt, peppercorn and coriander seed. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
ccc481ce-b6a7-4be9-8011-98a69029fb32 Pack the cactus strips, onion, and jalapeño into clean jars. Pour the vinegar brine into the jars, leaving 1/2" headspace. Apply lids and rings, and process in the water bath canner for 10 minutes.
1c0c0a0c-ccca-49fb-9aff-589cb643e23e Gather the ingredients.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Gather the ingredients.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Pick through the beans and remove any rocks or debris.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Then throughly rinse and place in a large pot. Pour in enough water to cover by 3 inches.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Partly cover and simmer until cooked through. You will most likely need to add more water to the pot, do not let them dry out and always keep plenty of water in the pot.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Once the beans are cooked, separate them from the broth and reserve the broth. (Please make sure you have all of the ingredients ready to go because the following process moves fast.)
