9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b In a large pot heat a splash of oil, then add the longaniza and sauté until it begins to brown slightly.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Drain the sausage, but leave a bit of the oil in the pan, set the sausage aside.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Next add the onion and sauté until soft.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Then add the Poblanos and sauté them for about 4 minutes.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Add the garlic and Serrano chilies and sauté for about 3 minutes — be careful not to breathe in the chile smoke, it will make you cough.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Now add the salt, ground cumin, and bay leaves.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Then gently pour in the drained-cooked beans.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Finally, very carefully, pour in the broth and give the stew a gently stir.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Then place the epazote inside the pan.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Partially cover and simmer under medium-low heat for about 45 minutes or longer if desired. The amount of broth that will be left in the pot is entirely up to you. Some people like their beans more soupy while others chunkier. Taste and adjust seasoning if desired.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Allow to cool slightly before serving.
9e2b246e-401c-423e-a651-2e56cb934a4b Serve as a main dish topped with finely chopped cilantro and with warm corn tortillas on the side. Alternatively, these beans may be served as a side dish to grilled meats like steak -- or arranchera is my favorite.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Gather the ingredients.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 First, roast and peel those chiles. You can roast the chiles over a gas burner or under a broiler.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Then put the chiles in a bowl and cover with a pot lid or foil. Let them sit and steam and cool down a bit for at least 15 minutes.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Scrape off and remove peels, pull off stems, remove seeds, and chop. Set the chiles aside.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Then peel and thinly slice the onion.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Heat lard or oil in a large, heavy pot. Add the onions, chiles, and salt and cook, stirring when you think of it, until the onions are soft - about 3 minutes.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Transfer the vegetables to a bowl, leaving as much fat in the pot as possible.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Brown the pork, working in batches just large enough to be in the pot in a single layer of pieces that don’t touch. This step adds extra flavor and helps melt some of the fat off the meat.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Once you’ve browned all the pork and have transferred it out of the pot, sprinkle the remaining fat/oil in the pot with the flour.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Cook, stirring until flour smells cooked - about 3 minutes.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Add the 1 cup of beer, broth, or water and scrape up any brown bits on the bottom of the pot. The mixture should thicken up fairly quickly.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Add the 2 cups of broth or water and return vegetables and pork to the pot. Everything should be covered by liquid, add more broth or water to cover if necessary.
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce to simmer, and cook, covered, until the pork is extremely tender - about an hour. (Alternatively, you can put the whole covered pot in a 350 F oven and bake for about an hour.)
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Remove the lid and simmer to reduce and thicken the liquid, if you like. Add more salt to taste, if needed. (You can cool the stew and remove the fat that will congeal on top, but be warned that doing so will remove some of the delicious, unctuous flavors that make this simple stew to special.)
fab76456-8dd8-4493-bb68-cfaa025cd627 Serve and enjoy!
6206bd4d-d364-4bb2-b581-353e5f1b644f Chop the tomato and onion into small pieces.
6206bd4d-d364-4bb2-b581-353e5f1b644f Pour the canned or jarred nopales into a strainer to drain. Rinse them under running water until the jar liquid is washed off. Leave the nopales in long strips (if that’s how they came), or chop into pieces of about the same size as the tomato and onions, as you prefer.
6206bd4d-d364-4bb2-b581-353e5f1b644f Place the olive oil, lime juice, oregano, and salt into a small jar with the lid on. Shake vigorously until the mixture comes together. Pour this dressing over the salad and toss again, gently but thoroughly.
6206bd4d-d364-4bb2-b581-353e5f1b644f Cover the bowl and refrigerate your salad for at least an hour and up to 24 hours for the flavors to meld.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Gather the ingredients.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Heat oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and cook (stirring frequently to prevent burning) until translucent and toasted 5 minutes.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Add onion, green pepper, and chile powder and continue cooking for 5 minutes, stirring often.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Stir in garlic and cook 1 minute longer.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Add tomatoes, chicken stock, and salt and bring to a boil. Cover tightly cook over low heat for 20 minutes.
c03b9dcb-ef98-4b1c-a4ba-65c47c79db1c Remove from heat and allow to sit, covered, for another 5 minutes then fluff with a fork.
a740f15e-2e6c-4126-99a9-ef335245c64b Lay out shrimp in the bottom of glass baking dish.
a740f15e-2e6c-4126-99a9-ef335245c64b Pour lemon and lime juice over them and refrigerate for 3 hours. The juice will "cook" the shrimp.
a740f15e-2e6c-4126-99a9-ef335245c64b Toss with remaining ingredients and refrigerate for one more hour or longer.
a740f15e-2e6c-4126-99a9-ef335245c64b Enjoy with tortilla chips or as a topper for grilled fish!
0bf5939b-a518-445e-ad68-89b995273bab Gather the ingredients.
0bf5939b-a518-445e-ad68-89b995273bab Combine all of the ingredients except the cream in the top pan of a double boiler—or use a slow cooker—and heat gently until the cheese melts completely. (Stir occasionally during this period.)
0bf5939b-a518-445e-ad68-89b995273bab Immediately before serving, stir in the crema or sour cream.
0bf5939b-a518-445e-ad68-89b995273bab Pour your delicious hot queso dip into one or more serving bowls and serve with homemade tortilla chips.
0bf5939b-a518-445e-ad68-89b995273bab Enjoy!
1ee66aed-3034-4bc2-ae35-de739b0e6c26 Put all ingredients into crockpot.
1ee66aed-3034-4bc2-ae35-de739b0e6c26 Cover and cook on high for 2 hours, then low for 5 to 7 hours.
cf99cab4-bc4f-479c-a174-930c8076eeb7 In a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat, saute the diced onions and the minced garlic in the olive oil for about 3 to 5 minutes, or just until the onions are starting to turn soft.
cf99cab4-bc4f-479c-a174-930c8076eeb7 Add in the ground ginger, coriander, cloves, and fresh ground black pepper and stir to combine well.
cf99cab4-bc4f-479c-a174-930c8076eeb7 Add the rice and stir for just a minute, in order to coat the rice evenly and well with the spices.
cf99cab4-bc4f-479c-a174-930c8076eeb7 Add in the tomatoes, salt, and water or vegetable broth and stir to combine. Bring to a low simmer, then cover the pan and allow to simmer over low heat for about 30 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and the rice is completely done cooking.
cf99cab4-bc4f-479c-a174-930c8076eeb7 Use this delicious rice to fill up a vegetarian burrito, serve it alongside some homemade refried beans, top it off with some fresh cilantro or enjoy it as it is for a simple side dish to just about any meal.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Place the sweet potatoes in a medium saucepan with the salt and water to cover.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Cover the pot and bring to a boil, then simmer until tender, about 10 minutes.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Drain and set aside.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 While the sweet potatoes are cooking, warm the oil in a medium skillet or saucepan and add the onions, garlic, and chilies.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Cover and cook on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until the onions are tender, about 7 minutes.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Add the cumin and coriander and cook for 2 to 3 minutes longer, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and set aside.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 In a food processor, combine the black beans, cilantro, lemon juice, salt, and cooked sweet potatoes and puree until smooth. (You can also mash the ingredients in a large bowl by hand using a potato masher. The result will be a less smooth but nicely textured filling.)
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Transfer the sweet potato mixture to a large mixing bowl and mix in the cooked onions and spices.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Lightly oil a large baking dish.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Spoon about 2/3 to 3/4 cup of the filling in the center of each tortilla, roll it up and place it, seam side down, in the baking dish.
85b1365d-83da-4aa7-b360-7b9158a50955 Cover tightly with foil and bake for about 30 minutes, or until piping hot. Serve topped with salsa.
a2c69b64-0a8c-424c-829b-282137045d2c Gather the ingredients.
a2c69b64-0a8c-424c-829b-282137045d2c In a saucepan or skillet over medium-low heat, cook the green onions for 1 minute.
a2c69b64-0a8c-424c-829b-282137045d2c Add garlic and cook for about 1 minute longer.
a2c69b64-0a8c-424c-829b-282137045d2c Stir in the rice, tomatoes, tomato sauce, and seasoning mix. Heat through.
a2c69b64-0a8c-424c-829b-282137045d2c Serve and enjoy!
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Gather the ingredients.
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Preheat the oven to 400 F.​
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Thoroughly grease and flour a 9 × 9-inch baking pan (or use a nonstick baking pan or a flexible silicone pan). Or use a cast-iron skillet.
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Sift together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt.​
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Combine the milk, eggs, butter (or shortening) and sugar.​
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Add the liquid ingredients to the dry ones and mix just until the flour is moistened, no more than 10 to 15 seconds. Then fold in the corn, diced peppers, and cheese, but don't overmix the batter or the cornbread will be too tough.​
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Pour the batter into your prepared pan and bake the cornbread immediately.
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cornbread comes out clean and the edges of the cornbread start to separate from the pan.
5ff4f400-747e-4089-9437-a7df2547f2ea Serve and enjoy.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Gather ingredients.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Put the cauliflower, carrots, onion, and chiles in a wide-mouthed quart canning jar or a heatproof glass or ceramic bowl.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Combine the vinegar, water, sugar, salt, cloves, oregano, bay leaf, and garlic in a saucepan and bring to a boil over high heat.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Remove from the heat. Place the jar or bowl in your sink to catch any overflow and carefully pour the vinegar mixture over the vegetables.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Let sit for about 1 hour, or until completely cooled.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 If you have used a jar, screw on or clamp the lid. If you have used a bowl, transfer the vegetables and liquid to a plastic container with a tight-fitting lid.
f7021fea-d26a-4598-8d52-f7925e5ad445 Let sit at room temperature for 24 hours before serving. The vegetables will keep in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
55a2fe60-d7b4-482e-8716-b5a72d03cdde Heat the 2 tablespoons of lard or oil in a large wok or skillet over medium heat. Add the strips of chicken and stir-fry for 10 minutes.
55a2fe60-d7b4-482e-8716-b5a72d03cdde Add the onion and garlic and cook together for another 3 to 4 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
55a2fe60-d7b4-482e-8716-b5a72d03cdde Reduce heat to low. Add the rice, beans, 2 tablespoons of chili powder, and 1 teaspoon of cumin. Continue to stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes, until heated through. Add soy sauce or salt to taste.
55a2fe60-d7b4-482e-8716-b5a72d03cdde Serve immediately. Any leftovers will keep nicely in the fridge; reheat in skillet or microwave for a delicious “re-run” of flavors.
78453eb8-9648-45ff-848c-243163ab2237 Place 1 pound (2 1/2 cups) pinto beans in a Dutch oven or heavy stockpot in water to cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let stand for 1 hour. (Beans also may be soaked in cold tap water overnight in a covered pot.) Drain beans.
78453eb8-9648-45ff-848c-243163ab2237 Return beans to the Dutch oven. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 cups chicken broth and 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce heat, and simmer for about 2 hours, or until beans are tender.
78453eb8-9648-45ff-848c-243163ab2237 Melt 1/4 cup lard or bacon drippings in a large, heavy skillet. Add cooked pinto beans with their liquid, 2 cloves minced garlic, and 1 1/2 teaspoons salt. Mash with a potato masher or fork as the beans heat. Stirring often, cook the refried beans, uncovered, for 10 to 15 minutes until thick. Do not let them scorch.
cc8554e5-a419-4c57-935d-dca340ca4898 In a food processor, add in the flesh from the tomatoes, the onion chunks, habaneros, garlic, cilantro, peppers, oil, lime juice and salt. Process until everything is well combined. Do not process until smooth. Garnish with a lime wedge and a sprig of cilantro.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Gather the ingredients.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Sort and rinse the dry black beans, removing any impurities.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Add the beans and 2 cups of water (or broth) to a medium saucepan and bring to a boil.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Cover, remove from heat, and let stand for 1 hour. Drain the beans and set aside.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Saute the onions and garlic in vegetable oil until onions are soft, about 4 to 6 minutes.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Add the beans, remaining water (or broth), bay leaves, bouillon cube if using, oregano, hot sauce if using, salt, sugar, and balsamic vinegar.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Bring to a boil, cover, reduce the heat, and allow to simmer over low heat for about 30 to 45 minutes, or until the beans are done cooking.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Give the beans an occasional stir from time to time while they are cooking. Keep in mind that once you turn off the heat and remove the pot from the heat, the beans will continue to cook a bit as they cool, so don't be tempted to overcook the beans, unless you are planning on using them for something where you want them extra soft, such as making homemade refried beans.
f9819078-d7c8-421f-88dc-6136706db7bf Be sure to remove and discard the bay leaves before serving.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Gather the ingredients.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Roast the green chilis either in a broiler or over an open flame for about 10 minutes.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Remove the chilis from the heat source and place into a bowl. Cover the bowl with saran wrap to help capture the steam and let sit for 10 minutes. This will make peeling them much easier.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 When the chilis have cooled off enough to be able to handle them, use a piece of paper towel to gently scrape off the charred skin. Place to the side.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Add onions, jalapeño, and tomatillos into a food processor and pulse 4 to 5 times.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Add in remaining ingredients and pulse until desired consistency.
c9343e3c-d04d-4447-9487-3588e1629453 Salsa verde can be served immediately but it is better when it sits in the refrigerator overnight to let the flavors meld.
fe18eec2-688c-4e6c-b575-c5a387a28d0a To prepare the rice, combine the rice and the water in a large saucepan over high heat. Bring the water to a boil, and then turn the heat down to medium and simmer for twenty minutes, or until the rice is tender. While the rice is cooking, proceed with making the beans.
fe18eec2-688c-4e6c-b575-c5a387a28d0a Pour the olive oil into a large heavy skillet, and heat the skillet over medium-high heat. To the skillet, add the chopped red bell pepper, chopped green bell pepper, chopped onion, and minced garlic. Continue cooking the vegetables for 8 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the onions are translucent. The vegetables should be aromatic but not charred or overcooked. Then, add the tomato sauce, the ground cumin, the oregano, and the salt. Turn the heat to medium, and simmer the mixture for 5 minutes. Then, add the black beans and the vinegar, and simmer an additional 10 minutes.​
fe18eec2-688c-4e6c-b575-c5a387a28d0a To serve, spoon about 1/3 cup of cooked rice into each bowl, and then ladle the beans equally into each bowl, on top of the rice. Serve immediately and top with chopped tomatoes, avocado, salsa, or a bit of shredded cheese if you would like to.
9534deac-d6c5-4ab1-9ac4-7a52da625cf5 Gather the ingredients. Preheat oven to 375 F.
9534deac-d6c5-4ab1-9ac4-7a52da625cf5 Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them up into approximately 1-inch cubes.
9534deac-d6c5-4ab1-9ac4-7a52da625cf5 Place them in a buttered oven-safe dish, cover and bake for 45 minutes.
9534deac-d6c5-4ab1-9ac4-7a52da625cf5 Remove and top the sweet potatoes with the remaining butter, honey and cinnamon. Bake uncovered for an additional 10 to 15 minutes.
9534deac-d6c5-4ab1-9ac4-7a52da625cf5 Serve and enjoy!
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e Gather the ingredients.
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e In a skillet or saute pan over medium-low heat, melt the butter.
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e When the butter is hot add the corn, salt, and pepper, and green bell pepper.
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 20 minutes.
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e Add the chopped pimiento and heat through.
5a6b0c3c-d671-423a-876a-eb6ea148e17e Garnish the corn with chopped fresh cilantro, if desired.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b Gather the ingredients.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b You will need to pull the wings and legs off of each chapuline.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b Heat the oil in a shallow pan and sauté the garlic, chile, and the onions until the onions are translucent.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b With a slotted spoon, remove and discard the onions, chile and the garlic from the oil, leaving the oil in the pan.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b Sauté the chapulines in the oil until they are brown and crispy.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b Remove the chapulines and drain them well on paper towels.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b Sprinkle salt over the top, and then squeeze some lime over them.
3b6e8d96-d524-47f3-9f72-8367956ec00b You can enjoy them as a snack or use as a filling for tacos.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Gather the ingredients.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Heat the vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, green bell pepper, and garlic. Cook until the onion is translucent, stirring frequently.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Add the rice to the skillet and cook for about 2 to 3 minutes, or until the rice has browned slightly. Add tomatoes, chili powder, salt, and beef broth.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Bring the rice to a boil and cover the pan. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes. Taste and add more salt if needed.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Garnish with chopped cilantro, if desired.
211a8f9b-0341-4fe3-8b01-aa7257fc6821 Serve and enjoy!
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Gather the ingredients.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Crumble the beef into the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Add the chopped onion and bell peppers and continue cook for a few minutes longer, or until the beef is no longer pink.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Drain the browned ground beef, onion, and bell pepper and transfer them to the slow cooker.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, Worcestershire sauce, rice, and water to the beef mixture. Stir to blend.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Cover the pot and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours, or high for 3 to 3 1/2 hours, or until rice is tender. (If your crock pot cooks quickly, check the rice for doneness after about 5 hours on low or 2 hours on high.)
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Serve Spanish rice with cornbread or crusty French bread and a tossed salad.
193b8a0f-53f3-488c-8a4d-864ada7c97fb Enjoy!
0923c356-317e-4373-9adc-5d1d55b2fd49 Gather the ingredients.
0923c356-317e-4373-9adc-5d1d55b2fd49 Add the rice and water to the pot and cook uncovered for 10 minutes, then cover and reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for another 10 minutes. Check rice and simmer for an additional 5 minute if necessary. Set aside.
0923c356-317e-4373-9adc-5d1d55b2fd49 As a rice cooks, add the cooking oil to a pan and heat on medium-high. Add the garlic, followed by the onion and chile. Cook until fragrant.
0923c356-317e-4373-9adc-5d1d55b2fd49 If using, add peas and carrots to the pan and cook until soft, stirring occasionally.
0923c356-317e-4373-9adc-5d1d55b2fd49 Once the vegetables are ready, add the cooked rice to the pan and mix thoroughly to combine. Add salt, adjusting seasoning if more is needed.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Gather the ingredients.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 If you are soaking the beans, place the black beans, 1 green bell pepper, and 8 cups of water in a large soup or stock pot and set aside to allow to soak for 8 hours or overnight. If you are not soaking the beans, combine these ingredients and proceed to the next step.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Bring the beans, pepper, and water to a boil, then immediately turn the heat to a simmer and cook, covered for 1 1/2 hours, or until the beans are almost tender.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Prepare a sauce, called sofrito, by combining the remaining green bell pepper, the onion, garlic, oregano, cumin, bay leaf, and a little of the cooking water in a blender. Blend on low until the mixture is smooth.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Add the sofrito to the beans. Bring to a boil again, then immediately reduce the heat to a simmer.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Add salt, wine, vinegar, and sugar. Continue to simmer, uncovered, until the bean mixture becomes thick, about 2 more hours.
a121022b-3935-4caf-be04-d44e2769d8a1 Add olive oil immediately before serving. Serve over steamed rice.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Gather the ingredients.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Cut the pork into chunks. Fairly big pieces are traditional, but if you prefer, cut the pork into bite-sized pieces.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Put the pork in a large pot and add enough cool water to cover it by about 2 inches (approximately 5 to 6 cups). Bring to a boil, skimming off any foam that forms in the pot.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Remove the stem and seeds from the chiles, and peel the garlic. Add the chiles, garlic, and salt to the pork.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Reduce the heat to maintain a steady simmer, cover, and cook until the pork is fork tender, about 90 minutes. Alternatively, put the covered, ovenproof pot in a 350 F oven for the same amount of time.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 After the pork has cooked, add the hominy and the Mexican oregano. Continue cooking at a simmer until the flavors blend and the pork is very tender, for another hour. Add additional water, if necessary, to keep the moisture at a good level, return the mixture to a boil and reduce back down to a simmer when needed. Add salt to taste.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Serve the pozole in deep bowls.
2fd12ca4-9130-4a3e-9a19-2c81180f89d3 Garnish with chopped cilantro, scallion, radish, and green cabbage. If you like, squeeze fresh lime juice on top. Enjoy.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Gather your ingredients.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Preheat the oven to 375F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside. Brush both sides of each tortilla with the melted butter. Stack them after they have been brushed.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Dust each buttered tortilla with cinnamon sugar on both sides.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Cut each tortilla into 6 wedges. You can cut them individually or stack them and cut them to save time.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Place the wedges on the prepared baking sheets. Do not let them overlap. Sprinkle the tops with extra cinnamon sugar.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Bake them in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until crisp and the sugar has slightly caramelized. Allow them to cool before topping them!
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Gather the ingredients for the cream cheese icing.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Whisk together the softened cream cheese, powdered sugar, vanilla extract, and milk in a small bowl. Place it in a decorating bag or a zip-top bag with the tip cut off.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave in 30-second increments, stirring in between until completely smooth.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Chop the strawberries in a small dice. Then toss them with the tablespoon of granulated sugar.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Arrange the tortillas on your serving plate.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Drizzle the cinnamon sugar chips with the melted chocolate and cream cheese icing. Then top with the chopped strawberries.
bbd9b2c5-ae14-4cae-aeb1-0011010369eb Top with a few squirts of whipped cream and serve immediately!
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Gather the ingredients.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 In the bowl of a stand mixer, combine butter, sugar, aniseed, salt, and 1/2 cup of the flour.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Use the dough hook to mix the ingredients until they begin to come together.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 In a separate small bowl, whisk together the eggs, water, and orange zest.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Add this to the stand mixer bowl, along with another 1/2 cup of the flour. Mix until combined.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Add the yeast and another 1/2 cup of flour, mixing to combine.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Add the remaining flour 1 cup at a time, mixing between additions, until a dough forms.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it for 1 minute.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Cover it with a clean, damp dishcloth and let rise in a warm area for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Separate about 1/4 of the dough and use it to make bone shapes to drape across the loaf.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Shape the rest of the dough into a flat-bottomed semi-sphere. Position the bone shapes on the top of the loaf and press gently so they adhere. Let the dough rise for an additional hour.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Bake the loaf in a 350 F oven for about 40 minutes (30 minutes for smaller loaves).
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Cool and glaze, if desired, before serving.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Cut pan de muerto into large wedges for eating by hand. Serve it with Mexican hot chocolate or champurrado (chocolate atole) if you like.
6eec5a87-3dc1-47d7-8a48-94edc699ed77 Enjoy!
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Gather your ingredients.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Whisk together the dry ingredients.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Whisk together the melted butter, milk, and eggs in a liquid measuring cup.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Fold the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and combine until all the dry ingredients are just moistened.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Cook the waffles on your waffle iron to your desired doneness. Keep them warm in a 250F oven while your finish cooking all of them.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Gather your topping ingredients.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Combine the cinnamon and sugar together in a bowl.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Melt the butter and brush the cooked waffles with the melted butter on both sides.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Dust the waffles with the cinnamon sugar until they are completely coated on both sides.
31d37014-581a-441e-bd3f-e84266019b9a Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave in 30-second increments until completely melted. Then drizzle the chocolate sauce over the top of the waffles, and serve with whipped cream!
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Gather the ingredients.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 The tablets of chocolate de mesa are usually divided into 6 to 8 wedges. Place each tablet on a cutting board and cut with a sharp knife to divide the piece into the wedges. Don't worry if they don’t cut perfectly—you are going to be dissolving the chocolate.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Place the milk in a saucepan over medium heat.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Once the first tiny bubbles begin to appear in the milk, add the wedges of chocolate and continue heating, stirring slowly but constantly, until the chocolate has melted. Do not let the milk boil; if it looks as if it is going to start boiling, take the pan off the heat for a few minutes, continue to stir, then turn the burner down somewhat and return the pan to the heat.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Drink your hot chocolate as is, or place in a blender, half of the amount at a time, and carefully blend the mixture until the desired degree of frothiness has been reached.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Pour your hot chocolate into rustic clay mugs for serving.
1e98dbc5-fcb4-4cb1-8c88-d626068727b0 Enjoy!
b1513e4e-64e7-4a6d-89d2-6abcb0db1fdf Gather the ingredients.
b1513e4e-64e7-4a6d-89d2-6abcb0db1fdf Place half of the fruit, the sugar, the water, and the lime juice into a blender and blend until smooth.
b1513e4e-64e7-4a6d-89d2-6abcb0db1fdf Dice the other half of the fruit. Spoon diced fruit into ice pop molds, then add the blended mixture, leaving about half an inch (approximately 1 centimeter) of headspace for expansion.
b1513e4e-64e7-4a6d-89d2-6abcb0db1fdf Place the molds into the freezer and allow at least 6 hours for your treats to firm up completely. If your molds don’t have built-in popsicle sticks (or you are using paper cups or some other receptacle as molds), take your pops out of the freezer after about an hour and insert wooden sticks into the slushy mix; return to freezer.
b1513e4e-64e7-4a6d-89d2-6abcb0db1fdf Enjoy!
74e3e5a7-4e02-4a17-a6fe-8c4cb2a64203 Melt the chocolate. The chocolate does not need to actually cook at all, just melt completely. Use one of the following methods: Microwave method: Place chocolate and heavy cream in a microwave safe bowl. Cook in microwave for a minute or so, making sure to stir every 20 seconds. Stop microwaving when mixture is smooth. Direct stove-top method: Place chocolate and cream in saucepan over low heat. Stir constantly until mixture is smooth. (Note: Be very careful when using this method, as a moment of inattention can lead to the chocolate´s burning). Hot water bath method: Place chocolate and cream in a metal bowl. Place the bowl in pan of very hot water in such a way that the water comes 1/3 to ½ way up the sides of the bowl. Stir ingredients gently until mixture is smooth.
74e3e5a7-4e02-4a17-a6fe-8c4cb2a64203 Stir in the cinnamon, coffee liqueur, and sugar. Pour into a serving dish and enjoy. Any leftover sauce can be stored in a tightly-covered glass jar in the refrigerator for a week or so. Reheat before using.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Gather your ingredients.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Preheat the oven to 325 F. Line a 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper. Cut the paper in a square that will fit in the bottom of the pan with four flaps on each side that will line the sides. You can do this by making a 90 degree cut at the corners where each side meets.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Place the butter and sugar in a large, microwave-safe bowl. You will do most of the stirring in this bowl, so make sure to pick one that will fit all of the batter. Heat it in the microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove it from the microwave and stir. We used a whisk, but you can also use a hand-mixer.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Allow it to cool on the counter for a few minutes, then stir in the vanilla extract, cayenne pepper, ground cinnamon, and cocoa powder.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Add in one egg at a time to the butter and sugar mixture, mixing after each addition.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af In another bowl whisk together the flour, baking soda, cornstarch, and salt.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients. Mix until the flour mixture has been completely incorporated, but do not over-mix!
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Gently stir in the chocolate chips and chocolate bar chunks. If you are adding nuts, add them now as well.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top so that it is even.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Allow the brownies to cool slightly in the pan and then lift the sides of the parchment paper to lift the brownies out of the pan.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Cut the brownies when they have mostly cooled to get the cleanest cuts.
4f2d6082-fded-40ac-ad3a-0e56b70540af Enjoy them with a cold glass of milk or a cup of Mexican Hot Chocolate!
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Gather the ingredients.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Line a half sheet baking pan (cookie sheet about 17 x 13 inches / 43 x 33 centimeters) completely with aluminum foil. Set aside.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Place the cajeta or dulce de leche into a little glass custard dish. Place the dish into a larger bowl containing hot water, in such a way that the heat will soften and thin out the thick candy paste while you’re preparing the other ingredients.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Break the Maria cookies into pieces of approximately 1 inch (2.5 centimeters) square. Use a sharp knife to cut up the Carlos V bars into pieces no larger than 1 inch (2.5 centimers) square. Since Mexican chocolate tends to be brittle and a little chalky, many smaller splinters with occur, which is fine.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Use one of these methods to melt the candy coating: Microwave method: Break the candy coating into chunks. Place them in a microwave-safe glass bowl. Microwave in spurts of 30 seconds, stirring with a heat-resistant rubber scraper after each spurt, until melted. Stove-top method: Break the candy coating into chunks. Place chunks into a non-stick saucepan over low heat. Heat, stirring frequently with a heat-resistant rubber scraper, until coating is melted.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Add the Maria cookies pieces, the peanuts, and the pumpkin seeds to the melted chocolate, and stir well. Add the Carlos V chocolate pieces and colored sprinkles and stir briefly but well. (We are adding these ingredients after the others have been well mixed in so that there will be less chance of these melting from the heat.) Note: Set aside a small amount of peanuts, pumpkin seeds, chocolate pieces and sprinkles, if you like, to decorate the top of your candy after mixing is done.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Pour the mixture onto the cookie sheet and use the rubber scraper to spread it out well, within about an inch of the edges of the pan.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Pour the softened cajeta or dulce de leche over the white mixture and use a spatula or spoon to spread it out. Place the wafers over the cajeta/dulce de leche layer, overlapping them slightly.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Sprinkle any reserved ingredients over the top of everything. Gently shake the cookie sheet so that these loose ingredients will get stuck in the sticky stuff in between the wafers. Press down lightly on the wafers with the palms of your hands so that all the ingredients will be well embedded into the white candy base.
fc613d12-d0d7-43e9-949a-02cb9bd35709 Refrigerate or freeze your candy for about at least half an hour, until it has completely hardened. Take candy off cookie sheet. Peel off aluminum foil. Break the candy into pieces; these will be irregularly shaped. Eat your delicious Mexican Candy Bark right away, or store it for up to a week in a plastic or glass jar or other container in the refrigerator.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Gather the ingredients.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Arrange six 5- or 6-ounce ramekins on your work surface. Add 3/4 cup of sugar and 1/4 cup of water to a saucepan and place it over medium heat. Cook, gently swirling the pan, until the sugar is melted and golden brown.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Working quickly while the syrup is still liquid, add about 1 tablespoon to each ramekin, swirling to coat the bottom. Repeat with the remaining sugar syrup and ramekins. Set the ramekins aside while you prepare the custard mixture.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 In a mixing bowl, whisk the eggs and egg yolk with 1/3 cup of granulated sugar and a dash of salt.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Combine the milk and cream in a medium saucepan. Place the saucepan over medium heat and cook until the milk mixture begins to bubble around the edge. Gradually whisk the hot milk and cream mixture into the egg mixture. Add the vanilla extract and whisk to blend thoroughly.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Divide the custard among the ramekins. Cover each ramekin tightly with foil.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Place a trivet in the Instant Pot and add 1 1/2 cups of water. Arrange the ramekins in the pot, stacking as necessary.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Lock the Instant Pot lid in place and turn the steam vent to the sealing position. Set the pot to manual or "pressure cook" setting, high pressure, for 9 minutes. When the time is up, let the pressure release naturally for 15 minutes.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Carefully turn the steam release vent to the venting position to release the remaining pressure. Remove the ramekins to a rack to cool to room temperature. Refrigerate the individual flan desserts for 3 to 4 hours, or overnight.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Remove the foil from the ramekins and let them stand at room temperature for 10 minutes. Carefully run a thin butter knife around the edge to loosen the custard. Un-mold onto rimmed dessert plates. If the flan doesn't un-mold immediately, tilt the ramekin from side to side to break the vacuum.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 After the flans are unmolded, set the ramekins in a pan with about 1/2-inch of hot water to melt some of the remaining hard caramel in the bottom; spoon or drizzle the extra caramel over the flans.
94323c56-914a-4258-9522-2fe699f89051 Enjoy!
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Gather the ingredients.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Use a fork to smash together the masa harina with the lard or shortening, mixing until well combined.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Add the sugar, salt, and baking soda and mix well.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 In a small bowl, use a fork to beat the egg yolks with the water until you achieve a homogenous mix. Add the egg yolk to the masa harina mixture and stir, first with a fork and later with your hands, until all the ingredients are well combined and you achieve a soft, smooth dough. Add a little more water, if necessary, to create a manageable dough.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Use your hands to form balls of dough of about 1 (3 cm) inch in diameter. Use your fingers to press this ball into a disk about 2 inches (5 cm) in diameter and a little less than half an inch (1 cm) thick. Note: Keeping your hands wet will greatly facilitate your work with the dough.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Place the disc of dough on a comal or anti-stick skillet over medium heat. Allow it to cook for 2 or 3 minutes. When the edges of the disk look dry and the dough starts to puff up a bit, use a spatula to turn it over to cook on the other side. Once your griddlecake has browned on both sides and looks cooked, take it off the heat; place it in cloth- or paper-lined basket or bowl where it will stay warm.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Continue with steps 4 and 5, cooking several gorditas at a time, until all the dough has been used.
12782358-e518-4e69-9eee-e6d5e472cb58 Eat your delicious warm corn griddle cakes dry, or top with syrup, cajeta, jam, or a bit of sweetened, condensed milk. Serve with atole, café con leche, or Mexican hot chocolate, if you wish. Any leftover griddle cakes can be stored at room temperature in an airtight container.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Gather the ingredients.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Make the topping by combining sugar and cinnamon in a shallow dish.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Sift together the flour and baking powder.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 In a separate bowl, cream the sugar and the oil or butter until smooth. Add the egg, milk, and masa harina.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Gradually add the flour, mixing well after each addition, until a dough forms.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Roll the dough into meatball-sized spheres, about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. You can leave them round, or flatten them into cakes.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Heat vegetable oil in a medium-sized saucepan until hot. Fry dough balls or cakes until golden brown, about 6 or 7 minutes, turning to brown all over.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Remove balls to the paper towel-covered plate to drain.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Using tongs, place each buñuelo onto the plate with the sugar and cinnamon mixture and shake until well coated, turning the piece over if necessary.
3ed1d009-6cfd-4b10-9139-57a1f81ccc91 Serve your delicious buñuelos warm, with atole or hot chocolate, if you like.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Gather the ingredients.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Mix 1 tablespoon of sugar and the yeast into lukewarm water. Let it rest for about 10 minutes.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Cream the shortening and sugar in a large mixing bowl until fluffy.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Slowly add the eggs, the salt, and the yeast water to the bowl, mixing to combine.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Add the flour 1 cup at a time and mix on low speed until fully incorporated.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Cover the dough and let it rise in a warm place for 45 minutes.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Divide the dough into 16 pieces and shape each into a ball. Place them on a lightly greased baking sheet with plenty of space in between each one.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Press each ball slightly to flatten it. Let the dough balls rise for another hour.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c During the second rise, mix all of the topping ingredients in a food processor until smooth.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Add a few drops of optional food coloring if desired.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Use your hands to divide the topping into 16 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball in your palms.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Then, use a rolling pin to flatten each one out on a floured surface to about 5 inches in diameter or until it can cover one of the risen buns.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Lightly press each topping disc onto an unbaked bun and use a knife to cut a pattern into the topping layer, without cutting into the dough.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Bake the buns at 350 F for about 15 minutes or until they turn lightly golden.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Cool the buns on a wire rack before serving.
538bba8c-556b-456f-b729-f5f83a075d3c Serve and enjoy!
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Gather the ingredients.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Sprinkle the yeast on the surface of the water and let it sit for 10 minutes.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b In a large mixing bowl, combine the yeast water, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, salt, cinnamon, anise seed, and vanilla extract.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Mix until a dough forms.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Knead the dough for 5 minutes, then cover and let rise in a warm area until dough is doubled in size, about 2 hours.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Preheat oven to 350 F.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Punch dough down and shape into a wreath. You can do this by simply rolling it into a log shape then bending the ends around to form a circle, or you can make three thinner strips and braid them, then put the ends together.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b The wreath should be about 12 to 14 inches in diameter. Lift up one area and insert the toy by pushing it up through the bottom. Smooth out any lumps or tears.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Add the dried fruit by laying it across the top and pressing it in slightly. Let it rise until doubled.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Brush top with egg wash, sprinkle with sugar and bake for approximately 45 minutes in the preheated oven.
0432d150-0327-49c3-b36e-301ed4e1dd3b Let cool, then serve and enjoy!
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Melt 5 tablespoons of the butter in the microwave or in a small saucepan. Spread the bread cubes in an even layer on two large baking sheets and drizzle with the melted butter. Toss to coat.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 While the bread toasts, grate the piloncillo.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 In a large saucepan, combine the grated piloncillo with the water, raisins, cinnamon stick, cloves, and star anise. Heat over medium-high heat until it comes to a gentle boil. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes, or until reduced by half.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Turn off the heat and remove the cinnamon stick, star anise, and cloves. Set the piloncillo syrup aside to cool.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Use the remaining 1 tablespoon of butter to grease a 9×13-inch baking dish. Add a third of the toasted bread to make the first layer covering the bottom of the baking dish.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Distribute half of the bananas, half of the diced mango, half of the queso fresco, and half of the peanuts over the bread layer.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Pour on about a third of the piloncillo syrup.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Start another layer, adding a third of the bread and the remaining half of the bananas, mango, queso fresco, and peanuts. Pour on another third of the syrup.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Finally, cover with the remaining third of the bread and pour the rest of the syrup on top.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Cover with aluminum foil. Bake the capirotada in the preheated oven for 25 minutes. After 25 minutes remove it from the oven, carefully uncover, and press down with a spatula to make sure the syrup saturates all of the bread. Cover again with aluminum foil and return to the oven. After another 25 minutes, carefully remove the foil, and bake for about 10 minutes more so the top browns.
33fa91ca-8571-4c11-acd8-0d59e39fd911 Cool slightly before serving. Dust the top with powdered sugar and garnish with non-pareil sprinkles, if desired.
57e77500-968e-459d-b117-5a304abd3ecc Gather the ingredients.
57e77500-968e-459d-b117-5a304abd3ecc Preheat the oven to 350 F and lightly grease a 9-inch square or round cake pan.
57e77500-968e-459d-b117-5a304abd3ecc In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, cinnamon, and cayenne and stir. Add the cold water, vegetable oil, white vinegar, and vanilla and stir until just combined.
57e77500-968e-459d-b117-5a304abd3ecc Pour the batter into the cake pan and bake for about 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.
57e77500-968e-459d-b117-5a304abd3ecc Let the cake cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar and serve.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Prepare an 8x8-inch baking pan by lining it with aluminum foil and spraying the foil with nonstick cooking spray.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Combine the marshmallows and chocolate chips in a small bowl and set aside.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Place the butter, milk, sugar, cinnamon, cayenne, and salt in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir until sugar dissolves.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Bring the mixture to a boil.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Continue to let the candy boil, stirring constantly, for five minutes.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Remove from the heat.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Stir in the marshmallows, chocolate chips, and vanilla, mixing until well-combined.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Pour into the prepared pan and smooth the top.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b While fudge is still wet, sprinkle the chopped Mexican chocolate on top.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Place in the refrigerator for 90 minutes to set the fudge.
7272b134-3b0c-4964-9a45-8b9e46c4729b Once set, cut into 1-inch squares to serve.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Cream the butter with the powdered sugar until well blended and smooth. Beat in the vanilla, then add the flour and salt.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Mix just until combined, but don't mix too much. You don't want too much gluten to form; the cookies should be tender. Add the nuts, if using.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Cover the dough and chill it for several hours in the refrigerator. We like to make this dough the day before we bake them.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 When you're ready to bake, let the dough stand at room temperature for about 30 minutes. The dough will be really hard from being chilled. Preheat the oven to 400 F.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Form the dough into 1-inch balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. The dough will not spread at all during baking, so you can place them pretty close together. We can usually get all of the cookies onto just two cookie sheets.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Bake the cookies for 8 to 12 minutes. The cookies should not brown on the top or just be very pale gold on the tops, but be lightly golden on the bottom.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Immediately take the cookies, one at a time, off the hot cookie sheet and drop into a shallow bowl full of powdered sugar, roll, and place on a rack to cool. When the cookies are cool, roll them again in powdered sugar to coat.
b628ed4b-5efa-4015-bada-f97228766358 Store in an airtight container at room temperature up to 1 week, if they last that long!
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 Turn your oven on at 350 F/175 C so that is can preheat while you prepare the tortillas. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon, mixing well.
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 If using butter, use the real stuff (not margarine!) and melt it completely, either with 10-second bursts in the microwave until it is liquid or over low heat in a pan on the stove. Use a pastry brush to coat both sides of one tortilla with a thin layer of melted butter. (Use this same method if you have chosen coconut oil—but remember that coconut oil melts at a much lower temperature than butter does, so be extra careful not to burn it). If using cooking spray, spray each side of one tortilla so that the whole piece is covered with a very thin layer of oil.
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 Place the tortilla on a large dinner plate. Sprinkle a couple of tablespoons of the sugar mixture on top of the tortilla and use your fingers to spread it around; it will stick to the tortilla because of the butter or oil coating. Turn tortilla over and repeat this operation, so that both sides of the tortilla are evenly coated with cinnamon sugar. If necessary, turn the piece over and repeat so that maximum coverage is achieved. Place coated tortilla on a large cutting board.
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 Repeat steps 2 and 3 with the rest of the tortillas, placing them all in a stack on the cutting board. Use a sharp knife to cut the stack of tortillas into 8 wedges.
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 Place the tortillas wedges in a single layer onto a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Bake the chips for about 15 minutes, until they are crispy and lightly browned. Keep a close eye on them during the last few minutes of baking so that your chips do not over-brown.
476d3fe2-490d-4c0e-b731-59d2a9651916 Remove your baked churro chips from the oven and allow them to cool undisturbed for 12 to 15 minutes so that they can “set.” Serve immediately or store loosely covered for later. (These are best when eaten within a couple of days of making.) Eat with your hands!
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Gather the ingredients.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Bring whole milk and water to a slow simmer in a large pot, over medium-low heat.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Stir in rice and add the cinnamon sticks and barely simmer, uncovered, until rice is softened, which should be about 20 to 30 minutes. Stir occasionally.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 When rice is soft, remove cinnamon sticks.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Stir in the condensed milk, vanilla, salt, and raisins.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Return to a slight simmer and cook for an additional 10 to 15 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed and rice has a pudding-like consistency.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Serve hot, topped with a sprinkle of cinnamon or butter.
67c1e3df-b69f-495d-9bf0-2c3b5ad8c2b9 Enjoy!
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. In a separate bowl, beat the oil, sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract until combined. Add the eggs to the sugar mixture one at a time and beat on medium speed until fully incorporated. Stir in 1/2 cup of milk, then gently fold in the flour mixture a little at a time.
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Pour the batter into a lightly greased cake pan or baking dish, and bake the cake at 325 F for 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in several locations comes out clean.
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Let the cake cool in the pan to room temperature. Turn it out onto a platter with raised edges. Pierce the cake with a fork 20 to 30 times. Let it cool in the refrigerator for an additional 30 minutes.
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Make the cream syrup while the cake chills. Whisk together the three milks and the rum or brandy if desired. Slowly pour the liquid over the cooled cake. Refrigerate it for 1 hour, periodically spooning the milk runoff back onto the cake.
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Make the whipped topping just before you serve the cake. Combine heavy cream, vanilla, and sugar in a chilled mixing bowl. Beat it on high speed until peaks form. Spread a thin layer of the whipped topping over the cake.
a417837e-8341-4a78-825c-7d9feaab0ced Top it with a sprinkle of cinnamon or garnish it with fresh berries.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Preheat the oven to 350 F/177 C.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Place the butter, 3/4 cup of the powdered sugar, and vanilla in a large mixing bowl. Stir vigorously, or beat with an electric mixer at medium-high speed until completely combined.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 In a separate bowl, combine flour and 1/4 teaspoon of the salt.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Add the flour to the butter about 1/2 cup at a time, beating well after each addition, until well incorporated.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Carefully fold in the nuts.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Take a small amount of dough, and roll it into a 1- to 2-inch ball. Place it on a on a lightly greased cookie sheet.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Repeat with more dough, leaving about 2 inches of space between balls. Bake for about 15 minutes.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Stir together the rest of the powdered sugar and salt.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 After taking cookies out of the oven, roll them one by one in this mixture.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Place on rack to cool. If desired, roll cookies in sugar again once they have cooled completely.
c4f24b6f-d2d8-496d-b35d-af8e8a6bd495 Serve and enjoy!
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Gather the ingredients.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Preheat your oven to 350 F.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 In a large mixing bowl, cream together the confectioner's sugar, vanilla extract, and margarine or coconut oil until creamy.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Add the chopped almonds to the sugar and margarine mixture, then gradually mix in the flour. Your dough will be crumbly but easily formed into a ball when worked slightly with hands.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Form into balls, about walnut sized, or 1 and 1/2 inches in diameter, and place onto an un-greased cookie sheet. You then can go on to shape them into moons or another shape with your hands or leave them as spheres. Do not flatten these as you would peanut butter cookies. To retain the crescent shape keep them kind of on the slender side because they tend to spread a little bit.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Bake the cookies an on un-greased cookie sheet on the middle rack of your preheated oven for about 12 minutes​ or until ever so lightly golden brown on edges. Remove from oven and let cool on cookie sheet about 15 minutes. Roll generously in confectioner's sugar until very well coated.
85f13a1f-8b2d-485d-84fa-027b2138ea35 Let cool an additional 20 minutes on wire rack before enjoying.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Gather the ingredients.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Preheat the oven to 325 F. Heat a kettle or pot of water for the water bath.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Pour 1 cup of the sugar in a warm pan over medium heat.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Constantly stir the sugar while it heats until it browns and turns into caramel—that is, becomes a brown liquid. Do not overcook since the caramel will burn.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Immediately, and quickly, pour approximately 2 to 3 tablespoons of caramel in each of the 12 individual custard dishes or ramekins, tilting them so the caramel swirls around on the inside. Work quickly, as the caramel will cool and harden almost as soon as it hits the dish. Reheat the caramel in the pan if it thickens too much to work with.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 In an electric mixer or with a whisk, blend the eggs. Add the sweetened condensed milk and evaporated milk, then mix.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Slowly mix in the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar while beating, then the vanilla. Blend until smooth after each ingredient is added.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Pour the custard mixture into the caramel-lined dishes, distributing it equally. Place the individual dishes in a large ceramic or metal baking pan with sides. Carefully pour hot water into the baking pan around the custard dishes to a depth of about 2 inches.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Cover the pan with foil and bake the flan for 45 minutes to an hour in the water bath. Check with a knife inserted just off-center into one of the servings; if the knife comes out clean, the flan is ready.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Remove the large baking dish from the oven and carefully take the individual dishes out of the hot water. Let cool to room temperature, then place in the refrigerator for at least an hour before serving. Leave flan in the dishes they baked in until time to serve.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 To serve, run a knife around the edge of the dish and invert each individual dish onto a small plate, allowing the flan to drop out and the caramel sauce to flow over the custard.
f16f9d41-5c1a-40a1-a2c7-7c479c249393 Enjoy.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Gather the ingredients.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Heat the water in a large pot until it starts to boil. Take the pot off the stove, and add the piloncillo or brown sugar so it will dissolve while we are working with the pineapple. (If you are using piloncillo, the dissolving process will take longer; stir the water occasionally with a wooden spoon and break the piloncillo up as it softens to help this process along.)
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Cut the crown off of the pineapple; discard it or use it to grow a new plant. Wash the outside of the pineapple with water, making sure to get rid of any dirt particles or potential bugs.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Peel your pineapple. Do this on a cutting board set into the sink to reduce mess. Cut a slice off the top of the fruit, another slice off the bottom, and then slice the peel off in strips -- but use your favorite method, as long as you end up with a peeled pineapple.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Once the sugar or piloncillo has dissolved into the hot water, place the pieces of peel into the pot. Add the stick of cinnamon.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Cut the fruit of the pineapple into slices or chunks, reserving the fibrous core. Store the fruit for another use.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Add the core, whole or in chunks, to the pot and stir.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Cover the pot with a dishtowel, and set it on the kitchen counter or another place (at room temperature) where it is easily accessible but out of the way. The towel will keep out any foreign matter while allowing air to reach the mixture, allowing for successful fermentation.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f After 24 to 36 hours, check your tepache. If you see a bit of frothy white foam on the surface of the water, it’s fermenting. You can drink it as is, or let it continue to brew another day or so. If you do not see any white froth, cover the pot again and check it after another 24 hours; the time necessary for fermentation will vary according to the temperature, ripeness of the pineapple, and other factors.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Once your tepache has reached the desired level of fermentation, strain out, and discard all the solids.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Transfer the liquid to a pitcher and refrigerate. Refrigerated tepache will keep for up to a week, very slowly continuing to ferment more.
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Before serving, take a test drink. Add more water or sugar to taste. (We almost always dilute mine with more water.)
5f1beb1a-7f29-4299-994c-3ba164dc865f Serve over ice, if desired.
beb7a65b-24dc-496a-911a-61e6b38d6e4b Gather the ingredients.
beb7a65b-24dc-496a-911a-61e6b38d6e4b In a large pot, whisk masa harina into the warm water until thoroughly combined.
beb7a65b-24dc-496a-911a-61e6b38d6e4b Add milk, chocolate, piloncillo, and anise.
beb7a65b-24dc-496a-911a-61e6b38d6e4b Bring to a simmer and whisk with a molinillo (a special tool to whip the drink) until chocolate is melted and sugar is dissolved. If you don't have a molinillo, use a whisk.
beb7a65b-24dc-496a-911a-61e6b38d6e4b Serve and enjoy!
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 Lightly butter or grease a 9 by 9-inch square pan. Line the pan with a piece of parchment paper or aluminum foil, leaving about a 1-inch overhang on all sides.
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 Combine the condensed milk, evaporated milk, butter, vanilla, cinnamon and salt in a saucepan.
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 Cook over medium heat, stirring continuously with a wooden spoon or heatproof spatula until the mixture has thickened and starts pulling away from the sides of the pan, 20 to 30 minutes. The candy should easily slide out of the pan.
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 At this time, you can add food coloring to the batch if you like. Pink, red, and green are the most popular colors, Split the batch in 2 to make more colors but work fast because the fudge will set up fairly quickly.
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 Pour into the prepared pan and allow to set at room temperature, about 2 hours.
ac5d53f0-7490-4be2-a98d-2023f3e32606 Cut into rectangles or desired shapes.
cc776b9a-35ba-4995-9008-6ef9e148d7e2 Gather the ingredients.
cc776b9a-35ba-4995-9008-6ef9e148d7e2 To a blender or food processor, add olive oil, garlic, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, lime juice, and salt.
cc776b9a-35ba-4995-9008-6ef9e148d7e2 Process until all the ingredients are incorporated and the garlic and onion are thoroughly broken down.
cc776b9a-35ba-4995-9008-6ef9e148d7e2 Transfer to a non-reactive bowl (a non-reactive bowl is one made of a material that does not react chemically with the citric acids in the lemon and lime such as stainless steel, glass, or ceramic). Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
cc776b9a-35ba-4995-9008-6ef9e148d7e2 Serve with plantain chips or fritters.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c Heat olive oil in a large skillet over low heat.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c When the oil is hot, saute garlic, bay leaf, onions, peppers, diced tomatoes, and ham until onions and peppers are soft.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c Stir in the tomato paste and allow to caramelize. Add the wine and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cilantro and oregano.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c Remove from heat and allow to cool. Remove the bay leaf.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c Puree the cooled mixture in a blender or food processor. Add salt and pepper to taste.
b73da190-de27-48b6-b07c-b6d7ccab986c You can use it right away in a recipe calling for sofrito or place the mixture in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid and refrigerate up to 2 weeks.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Mix together the yeast, sugar, and 2 cups warm water in a large mixing bowl. Cover the mixture and let it stand for about 20 minutes until the yeast forms a foam on the top.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 In a separate mixing bowl, mix together the salt and flour.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Add the flour mixture to the yeast mixture 1 cup at a time. The dough will begin to form as you add the flour.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Knead the dough for 10 to 15 minutes after you've added the last of the flour. It should become elastic and no longer sticky.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Grease a large bowl and place the ball of kneaded dough inside. Cover the bowl and let the dough rise for 1 1/2 to 2 hours. The dough should double in size.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Flour a work area and place the risen dough on it. Separate the dough into 2 equal portions and knead them into separate long loaves, about 12 to 14 inches.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Sprinkle some cornmeal or flour on a baking board or cookie sheet large enough to hold both loaves. Place the loaves on the board or sheet and make 3 to 4 slashes along the top of each with a sharp knife.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Mix together the egg whites and the 2 tablespoons water. Brush the egg mixture on top of the loaves.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Place the loaves on the center rack of a cold oven, then place a shallow baking pan on the rack below the loaves. Fill the shallow pan with 1 cup boiling water.
6403520b-e26c-4c6d-a1f9-754a61377b12 Wait 10 minutes, then turn the oven to 400 F. Bake the loaves for 35 minutes. Their internal temperature should reach 200 F and they should be golden and a little crusty. Serve warm.
e17de556-de88-4c73-a96c-4c229007997b Add the oil to large pot or pan. If you'll be using the sugar in a meat or poultry dish, use the same pot or pan you'll be cooking it in.
e17de556-de88-4c73-a96c-4c229007997b Warm the oil over medium-high heat until it's hot but not smoking.
e17de556-de88-4c73-a96c-4c229007997b Sprinkle the sugar into the pot in an even layer. Let it melt until it begins to froth and bubble.
e17de556-de88-4c73-a96c-4c229007997b Immediately add the remaining recipe ingredients as soon as the edges of the froth and the bubbles begin to turn a slightly darker shade.
e17de556-de88-4c73-a96c-4c229007997b Continue with the recipe you're making.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Gather the ingredients.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Toast the rice over medium heat in a dry skillet until lightly golden. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a plate or platter to cool.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Place the remaining spices, except the turmeric, into the skillet and cook over medium heat until fragrant and toasty. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a plate or platter to cool.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Place the cooled rice and spices into a spice mill, blender, or food processor. Grind into a fine powder. Place the powder in a bowl and thoroughly stir in the turmeric.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Store the seasoning in an airtight jar, container, or sealed baggie. Be sure to label it and record the date you made it. The powder will keep for several months.
9e2e81cf-3863-4060-999c-07c39e6bbb3d Enjoy!
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 Gather the ingredients.
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 In a small pot, add the bay leaves and water. Cover and boil over high heat for 3 minutes.
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 Remove the pot from the heat and let the tea steep for 4 minutes.
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 Strain out the bay leaves.
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 If desired, sweeten or add milk to suit your taste.
9c17ace0-d1aa-4224-8376-b9089482cfc2 Serve and enjoy.
7c4c7c01-1353-4ddb-abb4-971ea5e4b62e Heat the oil and seeds in a small saucepan over medium heat just until the seeds begin a steady bubble.
7c4c7c01-1353-4ddb-abb4-971ea5e4b62e Remove the saucepan from the heat and let stand for a minute.
7c4c7c01-1353-4ddb-abb4-971ea5e4b62e Strain the oil.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Add flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, and cinnamon to a large bowl and mix thoroughly.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Rub the butter into the flour mixture.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Add enough water to make a soft dough. When the dough comes together, knead for 2 to 3 minutes. Rub oil over the dough and let rest, covered, at least 30 minutes.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Heat oven to 350 F.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Knead rested dough for 1 minute and divide into 4 to 5 equal pieces. Form the dough into balls and roll into 3 1/2 inch circles. Transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet with adequate space between each disk.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Bake for 25 minutes or until the top is lightly browned and the bottom, when rapped, sounds hollow.
63575634-4d48-4b84-a8be-3b6036d7855a Cool on a wire rack, slice in half and serve as you please.
3e4bb0fc-77b5-43c3-88ba-9c63a3fb186f Soak sago with 1/2 cup water for 4 minutes.
3e4bb0fc-77b5-43c3-88ba-9c63a3fb186f While the sago is soaking, add the remaining 2 cups of water to a saucepan along with the cinnamon stick (or cardamom). Cover and bring to a boil.
3e4bb0fc-77b5-43c3-88ba-9c63a3fb186f Add the soaked sago along with any residual soaking liquid to the boiling water and stir.
3e4bb0fc-77b5-43c3-88ba-9c63a3fb186f Lower the heat to low, cover the pot, and let simmer for 6 minutes or until the sago is translucent.
3e4bb0fc-77b5-43c3-88ba-9c63a3fb186f Remove from the heat, and sweeten with sugar and milk to taste.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Gather the ingredients.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Add flour, sugar, salt, yeast, and cinnamon, if using, to a large bowl and mix thoroughly.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Add the eggs and vanilla extract to a small bowl and whisk gently (you just want to break up the eggs and get them mixed with the extract).
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Make a well in the center of the flour mixture, pour in the eggs and milk, and stir to mix and make a smooth, thick batter.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 and 1/2 hours or until the mixture has more than doubled in quantity.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Add oil to a deep frying pan and heat on medium heat until oil is hot (350 F).
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Working with 2 tablespoons, scoop and drop the batter into the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan. Let fry for 1 minute until nicely browned all over.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Remove using a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
284e99ec-35cf-4c08-8a95-f439e5b89214 Serve warm with a generous drizzle of homemade syrup.
2fc0840d-ee86-4fa7-ba19-0a26f550fd66 Soak the barley in 3/4 cup water for 1 hour.
2fc0840d-ee86-4fa7-ba19-0a26f550fd66 At the end of the hour, add the remaining 3 1/2 cups of water to a saucepan along with the cinnamon stick, cover the pot and bring it to a boil.
2fc0840d-ee86-4fa7-ba19-0a26f550fd66 Add the soaked barley as well as the soaking liquid to the boiling water and cook on medium heat for 30 minutes or until the barley is soft.
2fc0840d-ee86-4fa7-ba19-0a26f550fd66 Remove the pot from the heat and sweeten with sugar and milk to taste, stirring until fully incorporated.
2fc0840d-ee86-4fa7-ba19-0a26f550fd66 Serve hot with toppings such as fruit and nuts.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Gather the ingredients.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Add the vinegar, sugar, and salt to a sauce pot and place on medium heat. Stir, using a wooden spoon to dissolve the sugar.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Bring the mixture to a boil and then remove from heat. Let cool completely.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Cut peppers in half and remove the seeds and stems.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Slice the peppers lengthwise into 1/4-inch strips.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Add sliced peppers to a bowl, pour on 1/3 cup of the dressing, and toss thoroughly to coat the peppers with the pickling liquid.
376f387b-a389-48a3-9c86-a3079b279781 Set aside for half an hour before serving. Toss intermittently.
3a97daa8-c9fe-4845-8510-6a10eecbbafc Gather the ingredients.
3a97daa8-c9fe-4845-8510-6a10eecbbafc Put all the ingredients in a food processor and pulse until the peppers are minced finely. Scrape down the sides of the bowl from time to time.
3a97daa8-c9fe-4845-8510-6a10eecbbafc Once the peppers are chopped pretty finely, let the processor keep whirling and pour just enough of the vinegar through the chute to moisten the peppers and give it the consistency of a thick sauce.
3a97daa8-c9fe-4845-8510-6a10eecbbafc Pour the hot sauce into sterilized glass bottles or jars and cover with airtight lids. Store the finished product in a cool place or in your refrigerator until the flavors meld together nicely. Or, you can place your bottles of pepper sauce in the sun for 2-3 days to ripen quickly and then store in a cool place. If there's no sun where you are, let the pepper sauce cure for at least 5 days before use so that the flavors can develop.
5f45385f-d68a-4022-8af8-469c4386d364 Divide the ingredients into two equal batches. Add to food processor one batch at a time. Pulse or let whirl until all the ingredients are very fine. Drizzle in just enough water to moisten the mixture. Repeat with the second batch of ingredients.
5f45385f-d68a-4022-8af8-469c4386d364 Transfer to glass jars with airtight lids and store in refrigerator or, for longer storage, pour into ice cube trays and freeze.
5f45385f-d68a-4022-8af8-469c4386d364 Remove frozen cubes and store in a zip-top bag in the freezer.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Gather the ingredients.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Peel the papaya using a knife or vegetable peeler.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Cut the papaya in half lengthwise and remove the seeds.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Coarsely chop the flesh.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Place the papaya chunks, milk, lime juice and zest, sugar, vanilla, and ice into a blender or food processor.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Mix on high speed for 20 to 30 seconds until the mixture is smooth and thick.
7e5e5e86-fca0-4dff-b92a-ab9fd4711b22 Pour the smoothie into tall frosted glasses. Garnish with lime wedges and serve at once.
e9e6966b-0eb4-40b2-9e88-72a958da56d5 Chop and blend all the ingredients in a food processor or blender.
e9e6966b-0eb4-40b2-9e88-72a958da56d5 Place the mixture in a glass jar with a tight lid. Refrigerate up to 2 weeks.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Gather the ingredients.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Mix cream of coconut, sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, rum, coconut or vanilla extract, cinnamon, cloves, and nutmeg in a blender.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Process them until they are well-mixed and then pour into a glass pitcher or bottle and cover it. Alternatively, add the cover to the blender bowl and place it in the fridge.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Refrigerate for about 1 hour before serving. Coquito tastes best very cold.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Shake to mix well right before serving. Pour into a small glass and sprinkle the top with nutmeg or cinnamon or garnish with a cinnamon stick.
b476ebb6-b5e5-49fa-9af2-3aa977cd8a19 Enjoy!
e8f50d4b-f597-47e7-8a66-a9c0a34910ee Break the eggs into a large bowl.
e8f50d4b-f597-47e7-8a66-a9c0a34910ee Add zest to eggs and beat with hand mixer until the eggs are frothy.
e8f50d4b-f597-47e7-8a66-a9c0a34910ee Pour in evaporated and condensed milk and rum. Add bitters and nutmeg and beat until well blended and everything is incorporated.
e8f50d4b-f597-47e7-8a66-a9c0a34910ee Strain and pour into distilled bottles, cork, and chill ideally for 24 hours or longer.
e8f50d4b-f597-47e7-8a66-a9c0a34910ee Serve over ice.
8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Gather the ingredients.
8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Chop the ingredients into sizes that are small enough to fit into a food processor ​or blender. You don't have to dice them finely, as you will be processing them. Focus on removing the seeds and any tougher stems that might leave grit in the finished sofrito.
8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Place the chopped ingredients into a food processor or blender. You can process in batches if your food processor isn't big enough to accommodate everything at once.
