8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Blend all ingredients well so the finished sofrito is finely processed. If you're not familiar with sofrito, it should be the consistency of pesto, a thick paste.
8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Once blended, your sofrito is ready for immediate use. Store the sofrito in a glass container. Plastic containers are not ideal because plastic will absorb the odor of garlic and onions.
8da5bba1-3845-4229-8e2a-cf5206f483f3 Use the sofrito with rice, stews, beans, or a protein, and enjoy.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Add 2 teaspoon of sugar and 1/2 cup warm water to a large bowl and stir to dissolve. Sprinkle in yeast, stir, cover with plastic wrap and let proof in warm place for 10 minutes.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Add 5 1/2 cups of flour to a large bowl along with the salt, cinnamon and nutmeg. Mix thoroughly.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Rub in shortening and butter.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Stir in sugar, coconut (if using) and raisins.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and pour in yeast and essence. Add the remaining water 1/2 cup at a time to form a slightly sticky dough. (You may need more or less water depending on your location and the moisture in the atmosphere). Once the flour comes together as a dough, sprinkle the remaining 1/2 cup flour onto a clean work surface, turn the dough onto the work surface and gently knead the flour into the dough (for about 5 minutes). You may need to add a little more flour for dusting.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Rub oil on the dough and transfer to a large oiled bowl, cover and leave in a warm place for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until the dough has doubled in size.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Flour a work surface and transfer the risen dough. Knead for 1 minutes then cut dough into 12 equal pieces and form in balls. Place seam-side down on parchment-lined baking sheets with adequate space between each bun.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Cover with plastic wrap or towel and let buns rise in a warm place for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Meanwhile preheat oven to 350 degrees F (start preheating 25 minutes after the dough has been resting).
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Brush buns with water, sprinkle with sugar and bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until nicely browned. The bottom when rapped should sound hollow. You can opt to score the buns just before adding it to the oven.
b769b806-6ec1-4e10-850b-ef60efff4cea Cool completely before serving.
0d3ae5d9-420b-4997-9cee-e4555044932c Combine the wine, rum, orange juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice and sugar in a large glass pitcher. Stir well.
0d3ae5d9-420b-4997-9cee-e4555044932c Place the pitcher in the refrigerator and chill until you're ready to serve, but for at least 1 hour.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Gather the ingredients.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Fill a medium-sized pot halfway with cold water.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Carefully peel the yams; their slippery quality can make them hard to peel.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Cut the peeled yams into chunks and place them in the cold water.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Bring the yams to a boil over high heat. Keep a rapid boil until the yams are soft, about 25 minutes.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Remove the yams, drain, but reserve about a cup of the cooking water. Allow the yams to cool off.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Place the cooled yams in a large bowl along with the salt, pepper, and olive oil.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Mash and mix the ingredients using a potato masher. The mixture will be uneven and lumpy.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Place the fufu mixture in a food processor or blender. Pulse briefly at low speed to remove any lumps, but do not puree.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Place the yam mixture back in the bowl and beat it with a wooden spoon until it becomes smooth. The mixture should become sticky and slightly elastic. It's perfectly fine to use your hands to get it to the desired texture. Add some of the reserved water, starting with 1/4 of a cup, and work the dough. You might need to add more water, but it depends on how moist the yams were to begin with. Keep working and adding water until you have a springy dough that comes away from the bowl, is pliable, and is easily shaped.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Shape the fufu into balls of equal size.
e5d1185e-143c-400f-ba7f-6db9d411893d Enjoy.
92f36a56-0c1a-4a60-a695-68477982f9c5 Gather the ingredients.
92f36a56-0c1a-4a60-a695-68477982f9c5 Build the ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice cubes.
92f36a56-0c1a-4a60-a695-68477982f9c5 Garnish with the lime wedge.
92f36a56-0c1a-4a60-a695-68477982f9c5 Serve and enjoy!
82fcb25a-6d0f-4368-96a6-86f985166347 Sear lamb cubes over medium-high heat in a skillet with 1 tablespoon of oil until browned on all sides. Add seared lamb to the slow cooker.
82fcb25a-6d0f-4368-96a6-86f985166347 Cook onion in the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in the same skillet until soft, but not brown. Add onions to the slow cooker.
82fcb25a-6d0f-4368-96a6-86f985166347 Remove skillet from heat. Add 1/2 cup stock to the skillet and use a wooden spoon to loosen any leftover onions. Add the stock to the slow cooker.
82fcb25a-6d0f-4368-96a6-86f985166347 Add remaining ingredients to the slow cooker, stirring to combine.
82fcb25a-6d0f-4368-96a6-86f985166347 Cover and cook on low heat for 8 to 10 hours. Discard habanero before serving.
a482d28c-830c-4f27-bf0b-358c121562d9 Gather the ingredients.
a482d28c-830c-4f27-bf0b-358c121562d9 In a cocktail shaker filled with ice, pour the rum, kummel, orange juice, and pimento dram.
a482d28c-830c-4f27-bf0b-358c121562d9 Shake well.
a482d28c-830c-4f27-bf0b-358c121562d9 Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Gather the ingredients.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Place the grated coconut in a heavy saucepan and cover with the coconut water-cream or milk mixture.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Slowly bring this to a boil, stirring often. Turn off the heat, cover the saucepan, and remove from the burner. Let cool to room temperature.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Place a sieve or strainer over a large bowl. Line it with a double layer of damp cheesecloth.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Pour the soaked coconut with its liquid into the lined strainer.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Lift the cheesecloth, pull the edges together, and squeeze out the coconut cream into the bowl.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 The remaining coconut flesh can be air-dried and/or toasted for other uses.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Cover and refrigerate the coconut cream and use within five days.
0f51c85d-9707-4ee3-9c7a-96f0fece90b8 Enjoy!
344b7c32-b40c-42fd-ab2d-c94c35f209fb Gather the ingredients,
344b7c32-b40c-42fd-ab2d-c94c35f209fb Pour the Tia Maria into a shot glass.
344b7c32-b40c-42fd-ab2d-c94c35f209fb Float the rum cream on top of the Tia Maria by pouring it slowly over the back of a bar spoon.
344b7c32-b40c-42fd-ab2d-c94c35f209fb Float the overproof rum on top of the rum cream.
344b7c32-b40c-42fd-ab2d-c94c35f209fb Serve and enjoy!
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Gather the ingredients.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Drain peas and rinse a few times until the water runs clear. Drain well and then add to a food processor along with garlic and pepper. Puree until the mixture is a fine grainy paste. Set aside.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Add flour, baking powder, cornstarch, cumin or garam masala to a large bowl. Mix thoroughly.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Transfer the pea mixture along with the water to the flour mixture and stir to incorporate.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Add and mix in spinach, cilantro, and salt to taste to the flour-pea mixture. Mix thoroughly. Cover and set aside to rest for 1 hour.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Rub a little oil on your hands and take a little of the mixture at a time, about the size of a golf ball or larger, and shape into 1/3 to 1/2 inch thick disks. Repeat until all the patties are shaped. The mixture will be moist, don't worry about that.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Heat oil on medium heat and fry in batches until browned on both sides. Total cooking time take about 4 to 5 minutes per batch depending on how thick you make them.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Drain on paper towels.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Serve warm as is or with a salsa or chutney or pepper sauce.
1fc0eacb-6598-400c-b094-8749fc4f6a66 Enjoy!
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Place the fish into a large bowl.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 In another large bowl, mix the onions, chives, cilantro, tomatoes, thyme, lime juice and rum together and pour over the fish.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Marinate for 1 hour, turning frequently.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Melt the butter in a saucepan; add the garlic and sugar and heat until mixture begins to bubble.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Add the fish and cook until golden.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Add the marinade, Worcestershire sauce, stock, salt and pepper to taste.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Lower the heat, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
d44bbb17-0833-49d0-ad3d-d115a21be646 Garnish with lime wedges and cilantro sprigs.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Cut the calabaza into pieces of equal size. Place them in a pot and add the water and salt.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Bring the water to a boil and reduce the heat to medium low. Cover and simmer for about 30 minutes until the calabaza are soft.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Remove and drain the calabaza in a colander. Let it sit for about 15 minutes to drain off all the liquid.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Place the calabaza in a mixing bowl. Add the sugar, flour and vanilla. Mix well.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Heat the oil to 350 F in a frying pan.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Add the calabaza mixture to the oil in spoonfuls. Cook the spoonfuls until they're golden on both sides, about 2 minutes per side.
9ec08ebf-c234-4154-ab8a-c621e96adcda Drain on paper towels before serving.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Preheat the oven to 425 F.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Lightly oil a large roasting pan or foil-lined rimmed baking sheet.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef In a large bowl, whisk together the oil, honey, lime juice, garlic, and spices.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Add the sweet potatoes and toss to coat.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Pour the potatoes and seasonings into the roasting pan or baking sheet, and spread them out into a single layer.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, for about 40 minutes, or until they are tender and caramelized.
51a54201-0bdf-41b9-ba7c-5790d3da1aef Serve with your dish of choice and enjoy!
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Grease a cookie sheet and line it with parchment paper.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Mix the mango preserves with the chopped cashews in a bowl and set the bowl aside.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Lightly sprinkle each pastry square with the spices.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Place 1½ tablespoons of the mango mix in the middle of each pastry square.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Brush the edges of each pastry square with the beaten egg, then fold it over to form a triangle, enclosing the mango mix.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Place the pastries about 2 inches apart on the prepared cookie sheet.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Place the cookie sheet in the refrigerator and chill the turnovers for 30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 F.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Place the turnovers in the preheated oven after 30 minutes of refrigeration. Bake them for 25 to 30 minutes. They should turn a light gold color.
974b9366-50b7-4be2-81ad-06e776f23235 Remove the turnovers from the oven and dust them with the confectioners' sugar. Allow them to cool before serving.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 In a bowl, thoroughly mix the ingredients together, then cook in a saucepan over medium-low heat for 20 minutes.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 Allow the mix to cool before filling the empanada discs.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 While the mix is cooling, preheat oven to 350 F.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 Place the filling by the spoonful into your prepared empanada dough, or store-bought discs.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 Fold the dough and filling into a half-circle shape and crimp the edges with a fork. If the edges won't stay sealed you can dip the fork in water before crimping or use an egg wash. Do not overfill the empanadas. They will tear and you will lose your filling.
41e30387-8f0d-4769-90fc-4689ffbf0fc0 Bake the empanadas on a greased cookie sheet until golden brown, about 18 to 20 minutes. To avoid burning, watch them closely.
629aab15-78ed-4226-abe9-24fe70be12a2 Preheat about two inches of oil in a frying pan or deep fryer to 350 F.
629aab15-78ed-4226-abe9-24fe70be12a2 While the oil is heating up, peel the yuca and cut it into half-inch rounds or pieces.
629aab15-78ed-4226-abe9-24fe70be12a2 Fry the prepared yuca until fork-tender. This will take approximately 6 to 8 minutes.
629aab15-78ed-4226-abe9-24fe70be12a2 Remove cooked yuca from the fryer and allow it to drain on paper towels.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Gather the ingredients.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Add the water and the cinnamon stick to a saucepan. Cover the pot and bring the water to a boil.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Add the Cream of Wheat when the water boils, using a whisk to stir it well so there are no lumps.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Reduce the heat to low and simmer uncovered for 2 to 2 1/2 minutes until the Cream of Wheat has thickened.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Remove from the heat and discard the cinnamon stick.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Sweeten with sugar and milk, stirring until everything is fully incorporated.
63c58ed8-1a73-49ce-8abb-a5d9e414e521 Serve and enjoy!
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Gather the ingredients.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Place the beans in a small saucepan and add 1 cup of the water.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Bring to a boil, covered, and turn off the heat. Allow to sit for 1 hour, covered.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Then drain.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Brown the oxtails well in the lard or oil.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Place the oxtails in a 6-quart stovetop casserole, along with the garlic, onion, and tomato. Add the beef stock and enough water so that it just covers the contents of the pot. Then add the allspice, salt, and pepper.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, then add the drained beans.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Simmer for an additional 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Remove the lid during the last hour of cooking if you prefer a thicker sauce. Be careful that the pot does not boil dry; if it looks imminent, add a bit more water.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Taste and add more salt and pepper, if needed, and a few shots of Tabasco, to taste.
ddb0ae97-07fc-4d50-9039-44908b2e67ad Enjoy!
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Gather the ingredients.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Heat the oil in a pressure cooker.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add the onions and sauté until they're translucent (about 2 to 3 minutes).
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add 3 sprigs of thyme and sauté for 1 minute.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add the tripe, salt, and pepper to taste. Sauté for 4 minutes.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add 6 cups water and stir.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Cover the pressure cooker and let the soup cook for 45 to 50 minutes. Time begins from the first whistle. (If using a stockpot, cover it and cook for 2 to 3 hours.)
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Release pressure cooker valve to let out steam and open pressure cooker.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add the peas and enough additional water to make soup. Cover the pot and cook for 5 more minutes. Again, time begins from the first whistle.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Release the pressure cooker valve to let out steam and open the pressure cooker.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add the pumpkin, plantains, and the remaining thyme.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Cook until the plantains are almost melting. Don't close the pressure cooker at this stage. Just rest the cover on top of the pot.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Add the okra and dumplings to the pot. Cover and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
dbcd4b78-83df-4d44-8ce5-56f4de7741ae Stir and serve.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Gather the ingredients.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 It's best to make this soup in a pressure cooker, but you can prepare it in a regular pot. If you use a regular pot, you will need to add more water to the soup and increase the cooking time.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Heat the oil in the pressure cooker or pot.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Add onions and sauté until translucent, about 2 to 3 minutes.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Add 3 sprigs of thyme and sauté for 1 minute.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Add beef and sauté along with the onions and thyme for 3 minutes. Add split peas along with salt and pepper to taste.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Add 5 cups of water, stir, scraping up any bits stuck to the bottom of the pot. Close the pressure cooker and let pressure for 20 to 22 minutes. Timing begins from the first whistle. If you are using a pot, and an extra cup of water, bring to a boil, cover, and then let simmer for 30 to 35 minutes.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Open the pressure cooker and add sweet potatoes, plantains, carrots, and remaining thyme and enough water to cook the ingredients and make soup. Let cook on high heat for 12 to 15 minutes. Do not lock the pressure cooker; just let the cover rest on top of the pot.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Add raw dumpling dough along with okra to pot; cover and let cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the dumpling is cooked through.
0a6480e5-3d40-4245-828d-b3da0d9549a4 Taste soup for seasoning (salt and pepper) and adjust accordingly. Stir in green onions and serve.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Prepare the spice mixture
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 In a medium size soup pot over medium-high heat, add 1/4 cup vegetable oil.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Add meat and lightly brown for 6 to 8 minutes.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Add 1 tablespoon of flour and cook for 1 minute and remove meat mixture from the pot.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Reheat the same pot by turning it up to a medium-high heat.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Add 1/4 cup vegetable oil, minced onions, habanero, ginger, and garlic.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Slowly saute for 8 to 10 minutes or until mixture is completely tender and has no crunch.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Add the prepared spice mixture to the onion and lightly toast for 3 to 4 minutes or until the mixture is golden brown.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Remove the pot from the heat, add meat and rum then return to the stove top and cook until mixture is dry. (Beware, the rum could ignite like a flambé, make sure that you are standing away from the pot as you place it back on the flame.)
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Add beer, chicken broth, tomatoes, and salsa verde and bring to a boil.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4042f109-3f5c-4c76-b26a-7d70c38670d9 Stir in chopped cilantro, garnish and serve.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Gather the ingredients.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Soak the oats in 1 cup of water for 4 minutes.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 While the oats are soaking, bring the remaining 2 cups of water and the cinnamon stick to a boil in medium heat.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 When the water boils, add the soaked oats along with any residual soaking liquid.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Stir in the rinsed raisins and reduce to low heat.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Cover the pot and cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until the mixture becomes very thick.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Remove from the heat and discard the cinnamon stick. Stir in the freshly grated nutmeg, sugar, and whole milk. Depending on your preference, you can add more milk and/or sugar.
c918a188-09a5-4f6a-b8bf-080dc0f19c88 Enjoy hot!
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Gather the ingredients.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Season the chicken pieces with the adobo seasoning.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a heavy skillet or a Dutch oven. Make sure you have a lid available to cover it tightly.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Add the chicken pieces and brown them on each side, about 5 minutes per side.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Add the sofrito, the sazón packet, Spanish olives, cumin, bay leaf, culantro, Italian seasoning, tomato sauce, chicken broth, and potato cubes. Turn the chicken pieces to coat them with the sauce.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and reduce the heat to low. Simmer the chicken stew for 35 minutes or until the chicken is done.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Remove the bay leaf and the cilantro leaf.
74d0fa67-80de-4cdf-ae0a-fc6e513d833a Garnish the chicken pieces with fresh chopped cilantro or parsley and serve the sauce over your favorite rice recipe.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Gather the ingredients.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 In a large bowl, place chicken, green seasoning, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce and ketchup along with salt and pepper (to taste).
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Toss to mix and coat the chicken with the seasonings. Set aside and let marinate for at least an hour.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Pour oil into a large pot and place on medium-high heat. Let oil heat until hot but not smoking.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Make the burnt sugar by sprinkling it into the heated oil in an even layer.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Let the sugar melt until it starts to froth and bubble.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 As soon as the edges of the froth/bubbles start to get a slight shade darker, immediately add the seasoned chicken and stir to mix and coat with the burnt sugar.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Let cook for 7 to 10 minutes.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Add the rice to the pot, stir to mix and cook for 3 minutes.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Add onions, sweet peppers, pigeon peas, and carrots (if using) and cook for 1 minute.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Pour in coconut milk and other cooking liquid. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Toss in whole scotch bonnet pepper. Cover pot and bring to a boil.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 When the pot comes to a boil, remove lid partially and let boil until you can see the surface of the dish—about 7 to 8 minutes.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Cover pot fully, reduce heat to low and let cook for 25 to 30 minutes or until all the liquid has been absorbed.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Sprinkle the green onion on top and fold into Pelau. Taste and adjust seasonings with salt and pepper if necessary.
a0c3cf3c-6e7d-4a71-bdbc-73a1412b8259 Serve hot or at room temperature.
9b9bd052-fdc9-4b73-9602-83c0de98cd32 In a small bowl, combine the brown sugar with the curry powder, cumin, salt, and pepper, and mix well. Rub the spice mixture thoroughly into the pork roast.
9b9bd052-fdc9-4b73-9602-83c0de98cd32 Place the chopped onions and garlic in the bottom of a 4 to 5-quart crockpot. Place the roast on top of the onions. Pour the apple juice overall.
9b9bd052-fdc9-4b73-9602-83c0de98cd32 Cover the crockpot and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or until a reliable meat thermometer reads 140 F.
9b9bd052-fdc9-4b73-9602-83c0de98cd32 Remove the pork from the crockpot and cover it snugly with foil. Let the pork stand for 15 minutes before slicing.
9b9bd052-fdc9-4b73-9602-83c0de98cd32 You can thicken the oniony juices with some cornstarch dissolved in water and serve alongside if you like. Pour the juices from the slow cooker into a saucepan. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons of cornstarch mixed with more apple juice. Bring the mixture to a boil until it thickens to the consistency you want.
7d28c739-adba-49a0-8e3f-21f43edd7e27 Brown the stew meat in the olive oil for about 20 minutes in a large soup pot over medium heat.
7d28c739-adba-49a0-8e3f-21f43edd7e27 Add the next 10 ingredients: the cubanelle pepper, ajíes dulces, onion, garlic, cilantro, vinegar, oregano, tomato sauce, bay leaves, and salt.
7d28c739-adba-49a0-8e3f-21f43edd7e27 Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour. The juices from the vegetables and tomato sauce should cook down into a thick sauce. You can add a little water if the sauce seems to be getting too thick.
7d28c739-adba-49a0-8e3f-21f43edd7e27 Turn the heat to medium after 1 hour. Add the last seven ingredients: the carrots, peas, potatoes, olives, capers, salt, and pepper to taste.
7d28c739-adba-49a0-8e3f-21f43edd7e27 Reduce the heat to low when the stew begins to boil. Continue cooking over low heat for 1 more hour.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Heat oil in pressure cooker.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Add onions and half of the thyme and sauté until the onions are translucent, 2 to 3 minutes.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Add cow heel along with salt and pepper to taste and sauté for 3 minutes.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Add 5 cups of water, stir, cover the pressure cooker and let cook for 30 minutes. Start timing after the first whistle.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Release the valve of the pressure cooker to let out the steam. Open the pressure cooker and add the peas and more water. There should be enough water to cook the peas and make a soup.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Add more thyme and let the peas and cow heel cook on high heat until the peas soften.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Add okra and dumplings to pot, cover and let cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through. Taste soup for seasoning and adjust salt and pepper accordingly.
07c80baa-ca26-419d-8d16-e457378c30f8 Stir and serve.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Gather the ingredients.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Mash the garlic cloves and salt into a paste using a pilòn (mortar and pestle).
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Add the peppercorns and adobo and crush the ingredients into the paste.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Stir in the olive oil and apple cider vinegar.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Rub the mixture under the turkey’s skin inside the cavities, then rub the rest of the mixture on top of the skin.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Roast the turkey according to the manufacturer’s recommended time and temperature. A 14 to ​16-pound turkey will take about 2 to 2 1/2 hours to cook.
6949b274-8b7c-41ad-ab06-38497ae31176 Serve with your favorite Thanksgiving sides and enjoy!
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Heat the oil to 375 F.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Peel the plantains, cut them in half, then cut each half lengthwise.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Fry the plantains in oil for 4 minutes. Remove from hot oil and drain on paper towels.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Flatten the plantains. Re-fry in the hot oil for another 4 minutes until the plantains are crispy. Remove from the oil and drain on paper towels. Set aside.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise, chili powder, cumin powder, and garlic powder.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Spread the mayonnaise mix on one side of the flat plantains.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Build your sandwich by layering the tomatoes, onions, cheese, and roast beef, using the flat plantains as if it were bread.
693a273d-1d19-4c9d-a574-670430733d05 Stick a toothpick with olives in the middle of the sandwich and serve immediately.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Gather the ingredients.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Heat olive oil over medium heat then sauté onion and green pepper for about 5 minutes, until the onion is softened.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Add ground beef, salt, and pepper, garlic, cumin, oregano, cinnamon, and cloves. Cook, stirring occasionally until the meat is browned - about 5 minutes. Add the tomatoes, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for about 15 minutes.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Stir in olives and raisins and simmer 5 minutes longer. Salt and pepper to taste.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Serve hot over rice.
e3ced36f-3036-40fb-b5e7-09e35593297b Enjoy!
1724a193-e13a-4915-8d78-12efa4cafa10 Combine onion and ginger in a food processor; process until finely chopped. Add the chile pepper, dry mustard powder, pepper, allspice, thyme, vinegar, soy sauce, orange juice, and garlic. Process until the sauce is fairly smooth.
1724a193-e13a-4915-8d78-12efa4cafa10 Place the chicken pieces in a 3 1/2- to 5-quart slow cooker and cover with the sauce.
1724a193-e13a-4915-8d78-12efa4cafa10 Cover the pot cook on low for about 5 hours. or until chicken is tender (about 3 hours on high).
1724a193-e13a-4915-8d78-12efa4cafa10 Serve the chicken on the bone or shred it and put it back in the sauce.
ce00962b-cf0d-4954-8b00-f85e1a65424d Using a pilón (mortar and pestle), mash the garlic cloves and salt into a paste.
ce00962b-cf0d-4954-8b00-f85e1a65424d Mix in the pepper and oregano. Stir in the olive oil and vinegar. Set the marinade aside.
ce00962b-cf0d-4954-8b00-f85e1a65424d Cut the pork into 1-inch cubes.
ce00962b-cf0d-4954-8b00-f85e1a65424d Cover the pork pieces with the marinade and let set in the refrigerator for about 20 minutes.
ce00962b-cf0d-4954-8b00-f85e1a65424d Skewer the pork pieces and grill the kabobs for about eight minutes, turning occasionally for even grilling.
83f72a04-b2dc-49ea-ae08-97dfb3cddafd Parboil the lobster until bright red, then bake in the over at 300 degrees F with a little melted butter for about 15 minutes.
83f72a04-b2dc-49ea-ae08-97dfb3cddafd While the lobster bakes, sauté onion, jerk seasoning, and sweet pepper in remaining melted butter.
83f72a04-b2dc-49ea-ae08-97dfb3cddafd Remove from heat, pour in the rum and add butter, stirring until it has melted evenly and creamily.
83f72a04-b2dc-49ea-ae08-97dfb3cddafd Add lime juice and herbs.
83f72a04-b2dc-49ea-ae08-97dfb3cddafd Serve over lobster or in dipping bowls on plate.
a2b8df90-ad32-4a6a-977d-5843f79c9b0c Gather the ingredients.
a2b8df90-ad32-4a6a-977d-5843f79c9b0c Combine all ingredients (except the chicken) in a food processor, and process until a smooth puree forms. Put the chicken in a large bowl, and pour over the marinade. Mix the chicken pieces around to coat them completely, cover, and marinate at least 6 hours.
a2b8df90-ad32-4a6a-977d-5843f79c9b0c This part of the process seems lengthy, but it's important to let the spices fully permeate the chicken before cooking, to give it a hearty and robust jerk flavor.
a2b8df90-ad32-4a6a-977d-5843f79c9b0c Remove chicken from the jerk marinade and grill over charcoal until cooked through (internal temp of 165 F). You may also broil, or roast the chicken in a hot oven (425 F), but this will produce a slightly different flavor.
beca01a9-9519-489a-bf6f-8b84a925841c Combine all ingredients except the chicken and pour into a shallow baking dish or resealable plastic bag. Add chicken and turn to coat.
beca01a9-9519-489a-bf6f-8b84a925841c Cover and place in refrigerator to marinate in jerk seasoning for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from jerk marinade and pour marinade into a saucepan.
beca01a9-9519-489a-bf6f-8b84a925841c Bring to a boil. Place chicken on grill cooking approximately 7 to 10 minutes per side (or until done), basting periodically with remaining cooked jerk marinade.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 Gather the ingredients.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 In a large skillet, sauté the onion and the garlic in olive oil until the onions turn soft, about 3 to 5 minutes. Add in the nutmeg, cinnamon, and cloves, and allow to cook for just one more minute, stirring occasionally to prevent the spices from burning.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 Add in the kidney beans and the tomatoes, including the liquid from each (do not drain them). Give it all a quick stir to combine everything together well.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 Allow this to cook for a few more minutes, then add the rice and the water or vegetable broth.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 Cover the skillet and allow to cook for about 30 to 35 minutes, or until the rice is done and most of the liquid has been absorbed. Throughout the cooking time, stir the rice occasionally to make sure it doesn't stick to the bottom of the pan.
07ac1824-dd9e-4ca6-9141-7ee1abae6909 Add salt and pepper to taste. Sea salt or kosher salt and fresh ground black pepper are always best for maximizing flavor, particularly in simple dishes such as this one.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Drain and rinsed the white beans that have been soaking overnight.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Place the beans, water, bay leaves, salt pork, and ham hocks in a soup pot and bring to a boil over medium heat.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Reduce the heat to low.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Remove the salt pork and discard.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Remove the ham hocks and shred the meat from the bones.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Put the shredded meat back into the soup pot.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb In a skillet, heat the olive oil.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Sautee the onions and garlic until soft and translucent.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Add to the soup pot.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Add the cumin, oregano, salt, and white pepper to the pot.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Simmer for 15 minutes.
d9d20a56-8366-4010-baed-5cc7e9e825eb Serve.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 In a large zip-top plastic bag, combine all of the ingredients except the tablespoon of olive oil and shrimp. Seal and squish the contents to mix it thoroughly.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Add shrimp to the margarita marinade, squeeze out all the air, and seal. Turn bag to coat the shrimp.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Refrigerate for 30 to 45 minutes. Do not over-marinate or the citrus acids will "cook" the shrimp.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Heat a large, heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to hot pan and swirl to coat.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Remove shrimp from marinade and place in a single layer in the hot pan. Reserve the marinade.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Cook for one minute, then flip the shrimp to the other side. You may need to do this in batches, depending on the size of your pan. Do not overcook the shrimp or it will become rubbery. Remove shrimp and keep warm.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Add the reserved marinade to the hot pan. Continue cooking until it reduces to a thin sauce. Turn off heat, return the shrimp to the pan, and toss them in the sauce to coat.
80362bde-6538-4cbb-879d-a0b3c4f03ac5 Serve the shrimp over white rice.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b Gather the ingredients.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b Drain the tofu and press well using a Tofu Xpress or other tofu press, or by wrapping in a clean paper towel and pressing with heavy cans and allowing to rest 2 hours until most of the water has been pressed from the tofu.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b The day before cooking, place all of the ingredients except for the drained and pressed tofu into a medium-sized bowl. Whisk together to make a thin marinade.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b Slice the tofu into 4 to 6 equal rectangles, then arrange them evenly into a single layer in a 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Pour the marinade over the tofu to cover the tofu rectangles completely.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b Cover lightly with aluminum foil or plastic wrap and allow the tofu to rest overnight or up to 8 hours, flipping once time halfway through marinating time if desired. You can also leave them be, and they will soak up plenty of marinade this way as well.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b The next day, once you're ready to cook the tofu, preheat the oven to 350 F. Place the tofu onto a nonstick baking tray (like a large lipped cookie sheet) or a baking sheet covered with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Pour any remaining marinade evenly on top of the tofu to coat, letting the bits of spices and such rest on top of the individual tofu steaks.
3dcb3be8-9067-4c36-869c-d8b50fac989b Bake for one hour, carefully flipping after 30 minutes baking time. Scrape off any remaining spice mixture before serving.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Gather the ingredients.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Cut each butterfish in half lengthwise to make two fillets. Season the fish with salt and pepper to taste and set it aside.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Add the oil and 1 tablespoon butter to a large pan and melt the butter over medium heat.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Add the onions to the pan when the butter froth subsides. Sauté them until they become translucent.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Add the fresh thyme, garlic, and the hot pepper, then season with salt to taste. Continue to sauté the onions for 1 additional minute.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Pour the water into a ​pan with the sautéed onions. Stir and bring to a boil.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Add the fish as soon as the water and onions reach a boil.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Turn the heat to high and cook for 15 to 17 minutes, spooning the sauce over the fish occasionally as though basting it.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Add the remaining tablespoon of butter to the pan. Reduce the heat to low and let the butter melt completely, continuing to baste the fish with the sauce. Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary.
ab7aab6a-2ee8-4f17-9c1c-6dc8d50a52ee Toss in the green onions. Remove the pan from heat and serve.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Gather the ingredients.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Soak the cornmeal in 2 cups water for 5 minutes.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 In a pot, heat the 1 tablespoon of oil and gently saute the 1/2 cup of onions, 1 tablespoon of garlic, and 2 teaspoons of thyme for 1 to 2 minutes.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Add the 1 1/3 cups of sliced okra and saute for 1 minute.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Pour 4 cups of boiling water into the pot with the onion-okra mixture and let it boil for 10 minutes.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Using a slotted spoon, remove the okra to a small bowl and set aside.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Pour half of the liquid from the pot into a small bowl and reserve for later use.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Turn the heat to low and simmer. Add the soaked cornmeal, salt, and butter. Stir constantly using a whisk to avoid lumps and keep the cornmeal mixture from scorching.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 As the cornmeal begins to dry out, add the reserved liquid in stages, stirring with a wooden spoon until the cornmeal is cooked. This process takes about 90 minutes. Stir the cou-cou at 15-minute intervals to ensure that it is not sticking to the bottom of the pot.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 As the mixture begins to break away clean from the sides of the pot, add the okra and stir to incorporate fully.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Let the cou-cou continue to cook until it is firm but not stiff. The cou-cou should break away easily from the sides of the pot. Another way to check it is to insert a spoon into the middle of the cou-cou. It should stand and be easy to remove from the mixture.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Transfer the cou-cou to a generously buttered bowl and swirl it around to form a mold. Invert the bowl onto a serving platter so the cou-cou drops out in a nicely shaped mound.
d4824313-c48c-4328-b390-bc61b5252b67 Create an indentation in the center of the cou-cou and heap with stewed fish, meat, poultry, or vegetables, letting the rich sauce spill over to the sides.
1d243b8c-ef62-42ed-9d2f-95622f55cc91 Boil the yuca in salted water until it becomes tender, about 30 minutes.
1d243b8c-ef62-42ed-9d2f-95622f55cc91 Drain the yuca and place it in a serving dish. Set it aside, but keep it warm. Don't allow it to come back to room temperature while you make the garlic sauce.
1d243b8c-ef62-42ed-9d2f-95622f55cc91 Combine the onions, orange juice, lime juice, cilantro and garlic in a bowl. Pour the mixture over the yuca.
1d243b8c-ef62-42ed-9d2f-95622f55cc91 Heat the olive oil, oregano, cumin, salt, and pepper in a heavy pan until hot. Pour the hot oil over the yuca.
1d243b8c-ef62-42ed-9d2f-95622f55cc91 Garnish with orange wedges.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 In a pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 Add the sofrito and lightly fry for about 1 minute.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 Add the sazón, salt, beans, and rice. Stir to combine the ingredients and coat the rice with color.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 Pour in the water (or chicken broth) and bring to a rolling boil. Allow to boil for 1 to 2 minutes, then stir the rice mixture.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 Reduce the heat to low and cover with a tight-fitting lid that will not allow steam to escape. Do not lift the lid during the cooking time.
18c6dc23-e905-4c74-b0b1-445499e4fe82 Cook on low for 30 minutes. Remove the lid, fluff the rice, and then cover again and let sit a few minutes before serving.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Heat the oil to 375 F.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Cut the ends from each plantain and peel the fruits while the oil is heating. Cut the plantains into 3/4-inch slices.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Fry the slices in the hot oil for 3 minutes or until they turn a light golden color and they're semi-soft.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Remove the plantain slices with a slotted spoon and drain them on paper towels.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 When the plantain slices are cool enough to handle — about 1 minute — smash them into flat rounds.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Fry the rounds in the hot oil for 3 minutes until they turn crisp and golden brown.
5d681e4d-db2a-4de0-bb8e-f35d1c650310 Remove the tostones with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Salt to taste.
d5291bc1-dd6b-470b-b8b5-23b53960a751 Squeeze the juice from the bitter oranges into a mixing bowl.
d5291bc1-dd6b-470b-b8b5-23b53960a751 Add the remaining ingredients and stir.
d5291bc1-dd6b-470b-b8b5-23b53960a751 Immerse pork or another type of meat or chicken in the marinade for at least eight hours.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Rinse the rice well in a colander.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Bring the water to boil in a saucepan. Add the rice and the salt.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Allow the rice to boil for about 1 minute. Stir at least once to prevent sticking, but don't overdo it.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Cover the saucepan with an appropriate tight-fitting lid that does not have an exhaust hole.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Reduce the heat to low and allow the rice to simmer for about 30 minutes.
b67013d9-2f5c-4a5c-9690-4f0c13defa41 Fluff the rice with a fork and serve.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Gather the ingredients.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Add all ingredients except corn to a large pot and place on medium heat. Stir to mix and dissolve the salt.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Cut each ear of corn in half.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Add cut corn to pot with the coconut milk mixture.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Turn heat to high, cover the pot and bring to a boil.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Once pot comes to a boil, remove lid and let continue to cook on high heat until all liquid has been absorbed and coconut milk cracks (this is indicated by small bits of white curds from the coconut milk).
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Serve warm or at room temperature.
2cdf249e-0ca1-44b8-985c-02017896566a Enjoy!
313ad241-17a4-463e-ac34-e90ae9618796 Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over low heat.
313ad241-17a4-463e-ac34-e90ae9618796 Whisk in 4 tablespoons flour and 1/2 teaspoon of salt, then whisk in 2 cups of milk.
313ad241-17a4-463e-ac34-e90ae9618796 Turn the heat to medium and stir continuously until the mixture thickens.
313ad241-17a4-463e-ac34-e90ae9618796 Reduce the heat to medium-low and add 1/4 pound of shredded cheese a little at a time, stirring continuously until the sauce is smooth and creamy.
313ad241-17a4-463e-ac34-e90ae9618796 Pour the hot sauce over eggs, macaroni, potatoes or your favorite vegetables.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Mix together the hot mashed potatoes, eggs, butter and 2 teaspoons of cornstarch. Set aside and let cool.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a In a frying pan, heat the olive oil. Add the ground beef and cook until no longer pink. Stir to break up the meat.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Add the sofrito, tomato sauce, oregano and salt to the cooked ground beef. Mix thoroughly. Turn the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Spread a spoonful of the potato dough mix in the palm of your hand. Make an indentation in the middle and stuff it with the meat mixture.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Cover the filling with more potato dough. Shape into a ball. Dust the ball lightly with the remaining cornstarch.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Repeat until mix is used up.
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Deep fry the stuffed potato balls until golden (about 2 minutes).
19d98f52-d2be-4741-847b-01de992a441a Remove and drain on paper towels.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Gather the ingredients.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Combine all ingredients, except the white rice, in a saucepan.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Bring to a boil over medium heat.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Lower heat and let simmer uncovered until beans reach your desired consistency.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Remove and discard bay leaf.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Serve black beans side by side or over the top of the white rice.
c4bbdb86-b4ef-4770-882d-f4372fd283bc Enjoy!
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Gather the ingredients.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Add all ingredients except the scotch bonnet pepper and the salt to a large pot. Stir to mix.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Cover and bring to a light boil over medium heat, allowing the callaloo cook for 15 minutes.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Add the whole scotch bonnet pepper.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Cover the pot again and allow to cook for an additional 15 minutes or until the ingredients are cooked through and vegetables are very soft.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Remove the hot pepper, crab, and salt meat from the pot.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Use a swizzle stick or an immersion blender to puree the mixture. Add salt to taste, if necessary.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Pour the soup into bowls and garnish with the hot pepper and crab.
1a993ca8-c20e-4a59-a888-f139226c4b23 Enjoy!
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Heat the oven to 375 F. Grease a baking sheet while you're waiting for the oven to warm up.
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Combine the yuca flour, cheese, egg, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Knead the dough until it is completely mixed. If it's dry and begins to crumble, add a little water, a tablespoon of water at a time until the dough begins to hold together.
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Separate the dough into ten equal parts. Shape each part into a half moon shape or ball.
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Place the dough about 2 inches apart on the greased baking pan.
5f7ea233-e388-433a-89bf-7754a451c9c9 Bake for 20 minutes. The bread should be a golden color when it's done.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Gather the ingredients.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Husk the corn and remove the silk. Trim off any discolored kernels or any that have been damaged by insects. Depending on the size of your steamer basket, you may need to cut the ears of corn in half so they are short enough to fit.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Add 2 inches of water to a large pot and insert a steamer rack. Make sure the water is not touching the bottom of the steamer rack. If it is, pour some of it off.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Cover the pot and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff When the water begins to boil, place the corn into the steamer basket inside the pot using a pair of tongs.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Cover the pot and let the corn steam for 4 minutes or until it turns deep yellow and crisp. If you prefer softer corn, steam for 7 minutes. For the softest corn, steam for 10 to 15 minutes. The longer you steam the corn, the more attention you must pay to the water level. Don't let it fall lower than 1 inch or it may run dry and scorch your pot.
3638dbaa-85db-4508-bb20-f1db0ee743ff Turn off the burner and carefully remove the corn from the pot with tongs. Serve as is or with butter, salt, and pepper.
1d817d33-751b-4fe5-ac95-55d7879e71cb Shuck the corn and remove the silks
1d817d33-751b-4fe5-ac95-55d7879e71cb Place an ear of corn right on a burner. Feel free to use more burners to roast both ears of corn at the same time.
1d817d33-751b-4fe5-ac95-55d7879e71cb Light your gas stove and turn heat to medium-high.
1d817d33-751b-4fe5-ac95-55d7879e71cb Roast the corn over the gas flame, turning every minute or so until the kernels are charred in various places all around the corn.
1d817d33-751b-4fe5-ac95-55d7879e71cb Serve the corn warm as it is or with a dab of butter, a sprinkle of grated cheese, salt, and pepper or a squirt of lemon juice.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Add the oil to a deep pot and heat over medium heat.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Add the onions and saute until translucent, about 5 minutes.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Add the thyme, hot chile pepper, and salt to taste and continue to saute for about 1 minute.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Add the spinach and toss to wilt it and reduce the volume slightly.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Add the rice and water, stir, cover, and bring to a boil. Let boil for 3 minutes and then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed.
8a16db87-f64a-40a6-bad9-45385f28ba6c Adjust the seasoning with salt to taste. Fluff with a fork and serve.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Peel cassava (yuca) and cut into 4-inch pieces, lengthwise.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Add cassava to a pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. When the pot comes to a boil, season with salt to taste. Let cassava cook until fork tender.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Drain cooked cassava well and let cool to handle.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Cut cassava pieces in half and remove the hard spine in the middle. Cut the halved pieces into 1/2-inch strips.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Heat oil in a deep pan until smoking hot. Working in batches, fry cassava pieces until they are gently browned.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Using a slotted spoon, remove cassava fries from hot oil and let drain on paper toweling. Season with black pepper and a sprinkling of salt.
282896ca-7d8a-4373-8681-b067756334a0 Serve just as you would French fries. This mojito garlic dipping sauce is perfect for adding flavor.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Gather the ingredients.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc In a large bowl, thoroughly mix the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Add 1 tablespoon of oil, or ghee if using, and mix it into the flour.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Add just enough water to knead and make a dough. Start with 3/4 cup of water and knead the dough, adding a little bit more water at a time if you deem it necessary. Not all flours are alike, and not all doughs need the same amounts of water. The dough needs to be soft and pliable, and you'll get that after a few minutes of kneading, between 4 and 8.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Form a ball with the dough and rub some of the remaining oil on top to prevent the dough from forming a skin. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Heat a cast iron griddle, pan, or tawah if you have one, over medium heat.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Cut the dough into 4 equal pieces. Cover the rest of the dough as you work with one piece at a time.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Lightly flour your work surface and rolling pin.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Form one piece of the dough into a ball, then flatten it into a disk. Roll it out into a 5-inch circle of about 1/4 inch thickness.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Transfer the dough disc to the heated griddle or pan and lower the heat to medium-low. Let cook on one side until the roti puffs up.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Flip the roti and cook the other side for 1 or 2 minutes. Remove roti from the pan and wrap loosely in a clean kitchen towel, or any flour-bag type of fabric.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Repeat the process with the remaining pieces of dough.
28f40b6e-b7a0-4cf6-ad44-55bdda17adbc Serve warm with your favorite spreads or dishes and enjoy!
3c2fe4a3-697c-454a-81fe-e74bcadb9e01 Add the dry ingredients to a bowl and thoroughly whisk them together.
3c2fe4a3-697c-454a-81fe-e74bcadb9e01 Add the water to the dry ingredients a little at a time, kneading the mixture together to make a dough, about 2 to 3 minutes. Knead for an additional 2 minutes after the dough forms.
3c2fe4a3-697c-454a-81fe-e74bcadb9e01 Let the dough rest for about 10 minutes, then cut it into 8 equal pieces and shape the pieces into balls.
3c2fe4a3-697c-454a-81fe-e74bcadb9e01 Steam the balls in batches of 3 or 4 for 25 minutes per batch.
3c2fe4a3-697c-454a-81fe-e74bcadb9e01 Serve hot.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oil to 375 F.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Peel the green plantains and cut them into 3/4-inch slices while the oil is heating.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Fry the slices in the hot oil for 3 minutes. They should be a light golden color and semi-soft.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Remove the plantain slices with a slotted spoon and drain them on paper towels.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad When the plantain slices are cool enough to handle, usually about 1 minute, smash them into flat rounds.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Fry the rounds in the hot oil for an additional 3 minutes. They'll turn crisp and golden brown.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Remove the slices with a slotted spoon and drain again on paper towels.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Mash together the bacon, garlic, peppers, onion and olive oil in a mortar and pestle. Add each ingredient a little at a time until everything is well incorporated.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Add the broth. You can add more than 1/3 cup if the stuffing doesn't seem moist enough until you get the consistency that you prefer.
64718ec1-e9c9-4d8a-847b-785dee3c60ad Serve the stuffing as is, or use it to stuff your turkey.
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c Wash, peel and cut potatoes into quarters.
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c Cook potatoes in salted boiling water until fork-tender. Drain well.
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c Add potatoes to a large bowl along with pepper and cumin. Mash well, mixing the ingredients together. Taste for salt and adjust if necessary.
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c Fold in green onions and cilantro (if using).
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c With clean hands, take the mixture a little at a time and make into 3-inch balls. You can use an ice cream scoop for equal measurements.
c85eff8c-7326-46b3-8227-4d6776a47c2c Set aside balls.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Gather the ingredients.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Peel the sweet potatoes and cut them into large pieces.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 In a large pot, place the potatoes, cover with water, and bring the pot to a boil over high heat.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 When the pot comes to a boil, salt the water, and let the sweet potatoes cook until a knife inserts easily into them.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Drain the sweet potatoes thoroughly.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Add the drained potatoes back into the still-hot pot along with the salt, butter, pepper, and milk. Mash the potatoes until they are smooth. Season with the chili pepper. Mix well.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Fold in the green onions.
defe4eeb-096e-4222-aba5-fa9d8f58a540 Serve immediately and enjoy.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Gather the ingredients.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Place flour(s) in a bowl. Mix in the 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Add the warm water slowly, stirring as you go, until the dough starts to come together. Keep stirring, adding a little more water if the dough is dry, until the dough forms a ball.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Turn the dough out onto the counter and knead for a few minutes, adding a little flour if it is too sticky. The dough should be soft but not sticky enough to adhere to your hands or the counter.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Let the dough rest for 10 minutes, covered with a damp cloth.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Roll out the dough into a large circle, about 1/4-inch thick. Spread about 1 teaspoon vegetable oil over the surface of the dough. Roll the dough up into a long roll.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Slice the log of dough into 8 to 10 pieces. Roll each piece out flat into a 6-inch circle. Let the circles rest, covered with a damp cloth, for 5 minutes.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Heat a flat, heavy griddle or skillet (a cast-iron skillet or crepe pan works well) over medium-low heat.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Roll the first circle of dough out as thin as possible (to about an 8- to 9-inch circle).
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Add about 1 teaspoon oil to the skillet and add a circle of dough. Cook 1 to 2 minutes, until the bread puffs up and turns light brown on the underside. Slide the roti to the side of the pan and quickly flip to brown the other side, cooking for about 1 to 2 minutes more.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Remove from the pan and place roti in a colander to cool. Cover roti with a damp towel while you cook the rest; this will help keep them from becoming hard. Add more oil to the skillet as needed.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Brush the finished roti with melted butter before serving, if desired.
6b2a6c30-ecbc-40e1-9d7c-26d54d3f9489 Serve and enjoy.
050df704-eb9e-4261-b413-65d84d9cd778 Soak 2 1/2 cups long-grain white rice in cold water for 15 minutes and drain.
050df704-eb9e-4261-b413-65d84d9cd778 In a large saucepan, bring 6 cups of water to a boil. 1 teaspoon salt, 1 whole peeled onion, 1 branch parsley, 1 branch thyme, and 1 whole peeled carrot. Add the rinsed rice and simmer over medium heat for 20 minutes.
050df704-eb9e-4261-b413-65d84d9cd778 Remove the onion, parsley, thyme, and carrot. Drain the rice in a colander to remove any lingering starchiness. Rinse under cold running water. Drain again and turn into the saucepan.
050df704-eb9e-4261-b413-65d84d9cd778 Simmer over low heat for 5 minutes until the rice grains are completely dry.
050df704-eb9e-4261-b413-65d84d9cd778 Serve as a side dish or with Chicken Columbo.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 In a saucepan, combine garlic, bay leaves, salt, and water.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 Bring the mixture to a boil.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 Add the Yuca, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer until yuca is tender, but not sticky or falling apart, about 30 minutes.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 Drain the yuca on paper towels. When cool enough to handle, pat the yuca dry.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 In a fryer or deep skillet, heat the oil to 375 F.
09b232c2-6a42-449c-be47-f0ee0e101125 Fry the yuca until golden, drain on paper towels, sprinkle with salt, and serve hot with Garlic Dipping Sauce
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Bring a large saucepan of water to a roaring boil, then add salt to taste.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Scrub the potatoes and cut them into halves, then into thickly-cut wedges.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Add the potatoes to boiling water. Cook for 3 minutes, beginning when the water comes back to a boil.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Drain the potatoes well, shaking off any excess water. Transfer them to a large baking sheet.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Dust the potatoes with the all-purpose seasoning and black pepper. Toss to coat the wedges well then spread them out in an even layer on a baking sheet.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Roast the potatoes for 20 minutes.
77781166-4bd8-47ea-9ad1-30b8c47dc9d4 Flip the wedges over using a flat spatula. Roast them for an additional 20 to 25 minutes or until the potatoes are nicely browned.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Place the pieces of plantain in a saucepan and cover with lightly salted, cold water.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Bring to a boil and cook until the plantains are soft, about 10 minutes.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Drain the plantains in a colander.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Transfer to a bowl and mash the plantains using a potato masher. Set aside.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df In a frying pan, sauté the bacon until brown.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Add the diced onion and chopped garlic. Continue sautéing for about 5 minutes.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Remove the frying pan from the heat and carefully drain the excess bacon drippings, leaving about 2 tablespoons of grease in the pan.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Gently fold in the mashed plantains until thoroughly mixed.
81352a5d-0be1-44e9-ac8e-532093e736df Transfer the fufu to a dish, cover, and keep warm until ready to serve.
db3592e3-de42-4f43-9840-fac3fbe310c6 Gather the ingredients.
db3592e3-de42-4f43-9840-fac3fbe310c6 To a blender or food processor, add olive oil, garlic, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, lime juice, and salt.
db3592e3-de42-4f43-9840-fac3fbe310c6 Process until all the ingredients are incorporated and the garlic and onion are thoroughly broken down.
db3592e3-de42-4f43-9840-fac3fbe310c6 Transfer to a non-reactive bowl (a non-reactive bowl is one made of a material that does not react chemically with the citric acids in the lemon and lime such as stainless steel, glass, or ceramic). Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
db3592e3-de42-4f43-9840-fac3fbe310c6 Serve with plantain chips or fritters.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 Heat olive oil in a large skillet over low heat.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 When the oil is hot, saute garlic, bay leaf, onions, peppers, diced tomatoes, and ham until onions and peppers are soft.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 Stir in the tomato paste and allow to caramelize. Add the wine and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cilantro and oregano.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 Remove from heat and allow to cool. Remove the bay leaf.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 Puree the cooled mixture in a blender or food processor. Add salt and pepper to taste.
341fcaf7-0ef6-4b9e-b64d-32703d3252d1 You can use it right away in a recipe calling for sofrito or place the mixture in a glass jar with a tight-fitting lid and refrigerate up to 2 weeks.
00511f51-354f-4850-adf8-2439d84b2ffb Gather the ingredients.
00511f51-354f-4850-adf8-2439d84b2ffb In a small bowl, thoroughly mix together all of the ingredients.
00511f51-354f-4850-adf8-2439d84b2ffb Generously coat on your choice of protein and cook.
00511f51-354f-4850-adf8-2439d84b2ffb Serve and enjoy!
290ba1ce-382b-481c-9158-f57b7b450f89 Combine onion and ginger in a food processor; process until finely chopped. Add the chile pepper, dry mustard powder, pepper, allspice, thyme, vinegar, soy sauce, orange juice, and garlic. Process until the sauce is fairly smooth.
290ba1ce-382b-481c-9158-f57b7b450f89 Place the chicken pieces in a 3 1/2- to 5-quart slow cooker and cover with the sauce.
290ba1ce-382b-481c-9158-f57b7b450f89 Cover the pot cook on low for about 5 hours. or until chicken is tender (about 3 hours on high).
290ba1ce-382b-481c-9158-f57b7b450f89 Serve the chicken on the bone or shred it and put it back in the sauce.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Gather the ingredients.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Toast the rice over medium heat in a dry skillet until lightly golden. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 5 minutes. Transfer the rice to a plate or platter to cool.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Place the remaining spices, except the turmeric, into the skillet and cook over medium heat until fragrant and toasty. Shake the pan often to prevent burning. This will take about 3 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a plate or platter to cool.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Place the cooled rice and spices into a spice mill, blender, or food processor. Grind into a fine powder. Place the powder in a bowl and thoroughly stir in the turmeric.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Store the seasoning in an airtight jar, container, or sealed baggie. Be sure to label it and record the date you made it. The powder will keep for several months.
03751e1f-8c80-4935-8fc6-23db9597c043 Enjoy!
a9490d88-671d-486d-987c-49378f3d3ea6 Heat the oil and seeds in a small saucepan over medium heat just until the seeds begin a steady bubble.
a9490d88-671d-486d-987c-49378f3d3ea6 Remove the saucepan from the heat and let stand for a minute.
a9490d88-671d-486d-987c-49378f3d3ea6 Strain the oil.
e0c717b1-0f71-46bd-93c6-76ce59c4a9ed Combine all ingredients except the chicken and pour into a shallow baking dish or resealable plastic bag. Add chicken and turn to coat.
e0c717b1-0f71-46bd-93c6-76ce59c4a9ed Cover and place in refrigerator to marinate in jerk seasoning for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from jerk marinade and pour marinade into a saucepan.
e0c717b1-0f71-46bd-93c6-76ce59c4a9ed Bring to a boil. Place chicken on grill cooking approximately 7 to 10 minutes per side (or until done), basting periodically with remaining cooked jerk marinade.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Gather the ingredients.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Fill a medium-sized pot halfway with cold water.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Carefully peel the yams; their slippery quality can make them hard to peel.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Cut the peeled yams into chunks and place them in the cold water.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Bring the yams to a boil over high heat. Keep a rapid boil until the yams are soft, about 25 minutes.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Remove the yams, drain, but reserve about a cup of the cooking water. Allow the yams to cool off.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Place the cooled yams in a large bowl along with the salt, pepper, and olive oil.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Mash and mix the ingredients using a potato masher. The mixture will be uneven and lumpy.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Place the fufu mixture in a food processor or blender. Pulse briefly at low speed to remove any lumps, but do not puree.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Place the yam mixture back in the bowl and beat it with a wooden spoon until it becomes smooth. The mixture should become sticky and slightly elastic. It's perfectly fine to use your hands to get it to the desired texture. Add some of the reserved water, starting with 1/4 of a cup, and work the dough. You might need to add more water, but it depends on how moist the yams were to begin with. Keep working and adding water until you have a springy dough that comes away from the bowl, is pliable, and is easily shaped.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Shape the fufu into balls of equal size.
2b8741ef-71c3-4a71-8475-3a9b55c37341 Enjoy.
c04c10de-05a5-4324-8d55-7732a486252f Gather the ingredients.
c04c10de-05a5-4324-8d55-7732a486252f In a medium bowl, whisk together 6 tablespoons of salt, 6 tablespoons of granulated garlic, 4 tablespoons of oregano, 2 tablespoons of black pepper, 2 tablespoons of turmeric, and 2 tablespoons of onion powder until well mixed.
c04c10de-05a5-4324-8d55-7732a486252f Transfer to an airtight container for up to 6 months.
c04c10de-05a5-4324-8d55-7732a486252f Use as your recipe directs.
242a4592-59bc-4f46-851e-4e808dd78c69 Chop and blend all the ingredients in a food processor or blender.
242a4592-59bc-4f46-851e-4e808dd78c69 Place the mixture in a glass jar with a tight lid. Refrigerate up to 2 weeks.
c5d890a2-618b-4f34-b4d4-e0bf670856a4 Divide the ingredients into two equal batches. Add to food processor one batch at a time. Pulse or let whirl until all the ingredients are very fine. Drizzle in just enough water to moisten the mixture. Repeat with the second batch of ingredients.
c5d890a2-618b-4f34-b4d4-e0bf670856a4 Transfer to glass jars with airtight lids and store in refrigerator or, for longer storage, pour into ice cube trays and freeze.
c5d890a2-618b-4f34-b4d4-e0bf670856a4 Remove frozen cubes and store in a zip-top bag in the freezer.
ae07bec2-c769-4d11-91e8-4f9ba2ce6b2a Gather the ingredients.
ae07bec2-c769-4d11-91e8-4f9ba2ce6b2a Put all the ingredients in a food processor and pulse until the peppers are minced finely. Scrape down the sides of the bowl from time to time.
ae07bec2-c769-4d11-91e8-4f9ba2ce6b2a Once the peppers are chopped pretty finely, let the processor keep whirling and pour just enough of the vinegar through the chute to moisten the peppers and give it the consistency of a thick sauce.
ae07bec2-c769-4d11-91e8-4f9ba2ce6b2a Pour the hot sauce into sterilized glass bottles or jars and cover with airtight lids. Store the finished product in a cool place or in your refrigerator until the flavors meld together nicely. Or, you can place your bottles of pepper sauce in the sun for 2-3 days to ripen quickly and then store in a cool place. If there's no sun where you are, let the pepper sauce cure for at least 5 days before use so that the flavors can develop.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Place the pieces of plantain in a saucepan and cover with lightly salted, cold water.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Bring to a boil and cook until the plantains are soft, about 10 minutes.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Drain the plantains in a colander.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Transfer to a bowl and mash the plantains using a potato masher. Set aside.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 In a frying pan, sauté the bacon until brown.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Add the diced onion and chopped garlic. Continue sautéing for about 5 minutes.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Remove the frying pan from the heat and carefully drain the excess bacon drippings, leaving about 2 tablespoons of grease in the pan.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Gently fold in the mashed plantains until thoroughly mixed.
2abeb653-fdaf-49c4-9a07-a29c61b73a14 Transfer the fufu to a dish, cover, and keep warm until ready to serve.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Preheat oven to 200 F/93 C.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Line a baking sheet or cookie sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 In a mixing bowl, using an electric hand mixer (or use your stand mixer) beat the egg whites until frothy.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Add the cream of tartar, salt, and vanilla. Continue to beat until the whites stand up in soft peaks. Set the mixture aside.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 In a medium-size saucepan, combine sugar, water, lemon zest, and lime zest.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Bring the sugar mixture to a boil over medium heat, swirling the pan by the handle. Boil the mixture until the temperature reaches 238 F/114 C on your candy thermometer.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Remove the saucepan from the heat. Pour the sugar mixture through a coarse strainer (to remove the lemon and lime zest) into the bowl with the egg whites that you set aside earlier.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Right away start beating the mixture on medium speed. Continue to beat until the egg white mixture stands in stiff peaks. This will take about 10 minutes.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Using a pastry bag and 1/2-inch star tip, pipe the meringue onto the baking sheet into bite-size, pointed swirls.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Bake the kisses on the middle rack of the preheated oven for 1 hour.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Remove the kisses from oven and let them cool. The meringues should loosen easily from the paper and be light and crisp.
ec0d1506-0a2c-4e81-abb0-00c26016bc53 Store the kisses in an airtight container on the countertop.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Gather the ingredients.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 In a large saucepan or pot, bring 3 cups of water to a simmer. Add the ginger pieces, cinnamon sticks, whole cloves, and salt. Simmer for about 15 minutes until the flavors are infused into the water.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Remove the spices and save the infused water.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Put the infused water back into the saucepan or pot. Add the coconut milk and 1 more cup of water. Bring to a boil.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Add the sugar, raisins, and coconut and thoroughly stir. Reduce the heat to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes, stirring a few times.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 After 20 minutes, remove the lid and stir. Continue to cook for another 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked through and creamy. The water should be absorbed. If the water is absorbed but the rice is still not cooked, add a little hot water (about 1/4 cup) at a time and continue to cook until done.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Once the rice is cooked, pour into your serving dish or dishes. Allow to cool and place in the refrigerator to chill until ready to serve.
4872ee40-d881-4d01-88c6-a818e7e1da02 Garnish with cinnamon before serving and enjoy!
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Gather the ingredients.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Peel and halve each banana lengthwise.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Heat the oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Brown the bananas 5 minutes on each side.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Add the sugar and pour in the rum.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Cook for 2 minutes.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Flambé.
c67f2848-2bd7-4c69-866d-63556cfd7bd1 Sprinkle with lime juice and serve at once.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Gather the ingredients.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Preheat oven to 350 F.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Grease a 9x9 or 8x8 baking pan and set aside.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Remove and discard crusts from the bread. Cut remaining bread into cubes.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c In a mixing bowl, soak bread cubes in the hot milk for 5 to 10 minutes.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Mix the soaked cubes well and then strain off excess milk.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Dredge raisins in the flour and then fold into the bread and milk mix.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Add the remaining ingredients to the bowl. Mix well.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Pour the bread mix into the greased baking pan.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Bake uncovered for 40 minutes, or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Top with your favorite dessert topping sauce.
f09b0ab3-8581-435c-a484-5cca3cbb2c8c Serve and enjoy!
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Gather the ingredients.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Heat oven to 350 F/177 C.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Grease a 13-by-9-by-2-inch cookie sheet.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd In a bowl, thoroughly mix coconut flakes, flour, egg yolks, brown sugar, butter and extract until a sticky dough that is moldable forms.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Divide the dough into 24 uniform balls.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Place the balls on the greased cookie sheet and bake for about 25 minutes. They should be golden brown.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd Remove from the oven and let cool completely before eating.
47287c98-c49b-4ec3-a0ed-4e612aabb6fd If desired, drizzle with melted chocolate and chopped nuts.
6870e6ea-aa93-41f2-95b5-b8cb2aee2ef8 Preheat oven to 350 F.
6870e6ea-aa93-41f2-95b5-b8cb2aee2ef8 In a large bowl, combine mashed sweet potatoes, crushed pineapple, room temperature butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg, as well as salt and pepper to taste. Mix thoroughly.
6870e6ea-aa93-41f2-95b5-b8cb2aee2ef8 Transfer mixture to a greased 8 x 8-inch casserole dish. Arrange pineapple slices on top of the mixture and place a cherry in the center of each pineapple ring.
6870e6ea-aa93-41f2-95b5-b8cb2aee2ef8 Brush the entire top of the pie with the melted butter and bake for 40 minutes or until golden brown.
6870e6ea-aa93-41f2-95b5-b8cb2aee2ef8 Allow the pie to cool until it's either warm or room temperature before serving.
ec40b0a2-2a57-43c7-a0ca-b49a01b4c094 Gather the ingredients.
