ec40b0a2-2a57-43c7-a0ca-b49a01b4c094 Add the chopped onions, mayonnaise, sour cream, queso fresco, aji amarillo paste or sauteed pepper, ketchup, and lime juice into a food processor or blender.
ec40b0a2-2a57-43c7-a0ca-b49a01b4c094 Process until the mixture is smooth and creamy.
ec40b0a2-2a57-43c7-a0ca-b49a01b4c094 Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste and chill until ready to serve.
46d00fdb-1cbf-4dfe-80db-af0852e6cdb1 Place the pisco, simple syrup, frozen mango chunks, Key lime juice and egg white in a blender.
46d00fdb-1cbf-4dfe-80db-af0852e6cdb1 Mix until they are smooth.
46d00fdb-1cbf-4dfe-80db-af0852e6cdb1 Serve in an old-fashioned glass or tumbler.
9acfefdb-8a23-49ee-ac87-7cfb4d3a2082 Gather the ingredients.
9acfefdb-8a23-49ee-ac87-7cfb4d3a2082 Add the pisco, simple syrup, lime juice, and egg white to a cocktail shaker.
9acfefdb-8a23-49ee-ac87-7cfb4d3a2082 Add ice to fill, and shake vigorously. Alternatively, you can use a blender if you don't have a shaker.
9acfefdb-8a23-49ee-ac87-7cfb4d3a2082 Strain into an old-fashioned glass and sprinkle the Angostura bitters on top of the foam.
9acfefdb-8a23-49ee-ac87-7cfb4d3a2082 Serve immediately.
187a6654-9116-4cfd-969e-a6a478f1641f Gather the ingredients.
187a6654-9116-4cfd-969e-a6a478f1641f In a cocktail shaker, thoroughly muddle the fruit with the absinthe, cachaça, brandy, and orange liqueur.
187a6654-9116-4cfd-969e-a6a478f1641f Pour everything (including the ice) into a wine glass.
187a6654-9116-4cfd-969e-a6a478f1641f Float red wine on top of the cocktail by slowly pouring it over the back of a bar spoon.
187a6654-9116-4cfd-969e-a6a478f1641f Serve and enjoy.
31e66b65-f5cc-4036-98bf-e37af5d83ec3 Place limes in the microwave for 20 seconds on low power (or until they are just warm, not hot to the touch) then roll them around a few times on the counter, while pressing down with the palm of your hand.
31e66b65-f5cc-4036-98bf-e37af5d83ec3 Bring the water and sugar (and salt if using) to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and cool.
31e66b65-f5cc-4036-98bf-e37af5d83ec3 Mix the sugar water, lime juice, and ice in a blender, and blend until well mixed and slushy. Serve immediately in tall glasses.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Gather the ingredients.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Peel and chop the pineapple, mango and/or papaya, and strawberries into 1/2 inch dice and add to a large pitcher, including any juice.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Slice the grapes in half and add to the other fruit.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Peel, seed, and chop 2 of the oranges and add.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Cut remaining orange into thin slices and set aside for serving on the rim of each glass.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Peel and slice the banana into rounds, then slice each round in half. Add bananas to the rest of the fruit. You should have about 6 cups of chopped fruit. (Use any kind of fruit that you have on hand - other good choices include peaches, kiwis, apples, etc).
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Cover the fruit with about 2 to 3 cups of orange juice and then add the can of frozen limeade mix.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Fill the empty can with water twice and add to the fruit mixture.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Stir in the grenadine syrup, adding more than 1/4 cup if desired to obtain the desired color.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 Chill mixture for several hours before serving, allowing the flavors to blend.
0c10c092-1ba8-4079-a658-c9249319cef1 To serve, fill each glass 2/3 full, including plenty of chopped fruit, then fill to top with club soda, water, more juice (passion fruit juice would be tasty), or alcohol. Serve glass with a slice of orange on the rim and spoon on the side for the fruit.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Gather the ingredients.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Bring the water, both kinds of sugar, lime juice, salt, cloves, and cinnamon sticks to a boil.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Remove from the heat and stir in the orange juice.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Add the aguardiente or rum, to taste.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Reheat without boiling. If it boils, the alcohol will boil away.
4f27f34d-2e55-44f5-ae98-2d28fdf16186 Strain and serve hot.
d5fecceb-ba4e-4056-b463-d07b641009aa Pour the milk into a saucepan.
d5fecceb-ba4e-4056-b463-d07b641009aa Stir in the sugar and vanilla.
d5fecceb-ba4e-4056-b463-d07b641009aa Heat the milk slowly over low heat until it is just about to boil. Do not let it boil.
d5fecceb-ba4e-4056-b463-d07b641009aa Remove from the heat and divide the milk into 4 mugs.
d5fecceb-ba4e-4056-b463-d07b641009aa Serve each mug with a piece of the chocolate.
ceeaa60c-bd87-442a-ad10-c771e78c15dc Fill an 8-ounce tumbler with ice cubes.
ceeaa60c-bd87-442a-ad10-c771e78c15dc Pour the pisco over the ice.
ceeaa60c-bd87-442a-ad10-c771e78c15dc Squeeze the lime juice into the glass.
ceeaa60c-bd87-442a-ad10-c771e78c15dc Fill the glass with the ginger ale.
ceeaa60c-bd87-442a-ad10-c771e78c15dc Enjoy!
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Make sugar syrup: Put sugar and water in a pot and bring to a boil. Boil for 2 minutes, remove from heat and let cool.
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Measure pisco into blender. Add passion fruit juice and lime juice.
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Add sugar water, ice cubes, and egg white.
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Blend until mixture is frothy and the ice is completely crushed and blended.
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Serve immediately in small tumblers.
af912131-0d76-4e66-9841-2559865037a1 Serves 4.
e49f22b1-9664-42bb-9ac8-daa170019afd Place the frozen coconut, milk, condensed milk, pinch of salt, and vanilla in the blender. Blend until as smooth as possible. You can serve the cocada as is, without ice, adding additional milk to achieve desired texture.
e49f22b1-9664-42bb-9ac8-daa170019afd To make a frozen version, add ice and blend until desired texture is reached. (This method works well with more traditional blenders. They can't completely process the coconut. The ice helps to make a more consistent texture). Serve immediately with a dash of powdered cinnamon on top of each glass.
a50af439-f94b-4938-9855-ea50018236c6 Fill an old-fashioned glass with crushed ice.
a50af439-f94b-4938-9855-ea50018236c6 Add bourbon and lemon juice.
a50af439-f94b-4938-9855-ea50018236c6 Add lemon/mint/eucalyptus infusion and stir to incorporate.
a50af439-f94b-4938-9855-ea50018236c6 Garnish with a fresh mint sprig.
09978c0e-e962-4af2-8ace-b0eadb1fb05a Gather the ingredients.
09978c0e-e962-4af2-8ace-b0eadb1fb05a Put everything into a food processor or blender and whir the hell out of it. If you want a thinner sauce, add more olive oil, or you could add a little water.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Gather the ingredients.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Crumble or grate the two cheeses together, making sure that they are grated very finely.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Mix the cheese, cornstarch, tapioca starch, brown sugar, baking powder, salt, eggs, and butter in a large bowl until well-blended.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Knead the dough until it is smooth. It will be soft but should not be sticky and firm enough to shape into balls. Add more cornstarch if the dough seems too wet. If the dough seems too dry or crumbly, add a small amount of milk (1 to 2 teaspoons at a time) until it is smooth.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Take about 2 tablespoons of dough into the palms of your hands and shape the dough into a very smooth ball.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Heat several inches of oil in a heavy pot to 325 F.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Add the bunuelos, a few at a time, and cook. They will sink to the bottom, then rise and expand.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Cook for 10 to 12 minutes, or longer if needed, turning them occasionally until they are golden brown.
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Drain on a plate lined with paper towels. Dust with powdered sugar, if desired
384f7dfc-96b6-42b1-8885-19523c07c707 Serve warm or at room temperature.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Gather the ingredients.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Preheat oven to 400 F.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 In a saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Whisk the flour into the melted butter and increase the heat to medium. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Whisk the milk into the flour/butter mixture and bring it to boil, stirring. The sauce will thicken slightly.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Whisk 2 eggs into mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes more or until sauce has thickened.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Add grated cheese and parmesan and stir until melted. Remove from heat and add cayenne pepper and salt to taste.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Roll out 1 sheet of puff pastry dough on a floured surface to 12 inches square. With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut dough into 12 3-inch-by-4-inch rectangles.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Mix the egg yolk with the water and brush the edges of half of the rectangles with the egg yolk mixture.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Place a piece of ham in the center of each rectangle that has been brushed with the egg yolk mixture. There should be an edge of dough all around the ham. Top ham the ham with 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Cover the ham and cheese with one of the plain rectangles and firmly press down around the edges to seal.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Repeat with the other sheet of puff pastry. Pastries may be frozen at this point or kept in the refrigerator for up to 6 hours before baking.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 When ready to bake, prick the top of the empanadas several times with a fork and brush tops lightly with the egg yolk mixture.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Bake 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown.
85f72c33-c2b1-48f1-9707-5b911bcd7f12 Serve hot or at room temperature.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Gather the ingredients.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Preheat oven to 350 F.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Peel butternut squash, then cut in half lengthwise and remove seeds (and the fibrous material around the seeds).
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Separate seeds from the squash, and rinse well. Place seeds in a shallow pan with 1 tablespoon butter and 1/2 teaspoon salt and toast seeds in the preheated oven until dark golden brown and crispy, stirring once or twice, about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove seeds from the oven and set aside to let cool. Note: This step is optional but encouraged.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Chop squash into 1/2 inch cubes. Peel and dice onion. Peel the sweet potato and chop into 1/2 inch cubes. Wash spinach, dry thoroughly and roll it up tightly in a bunch. Slice spinach crosswise to make thin ribbons.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Place vegetable oil and remaining 1 tablespoon of butter in a heavy stockpot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook, stirring, until onion is soft and fragrant.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Add the squash, sweet potatoes, cumin, cinnamon, and sugar to the skillet and cook, stirring often until vegetables are lightly browned.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Add the chicken stock, season with salt and pepper, then simmer vegetables over low heat until they are tender (about 15 minutes).
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Once squash and sweet potatoes are cooked through, use a slotted spoon to transfer the vegetables to a blender (reserve cooking liquid). Add coconut milk and lime juice to the blender and process until it's smooth.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Add blended mixture back to the soup and whisk gently over low heat until evenly heated through. Stir in spinach ribbons and heat for 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
07c59d9b-ba55-422c-a124-26ea66639caf Serve soup warm garnished with the toasted seeds. Enjoy!
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Gather the ingredients.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Set the banana leaves out to thaw. If using corn husks instead, soak in very hot water for an hour to soften.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Make the masa: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the lard or vegetable shortening, cream cheese, and chili con queso until light and fluffy.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 In a separate bowl, mix the masa harina with 2 cups of chicken stock. Add half of the masa harina mixture to the lard mixture and beat well.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Add the remaining masa along with additional chicken stock as needed, beating well, until mixture resembles a thick cake batter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 For the filling, stir together the grated cheddar and pepper Jack cheeses with the salsa.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Rinse and dry the banana leaves and cut them into rectangles about 8 inches by 10 inches in size (for medium tamales). Pat the corn husks dry, if using.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Lay a banana leaf rectangle or corn husk on a flat surface. Place about 1/4 cup of the masa in the middle and spread into a rectangle about 2 inches by 4 inches. Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of the rectangle.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Fold the sides of the banana leaf (or corn husk) in over the filling, closing the masa over the cheese filling.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Fold up the bottom half over the filling, then fold the top half down and roll the tamale until well wrapped.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Tie the tamale with a piece of kitchen string or a strip of banana leaf to secure it. Repeat with the remaining ingredients to produce more tamales.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Bring 1 to 2 inches of water to boil in a steamer pot or in a large pot with a colander or steamer basket set inside. Fill the steamer with one layer of tamales (you may have to steam in batches). The tamales should be above the water; they are cooked by the steam only. Cover the tamales with a dish towel and the pot lid and steam for 30 to 40 minutes. Add water to the pot when necessary.
0d7abda0-8756-4137-b084-9431ad7cfa65 Remove the tamales and serve warm. Enjoy!
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Gather the ingredients.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 In a large bowl, mix the masa harina with the water and salt, stirring well. Add more water if necessary to obtain a soft dough that does not crack around the edges when flattened.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Let the dough rest, covered with plastic wrap, for about 15 minutes.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 If using the refried beans and/or the pork, place in a blender or food processor and process until smooth. The consistency should be like a paste.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Divide the dough into about 6 pieces.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Lightly oil your hands to keep the dough from sticking to them (just a small amount of vegetable oil will do). Form each piece of dough into a ball, then make an indentation in the ball.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Place the cheese, beans, pork, or a combination of fillings in the indentation, and carefully wrap dough around the filling to seal.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Flatten the ball into a disk, about 1/4-inch thick, being careful to keep the filling from leaking out of the edges. This can take a little practice.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Wipe a very small amount of oil onto the surface of a heavy skillet (cast iron works well). Heat the skillet over medium heat, and place the pupusas in the skillet.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Once the bottom of the pupusa is browned, flip over and cook the other side, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Remove from heat and serve warm with a side of pickled cabbage slaw (curtido) and tomato sauce (salsa roja).
2686acfb-798a-422e-9e9d-392a0f1e7ba1 Enjoy!
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 9-inch square baking pan with aluminum foil. Lightly grease the foil with vegetable oil.
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Place 4 tablespoons vegetable oil, maple syrup, peanut butter, and brown sugar in a microwave-proof bowl or measuring cup. Microwave gently on low heat for 30 seconds or so, or until ingredients can be whisked together easily. Whisk in the vanilla and the salt.
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Mix the oats and quinoa flakes together in a bowl. Coarsely chop the nuts and dried fruit, and stir them into the oat mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips.
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Add the liquid mixture to the oat mixture and stir until the dry ingredients are well coated. The mixture should be sticky and should start to clump together. If it doesn't, and it seems dry and crumbly, add more maple syrup to achieve the desired consistency.
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Press the mixture down firmly into a baking pan. Grease a small piece of aluminum foil and use it to compress the mixture down into the pan as smoothly and firmly as possible.
88ca2c16-a35b-4788-b757-da64d07c9a47 Place pan in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until grains appear toasted and smell fragrant. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Finish cooling pan in the refrigerator, and for best (least crumbly) results, wait until the mixture is well-chilled before cutting it into bars.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Whisk the garbanzo bean flour together with the salt, 3 tablespoons olive oil, parmesan cheese, and a generous amount of ground black pepper.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Whisk in 1 3/4 cups of water until well mixed. Set aside for about a half hour, to let the flour absorb some of the water.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Remove the casings from the sausages and roughly chop the sausage. Cook the sausage in a skillet until well browned, adding a tablespoon or so of vegetable or olive oil if they are sticking. Remove sausages to a plate lined with paper towels to cool.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Preheat the oven to 450 degrees. When it is hot, place the remaining 4 tablespoons of olive oil in a 12 inch pizza pan, and heat in the oven until very hot.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Stir more water into the batter if necessary, until the batter is just thin enough to pour. Carefully remove hot pizza pan from oven, and pour batter into the pan. It should make a thin (about 1/4 inch) layer. Place in the oven and bake until fainá is just golden and crispy (about 8-10 minutes). Remove from oven and top with sausage, spinach and crumbled blue cheese. Return to oven for a few minutes longer, until the blue cheese starts to melt and the spinach is just wilting.
5cb3f75f-e4ef-416d-a755-6dc87457ec6c Cut into pieces and serve.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Gather the ingredients.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Sift the flour into a bowl. Stir in 1 teaspoon of the salt and the sugar.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Blend the chilled butter and lard or shortening into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter or with 2 knives until fairly well blended.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Whisk the egg yolks with 3/4 cup water. Stir in the 1/2 cup of the water-egg mixture, a little bit at a time, until the dough starts to come together smoothly.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Keep kneading the dough, adding more of the water-egg mixture as needed (you may need a few tablespoons extra of water), until the dough is smooth. The dough will seem a bit shaggy until it has thoroughly chilled. Taste for salt and add more if needed.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 1 hour. When ready to use, the dough should be soft and smooth, not elastic. If you poke a hole in the dough with your finger, the indentation should remain.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and roll into desired thickness before cutting.
1fe52ebe-2601-4189-852a-292dc15f1570 Use in your desired recipe and enjoy.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Gather the ingredients.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Prepare one recipe of empanada dough, and set aside at room temperature.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Finely chop the garlic.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Wash the spinach and remove the stems. Roll up the spinach leaves in bunches and slice crosswise into 1/2 inch strips (a rough chiffonade).
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the garlic and chile powder and sauté, stirring until garlic is golden brown.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Add the spinach (in batches if necessary) and cook briefly until spinach is wilted and soft.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Remove from heat and drain spinach in a colander. Let spinach cool briefly.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Grate the mozzarella cheese and stir into the spinach with the ricotta cheese and the parmesan. Season spinach mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Divide empanada dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 6 to 8-inch diameter circle. Add about 1/4 cup of filling to the center of the dough circles, and fold the dough over the filling to make a half-circle. Pinch the edges of the dough together firmly to seal them, then crimp the edges decoratively.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Place the empanadas on a baking sheet. Whisk the egg briefly, then brush egg wash over the empanadas.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Bake the empanadas for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown and slightly puffed.
dc5b474a-f2ee-4fa3-a069-76c87ed5c744 Serve warm or at room temperature.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Peel the yuca root and cut it into 3 inch long pieces.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Add the yuca to the boiling water and cook for about 30 to 40 minutes, until the yuca is very tender and can be easily pierced with a fork. It should be fall apart when poked with the fork.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Drain the yuca in a colander. Remove as many of the woody stems from the center of the root as possible. Pass the yuca through a potato ricer, or force it through a colander, to remove any remaining fibrous strings.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Season the mashed yuca with salt and pepper to taste. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Place 2 tablespoons of mashed yuca in the palm of one hand. Make a small well in the middle, and place a piece of cheese in the well. Wrap the mashed yuca around the cheese, and roll between your hands to make a round ball. Repeat with the remaining mashed yuca.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf In a deep skillet or deep fat fryer, heat 2 inches of vegetable oil to 360 degrees. Fry the yuca balls in batches until lightly golden. Drain on paper towels.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Crack 1 egg into a bowl and whisk lightly with a fork. Process the bread with the crackers.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Roll each ball in the egg and then in the bread/cracker crumbs, until well coated with crumbs.
c49f1797-e2d7-4828-9d23-4f9e525aafaf Fry the yuca balls a second time, just until they are golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels and serve warm with huancaína sauce for dipping.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake sweet potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven and let cool.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Prepare the empanada dough according to the recipe and let rest while sweet potato is baking.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Brown bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. When bacon is cooked, removed and cool on a plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon fat in the skillet, and discard remaining fat.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Thinly slice the onion and place slices in the skillet with the cumin, brown sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook onion over low heat until dark golden brown and fragrant.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Peel and mash the baked sweet potato and place in a bowl. Add the caramelized onions, coarsely chopped bacon, lime juice, and cheese (cut into small cubes). Season filling with salt and pepper to taste.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Divide empanada dough into 10 balls. On floured surface, roll each ball into a 5-inch diameter circle.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Place 1-2 tablespoons of the sweet potato filling in the center of the dough. Fold dough over and seal and crimp edges.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Whisk egg with a little bit of water and brush empanadas with egg wash. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.
66811c99-bcc2-4dc5-8d3d-dd603931c00e Serve warm or at room temperature. Reheat empanadas in oven or microwave.
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Mix flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons shortening or lard and mix into the flour with your fingers until well blended.
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Add milk gradually, stirring and then kneading gently as you go, until the mixture forms a smooth dough (add more flour if mixture becomes too wet).
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Roll dough out to about 1/4 inch thickness, and use a round cutter to make 3 1/2 inch circles. (Or separate dough into about 10 pieces, shape each piece into a ball, and flatten each ball into a pancake about 1/4 inch thick). Poke a hole in the center of each with your finger.
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Add enough vegetable oil (or melt enough shortening or lard) in a small skillet to have a depth of about an inch of fat, and heat until fat sizzles when the dough is added. Fry breads in batches until golden brown on both sides, turning them once.
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Drain fried tortas on paper towels and sprinkle with sugar while still hot.
fe3d736b-2b90-4a2f-abb6-33cda099f8df Serve warm.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Whisk together the vegetable oil, vinegar, soy sauce, and mustard in a non-reactive bowl.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Add the beef and mix well. Loosely cover with plastic wrap. Marinate beef in the refrigerator for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Peel and dice one onion. Cut the second onion into thin half-moon shaped slices and set aside. Cut the green pepper into strips.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Heat a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Remove the beef from the marinade and brown beef on all sides in the skillet (reserving marinade). Remove the beef to a plate and set aside.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Add the diced onions to the skillet with the reserved marinade. Cook over medium heat until onions are soft and fragrant.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Add the garlic and diced tomatoes and continue to cook until tomatoes are soft and most of their liquid has evaporated.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Add the tomato paste, green pepper, sliced onions, and oregano, and continue to cook for 1 to 2 minutes more.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Add the browned beef back to the skillet along with the beef bouillon and 1 to 2 cups of water, or enough to just cover the beef (or use beef stock instead of bouillon and water). Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer beef for 1 to 2 hours, or until beef is tender enough to be shredded with a fork.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 In a small bowl, whisk together the cachaça (or rum), cornstarch, and chile pepper paste or hot sauce until the cornstarch is dissolved. Add the mixture to beef and stir until sauce has thickened. Add capers and green onions and stir. Remove from heat.
9a9b9d88-b805-4ef8-9400-1f0a030e4778 Let beef mixture cool slightly before filling sandwich rolls. Carne louca keeps well for several days and can be reheated to make more sandwiches.
f24f9284-624d-4c72-a144-6480699de32e Finely mince the garlic. Finely chop the parsley and cilantro, and oregano if using).
f24f9284-624d-4c72-a144-6480699de32e Stir garlic and herbs together in a small bowl. Add the olive oil and lime juice and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
f24f9284-624d-4c72-a144-6480699de32e Peel and slice the avocado and place in a blender or food processor. Add the mayonnaise and sour cream and process until mixed well. Add parsley/garlic mixture and pulse very briefly, just until you have a smooth, blended mixture. Taste for seasoning and season with salt and pepper to taste. Add more lime juice if needed.
f24f9284-624d-4c72-a144-6480699de32e Store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Gather the ingredients.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Place the bulgur wheat in a heatproof bowl.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 In a small pot, bring the beef broth or water to a boil.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Remove from heat and pour over the bulgur wheat.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Let the wheat rest for 1/2 hour.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Make the filling by placing 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet, and sauté half of the chopped onions, all of the minced garlic, all of the cinnamon, and all of the nutmeg.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 When onions are fragrant and soft, add 1/3 of the ground beef. Cook, stirring until the ground beef is well-browned.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Stir in the parsley and cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Drain the bulgur wheat in a colander, pressing down on the wheat with the flat side of a spoon to press out all of the excess liquid.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Place the bulgur wheat in the bowl of a food processor with the remaining (uncooked) ground beef, remaining raw onions, and mint leaves. Add 3/4 teaspoon salt and sprinkle generously with freshly ground black pepper.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Process ground beef mixture until the mixture is very smooth, like a dough.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 If you have time to chill both the uncooked beef mixture and cooked filling for several hours, it will be easier to shape the kibe.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Take golf ball-size balls of the uncooked beef mixture and press them flat into the palm of your hand.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Place 1 tablespoon of the cooked beef mixture in the middle.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Then close the "dough" around the filling and seal well.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Shape the balls into elongated football-like ovals, with pointed ends. Place kibe on a baking sheet until ready to fry.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Heat several inches of oil in a deep pot to 350 F.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Gently lower the kibe into the oil, working in batches, and cook until very dark brown and crispy.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Drain the kibe on paper towels.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Serve kibe warm with lime wedges and tahini sauce for dipping.
962c8778-f37b-47bd-af10-61f1c390e6a1 Enjoy!
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Gather the ingredients.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and sugar.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Gently mix the vegetable shortening into the flour.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Place the milk and water in a saucepan and heat until almost boiling.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Stir the hot liquid into the flour mixture. Add more water (1 tablespoon at a time) if the mixture seems too dry and crumbly, or add more flour if the mixture is too wet and sticky.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Knead dough gently until well mixed and homogenous.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Divide dough into 16 portions, and roll each piece into a ball. Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Grate or finely chop cheese.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Roll each ball of dough into a 6- to 7-inch circle.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Place 1 ounce of cheese in the center of each dough circle.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Fold the dough in half over the cheese to form a semicircle.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Press down firmly along edges to seal.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Roll the edge inward over itself and press down again to seal.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Crimp edge decoratively with a fork, pressing to seal.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 In a deep-sided skillet, pot, or deep-fat fryer, heat several inches of vegetable oil to 350 F. Fry empanadas in batches, turning at least once, until golden brown.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Drain empanadas on paper towels.
3606723f-c111-4f44-8ed5-0574833d9884 Empanadas can be kept warm in a 200 F oven for up to 1 hour before serving. Serve warm.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Gather the ingredients.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Preheat the oven to 350 F.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Mix milk, salt, vegetable oil, and butter in a pot, and bring to a boil. As soon as it boils, remove from heat.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Stir tapioca flour into the milk and butter mixture.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Stir in the eggs and the cheese, and mix well.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Let mixture cool for 15 to 30 minutes so that it will be easier to handle. (You can chill it in the refrigerator for 15 minutes or so).
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f With floured (tapioca flour) hands, shape the dough into golf ball-size balls and place them on a baking sheet.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Bake rolls for 20 to 25 minutes, until they are puffed up and golden. They will rise slowly and puff up mostly in the last 5 or 10 minutes.
6d9f434c-57c8-4032-8fb4-1861d2d82b3f Serve warm.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Gather the ingredients.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d If using fresh yuca, peel the yuca using a knife.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Cut the yuka into large pieces.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Remove the fibrous inner core of the root.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook yuca until it starts to turn translucent and can be pierced easily with a fork, about 20 to 30 minutes.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Drain thoroughly.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Check yuca for any remaining fibrous pieces and remove them.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Cut the yuca root into thick rectangular wedges.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a heavy frying pan over medium-high heat.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Once the oil is hot (ideally 350 F), fry the yuca in batches, turning occasionally, until golden brown.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Carefully remove yuca from pan with a slotted spoon or wire skimmer and place onto a plate lined with paper towels.
48810851-99e2-4ffc-82a0-f386ab92b27d Sprinkle the yuca fries with kosher salt. Serve hot with aji chile pepper sauce or huancaina sauce for dipping and enjoy.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Scrub and wash the potatoes.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted water.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Bring to boil, and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 20 minutes.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Drain potatoes and let cool.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Stir the chimichurri sauce into the mayonnaise.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 When potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut them into 1 inch cubes.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Toss potatoes with chimichurri mixture until well mixed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
cb7e9273-e4c7-4a89-8e90-84d472a068a3 Chill salad until ready to serve.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Make filling: Slice the onion very thinly. Place the sliced onions in a skillet with the olive oil or palm oil, sprinkle with salt and chile powder, and cook on low heat until they are soft and golden brown (about 15 minutes).
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Add the shrimp and sauté until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Make the fritters: Thoroughly drain the black-eyed peas and place them in the food processor. Roughly chop the onion and garlic, and add it to the peas.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Remove the seeds and white parts from the inside of the chile pepper and add to the processor.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Process mixture just until very well-blended, adding a tablespoon or two of water or broth if needed.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Add flour by the tablespoon, until the mixture is stiff enough to hold a shape. Divide into 15 pieces, and shape into balls or ovals with the palms of your hand.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Heat 2 inches palm oil and/or vegetable oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Fry several fritters at a time until browned on all sides. Drain fritters on a plate lined with paper towels. Fritters can be kept warm in a 200-degree oven.
c6e6eccd-4aec-45bc-b0c6-0b48f8d5ffdd Split fritters in half and fill with a spoonful of the onion and shrimp mixture. Serve warm.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Gather the ingredients.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Make the empanada dough and let it chill for several hours or overnight.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Preheat oven to 400 F.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Sauté the onion and garlic in the olive oil on low heat until onions are soft and golden, 5 to 10 minutes.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Turn the heat up to medium and add the spinach. Cook, stirring, until spinach is wilted and soft, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Add the flour to a saucepan. Whisk in the milk gradually until mixture is smooth.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Add the butter and place over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture just comes to a boil and thickens.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Remove from heat and whisk in the eggs. Return to heat and cook, stirring until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. The sauce will be very thick, like a paste.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Remove from heat and stir in the cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Chop the cooled spinach and onion mixture. Stir chopped spinach and onions into the cheese sauce.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Roll out 1/2 of the dough very to 1/4 inch thick. Cut the dough into 4 to 5-inch rounds, using a large cookie cutter, bowl, or coffee can. Knead the scraps into a ball and let the dough rest, covered, while you roll out the other half of dough. You should end up with about 20 to 24 rounds of dough, depending on the size.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of filling in the middle of a dough round. Brush edges of the circle with water. Fold the round in half over the filling, and press down hard along the edges to seal.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Starting at one end of the pressed-down edge, fold the edge towards the middle and press down. Move your fingers over 1/2 inch and fold the edge into the middle again. Continue around the sealed edge of the empanada, folding the edge over itself, to make a twisted rope effect.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Bake the empanadas for 10 minutes, then turn the temperature down to 350 F and bake for 10 to 15 minutes more. The empanadas should be golden brown when done.
d2bbc96a-6789-49b1-886a-87c71dae5266 Enjoy!
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Gather the ingredients.
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the lima beans and the packet of Sazón Goya seasoning and return to a boil. Simmer beans for 8-10 minutes, or until desired tenderness.
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Drain beans well and let cool for 5 minutes. Add beans to a food processor with 2 tablespoons olive oil and the cilantro.
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Process beans and cilantro for 30 seconds or so. Add lemon juice, salt, pepper, cumin and process until smoooth, adding more olive oil if mixture seems too dry. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, lime juice, or pepper to taste.
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Serve with chips or vegetables for dipping, or on sandwiches.
00bda165-72d5-44b4-98d2-181b16725eeb Store dip in the refrigerator, in a lidded container, covered with a thin layer of olive oil. (Dip keeps for 3-4 days).
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Prepare empanada dough according to your chose recipe. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and let it rest at room temperature for one hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Place the sausages in a skillet, and cover them halfway with water. Cook the sausages until the water has evaporated then continue to cook until all sides are browned and the sausages are cooked through.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Use a spatula to crumble the sausages, and brown them in the skillet for a few minutes longer. Remove sausages from the heat, and set aside to cool.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Place the onions, cumin, and chopped peppers in the same skillet, adding a bit of vegetable oil if needed. Sauté the vegetables until softened and fragrant.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Add the potatoes and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth to the skillet with the vegetables, and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add more liquid in small amounts if necessary, and continue to cook just until the potatoes are just tender.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Stir the sausage into the potato mixture, and let the filling cool. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Preheat the oven to 375 F.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Divide the empanada dough into about 12 pieces (for medium-large empanadas), and roll each piece into a circle.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Fill each circle of dough with a couple of tablespoons of filling. Wet the edges of the dough lightly with water and fold the circle of dough in half, sealing the filling inside. Press the edges firmly to seal.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Fold the edges over in a decorative braid.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Brush the empanadas lightly with the egg yolk, and place them on a baking sheet. Bake empanadas for 25-20 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
5c140943-dcdf-4ceb-a971-5c11e8e20789 Serve empanadas warm or at room temperature.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Place milk, butter, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan. Bring just to a boil, then slowly stir in the flour with a wooden spoon until you have a stiff batter.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Continue to stir over heat for 2 to 3 minutes more, until well mixed, then remove from heat and set aside to cool.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Place the chicken breasts in a larger saucepan and cover with water or chicken stock. Cover, bring to a gentle boil and poach chicken until it's just cooked through about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool, reserving cooking liquid.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Shred chicken into very small pieces when cool enough to handle (you can use a food processor with the plastic blade for this).
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Cook the onion, garlic, and bell pepper in a couple of tablespoons of vegetable oil until they are soft and fragrant.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Add the shredded chicken to the vegetables with 1 cup of the reserved chicken broth and the cube of chicken bouillon. Cook, stirring until most of the water is absorbed or evaporated.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Stir 2 tablespoons of flour into the chicken mixture and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the milk and cook until mixture is thickened and creamy. Remove from heat and stir in the cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Knead the milk and flour dough lightly, adding a little more flour if necessary, until smooth. Pinch off a small piece and roll it on a lightly floured surface into a 4-inch circle (about 2 mm thick). Continue with remaining dough, stacking the circles of dough as you go. (Or roll out half the dough into a large rectangle and cut circles with a large round cookie or biscuit cutter, then repeat with the other half of the dough).
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Place about 1 tablespoon of the chicken mixture inside each circle of dough, and fold in half to close. Seal edges firmly.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 In a shallow bowl, whisk the eggs together with a 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon sugar. Place the bread crumbs in another shallow bowl.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Dip each pastry into the egg wash, and then into the bread crumbs. Set aside on a plate.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy skillet with tall sides to 350 F.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Fry the risoles in batches until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.
e8047721-de7d-4ac2-a471-101221fa7ae0 Risoles may be kept warm (or reheated) in a 200 F oven for up to an hour. Risoles may be prepared and breaded, then refrigerated for several hours before frying.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Gather the ingredients.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 In a medium bowl, whisk the garbanzo bean flour with the salt, 3 tablespoons of the olive oil, the Parmesan cheese (if using) and a generous amount of ground black pepper.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Whisk in 1 3/4 cups of water until the mixture is well blended. Set the batter aside for about 30 minutes at room temperature to let the garbanzo flour absorb some of the water.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Preheat the oven to 450 F. When it is hot, place the remaining 1/4 cup olive oil in a 12-inch pizza pan. Heat the pan in the oven until very hot.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Gradually stir remaining water into the batter mixture until it is thin enough to pour. Remove the hot pizza pan from oven, and immediately pour the batter into the pan. The batter should make a thin layer, about 1/4 inch. Place the pan back in the oven and bake until fainá is golden and crispy about 8 to 10 minutes.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Remove the pan from the oven.
9b75315d-1194-4d99-b8a7-7c37c51634f0 Cut the flatbread into pieces and serve hot.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Gather the ingredients.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Place the flour in a large bowl. Whisk in 1 teaspoon salt.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Add the yogurt and the melted butter to the flour and stir with a wooden spoon.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Add the water 1 tablespoon at a time, and mix until the dough starts to come together.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Knead dough gently with your hands, adding more water if the dough is too dry. Taste for salt and add another 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon if desired. Knead mixture very gently and briefly until you obtain a relatively smooth dough, but do not overwork the dough. It's fine if the dough appears a bit shaggy and unevenly mixed (something like pie crust), but it should have enough moisture to come together in a cohesive ball. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more water. If it is too sticky, add a bit more flour, and knead lightly.
fd03212c-827d-45ad-b9cb-f76267cb1c41 Cover the dough with plastic wrap and set aside to rest and chill in the refrigerator for at least one hour. Dough may be prepared the day before and chilled overnight.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Gather the ingredients.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Use a sharp knife to cut the pointy tips off of each end of the plantains.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Score cuts through the skin down the length of the plantain in several places.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Peel the skin off the plantains, then slice each one in half lengthwise.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Slice each piece in half lengthwise again, resulting in four long slices from each plantain.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Heat the oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat and fry the plantain slices until dark golden brown on each side.
38d683b9-7de3-4c7b-a869-078320681712 Drain the slices on a paper towel and sprinkle with salt. Serve warm and enjoy!
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Gather the ingredients.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Remove the casings from the chorizo sausages.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Place 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a heavy skillet and heat on medium. Add the sausage and cook, crumbling it and breaking it into pieces with a spatula, until it is well browned.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Remove sausage from skillet and set aside.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Peel and dice the onion.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Add another tablespoon of oil to the same skillet. Cook the onion in the skillet over medium heat, stirring, until soft and fragrant.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Add the cumin and cook for one minute more.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Add the salsa, lower the heat, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Remove skillet from heat and stir in the cream cheese until melted and well mixed.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Place the onion mixture in a small ovenproof casserole dish. Place the grated cheese on top of the onions, then sprinkle the cooked chorizo on top of the cheese.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Place casserole under the broiler until cheese is melted.
46772dbb-e983-4a85-83f5-27b73d3f4f8a Serve queso fundido warm, with tortillas, corn chips, or bread for dipping. Enjoy!
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Gather the ingredients.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Peel the potatoes and slice very thinly (about 1/4-inch thick) or cut them into 1/2-inch cubes.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Place the cut potatoes into a bowl and cover them with salted water.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Slice the onion thinly.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d In a heavy, oven-proof, 12-inch skillet that is at least 2 inches deep, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until the onions are soft, fragrant, and turning golden.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Drain the potatoes and pat them dry.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d In a bowl, toss the potatoes with the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and season with salt and pepper.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Add the potatoes to the onions in the skillet.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Cover and cook the potatoes over low heat until tender, stirring occasionally to keep them from sticking to the pan and burning.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and cream, seasoning with salt and pepper.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Pour the milk and egg mixture over the potatoes and onions.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Sprinkle chopped parsley or cilantro over the eggs and potatoes.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Cook the mixture over low heat until the eggs seem mostly set, being careful not to burn them, about 5 to 8 minutes.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d If you are using a nonstick pan, you can carefully flip the frittata: Turn a plate upside down over the skillet.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Turn the skillet over so that the frittata falls onto the now right-side-up plate.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Slide the frittata from the plate back into the pan so the browned side is facing up and cook over low heat for a few more minutes.
4ebb3668-f36e-407d-8702-5437f64ddb5d Cut the tortilla into wedges to serve. Enjoy.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg, flour, buttermilk, sugar and a generous pinch of salt. Add some water gradually, enough to make a thick, smooth batter. The batter should not be too runny or it will not adhere to the plantain slices. Set the batter aside to rest for 15 minutes.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 Slice the ends off of the plantains. With a sharp knife make a slit in the skin of the plantain from one end to the other. Pull the skin off.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 Slice the plantain diagonally into slices about 3 inches long, and about 1/3 inch thick.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 Place the plantain slices into the batter and stir to coat them.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 In a heavy pot, deep skillet, or deep fat fryer, place the oil to a depth of about 2 inches. Heat over medium-high heat to about 350 F, or until a drop of batter sizzles well and browns lightly.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 Carefully cook the plantain in the oil (in batches if necessary) until golden brown on both sides (turning once), about 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
805b31f2-c892-40fa-8ee0-b02602611944 Serve warm with peanut sauce for dipping.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Gather the ingredients.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Heat the oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Add cancha corn kernels and heat, shaking the pan from time to time, until kernels start to pop.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Cover the pan loosely with a large lid so that the corn kernels don't fly out of the pan as they pop, and continue to cook, stirring frequently​ until the kernels have stopped popping and are deep golden brown, about 10 minutes.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Remove from heat and toss the toasted corn with salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.
fbb41ed8-5c29-448d-b10a-1c7de1a36ebb Store cancha in an air-tight container.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Melt the butter with the shortening and let cool.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 In a large bowl, stir together the flour and salt. Stir in the cooled butter and shortening with a fork.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Stir in the egg yolks, and mix well. Add the buttermilk gradually until the mixture starts to come together. Knead briefly until dough is smooth.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Wrap dough in saran wrap and let rest on the counter for 30 minutes to an hour.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Melt butter and oil in a skillet on medium heat. Sauté optional bacon pieces until crispy, then remove to paper towels. Add the onions and sugar to the skillet and sauté until golden and translucent. Add the hearts of palm and sauté a few minutes more.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Stir in the flour, then add the milk and lower heat slightly. Cook, stirring until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the olives. Stir in the farmer's cheese and bacon bits, if using. Set aside to cool.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Divide dough into 12 pieces. Roll out 10 of the pieces into circles large enough to line the bottom and sides of a standard muffin tin. It may help to roll the dough, then let it rest for a few minutes, then roll it out the rest of the way. The rest lets the elasticity in the dough relax and helps it to maintain its shape.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Line 10 muffin tins with dough circles, pressing them into the bottom and sides of the pan. Divide the filling between the 10 lined muffin tins.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Roll out the remaining two portions of dough and cut circles to match the diameter of the muffin tins. Place the circles on top of the filling, and pinch around the edges to seal them with the dough lining the tin. Seal them well so that the filling doesn't leak out during baking.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Bake pastries for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
04e63691-7786-45eb-b484-ea39ca284768 Serve hot and enjoy.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Gather the ingredients.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Prepare hogao by heating olive oil in a large stockpot. Add garlic, tomato, onions, cumin, goya seasoning, and cilantro and sauté over medium heat, stirring, until onion is very soft (about 12 to 15 minutes). Season with salt and pepper to taste.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Remove hogao from pot and set aside in a separate bowl. Add the beef bouillon cubes to the pot.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Slice the beef into strips and add to the pot. Cover the meat with water, and bring to a boil.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Simmer beef until very tender when pierced with a fork, about an hour.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Peel and quarter potatoes and add to the beef, adding more water if necessary to cover the potatoes. Simmer until potatoes are very tender. Remove pot from heat and let the meat and potatoes cool in the broth.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Remove meat and potatoes into a separate bowl and set aside. Strain the broth into a large measuring cup and reserve.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Place the masarepa into a large bowl. Stir 1 cup of the reserved broth into the masarepa, along with 2 1/4 cups of hot water and the 2 teaspoons sugar.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Season mixture with salt and pepper and set aside for 10 minutes.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Finely chop the meat and potatoes. Stir the reserved hogao into the meat and potatoes and mix thoroughly, adding a little of the beef broth and slightly mashing the potatoes.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Roll the masarepa dough into about 40 golfball-size balls.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Working with one ball of dough at a time, flatten each ball into a 4-inch circle between 2 sheets of plastic wrap.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Place a teaspoon or so of filling in the middle of the dough circle.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Fold the circle in half to make a half moon shape that encloses the filling. Seal the edges with your fingers. Repeat with all of the balls of dough.
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Preheat vegetable oil to 350 F. Fry empanadas in batches until they are golden brown (about 5 minutes).
2bcf545b-aa27-41f9-b619-e7d4455c6b9e Drain on paper towels. Serve empanadas warm with aji sauce.
7bd740eb-1442-4f91-b649-d3cbf45a0401 Prepare the dipping sauce: Place the guava paste in a small saucepan. Add the remaining ingredients (vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, and juice) and whisk together over low heat until the guava paste has completely melted. Remove from heat and set aside.
7bd740eb-1442-4f91-b649-d3cbf45a0401 Prepare the cheese fritters: coarsely chop the green onions and place them in the bowl of a food processor. Pulse a couple of times for a few seconds each time, until the onions are more finely chopped. Add the goat cheese, the softened cream cheese, and the ricotta cheese to the food processor bowl. Add 2 eggs and the flour and process the mixture until it is well mixed. Add salt and pepper to taste, and pulse to mix. If desired, add one or more optional ingredients to the cheese mixture at this point, such as crumbled cooked bacon, crumbled blue cheese, grated manchego cheese, finely chopped sun-dried tomatoes, finely chopped olives, etc.
7bd740eb-1442-4f91-b649-d3cbf45a0401 Chill the cheese mixture for at least an hour.
7bd740eb-1442-4f91-b649-d3cbf45a0401 Once the cheese mixture is cold, shape the mixture into 1-inch diameter balls. Roll each ball in the breadcrumbs and thoroughly coat the cheese with the crumbs. Place the cheese balls on a baking sheet and keep them chilled until you are ready to fry them.
7bd740eb-1442-4f91-b649-d3cbf45a0401 Heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a deep skillet or saucepan to 350 F. Fry the cheese balls, in batches, until they are very golden brown. Carefully remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels. Serve cheese fritters warm, with the dipping sauce. If you are not going to serve the fried fritters right away, keep them warm in a 200 F oven until ready to serve.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Place the milk and the corn kernels in a blender and pulse briefly until the corn is coarsely ground.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Pour the corn/milk mixture into a saucepan and add the butter. Heat over medium heat until milk just comes to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool for 2 minutes.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Add the masarepa to a large heat-resistant bowl. Whisk in the crumbled cheese. Slowly pour the hot milk mixture into the masarepa, stirring with a wooden spoon.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Continue to stir mixture until it's cool enough to handle, then knead gently with your hands until you have a smooth homogeneous dough.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Season with salt to taste, and knead.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Shape the arepas by taking about 1/4 cup of the dough and forming it into a ball. Flatten it between your palms into a pancake shape, smoothing cracked edges with your fingers. Flatten pancake until it's about 1/3 inch thick and about 4 inches in diameter. Repeat with remaining dough.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Melt a tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Cook the arepas in batches until golden brown and crispy on both sides–about 4 minutes per side.
833e90db-50e9-405a-94f9-098f5f713c3e Top the arepas with a thin slice of farmers cheese while still hot or place a slice of cheese between two arepas. Serve warm.
856c179d-2b62-4831-95e5-3690c0cc9b57 Cut off both ends of the plantains, and remove peel/skin. You may need to slice the peel open lengthwise with a knife. Work carefully because plantains can stain skin and clothes.
856c179d-2b62-4831-95e5-3690c0cc9b57 Slice plantains crosswise into very thin slices. about 1 to 2 millimeters. It's fun to use a mandoline for this, but a sharp knife works great too.
856c179d-2b62-4831-95e5-3690c0cc9b57 Heat 1 to 2 inches of oil in a saucepan on medium-high heat.
856c179d-2b62-4831-95e5-3690c0cc9b57 When the oil is hot (about 360 F), fry several slices of plantain at a time until golden, 2 to 3 minutes.
856c179d-2b62-4831-95e5-3690c0cc9b57 Remove and drain on paper towels. Season with salt to taste.
eaf48813-3b06-452f-8628-f2ccb140112a Arrange meats and cheeses decoratively on a tray.
eaf48813-3b06-452f-8628-f2ccb140112a Serve bread and nuts in small bowls on the side, and provide toothpicks or forks and small plates to guests.
eaf48813-3b06-452f-8628-f2ccb140112a Enjoy it with your preferred pairing of wine or beer.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Gather the ingredients.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Peel and core the quince, and cut into large wedges.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Place the fruit in a pot and cover with water.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Add the lemon juice.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Bring the water to a boil and cook the fruit until it's very soft.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Drain and let cool for 5 minutes.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Process the fruit in a food processor or blender until it is smooth, about the consistency of applesauce.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Measure the fruit – you should have about 2 cups – and place it in a heavy-bottomed pot.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Add sugar equal to three-fourths of the amount of fruit and stir the sugar into the fruit. (If you have 2 cups of fruit, add 1 1/2 cups of sugar.) Add a pinch of salt.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Bring the sugar and fruit to a low boil and simmer, stirring frequently, on low heat.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Cook slowly, keeping the mixture barely at a boil and stirring often to prevent burning, until the mixture thickens.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Continue to cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is a thick paste that stays together in a ball. The mixture should seem stretchy and almost dry. The fruit will change color and become a bright orange-red.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Pour into a lightly oiled dish and let cool.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Slice when firm.
0eb8c2b7-be8b-405c-8b84-e18358d613dc Fruit paste will keep for several weeks, covered, in the refrigerator.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Prepare empanada dough according to the recipe. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 10 minutes.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Grate the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses and place them in a medium bowl. Add half of the Parmesan cheese and 1/2 cup of the marinara sauce and mix well.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Divide the empanada dough into about 20 small pieces (approximately 50 g each) and gently roll each piece into a ball.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec On a lightly floured surface, take one ball of dough and roll it out into about a 4-5 inch diameter circle. Place one tablespoon of the cheese filling and one pepperoni (or another filling of choice) on the middle of the dough circle. Gently fold the circle in half to form a half-moon shape, sealing the edges firmly together with your fingers. Fold the edge over itself decoratively (see how to fill and shape empanadas).
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Place the empanada on a cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining balls of dough.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Mix egg yolk with 1 tablespoons water. Lightly brush egg mixture over tops and sides of the empanadas. Sprinkle empanadas with remaining grated Parmesan cheese.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Place empanadas in the oven and bake until puffed, shiny, and golden brown - about 20-25 minutes.
999805af-1747-462f-9eee-42c4b66082ec Serve warm with marinara sauce for dipping.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Prepare the empanada dough and let it rest for 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Mix the pork bbq, aji sauce and grated cheese together in a bowl.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Divide the empanada dough into 18 pieces, and roll each one into a ball. Roll each ball of dough out into a 6 to 7 inch diameter circle, and let dough circles rest on the counter for 5 minutes.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of filling in the middle of a circle of dough, and fold dough over to make a half circle. Press the edges of the dough together firmly around the filling.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Brush the pressed edge of the semicircle with a little bit of water, and fold the edge over itself, pinching and crimping as you go to make a braid-like effect. (See How to Fill and Shape Empanadas).
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Place the empanadas on a baking sheet, 1 to 2 inches apart.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Mix the egg yolk with 1 tablespoon water and brush the mixture over the entire surface of each empanada.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Bake the empanadas until they are golden golden brown and puffed, about 25 minutes.
dc62e5c6-39fe-4121-9091-f33893d20830 Serve warm or at room temperature. Store empanadas in the refrigerator. Empanadas can be wrapped in foil and reheated in the oven at 325 F for 10 minutes.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Stir the cilantro, lime juice, and garlic into the mayonnaise.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Heat the arepas for a few minutes in a 350-degree oven, or warm them briefly in a skillet.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Heat the pulled pork in the microwave or on the stove.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Split the arepas in half, in the same way you would split an English muffin, but do not slice all the way through—leave the two halves attached at one end.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Spread the inside of arepas with 2 teaspoons of the garlic mayonnaise.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Fill each arepa with 2-3 tablespoons of the beef mixture.
0c70e5e8-47e9-4039-9dc7-14907e31ade4 Serve arepas warm. Filled arepas can be wrapped in foil and chilled until ready to serve, then reheated in the oven (still wrapped in foil).
29b5ccae-2e8a-4439-9db5-529ab9231c5f Place the ribs on a plate or platter, and sprinkle both sides generously with the kosher salt. Let ribs sit at room temperature while the grill heats to medium-high (using charcoal with some wood chips for best flavor).
29b5ccae-2e8a-4439-9db5-529ab9231c5f Grill ribs for 4 to 6 minutes on each side, to the desired doneness. Cut into a rib to test for doneness (use the handy ​gaucho knife tucked into your belt for true authenticity!).
29b5ccae-2e8a-4439-9db5-529ab9231c5f Serve right off the grill with chimichurri sauce on the side.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Gather the ingredients.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Add the tapioca starch to a medium bowl. Add the water gradually, 2 tablespoons at a time, stirring with your fingers as you go. The mixture will form clumps that you can break into smaller clumps with your fingers.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Keep stirring and adding water gradually until the entire mixture is in the form of medium to small clumps. You will know if you add too much water because the mixture will start to flow like a thick liquid. If that happens, add a little more starch until you find a good balance.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Pass the moistened starch through a very fine sieve into a clean bowl. Use a wooden spoon to stir the starch in the sieve to help it pass through.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Working quickly, evenly sprinkle the sifted starch over the entire skillet in a thin layer. Let the crepe cook for about 30 seconds, or until the crepe slides easily in the pan.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Flip the crepe over with a spatula or by tossing it in the air and catching it with the skillet. Cook for 30 to 40 seconds and remove to a plate. Wipe the skillet clean after each crepe and repeat.
061f1cdd-cf13-4791-a33d-3cc961945e3a Fill the crepe with your desired fillings and fold in half or roll it up. The crepes should be served warm because they will stiffen as they cool.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Place the warm water (100 to 105 F) in a small bowl. Stir 1 teaspoon sugar into the water and sprinkle the yeast over the water. Set aside for 5 to 10 minutes, until mixture is bubbly.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Place the flour, olive oil, and salt in the bowl of a standing mixer and mix briefly using the dough hook. Add the yeast/water mixture and begin to knead. The mixture should come together as a soft, stretchy dough, pulling away from the sides of the bowl. Add a bit more flour if the mixture is too wet, and add a bit more water if the mixture seems dry, crumbly, or overly firm. Knead for 5 to 10 minutes, until dough is smooth, soft and elastic.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Oil a bowl with olive oil and place the dough in the bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let the dough rise until doubled in size.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 While the dough is rising, peel and slice the onion into very thin strips. Place them in a bowl of cold salt water and soak for 30 minutes. Drain onions well and dry them with paper towels.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Once it has risen, punch down the dough and shape into a smooth ball. Pour 3 tablespoons of olive oil into a 14-inch pizza pan with 1-inch sides. Place the ball of dough in the middle of the pan and flatten gently with your fingers. Let the dough relax for 10 minutes.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Continue to flatten the dough into the pan, flattening it and pushing it toward the sides of the pan, letting it relax in between until dough covers the bottom of the pan.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Preheat oven to 450 F. Sprinkle the onions over the top of the dough. Drizzle a tablespoon of olive oil over the onions, and sprinkle with the dried oregano.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Place the fugazza in the oven. Bake for 15 minutes, or until edges start to turn golden brown. If desired, remove fugazza from oven and top with thin slices of mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with grated Parmesan. Return to oven and bake until fugazza is golden brown and crispy around the edges. Brown onions under the broiler for the last 3 minutes of cooking if desired.
9f75e171-b422-4413-96b0-8ed0c7c2bc62 Remove from the oven and cut into slices to serve.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Gather the ingredients.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Place the warm water in the bowl of a stand mixer. Sprinkle the yeast over the water and let stand for 5 minutes.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Add 1 cup of the flour, the butter, and egg, and mix well using the dough hook attachment.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Add the softened butter and another cup of flour and mix well.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Add the remaining ingredients and knead until smooth, adding a bit of extra flour if the dough is too sticky. When well kneaded, the dough should be soft, shiny, and smooth.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Place the dough in an oiled bowl. Cover with plastic wrap, set in a warm location, and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 30 minutes.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Divide the dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll half of the dough into a large rectangle about 10 x 12 inches.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Brush the dough with 1 tablespoon of the melted butter. Place half of the ham slices over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border all around.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Sprinkle half of the raisins and half of the olives around over the ham.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Tightly roll up the dough lengthwise starting with the long edge, sealing the last part of the dough to the roll with some water.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Place roll, seam side down, on a parchment-lined baking sheet, and tuck the ends under slightly. Repeat with the other half of dough.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Mix the egg yolk with a teaspoon of sugar and brush the mixture onto the rolls with a pastry brush.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Lightly cover the rolls with oiled plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about an hour.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Bake bread at 350 F for 30 to 40 minutes, until golden brown.
d9ac20cc-6f65-4bf0-a521-e3bf3e678fb5 Remove from oven, and let it cool slightly before slicing.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with cold water.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Add a couple of teaspoons of salt.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Bring the water to a boil, then cover and simmer potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Remove from the heat and drain in a colander.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Once the potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel the potatoes and place them in a large bowl.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Add the cream and butter to the potatoes and mash well.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place them through a potato ricer to remove lumps or mix them with a hand mixer or a standing mixer with the paddle attachment until smooth.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Season with salt and pepper to taste.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Stir in the Parmesan cheese, egg yolks, and the grated cheese.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place the potato mixture in the refrigerator and thoroughly chill.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place about 1/4 cup of the potato mixture in the palm of your hand. Flatten it slightly and place several pieces of the diced cooked ham inside. Fold the potatoes over the ham to enclose it completely, then shape the potatoes into an oblong croquette. Repeat with remaining potato mixture.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place 2 eggs in a shallow bowl, add 1 to 2 tablespoons water or milk and whisk with a fork.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Place the breadcrumbs, flour, and parsley in another shallow bowl and season mixture with salt and pepper.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Dip the croquettes into the egg mixture, letting any excess drip off, then dredge croquettes in the flour/breadcrumb mixture. Repeat with remaining croquettes.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Heat 2 to 3 inches of oil in a heavy saute pan with tall sides or use a deep fryer to about 350 F.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Carefully fry the croquettes in batches until they are dark golden brown on all sides.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec Remove croquettes from the oil with a slotted spoon and place on paper towels to drain.
e2a00ead-7643-4503-93ab-a8ae3086e5ec To keep the croquettes warm until ready to serve or to reheat them, place them on a baking sheet in a 300 F oven.
f8f98e46-87c0-4c08-8214-94ecd6d7658b Place the whole wheat flour, cake flour (or all-purpose flour), sugar, and salt in a medium bowl and whisk well.
f8f98e46-87c0-4c08-8214-94ecd6d7658b Cut the butter into small pieces and add to flour. Use your fingers or a pastry cutter to cut the cold butter into the flour, until the butter pieces are the size of small peas.
f8f98e46-87c0-4c08-8214-94ecd6d7658b Use a fork to quickly whisk in the sour cream and 1/4 cup buttermilk until you have a ragged dough. Add a bit more buttermilk if the dough is not coming together. Turn dough out on a counter and knead a few times, folding it over itself, until it's just mixed. (add more flour if it is too sticky).
f8f98e46-87c0-4c08-8214-94ecd6d7658b Wrap dough in plastic wrap and press it into a flat disk. Place in the refrigerator to chill for at least an hour before rolling it out. Dough can be kept chilled for up to 2 days, or frozen for 1-2 months. Makes enough dough for 8 medium-large empanadas.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Place the cheese slices in a shallow dish and drizzle the olive oil over them. Turn the slices so that each side is coated with oil.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Sprinkle the cheese with the salt and oregano, and red pepper flakes if desired.
