df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Place the cheese in the freezer while you prepare the grill.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Fire up the grill and when the coals are coated with ash or the gas grill has reached a high temperature, brush the grate with a generous amount of olive oil to help prevent sticking.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Place the cheese slices directly on the hot grill and cook for about 2 minutes on each side, or until the cheese is hot and slightly browned but still holding its shape.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Remove the cheese to a plate.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Brush the bread slices with any remaining olive oil left from the cheese marinade.
df254933-d9be-4d1e-87fa-ccc0fed29e1f Grill the bread slices until they are slightly toasted.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Gather the ingredients.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Place the flour in a medium bowl along with the sugar and the salt and whisk together.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Cut the butter into 1/2 inch pieces and place them in the bowl with the flour.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Add the egg.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Use your fingers to mix the egg and butter into the flour until the mixture is sandy and crumbly, and the butter is in very small pieces.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Stir 1/4 cup of water into the flour/butter mixture using a fork. Add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until the mixture starts to come together as a dough. Knead the dough in the bowl several times, adding more water if it is overly crumbly. The dough should be soft and kneadable but will appear somewhat shaggy and not perfectly blended. Cover with saran wrap and let rest for 20 to 30 minutes.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Cut the cheese into 3 to 4 inch long sticks, about 1/2 inch square. Depending on the size of the cheese block you start with, you should have about 24 sticks.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 On a lightly floured surface, roll out half of the dough into a 12 by 14-inch rectangle. Using a pizza cutter, cut the dough into 1 inch wide strips lengthwise, so that you end up with 12 strips, each about 14 inches long and an inch wide.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Use a strip of dough to wrap one of the cheese sticks: Start at one end of the cheese stick and cover the end with dough. Continue to wrap dough around the stick in a spiral fashion, overlapping the edges, until you reach the other end. Cover the other end of the cheese stick and seal, cutting off any excess dough. (You can dampen the dough with a bit of water to help seal it). The cheese should be completely covered with dough.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Repeat with remaining cheese sticks and remaining half of the dough until you have about 24 dough covered cheese sticks.
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Cover the bottom of a heavy, high-sided skillet with vegetable oil and heat over medium heat. When the oil is hot, cook the cheese sticks in batches, turning them with a spatula until all sides are golden brown. Remove sticks to a plate lined with paper towels and let cool. (You can also fry tequeños in a deep fat fryer if preferred).
543101aa-3824-4e7a-9430-480d58a7ec98 Serve warm with guasacaca or preferred dipping sauce. Enjoy!
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Gather the ingredients.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Place the eggs in a shallow bowl or pan, and whisk them together with the oregano and some salt and pepper.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Stir the parmesan cheese and garlic into the bread crumbs and place them in another shallow pan.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Dip the steaks first in the egg mixture, then in the bread crumbs, coating them well with the crumbs.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet, and cook steaks for several minutes on each side, until golden brown and crispy. Drain steaks on paper towels.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Place steaks on a baking sheet. Turn on oven broiler.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Top each steak with a slice of ham, 2 to 3 tablespoons tomato sauce, and 1/4 cup grated mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle Italian seasoning over the cheese and place steaks under ​the broiler until cheese melts.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Serve warm, with fries.
57448255-6464-415e-a481-0fc28acd5f69 Enjoy!
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Gather the ingredients.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Preheat oven to 350 F.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Place the raisins in a small bowl and cover with boiling water. Let them plump in the water for 10 minutes.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Sauté the chopped onions, garlic, and peppers in the olive oil until soft and fragrant.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Add the cumin and paprika and cook 2 minutes more, stirring. Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Drain the raisins and add them to the ground beef. Add the beef broth and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until most of the liquid is gone.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Stir in the hard-boiled egg and the black olives. Season mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Remove beef mixture from heat and let cool for 5 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup crumbled queso fresco.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 While the beef is cooking, bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Slice the tops off of the peppers and reserve. Clean the inside of the peppers, removing the seeds and veins.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Cook the peppers in the boiling water until bright red and just tender, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain peppers and blot dry with paper towels.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Fill each pepper with some of the seasoned ground beef mixtures. Top with remaining queso fresco.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Place the peppers on a baking sheet, with the tops alongside them (but not covering the filling). Bake the peppers for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the filling is heated through.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Serve warm.
12e71a21-acf1-401d-89a6-c80bfa2ad214 Enjoy!
dec4d915-4b35-4789-873c-0c85d1ee8131 Cut the pork into several large pieces and place the meat in the slow cooker with 1 cup salsa, the cumin, salt, and pepper to taste.
dec4d915-4b35-4789-873c-0c85d1ee8131 Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours (or 4 hours on high) or until pork is fork tender.
dec4d915-4b35-4789-873c-0c85d1ee8131 Remove pork from slow cooker, reserving liquid, and shred finely with a fork or using a food processor (fitted with the plastic blade).
dec4d915-4b35-4789-873c-0c85d1ee8131 Place shredded pork and reserved liquid in a large skillet and saute until liquid evaporates and pork starts to brown slightly. Stir in remaining salsa until desired consistency.
dec4d915-4b35-4789-873c-0c85d1ee8131 For making pupusas, add pork and salsa back to a ​food processor, fitted with metal blade, and process with short pulses until finely ground.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Gather the ingredients.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Set the banana leaves out to thaw. If using corn husks instead, soak in very hot water for an hour to soften.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Make the masa: In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, beat the lard or vegetable shortening, cream cheese, and chili con queso until light and fluffy.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 In a separate bowl, mix the masa harina with 2 cups of chicken stock. Add half of the masa harina mixture to the lard mixture and beat well.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Add the remaining masa along with additional chicken stock as needed, beating well, until mixture resembles a thick cake batter. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 For the filling, stir together the grated cheddar and pepper Jack cheeses with the salsa.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Rinse and dry the banana leaves and cut them into rectangles about 8 inches by 10 inches in size (for medium tamales). Pat the corn husks dry, if using.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Lay a banana leaf rectangle or corn husk on a flat surface. Place about 1/4 cup of the masa in the middle and spread into a rectangle about 2 inches by 4 inches. Spread 1 to 2 tablespoons of the filling in the center of the rectangle.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Fold the sides of the banana leaf (or corn husk) in over the filling, closing the masa over the cheese filling.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Fold up the bottom half over the filling, then fold the top half down and roll the tamale until well wrapped.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Tie the tamale with a piece of kitchen string or a strip of banana leaf to secure it. Repeat with the remaining ingredients to produce more tamales.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Bring 1 to 2 inches of water to boil in a steamer pot or in a large pot with a colander or steamer basket set inside. Fill the steamer with one layer of tamales (you may have to steam in batches). The tamales should be above the water; they are cooked by the steam only. Cover the tamales with a dish towel and the pot lid and steam for 30 to 40 minutes. Add water to the pot when necessary.
786c5a73-a5eb-41eb-9602-76df053d1968 Remove the tamales and serve warm. Enjoy!
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Prepare the empanada dough and let the dough rest in the refrigerator for at least one hour (overnight is best).
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Cook the bacon until crispy and drain on paper towels. Crumble the bacon roughly.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Whisk the eggs with the milk and season with salt and pepper.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Melt the butter over medium heat in a nonstick skillet. Add the chopped scallions and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until soft.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Pour in the eggs and cook, stirring, until well scrambled and just cooked. Stir in the cream cheese just before removing eggs from heat. The cheese does not have to be mixed in well.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Preheat oven to 375 F.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Roll out the empanada dough and cut into 8 6-inch circles of dough. Let circles rest for 5 minutes.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Place spoonfuls of the egg mixture in the middle of each dough circle, dividing the mixture evenly between the empanadas. Sprinkle some crumbled bacon and grated pepper jack cheese on top of the egg mixture, dividing the cheese and bacon evenly between the 8 empanadas.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Fold and seal the empanadas (see how to make empanadas for step-by-step instructions on shaping empanadas).
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Place empanadas on a baking sheet. Whisk an egg with a tablespoon of water, and brush empanadas carefully with the egg wash.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Bake empanadas for 25 to 30 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
e37d4431-6d67-4194-905b-1c0b34646ce0 Remove from oven and let cool. Empanadas can be wrapped well and frozen. Thaw empanadas and reheat in the oven or microwave.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Toss the cubes of beef with the flour and season with salt and pepper.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Melt the 2 tablespoons of butter in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the cubes of beef until browned.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Add the beef stock to the skillet and bring to a simmer over low heat.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Chop the beef jerky into small pieces and add to the beef stock and beef cubes. Simmer gently for about 5 minutes.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Transfer beef and beef stock to a large stockpot or slow cooker.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Do not clean skillet. Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil, the chopped onion and garlic, and the aji chile pepper paste to the skillet. Sauté until the onion and garlic are soft and fragrant.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Add the chopped squash, carrots, and potatoes and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Add sautéed vegetables to the stockpot or crockpot with the beef. Simmer over low heat until beef and beef jerky are tender, about an hour and a half on the stove or about 6 hours in the crockpot. If simmering the stew on the stove, you may need to add more liquid (beef stock or water) from time to time, but stew should finish up very thick, without much broth.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Add the lima beans and corn and simmer for 10-15 minutes more.
4b336cd6-7b42-4179-8052-e3e6db772c43 Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve over rice.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Gather the ingredients.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Place the sausages in a skillet and add enough water to cover the bottom of the skillet to 1/2 inch. Cook over medium heat until the water has evaporated, turning sausages once.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Remove the sausages from the skillet and slice (almost) in half lengthwise, leaving the two pieces attached.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and place sausages in the skillet, split open and flattened. Cook over medium heat until well browned on both sides.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Split each bread roll, spread with mayonnaise, mustard, and other desired condiments and serve warm.
292474c7-af22-4309-82cd-5506f19c8040 Enjoy!
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Lay flank steak flat on a cutting board and carefully slice it in half horizontally almost all the way, cutting in the same direction as the fibers. Open the steak up like a book, and lay flat.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Squeeze lime juice over the steak and sprinkle with black pepper, kosher salt, oregano, and minced garlic. Use a meat tenderizing hammer to pound meat until it's flattened and evenly thick and in the approximate shape of a rectangle. The grain of the meat should run parallel to the long side of the rectangle.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Lay the spinach leaves over the meat, leaving 1 to 2 inches of one long side uncovered. Sprinkle the cheese over the spinach.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Peel the carrots and slice them into quarters lengthwise. Lay the carrots over the spinach, in the direction of the meat fibers. Cut the peppers into strips and spread them over the spinach. Cut the eggs into wedges and distribute pieces over the spinach. Add the olives, if using.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Carefully roll up the flank steak with the vegetables inside, rolling from one long side to the other, and tie the roll up securely with kitchen twine. Season the outside with salt and pepper.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab To cook on the grill:
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Wrap the stuffed flank steak tightly with foil, and place it directly on the coals. Cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until meat is cooked to desired doneness. Unwrap and let cool, then slice crosswise into thin slices to serve.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab To cook stovetop:
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Brown the flank steak roll in a large stockpot over medium-high heat in a little bit of olive oil, until well browned on all sides.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Add 2 cups red wine and enough water (or beef broth) to cover the meat. Simmer gently until meat is tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool, then slice crosswise into thin slices to serve.
1c038e93-2db5-4e41-8f6b-3d8ef98f12ab Matambre slices easiest after it has cooled some, and can be served at room temperature with a salad as an appetizer or starter course. Serve with chimichurri sauce, or with a sauce made from the wine cooking liquid, if desired.​
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Gather the ingredients.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Peel and cut potatoes into 1/2-inch thick French fries and place in ice water. Set aside.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Cut beef into thin 1/2-inch strips.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Peel and mash the garlic cloves.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 In a skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Sauté the garlic in the cumin for 1 minute.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Add beef to the skillet and cook, turning often, until browned on all sides.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Remove the beef from the heat and season it with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Set aside.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Using the same pan, add the onions and the minced hot pepper and cook 5 to 6 minutes or until the onions are soft and fragrant. Add a little more vegetable oil if needed.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Add the vinegar, soy sauce, red peppers, and tomatoes, and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 In a separate pan, bring several inches of vegetable oil to 350 F over medium heat. Remove fries from the water and pat dry. Fry the potatoes in the oil until golden.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Drain the fries on paper towels and season them with salt and pepper to taste.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Add the beef to the pan with the onions and peppers and keep warm until ready to serve.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Just before serving, add the French fries to the stir-fry.
a7ff5d3f-d65c-4920-b9a6-60d4119841e7 Serve with rice and enjoy!
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Cut the meat into approximately 2-inch cubes.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Mix the vinegar with the garlic, cumin, 1/4 cup vegetable oil, and some salt and black pepper, and pour over the meat. Let meat marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes to an hour.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Purée the cilantro (stems removed) with some water in a blender or food processor until you get a smooth paste.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Heat 3-4 tablespoons oil in a large pot or skillet on high heat. Working in 2 batches, brown the meat on all sides. Remove meat to a plate.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Lower the heat and add the onion and aji pepper to the same skillet with the leftover marinade. Cook until soft and fragrant, about 5 minutes.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Add the meat back to the skillet, along with the beer, the cilantro, and 1 cup of the chicken stock. Cover and cook over low heat until the meat is tender, about an hour.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Peel and quarter the potatoes, and add them to the stew. Continue to cook over low heat until potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes more, adding more chicken broth if necessary.
732f5f29-0fab-40e7-9edd-4391d7c43569 Serve warm over rice.
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a Gather the ingredients.
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a Cut the fish into small pieces. You can dice it or leave it in pieces up to 1-inch square, but remember that the larger the pieces, the longer it will take to marinate.
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a Salt the fish, then cover with the lime juice, lemon juice, and orange juice in a non-reactive (glass or plastic) container with a lid. Add the sliced onions and the chiles.
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a Chill the fish mixture in the fridge for at least 2 hours, possibly as much as 3 hours (very large pieces of fish can take longer to fully marinate). If your fish is truly raw-eating quality, it is OK if the centers of the pieces are still raw-looking.​
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a To serve, on a plate or in a bowl, lay down some of the onions and chiles and top with the fish. Garnish with the cilantro.
3e52832e-2cf0-4aa1-9eee-005d24a9309a Enjoy!
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Place the chicken breasts in a large saucepan with the bouillon; one onion cut into wedges and the juice of one lime. (Add other vegetables for flavor if desired - leftover roasted vegetables are especially good).
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Cover chicken with water and bring to a low simmer. Cover and simmer for 12-15 minutes, then turn off heat and leave covered for 5 minutes more. Check chicken for doneness - if the meat is still pink in the center, simmer for a few minutes longer until cooked through. Remove chicken from pot (reserving broth) and set aside to cool. Strain broth into a container or bowl - you will need about three cups to cook the rice.
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Peel and dice the remaining onion. Peel and dice the carrots. In the same saucepan, add 2 tablespoons olive oil, the minced garlic, and the diced carrots and onions. Cook over medium heat until the onions are translucent and fragrant.
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Rinse the rice with water several times and add rice to the pot with the onions and carrots. Add 2 1/2 cups of the reserved broth and stir. Taste for seasoning, and add salt and pepper to taste. Turn heat to low, cover, and cook until rice is just tender (adding more broth if needed).
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Shred the cooled chicken breasts into bite-size pieces. Dice the ham. Add the butter to a large skillet or paella pan, and heat over medium heat. Add the ham and cook until slightly browned and crispy. Add the chicken and toss with the ham. Remove meat from skillet and set aside.
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Seed and slice the red bell pepper into strips and add it to the skillet with a tablespoon of olive oil. Seed and dice the tomato and add it to the skillet. Add the cumin, paprika, and Worcestershire sauce, and cook the vegetables over medium heat, stirring, until pepper is tender and fragrant and liquid has mostly evaporated. Reserve a few slices of bell pepper to use as a garnish, if desired.
05725432-5829-4148-8e72-5954874122a4 Add the cooked rice to the skillet, along with the beer, the olives, the capers, and the tomato paste. Cook, stirring everything together, for about 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the peas, the ham, and the chicken to the skillet and cook for several minutes longer. Check for seasoning and season with additional salt and pepper if needed.
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 Brine the chicken breasts: Place the chicken in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Add 2-3 tablespoons of salt and the juice of 2 limes to the water. Refrigerate until ready to cook (several hours or overnight).
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 Prepare marinade: In a blender or food processor, mix the garlic, mint, cumin, sugar, paprika, chile pepper, oregano, aji panca paste, sazon goya, vinegar, soy sauce, juice of the third lime, and vegetable oil. Process until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 Drain chicken breasts and place in a shallow dish. Cover chicken with marinade, turning to coat. Let chicken marinate for about an hour.
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 You must preheat the oven to 350 F, and heat butter or olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté chicken breasts, in batches if necessary, until browned on both sides.
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 Place chicken breasts on a baking sheet and finish cooking in the oven for 8 to 10 minutes, or just until chicken is cooked through (cut into a piece and check after 5 minutes in the oven—the chicken should no longer be pink and juices should run clear).
3a4e9c5f-3d12-4e24-97cc-960d5be1ebb0 Remove from oven and serve.
c65d75df-70ba-4386-8b0a-20f77ad73627 Gather the ingredients.
c65d75df-70ba-4386-8b0a-20f77ad73627 Place the frozen açaí and the passion fruit purée in a blender, along with one banana, the orange juice (if using), and the sugar. Blend until smooth and thick. (The mixture should have the texture of a soft sorbet that you would eat with a spoon.) Taste and add more sugar if desired, or a bit of lime juice for extra tartness.
c65d75df-70ba-4386-8b0a-20f77ad73627 Place the fruit mixture in a bowl. Slice the remaining banana and place the slices on top of the acai. Sprinkle granola over the fruit.
c65d75df-70ba-4386-8b0a-20f77ad73627 Enjoy immediately!
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Gather the ingredients.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e In a small saucepan, heat the milk with the butter and the sugar until the butter is just melted and the milk is warm (but not too hot - less than 110 degrees).
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Pour milk/butter mixture into the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment. Sprinkle the yeast over the milk. Let stand for 3-5 minutes, or until slightly foamy.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Mix on low speed, adding the eggs one at a time. In a separate bowl. stir the salt into the flour. Add 2 cups of the flour mixture and mix until smooth. Add the remaining flour in parts, letting the mixer knead after each addition. Knead dough until it's smooth and stretchy. If the dough is too sticky, add more flour in small amounts. if the dough is too stiff or crumbly, add 1 to 2 tablespoons of milk.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Knead the dough with the dough hook until it's smooth and elastic. Place the dough in a large oiled bowl. Cover it loosely with a towel and let it rise in until it's doubled in bulk, about 1 1/2 hours.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Divide the dough in half. Generously grease a half sheet baking pan (13" x 18") with olive oil. Roll out half of the dough into a rectangle about the size of the baking pan. Transfer the dough to the baking pan and press it into the sides and bottom of the pan.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Layer the sliced cheese and ham over the dough, covering all of the dough Add the sliced tomato as well, if desired.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Roll out the other half of the dough into a similar rectangle. Place it into the pan, covering the ham and cheese filling completely. Brush the top of the dough with olive oil, then sprinkle the grated cheese and the oregano over the top of the dough.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Loosely cover the sandwich, and let it rise in a warm place for about 45 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees about 10 minutes before baking.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Bake the sandwich for 35 to 40 minutes, or until it is golden brown, puffy, and the cheese is melted.
e136e734-1422-4da9-8d20-6b626f34138e Cut into squares and serve warm or at room temperature. Sandwich can be reheated in the oven (covered loosely with foil)
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 In a large sauté pan, melt the butter over medium-low heat. Add the shallot and the ginger, and cook on medium heat for a few minutes, stirring, until shallot and ginger are softened and fragrant.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Add the chicken broth, 1/2 cup of the passionfruit pulp, and 1/3 cup brown sugar. Add the chicken breasts in a single layer. Add more chicken broth if necessary to ensure that the chicken breasts are covered with liquid.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Bring the cooking liquid to a low simmer. Cover and cook the chicken breasts for 15-20 minutes, turning once, until just cooked through (slice into one of the breasts to check for doneness).
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Remove the chicken breasts to an ovenproof pan, cover with foil, and keep them warm in a 200 degree (F) oven while preparing the sauce.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Pour off all but 1 cup of the cooking liquid from the sauté pan. Add the remaining 1 cup of passion fruit juice, the apple cider, the vinegar, the soy sauce, and 1/3 cup brown sugar. Whisk in the cornstarch.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Bring the sauce to a boil, whisking constantly, and cook until it the sauce has thickened about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
1c14b409-eb23-49a0-affc-c0674c35d996 Pour the sauce over chicken breasts and serve. Serve with coconut rice if desired.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 Prepare the ribs: Remove the membrane from the bony side of the rack of ribs: Slide a dull knife under the membrane and use the knife to loosen the membrane from the ribs, then peel away the membrane. Rinse the ribs and pat dry. Rub all over with coarse salt and freshly ground pepper.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 Prepare the marinade: Peel the garlic and coarsely chop. Chop white and green parts of the scallions. Place all of the marinade ingredients in a blender or food processor and process until smooth and well blended.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 Place the ribs in a shallow dish and cover with the marinade, rubbing the marinade into both sides of the ribs with your fingers. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for a couple of hours or overnight.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 Preheat the oven to 250 F. Place the ribs on a large piece of aluminum foil. Add the marinade and wrap tightly with more foil, making sure foil is well sealed around the ribs. Place foil packet on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 3 hours. Remove ribs from oven and let cool.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 Heat the grill to medium-high, moving the charcoal to one side in order to create an area where the ribs can cook over indirect heat. Place the ribs directly over the coals to sear each side, then move them to the cooler part of the grill (around 250 F) and cook for 5 to 6 minutes on each side, brushing them with marinade or with optional mango glaze. Remove from heat and serve warm.
e1e6c613-54c1-4267-b9cc-208f216664e2 To cook ribs on the grill only: Prepare the grill: light the charcoal then move charcoal to one side of the grill, creating an area with lower temperature - around 225 to 250 F for the ribs. Sear the ribs on each side directly over the coals, then place over indirect heat (temperature should not exceed 250 F). Cook ribs, basting occasionally with marinade, for 3 to 3 1/2 hours, or until ribs reach an internal temperature of 160 F.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Gather the ingredients.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Sauté the onions in the vegetable oil until soft and translucent - 5 minutes.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Add the ground beef, cumin, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring, until the beef is crumbled and browned. Remove from heat and set aside.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Place the corn kernels in a food processor or blender with 1/4 cup milk. Process for 1 to 2 minutes, until the corn is blended and appears creamy.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Melt 1/4 cup of butter in a large saucepan. Add 1 teaspoon salt, sugar, and the blended corn mixture.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Add the remaining 3/4 cup milk and simmer, constantly stirring, until the mixture thickens about 5 to 10 minutes.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Remove from heat and stir in the chopped fresh basil.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Preheat oven to 375 F.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Drain the liquid from the browned beef mixture.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Place the ground beef mixture in the bottom of a 3- to 4-quart casserole dish.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Sprinkle the raisins, olives, and hardboiled eggs over the beef, then layer the chicken on top.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Spread the corn mixture over the top of the casserole so that it covers the rest of the ingredients. Sprinkle the powdered sugar on top.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Bake the casserole in the oven for 30 to 45 minutes, until the filling is bubbling hot and the corn mixture is golden brown.
c420f469-e5b9-4cd2-8986-2fe1c7ff60f2 Serve warm.
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Slice each chicken breast in half horizontally to make two pieces of even thickness. If one end of the chicken is thicker than the other end, use the flat side of a mallet to pound the chicken into an even thickness.
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Place all of the chicken into a bowl. Add 3 to 4 tablespoons of salt and cover chicken with water. Let chicken brine in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight.
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Remove chicken from brine, rinse, and pat dry. Place chicken in a ziplock bag. Juice the limes and add the lime juice and the olive oil to the bag. Let the chicken marinate in the lime juice, refrigerated, for another 2 to 6 hours.
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Mix the kosher salt, cumin and ground pepper together in a small bowl. Remove the chicken from the lime juice marinade and place in a dish or on a plate. Rub the chicken on all sides with the cumin/salt mixture.
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Heat the grill. When the grill is hot, cook the chicken breasts for about 3-5 minutes per side, or until they are browned and just cooked through (cut into the chicken to test for doneness - the juices should run clear and the meat should be firm and opaque all the way through).
056c9081-1918-4291-923b-b291ce2437b5 Remove chicken from grill to a clean plate, and serve warm with salsa or chimichurri sauce.
90b9ce85-0889-4d19-a2d4-82ac8327aa7a Whisk together the vegetable oil, 1/2 of the bottle of beer, orange juice, lime juice, vinegar and Worcestershire sauce.
90b9ce85-0889-4d19-a2d4-82ac8327aa7a Whisk in the garlic, cumin, SazonGoya and salt and pepper to taste.
90b9ce85-0889-4d19-a2d4-82ac8327aa7a Place the flank steak inside of a plastic bag, and more the marinade mixture into the bag with the steak. Seal bag tightly, then leave the steak to marinate overnight in the fridge.
90b9ce85-0889-4d19-a2d4-82ac8327aa7a Heat the grill to medium-high. Remove steak from marinade and grill for 5 to 8 minutes on each side, or until it reaches desired doneness.
90b9ce85-0889-4d19-a2d4-82ac8327aa7a Let steak rest for 5 minutes, then slice very thinly against the grain and serve.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Remove excess fat from the pork. No need to remove all of the fat — just the really big pieces. Cut the pork into 3 or 4 pieces and sprinkle all over with salt and pepper.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Place all the ingredients in the crock pot and cook on low for about 7 to 8 hours, or until pork is very tender and can be pulled apart easily with a fork. Alternatively, you can cook on high for 4 to 5 hours.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Line a rimmed baking sheet with foil. Preheat the broiler.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Shred the pork, and place in on the baking sheet. Pour the sauce from the crock pot over the pork and mix gently.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Broil meat, turning once, until brown and caramelized around the edges, or desired amount (about 5 minutes). Be sure to watch the oven and pull the tray out quickly after caramelizing to prevent it from drying out.
4fc3f537-db30-4f33-9616-e2a4cc48046e Serve immediately with warm with rice, beans, and tortillas. Garnish plate with a squeeze of lime and chopped cilantro if you have on hand.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Gather the ingredients.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat and sauté the chopped onion, green pepper, tomato, garlic, oregano, and seasoning until soft and fragrant, about 5 to 8 minutes.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Peel the plantains and place them in a food processor with the fish stock. Add the sautéed vegetable mixture and process until well blended and mostly smooth.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Season the shrimp with salt and pepper. Using the same skillet, sauté them in the butter with the cilantro until just cooked, 2-3 minutes (depending on the size of the shrimp). Set the shrimp aside on a plate.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Add the plantain and vegetable mixture to the skillet and stir in the peanut butter. Bring to a simmer and cook, stirring, for about 10 minutes, or until the mixture is thickened.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Add the cooked shrimp to the sauce and stir briefly until shrimp is heated through.
06e940f0-d933-4c74-b576-bffa80e5306d Serve warm over white rice.
0469d074-c632-4540-908f-aa59c59fa63c Cut pizza into slices.
0469d074-c632-4540-908f-aa59c59fa63c Top each slice of pizza with a generous slice of fainá.
0469d074-c632-4540-908f-aa59c59fa63c Enjoy!
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Gather the ingredients.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f In a shallow bowl or plate, mix the flour, salt, and ground pepper and set aside.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f In a shallow bowl, whisk the eggs lightly with the water.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Mix the breadcrumbs with the oregano and Parmesan cheese, and season them with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Spread the breadcrumbs out onto a plate.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Dredge each steak in the flour, coating both sides and shaking off excess.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Dip each floured steak into the egg wash, and let the excess drip off. Then place the steak into the breadcrumbs, coating both sides thoroughly.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Fry each steak for about 3 to 4 minutes on each side, or until breading is crispy and steak is cooked to desired doneness.
fc431566-3663-45d8-b2e5-e0d7e42c538f Serve warm, with rice and chimichurri sauce.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Gather the ingredients.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Cut the beef into 1 1/2-inch pieces and place the pieces in a nonreactive bowl or dish.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Mash or crush the garlic with a heavy utensil, or with a mortar and pestle. Add a little water if necessary to make a paste.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea In a small bowl, mix the crushed garlic, 1/4 cup of the vinegar, 1/4 cup chile pepper paste, 1 tablespoon cumin, 1 tablespoon salt, and 2 teaspoons freshly ground pepper.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Pour the marinade over the beef and mix well.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Cover and marinate the beef overnight in the refrigerator. If you are pressed for time, marinate the beef for at least 1 hour at room temperature.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Prepare the grill.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Place the pieces beef onto the skewers (about 4 pieces on each skewer, depending on size).
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Make a basting mixture of 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup vinegar, and a pinch of cumin.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Grill the skewers for about 5 minutes on each side, or to the desired doneness. Baste the meat several times during cooking.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Serve the anticuchos with rice and corn on the cob.
02cd2b13-35e1-42f3-97f6-0b65b28f6aea Enjoy!
8c88d537-0902-4f1e-9129-ba790a387b8f Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1-inch square pieces. Place in a bowl of salted water and set aside.
8c88d537-0902-4f1e-9129-ba790a387b8f Mince the garlic and place it in a medium bowl. Juice the limes and add the juice to the garlic. Add the cumin, sugar, mint, paprika, chile pepper, oregano, aji panca paste, soy sauce, vinegar, chicken broth, and two tablespoons of vegetable oil. Whisk ingredients together until well mixed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8c88d537-0902-4f1e-9129-ba790a387b8f Season the chicken breasts on both sides with salt and pepper. Heat remaining two tablespoons of vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the chicken breasts briefly, turning once, until they are just browned on both sides.
8c88d537-0902-4f1e-9129-ba790a387b8f Transfer the chicken breasts to the crockpot and arrange them so that they cover the bottom of the pot. Drain the potatoes and place them on top of the chicken. Pour the sauce (garlic/lime/vinegar mixture) over the chicken and potatoes. Set slow cooker to low setting, and cook for 6 hours, or until chicken is extremely tender and shreds easily with a fork.
8c88d537-0902-4f1e-9129-ba790a387b8f Let chicken cool in the slow cooker, covered. Shred chicken using two forks. The potatoes will crumble and mix in. Stir to incorporate any remaining liquid, adding some extra chicken broth if mixture seems too dry.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Place the olive oil in a large saucepan with the onion and the garlic. Cook over medium-low heat, stirring often until the onion is softened and fragrant.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Add the chopped tomato and the sun-dried tomatoes and cook until most of the liquid from the tomato is gone.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Add the miso, the chile pepper paste, the tomato paste, the Worcestershire sauce, the soy sauce, the cumin, and the smoked paprika. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the green lentils.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Add the vegetable broth to the pan and bring to a simmer. Lower the heat and cover the pot. Let lentils simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the quinoa and continue to cook, covered, for 20 minutes longer. Add more vegetable broth if needed.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Add the kale and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in the lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5bfb455d-8240-4176-b870-a45c74bde604 Portion into bowls and top with sliced roasted chicken or a soft boiled egg, and a couple of tablespoons of sofrito.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Gather the ingredients.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Preheat the oven to 425 F.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Oil a broiler pan and rack or baking pan with olive oil.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Lightly sprinkle the sea bass fillets all over with Kosher salt, pepper, and Creole seasoning.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Place the Chilean sea bass on the oiled broiler rack, skin-side down.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Bake the fish fillets at 425 F for about 15 to 20 minutes depending on the thickness of the fillets. The fish is ready when the temperature reaches 145 F on an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a fillet.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 While the fish is baking, prepare the lemon buerre blanc sauce.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 In a saucepan, combine the dry white wine, white wine vinegar, and minced shallots.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until it has reduced to about 2 tablespoons.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Add the lemon juice, zest, and heavy cream.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Remove the pan from the heat and whisk in 1 piece of the butter.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Set it back over low heat and continue whisking until the butter has almost melted.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Continue with the remaining pieces of butter until all are incorporated.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Taste and add salt and pepper, as needed. Whisk until the well blended. If the sauce is too hot or too cold, it can separate, so keep it warm—at least 80 F but no hotter than about 135 F— until serving time.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Arrange the fish on plates with lemon wedges and drizzle with the lemon buerre blanc.
699c2fda-5f53-4bad-ab5c-562a32c5b2a8 Serve and enjoy!
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Place the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high Brown the roast on all sides.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Transfer the roast into a large cooking pot and cover with the chicken stock (adding water if necessary to cover the meat completely).
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Cut the onion into quarters and add to the pot, along with the bay leaf.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Bring the liquid to a boil and simmer over low heat, covered, until the meat is cooked through and tender, about 1 1/2 hours depending on the size. When you cut into the meat, the juices should run clear.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Remove the meat from the pot and place it in a roasting pan. Reserve 2 cups of the cooking liquid. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Mix the aji panca paste, salt, vinegar, minced garlic, cumin, turmeric, and Sazón Goya together in a small bowl. (If you can't find jarred aji panca paste, you can also use dried aji panca peppers to make your own: soak the dried peppers briefly in very hot water, then process them in a blender or food processor with some vegetable oil to make a paste).
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Spread the aji pepper and garlic mixture onto the pork, turning it to cover all sides. Make several deep slits in the meat to help introduce the seasoning. Add the reserved cooking liquid to the roasting pan.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Roast the meat in the oven until heated through, turning the meat over once, for a total time of about 30-45 minutes.
146605b7-179d-4211-8481-3552b33e08e9 Let cool, slice thinly, and serve with salsa criolla.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Gather the ingredients.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Cut the fish into bite-size pieces and place the pieces in a ziplock bag. Add the lime juice, salt, ground pepper, and minced garlic. Marinate the fish for 1 to 4 hours in the refrigerator.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a large sauté pan. Layer half of the peppers, half of the tomatoes, and half of the onions over the bottom of the pan.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Cover the vegetables with the fish and the marinade.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Layer the rest of the peppers, onions, and tomatoes on top. Sprinkle with the chopped green onions and half of the chopped cilantro.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Whisk the paprika and the chile pepper into the coconut milk, and pour the mixture over the vegetables and fish.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Drizzle the vegetables with the palm oil.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Bring the mixture to a boil, and simmer gently, covered, for 15 minutes. Remove cover and simmer for 25 minutes more, or until vegetables are well-cooked and tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Sprinkle the rest of the chopped cilantro over the hot stew. Serve with rice, toasted manioc meal (farofa de dende) and fried plantains.
665fd972-4132-4921-a2c8-325e4dff51c6 Enjoy!
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Sauté onion and garlic in the butter until soft and slightly golden. Add salt and nutmeg.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Add mushrooms and sauté for 3-5 minutes more.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Add spinach and cook for one minute. Remove from heat and let cool.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Mix ricotta, mozzarella, parmesan and 2 eggs in a large bowl.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Add cooled spinach mixture to the cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Preheat oven to 400 F.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Roll out one of the pastry sheets in a circle about 14 inches in diameter (or roll out half of the empanada dough or pastel pastry in the same way).
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Drape pastry over a buttered 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom, pressing the pastry into bottom and sides of the pan.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Fill the tart with spinach/cheese mixture.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Cut the hard-boiled eggs in half. Press them into filling, spacing them evenly.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Roll out the other piece of puff pastry (or the other half of the empanada dough) into a 9-inch circle, and place on top of the tart. Seal edges together and crimp with a fork.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Brush tart with the egg wash. Use a fork to prick a few holes in the top of the tart as vents.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Place tart in the oven, lower temperature to 350 F, and bake for one hour. If tart is browning too quickly, you can cover the tart with foil loosely.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Cool in pan for 30 minutes before lifting tart (with the removable bottom) out of the tart pan.
aadfac05-d034-4144-8d49-944fce184a4a Serve warm or at room temperature.
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Gather the ingredients.
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Place the olive oil in a large saucepan. Add the onion and cook over medium heat until onion is soft and fragrant, about 5 to 8 minutes.
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Add the tomato, green onions, minced garlic, cilantro, cumin, smoked paprika, chili powder, dark brown sugar and salt, and cook, stirring, until all the vegetables are soft.
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Add the quinoa and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato sauce and the water and stir well. Cover and simmer chili over low heat until quinoa is cooked, about 20 minutes. (The quinoa grains will appear swollen and have a tiny visible thread/tail).
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Add the beans and the corn (optional) and cook for 5 to 10 minutes more, or until beans and corn are hot. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
429791ae-84fa-4950-a031-8554ba66c3ad Serve with rice, grated cheddar cheese, sour cream, chopped green onions, tortilla chips, etc.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Sprinkle the yeast over 1 cup of the water.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Add the flour, salt, and olive oil to a large bowl or in the bowl of a standing mixer, and whisk together.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Gradually stir in the water with the yeast.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Stir in another 3/4 cups water and knead dough (with a dough hook or by hand), adding more water if the dough is too dry. Knead dough until it is very smooth, about 5 minutes in the standing mixer or 10 minutes by hand. Dough will be soft and slightly sticky.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Place dough in an oiled bowl and cover loosely. Let dough rise until double in size.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Slice the onions into thin rings.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet and cook onions (and pimentos if using) over medium-low heat until the onions are soft and turning golden, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Preheat oven to 425 F.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Lightly oil a large rectangular baking pan (about 18" by 12"). Punch down the pizza dough and stretch it gently to fit the baking pan, pressing it into the corners. Brush the dough lightly with olive oil.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Spread the cooked onions over the top of the dough. Sprinkle generously with oregano and coarse salt.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 If using, cut the olives into quarters and scatter them over the onions. Sprinkle the pizza with the grated parmesan.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Place the pizza into the preheated oven and bake until the pizza crust appears golden and crispy.
068b5eb6-f669-426b-aa90-b1d3b9a02db3 Cut pizza into rectangles, and serve hot or at room temperature.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Place quinoa in a saucepan with the chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until quinoa has absorbed all of the liquid, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir cranberries into quinoa. Cover and set aside.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Add olive oil to a heavy skillet and place over medium heat. Add sausages, crumbling them with a wooden spoon or spatula as they cook. Cook sausages until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Add garlic to the same skillet and cook briefly over medium heat, until fragrant. Add spinach and 3 tablespoons water and cook until spinach is wilted and water has evaporated. Remove spinach, drain thoroughly and roughly chop.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Preheat oven to 350 F. Mix sausage and spinach into quinoa. Stir in cream cheese, eggs, cumin, pecans, and salt and pepper to taste.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Brush bottom and sides of a casserole dish with melted butter. Spoon quinoa mixture lightly into the casserole (don't mash quinoa down into the dish), and drizzle with remaining melted butter.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Bake casserole until heated through and browned on top, 25 to 30 minutes.
2650a606-589d-49bc-af92-245ce4063733 Remove from oven and serve warm.
8b5cac0b-13d6-4f23-8501-fef6524cbdf9 Sauté the bacon until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve for another use, but leave the bacon drippings in the pan.
8b5cac0b-13d6-4f23-8501-fef6524cbdf9 Add the chopped tomatoes, chopped scallions, and cumin to the pan. Sauté them in the bacon fat until they are soft, about 5 to 8 minutes.
8b5cac0b-13d6-4f23-8501-fef6524cbdf9 Add the beans (including liquid) to the pan, sugar, water, and the chicken bouillon. Bring to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes more, until most of the water has evaporated and the beans have thickened.
8b5cac0b-13d6-4f23-8501-fef6524cbdf9 Remove from heat and stir in the chopped cilantro. Serve with rice.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Peel and cut the potatoes into french fries. Cook fries in hot (360 F) vegetable oil until golden. Drain on a cookie sheet lined with paper towels, season with salt, and place in a 200 F oven to keep them warm.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Carefully pour the excess vegetable oil into a separate container, leaving about 3 tablespoons in the skillet, or use a new skillet.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Sauté onions in the vegetable oil until soft and golden brown, about 10 minutes. Remove onions and place in a shallow pan or casserole dish, and place in the oven with the french fries.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Finely chop the garlic. Season one side of the steaks with salt and pepper and sprinkle with half the chopped garlic. Pound steaks with a meat hammer to flatten them, then flip them and repeat on the other side with the remaining garlic.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Sauté steaks on high heat, turning once, until browned on both sides and cooked to desired doneness. Place steaks over onions and return to the oven.
80f86853-1985-4496-84d7-cbd94b340224 Add a little oil to the skillet and fry the eggs, sunnyside up. Season with salt and pepper if desired. While the eggs are cooking, remove the potatoes, steak, and onions from the oven. Distribute the onions among 4 plates, top with a portion of the fries, and lay the steaks on top. When the eggs are ready, top each steak with a fried egg. Serve immediately.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Trim the stems from the okra, taking care not to cut into the inside of the okra where the seeds are.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Chop the onion finely and mince the garlic.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Dice the red pepper.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e When the skillet is hot, add the okra and cook, stirring often, until okra is crisp-tender, about 2 to 3 minutes.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Squeeze the lime juice over the okra.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Remove the okra to a plate and set aside.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and cook until the onion is very soft and fragrant.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Add the chopped red pepper to the skillet and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until softened.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Add the rice, soy sauce, and teriyaki sauce to the skillet and cook, stirring, until rice is heated through and well mixed with the vegetables. If the rice sticks to the skillet, add a little water or some additional soy sauce (to taste).
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Add the okra back into the skillet with the rice and stir until the okra is heated through.
1bc68562-c780-4ac8-a636-d90dcc4c325e Taste for seasoning, adding more soy sauce or teriyaki if desired, and serve warm.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Remove the tamales from their husks and cut them into bite-size pieces.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Place the olive oil in a heavy skillet. Coarsely chop the onion. Remove the charred skin and seeds from the roasted poblanos and dice them.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Saute the onions in the olive oil over medium-low heat until onion is soft and fragrant. Add the garlic and peppers and cook for several minutes more. Remove from heat, stir in the cream cheese, and season with salt and pepper to taste.​
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 In a medium bowl, whisk together the sour cream, salsa, and chicken stock.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Preheat oven to 350 F.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Lightly grease a 2-quart casserole dish. Place 1/3 of the chopped tamales over the bottom. Cover with 1/2 of the onion-pepper mixture. Sprinkle 3/4 cup of the grated cheese over the onions.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Layer another third of the tamal pieces over the cheese, and top with the remaining onions and peppers. Top with 3/4 cup of cheese.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Finally, place the remaining chopped tamales on top of the casserole. Pour the sour cream mixture over the entire casserole. Top with the last 1/2 cup of cheese.
bc16cd36-aa72-4f21-90ff-6aea14c79d28 Loosely cover casserole with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 15 minutes more, or until casserole is bubbly and hot, and cheese is melted.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Cut the onion into the thinnest possible slices, slicing it with the cut side facing down so that the pieces are semicircular in shape.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Place the onion slices in a bowl of cold salted water, and let soak for 20 minutes.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Cook the corn kernels in a pot of boiling salted water until just tender. Drain and rinse with cold water.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff If the shrimp is not cooked, bring a pot of salted water to a boil, and add the juice of one lime to the pot. Boil the shrimp for one to two minutes, until just cooked. Drain shrimp and rinse with cold water.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff De-vein the shrimp and trim off the tails, and place in a bowl.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Drain onions and rinse with cold water. Add onions and corn to bowl with the shrimp.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Whisk together lime juice, orange juice, ketchup, sugar, and vinegar. Toss with shrimp, corn, and onions. Taste and season with salt and pepper.
c9ba5d58-8cc9-4477-9e19-d2305f67bcff Chill shrimp until ready to serve. Toss shrimp with cilantro before serving, and drizzle decoratively with ketchup if desired.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Soak the beans overnight in cold water.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 In a separate bowl, soak the beef jerky overnight, changing the water two or three times.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Place the beans in a large pot and cover with water.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Add the dried beef and ham hock.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Simmer for 2 hours or until the beans are cooked but firm.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Remove the ham hock and discard.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Add the ribs, chorizo, sirloin or pork loin, bacon and smoked pig or tongue, if desired, and the bay leaf to the beans and simmer for 30 minutes, adding hot water if necessary to maintain an inch of water over the beans.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Heat the oil in a skillet and cook the onions and garlic until soft and golden. Add the parsley and season with the cumin and salt and pepper to taste.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Add 3/4 cup of the bean mixture to the skillet and mash the beans with the onions.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Add this mixture back to the beans and meat and simmer for 30 minutes more.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Remove the meats from the beans and cut them into smaller pieces or thin slices.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Arrange the meats on a platter, grouped by type.
bdc436f6-f5c5-4ea3-be79-60dd96389334 Serve the beans in a separate bowl.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Generously salt and pepper the roast on all sides. Peel and slice the onions into thin slices. Chop the garlic. Peel and slice the carrots crosswise into thin slices. Chop the bell pepper. Wash and slice the mushrooms.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Place the bacon in a dutch oven or other heavy pot large enough to hold the roast. Brown the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove bacon from the pot, reserving the rendered fat in the pot.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Turn the heat up to medium-high and brown the roast on all sides. Remove roast to a plate and set aside.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Add vegetables to the pot along with the aji panca paste and 1 teaspoon garlic salt, and cook over low heat until onions are soft and fragrant or about 5 to 8 minutes.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Add the beef back to the pot (place on top of the vegetables). Pour the red wine over the meat and simmer uncovered until most of the liquid has boiled away.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Add the beef broth, cover, and simmer over low heat for 30 minutes. Turn the roast over and simmer for another hour, or until beef is very tender. Turn off the heat and left roast cool in the liquid for about 20 minutes.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Remove meat to a plate or cutting board. Pour cooking liquid through a strainer, reserving liquid and discarding vegetables. Place cornstarch in a small bowl. Whisk 1/4 cup of the broth into the cornstarch until smooth. Set aside.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Pour remaining reserved broth into a large skillet and bring to a simmer. Whisk in the cornstarch mixture. Simmer broth until reduced and thickened, about 10 minutes. Taste for seasoning and season with salt and pepper as needed.
58b913ba-1c0e-47eb-8e6d-edb8c7948c77 Slice roast across the grain into thin slices, and place slices into the gravy to heat them. Serve warm, with extra gravy on the side.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba Prepare the mango salsa: Stir together the mango, onion, lime juice, red pepper, vinegar, sugar, vegetable oil, cilantro and curry powder in a bowl. Season salsa with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba Place the coconut flakes in a food processor and pulse very briefly, until they are a bit more finely shredded. Add 1/3 cup flour, the cumin, curry powder, salt and pepper and pulse to mix. Transfer mixture to a shallow plate.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba In a small bowl, whisk the egg with 1 tablespoon water. Place the remaining 1/3 cup flour on a second plate.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba Dredge the fillets first in the plain flour (shaking off excess), then in the egg mixture (letting excess drip off), and finally in the coconut mixture, coating both sides completely.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba Heat the olive oil and the butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sauté the fillets until they are browned on both sides and cooked through on the inside, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
5a591718-d245-4cfa-a9ac-f5f4f305fdba Spoon a bit of the mango salsa on each fillet and serve.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Gather the ingredients.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Peel the potatoes and slice them into 1/4 inch thick slices.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover them with water. Slice the onion into 4 pieces and add the pieces to the water, along with 1 teaspoon salt, the peeled garlic cloves, and the anise seeds. Bring the water to a simmer and cook the potato slices until they are just barely tender.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Drain the potatoes in a colander and set them aside until cool enough to handle.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Place the evaporated milk, corn starch, 3 eggs, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon pepper in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Melt 1 tablespoon butter and spread the butter with a tablespoon of olive oil over the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch casserole dish. Slice the cheese into 1/4 inch thick slices.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Place a layer of the sliced potatoes on the bottom of the casserole, and cover them with a layer of sliced cheese. Repeat with more layers of potatoes and cheese until the casserole is full, pressing down on the layers to fit them in snugly. End with a layer of cheese slices.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Pour the milk mixture over the layers of potatoes and cheese. Top the casserole with the grated Monterey jack cheese and the grated Parmesan cheese.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Cover the casserole with a piece of foil and bake until the casserole is bubbly and hot, about 30 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 10-15 minutes more until the top of the casserole is golden brown.
daff168d-6079-4c9d-bf23-e6c3067de793 Remove from oven and let cool for 10-15 minutes before serving.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Gather the ingredients.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Place the corn, cream, salt, melted butter, and cornstarch (if using) in a food processor or blender. Process until you have a fairly smooth, thick batter.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Heat a lightly oiled skillet over medium-low heat.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Add about 1/4 to 1/3 cup of the batter to skillet. Spread it with a spatula to make a circle.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Cook the pancake until it starts to bubble and the spatula can easily slide underneath it.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Flip the pancake and cook for several minutes on the other side. Keep the temperature on the low side, or the outside of the pancakes will burn before the inside is completely cooked.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Continue cooking pancakes until you have used all the batter.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Spread the pancakes with butter and cream cheese or top with grated ​queso fresco cheese.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Fold the pancakes in half and serve.
73ccb721-ac6e-4512-91d3-65bf7ced92a0 Enjoy!
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Gather the ingredients.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Cook the bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Remove the bacon, saving it for later use, and use the bacon grease left in the pan to sauté the chopped onion with the chile powder or chile paste until soft and golden.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Stir in the beans and mash them with a wooden spoon until they are pretty well broken up. Add the rice and stir.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Cook, stirring, until the rice and beans are heated through. Remove from the heat, let cool, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Process the saltine crackers in a food processor to make fine crumbs. Alternatively, place them in a sealed zip-top bag and pound into crumbs.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Sprinkle a layer of crumbs on a cutting board and place a piece of steak over the crumbs. Sprinkle the steak with salt and pepper and pound with a meat mallet until flat and thin. Flip the steak over and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Repeat with the rest of the steaks.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Heat 2 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons oil in a skillet until hot. Sauté the steaks for 2 minutes on each side, or until desired doneness. Remove from the heat and place the steaks on a plate. Cover them with foil and keep them warm in a low-temperature oven until ready to serve.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Shape the cooled rice and bean mixture into 4 flattened, football-shaped patties. Press them into the remaining saltine cracker crumbs, covering both sides.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Using the same skillet that cooked the steaks (uncleaned), heat 2 tablespoons of oil. Add the patties, 1 or 2 at a time if necessary, and cook, 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and crispy on the outside. Remove the patties from the heat and cover with foil to keep warm.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Heat about an inch of oil in a clean, tall skillet or pot. Peel the plantains or bananas and slice each in half crosswise. Slice each piece in half lengthwise to make 8 pieces. Fry the slices until browned and cooked through. Sprinkle with salt and set aside.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Pace one of the rice and beans patties on each plate. Top it with a piece of steak. Place a slice of plantain or banana on the side of each plate.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 In a large skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter until hot. Crack the eggs into the skillet and fry for 3 to 4 minutes or until desired doneness.
4218f1af-ae82-4bb7-8b62-f8f9e4ddcad9 Top each piece of steak with a fried egg. Garnish with thinly sliced onions and serve.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 Gather the ingredients.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 Cook the okra in boiling water for 3 minutes, and drain immediately. Set aside.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 Stir the manioc meal into 2 cups of fish stock. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring, for 3 minutes.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 In a separate pan, sauté the onion and the garlic in the olive oil until soft. Add the shrimp and sauté until pink. Season with salt and pepper.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 Stir the stock and manioc meal into the pan with the onions and shrimp. Add the okra and stir until heated through.
56ca0ec3-732e-4bdb-b5d2-7675abda7331 Serve with rice and enjoy!
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Prepare the dough: Whisk together the flour, salt, and paprika. Stir the yeast into the water. Make a well in the center of the flour and add the water/yeast mixture, olive oil, and the egg to the well.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Place the dough in an oiled bowl, cover loosely with a towel or plastic wrap, and let the dough rise in a warm place until double in bulk (about an hour).
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 While the dough is rising, prepare the filling: Chop the onion and bell peppers into small dice. Mince the garlic. Grate the tomato with a cheese grater (or finely chop). Peel the hard boiled eggs and chop them into 1/2 inch pieces.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Place the olive oil in a large skillet. Add the onion and cook over medium heat, stirring, until onion is soft, fragrant, and translucent, about 5 to 8 minutes.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Add the garlic, chopped bell pepper, tomato, and paprika and cook until most of the liquid has evaporated and vegetables are soft and fragrant. Season mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Drain the tuna and add to the vegetable mixture.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Assemble empanada: Preheat oven to 350 F. Lightly grease a 15-inch pizza pan, baking sheet, or paella pan with olive oil.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Divide the dough into 2 pieces. Gently shape each one into a ball and let rest for 5 minutes. On a lightly floured surface, roll one piece of dough into an 18-inch diameter circle, letting dough rest from time to time so that the gluten will relax. Line the bottom of the baking pan with the dough, letting the excess overhang the edges.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Spread the filling over the dough in the pan, and sprinkle the chopped hard-boiled egg over the filling. Roll out the second piece of dough in the same manner and place it over the filling.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Seal the edges of the dough together, trimming off any excess, and crimp the edges decoratively. Use the excess dough to decorate the empanada, if desired. Make a small 1/2 inch hole in the center of the empanada. Whisk the egg with a tablespoon of water and brush the egg wash over the empanada.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Place the empanada in the oven. Bake until golden brown, about 30 to 35 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for at least 15 minutes before serving.
db7b32f7-4890-440c-a7e0-23178dc0ca92 Reheat empanada in a large skillet or in the oven. Enjoy warm or at room temperature.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Bring a pot of salted water to a boil.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Add the shrimp and cook for 2 minutes, until they just turn pink.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Remove the shrimp from the water with a slotted spoon and place shrimp in a bowl of ice water. Reserve the cooking water.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Peel and de-vein the shrimp, leaving the tails on if desired. Set aside.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Put the oil in a skillet over medium heat.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Add the chopped onion and garlic and cook until translucent and fragrant.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Add the aji amarillo paste, cumin, Sazon Goya, salt and tomatoes to the onions and garlic.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Continue cooking for several minutes more, until the onions are soft and golden.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Add the rice and white wine and cook until the liquid is dissolved, stirring frequently.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Add 2 to 3 cups of the shrimp cooking water to the rice.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Cover and simmer over low heat until the rice has absorbed the water and is fully cooked, about 15 minutes. Add more liquid if needed.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Just before the rice is done, add frozen peas if desired.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Taste the mixture and season with salt and pepper as desired.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Remove from the heat and add the cooked shrimp.
42a3b55e-b748-46ec-b54d-ac846518063a Garnish with minced cilantro and lime juice.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 Place the chopped onion in a small bowl with the juice of 1 lime and season lightly with salt. Set aside to marinate while the potatoes cook.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 Cook the potatoes in boiling salted water until soft. Peel the potatoes once they are cool enough to handle, then pass them through the finest disk of a potato ricer (or thoroughly mash them). Set aside.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 If using a fresh chili pepper, remove the seeds and coarsely chop the pepper. Place in a food processor or blender, along with the juice of the remaining 3 limes, the garlic, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Process until smooth.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 Stir the lime/chili mixture into the potatoes, adding it in parts and tasting after each addition, until potatoes are seasoned to your liking. Stir in the remaining 3 tablespoons vegetable oil and season potatoes with more salt and pepper if needed. If using the jarred chili pepper paste, add the paste to potatoes 1 tablespoon at a time, until potatoes are seasoned as desired.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 To poach the chicken, fill a pot large enough to fit the chicken breasts in one layer with a couple inches of cold water; season with salt and pepper. Add chicken breasts and cook at a low simmer until just cooked through about 15 minutes. Shred the cooked chicken, place in a bowl, and mix with the mayonnaise and the marinated onions. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 Generously oil a springform pan with vegetable oil. Press half of the mashed potato mixture into the bottom of the pan. Use a small offset spatula or knife to spread the potato mixer into an even layer. Cover with the chicken salad in a smooth layer. Top the chicken salad with slices of avocado. Layer the other half of the potato mixture on top and smooth the potatoes with a knife or offset spatula.
e073c763-8678-413a-a634-de968c86a997 Decorate the top with parsley leaves, slices of hard-boiled eggs and sliced olives if desired. Serve chilled.
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f Slice the avocados as thinly as possible and sprinkle with lime juice. Sprinkle the tomato slices with salt and pepper. Trim crusts from bread.
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f For each sandwich, start with a slice of bread spread with mayonnaise. Layer avocado slices thinly on top of the bread.
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f Spread both sides of another slice of bread with mayonnaise and place it on top of the avocado.
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f Spread the chicken salad or egg salad (hardboiled eggs mashed with mayonnaise, salt & pepper) on top of the bread, and then add a tomato slice on top of the chicken salad.
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f Top with another sliced of bread (spread on one side with mayonnaise).
82853db7-c462-4b10-9c59-6ebe261fae9f Slice the sandwiches into triangles and serve.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Add the chopped onion, garlic and bacon bits and saute in the butter until the onions are soft and turning translucent.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Add the chopped red pepper, chili paste, cumin, salt and mushrooms and cook for 5 to 10 minutes more, or until mushrooms have reduced in size and mixture is fragrant.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Transfer the vegetables to a bowl or plate and set aside.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Add the quinoa to the same saucepan and toast briefly over medium heat.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Add the white wine and simmer until the liquid is almost gone.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Begin adding chicken stock, one cup at a time.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Cover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, then add more as needed. Quinoa should be ready after about 15 to 20 minutes. When the quinoa is cooked, the grain looks translucent and you can see a little thread, or "tail," on the grain. If you run out of chicken stock, use water. There should be a little liquid left when the quinoa is done.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Stir the vegetable mixture back in with the quinoa.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Add the cream and Parmesan and heat several minutes more, stirring, until the cheese is melted and everything is hot.
edbebdd9-0822-4c59-b910-366129d4754c Stir in the cilantro, season to taste with salt and pepper, and serve warm
6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 Sauté the onion and garlic in the olive oil over medium heat until soft and fragrant. Remove from heat and set aside.
6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 While onions are cooking, add spinach and basil leaves to a blender with the milk and process (working in batches if necessary) until smooth.
