6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 Add cooked onions and garlic to the blender with the cheese and process, adding a little more milk if necessary, until you have a smooth mixture.
6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 Melt butter in the skillet that cooked the onions. Pour sauce from the blender into the skillet and cook, stirring constantly, for 3 to 4 minutes, until sauce is heated through and smooth. Keep sauce warm.
6c9e861e-af80-48c5-9da9-fa2f016f6705 Add pasta to the boiling water and cook according to directions. Drain well and toss pasta with the sauce. Serve warm.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Season the chicken breasts generously with salt and pepper.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté the chicken breasts in the butter until lightly browned on both sides. Chill chicken for 20 minutes.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Stir the chimichurri sauce into the cream cheese until well mixed.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 On a floured surface, roll out the pastry sheet to a 14-inch square. Cut pastry into four seven inch squares.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Spread 2 tablespoons of the cream cheese mixture in the middle of each pastry sheet. Place a chicken breast in each square, on top of the cheese, centered in the pastry square.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Brush the edges of the pastry squares with beaten egg. Fold the corners up over the chicken and seal the edges completely.
abc4234e-ffae-47d4-8e9a-ba5b09d9b364 Place the chicken breasts, seam side down, on a cookie sheet lined with foil or parchment. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the pastry is golden brown and chicken is cooked through. Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Place the flank steak in a pot with the bouillon, and cover with water.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Bring to a boil and simmer on low for 1 1/2 hours, or until the meat is tender. Remove from heat and let the meat cool in the pot with the juices.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Saute 2 teaspoons minced garlic in 4 tablespoons vegetable oil for 1 to 2 minutes. Add 2 cups water and 1 teaspoon salt and bring to a boil.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Add the rice to the boiling water, lower the heat, and simmer the rice, covered, for 10 to 15 minutes. Turn off the heat and leave the rice covered for 5 minutes more.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil to a skillet, and saute half the chopped onions with the rest of the minced garlic until soft.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Add the can of black beans (undrained), 1/2 cup water, chicken bouillon, cumin, garlic powder, vinegar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt, and simmer on low heat for about 10 minutes, until the liquid is reduced.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Slice the cooled steak against the grain into thin slices. The meat should be very tender and falling apart. Shred the larger pieces into bite-size pieces with your fingers.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Add 2 tablespoons butter to a skillet and cook the rest of the chopped onions until soft. Add the tomatoes, 1 cup of the steak pan juices, and the sliced steak and simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Arrange the meat and tomatoes on 1/3 of a serving platter. Place the rice next to the meat, and then place the beans on the other side of the rice, to resemble the stripes of a tri-color flag.
8a6af9eb-e3ad-470b-a830-d6d50b035b6d Serve with fried plantains on the side and enjoy!
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Gather the ingredients.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Peel the potatoes and slice very thinly (about 1/4-inch thick) or cut them into 1/2-inch cubes.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Place the cut potatoes into a bowl and cover them with salted water.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Slice the onion thinly.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb In a heavy, oven-proof, 12-inch skillet that is at least 2 inches deep, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until the onions are soft, fragrant, and turning golden.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Drain the potatoes and pat them dry.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb In a bowl, toss the potatoes with the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil and season with salt and pepper.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Add the potatoes to the onions in the skillet.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Cover and cook the potatoes over low heat until tender, stirring occasionally to keep them from sticking to the pan and burning.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs and cream, seasoning with salt and pepper.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Pour the milk and egg mixture over the potatoes and onions.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Sprinkle chopped parsley or cilantro over the eggs and potatoes.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Cook the mixture over low heat until the eggs seem mostly set, being careful not to burn them, about 5 to 8 minutes.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb If you are using a nonstick pan, you can carefully flip the frittata: Turn a plate upside down over the skillet.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Turn the skillet over so that the frittata falls onto the now right-side-up plate.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Slide the frittata from the plate back into the pan so the browned side is facing up and cook over low heat for a few more minutes.
df339ae9-8037-4a5d-8c25-3ea82bc894cb Cut the tortilla into wedges to serve. Enjoy.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Place the warm water (100 to 105 F) in a small bowl. Stir 1 teaspoon sugar into the water and sprinkle the yeast over the water. Set aside for 5 to 10 minutes, until mixture is bubbly.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Place the flour, olive oil, and salt in the bowl of a standing mixer and mix briefly using the dough hook. Add the yeast/water mixture and begin to knead. The mixture should come together as a soft, stretchy dough, pulling away from the sides of the bowl. Add a bit more flour if the mixture is too wet, and add a bit more water if the mixture seems dry, crumbly, or overly firm. Knead for 5 to 10 minutes, until dough is smooth, soft and elastic.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Oil a bowl with olive oil and place the dough in the bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let the dough rise until doubled in size.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 While the dough is rising, peel and slice the onion into very thin strips. Place them in a bowl of cold salt water and soak for 30 minutes. Drain onions well and dry them with paper towels.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Once it has risen, punch down the dough and shape into a smooth ball. Pour 3 tablespoons of olive oil into a 14-inch pizza pan with 1-inch sides. Place the ball of dough in the middle of the pan and flatten gently with your fingers. Let the dough relax for 10 minutes.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Continue to flatten the dough into the pan, flattening it and pushing it toward the sides of the pan, letting it relax in between until dough covers the bottom of the pan.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Preheat oven to 450 F. Sprinkle the onions over the top of the dough. Drizzle a tablespoon of olive oil over the onions, and sprinkle with the dried oregano.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Place the fugazza in the oven. Bake for 15 minutes, or until edges start to turn golden brown. If desired, remove fugazza from oven and top with thin slices of mozzarella cheese and sprinkle with grated Parmesan. Return to oven and bake until fugazza is golden brown and crispy around the edges. Brown onions under the broiler for the last 3 minutes of cooking if desired.
93d35ad5-3796-46f1-a656-8d38b0f96c66 Remove from the oven and cut into slices to serve.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 To make this dough in the bread machine, place all of these ingredients in the machine according to manufacturer's directions. Run the dough cycle, and let dough rest in the machine until ready to use (up to 12 hours). The longer the dough rests, the more complex the flavor will be.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 To prepare dough in a mixer: Place the flour in the bowl of a standing mixer and use the dough hook attachment to mix them together briefly. Add the remaining ingredients, and using the dough hook attachment, begin to knead them together.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Knead until dough comes together in a ball, adding a tablespoon or two more water if necessary, or some extra flour if the dough seems too wet. The dough should form a stretchy yet firm ball. Continue to knead dough until it is smooth, elastic, and no longer sticky, about 10 minutes.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a towel or plastic wrap, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size. Dough can be refrigerated overnight at this stage, which will also improve the flavor.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Punch dough down and divide into 10 equal pieces (100 grams each). Roll each piece into a smooth ball.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Take two balls of dough and place them side by side, touching closely, to form an oval. Roll the oval on the counter, horizontally, to help stick the two balls of dough together. Let the paired balls of dough rest for 5 minutes, covered with a damp towel.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Preheat the oven to 400 F. Use a rolling pin to flatten the paired dough balls into a flat oval shape, by rolling over them lengthwise in both directions. Turn the oval 90 degrees and run the rolling pin over it again. Place the flattened dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment. Use a pizza cutter to make a line from end to end, lengthwise, cutting deeply but not all the way through. Repeat with remaining dough, until you have 5 flat, double rolls on the baking sheet. Just before placing the rolls in the oven, use the side of your hand or the tips of your fingers to press down on the cut made with the pizza cutter, pressing down firmly to completely flatten the dough along this groove.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Place the rolls in the oven. Scatter 1 cup of ice cubes in the bottom of the oven to create steam. Bake rolls for 15 to 20 minutes, until golden and crusty.
56fa07f7-a258-40fa-85d8-b4a24d0765c7 Makes 5 large (double) rolls.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Place the warm (but not too hot) milk in the bowl of a standing mixer. Sprinkle the yeast over the milk and set the mixture aside for 5 minutes, until the yeast is bubbly. (Note: If you can find fresh cake yeast (more easily obtained in South America than in the US), use about 2 ounces of the cake yeast instead of the dry yeast - it adds authentic yeasty flavor to these rolls).
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Add the sugar, 2 cups of the flour, 2 eggs, the butter (cut into small pieces), and the salt. Use the dough hook attachment to knead the mixture until everything is well mixed. Add the remaining flour gradually, 1/2 cup at a time. Knead until the dough is soft, smooth, and stretchy, adding a bit more or a bit less flour, as needed.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Place the dough in a large, lightly oiled bowl and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 1/2 hours.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Divide the dough into about 30 pieces. Each piece should be around the size of a golf ball (about 2 ounces each). Roll each piece of dough into a smooth ball. Place the balls of dough about 1 inch apart on a large buttered baking sheet (or 2 smaller baking sheets).
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Lightly beat an egg, then brush the tops of the rolls with the beaten egg.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Let the rolls rise in a warm place until they have almost doubled in size, about 30 minutes.
37d25cac-4752-4626-ae2a-2bbb8f3ab265 Bake rolls until they are medium golden brown on top, about 30 to 40 minutes. Brush the tops of the rolls with the melted butter as soon as they come out of the oven, then sprinkle them with the sugar.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Gather the ingredients.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Prepare the sponge: Mix all of the ingredients in the bowl of a standing mixer, using the dough hook attachment, until well mixed. Stir ingredients together by hand with a wooden spoon, kneading with your hands if necessary, until you have a smooth dough.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Cover bowl with saran wrap and let sponge rest in a warm spot for 1 to 3 hours.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Finish the dough. Dissolve the remaining teaspoon of yeast in a 1/2 cup of lukewarm water.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Add the remaining 3 1/2 cups flour, the salt, the brown sugar, the egg, the anise, cinnamon, and softened butter and shortening to the sponge.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Knead the mixture gently with the dough hook, while adding the 1/2 cup of water (and yeast) gradually. Add more water if necessary in small amounts, kneading, to get a smooth dough. Knead until dough is smooth, shiny, and stretchy, about 10 minutes in the mixer, or 20 minutes by hand.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Place dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover loosely with saran wrap and let the dough rest for 1 hour.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Punch down and divide dough into about 20 pieces. Roll each piece into a smooth ball, and place on a large cookie sheet, about an inch apart on all sides.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Brush tops of rolls with half of the melted butter. Loosely cover with saran wrap, and let rolls rise in a warmish place for about an hour, or until they have risen 50% larger.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Preheat oven to 400 F. Gently brush rolls with the remaining melted butter and sprinkle tops with sesame seeds.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Bake rolls for about 20 minutes, turning oven down to 350 F after the first 10 minutes, or until rolls are deep golden brown.
25b0b20a-3f08-4835-a5b4-a819daaf0c64 Remove from oven and let cool.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Gather the ingredients.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Heat a large pot of salted water to boiling and add the potatoes.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Boil the potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork, about 15 to 20 minutes.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Drain the water from potatoes and let them cool.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Slice the potatoes and arrange on top of the lettuce leaves.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Pour Huancaina sauce over the potatoes and garnish with slices of hard-boiled egg and black olive halves.
8c3ac3a1-8fdc-407c-a921-b2397735b4a6 Serve and enjoy.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e In the bowl of a large standing mixer, add 4 cups flour, 1 teaspoon of the yeast, and 2 1/4 cups water. Knead with the dough hook on low speed until well mixed. Cover and let this mixture rest overnight at room temperature.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e In a saucepan, add the quinoa grains to 2 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook quinoa until it's slightly translucent and water is absorbed, about 15 minutes. Set aside to cool. Add the honey, sugar, and salt to the bowl with the flour/yeast mixture and stir briefly with the dough hook. Add 1 cup of flour, the remaining yeast, 1 cup of the quinoa flakes, and the vegetable shortening. Add the cooked quinoa (reserving 1/4 cup to garnish the tops of the bagels). Continue to knead for about 5 minutes, adding remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time, until you have a smooth, stiff dough.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Place dough in an oiled bowl, and let rise in a warm place, covered, for about 1 1/2 hours, or until doubled. (Dough can be left overnight in the refrigerator to rise as well).
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Punch down the dough and cut into about 12 equal pieces. Roll each piece until a ball and let rest for 5 minutes. Flatten each ball into a rectangle, fold long sides toward center, then roll into a tube. Repeat with remaining pieces. Let dough rest 5 minutes.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Use the palms of your hands to roll each tube of dough into a longer tube, until they are about 12 inches long. Let rest again.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Bring ends of each tube together, overlapping slightly. Place your hand through the center of the bagel and roll seam gently along the counter to even it out and seal ends together.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Fill a large soup pot with water, and add 1 tablespoon baking soda. Bring water to a boil. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a small bowl, mix reserved cooked quinoa with 2 tablespoons quinoa flakes and a large pinch of coarse salt - set aside for garnish.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Once the water is boiling, add bagels to the water in batches, boiling them for about 30 seconds on each side. Remove bagels with a slotted spoon and place on a dish towel to drain. Sprinkle tops of bagels with quinoa grains and salt mixture. Sprinkle a baking sheet with cornmeal and place the boiled bagels onto the sheet. Repeat with remaining bagels.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Place bagels into the oven and then turn the temperature down to 400 degrees. Bake until golden brown, about 20-25 minutes.
c4870235-96be-4f7e-9675-966370c92a3e Bagels will keep for one day, then should be stored in the freezer, wrapped in foil.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Gather the ingredients.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Prepare the simple syrup: In a small saucepan, bring the sugar and water to a boil, and simmer for several minutes until the sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Preheat the oven to 375 F.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Beat the cream cheese lightly with the 3 tablespoons of sugar, 1 egg yolk (reserve egg white), and the vanilla.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Gently unroll one sheet of the puff pastry dough. Use a pizza cutter or sharp knife to cut the pastry lengthwise into 3 equal strips. Repeat with remaining sheet of pastry.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Working quickly, place 3 of the strips on a baking sheet lined with parchment. Spread 1/3 of the guava paste (or jelly) lengthwise down the center of each strip. Top with 1/3 of the cheese mixture.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Brush the edges of the pastry lightly with water.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Top each one with another strip of pastry, and seal the edges well using your finger or a fork.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Whisk the egg white with 1 tablespoon water and brush over the top of the pastries.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Place the pastries in the oven and bake until they are just turning golden, about 10 to 12 minutes.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Remove from oven and brush pastries generously with the simple syrup.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Return them to the oven and bake for 3 to 5 minutes more, or until puffed, flaky, and golden.
43f40dc2-41d8-485a-9f3f-3b03696ada03 Remove from the oven and slice each pastry crosswise into individual portions. Serve warm.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Place the milk, water, sugar, and butter in a small saucepan and heat over low heat until the butter and the shortening have just melted.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Transfer the mixture to a standing mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Sprinkle the yeast over the warm (not hot) milk/butter mixture and set aside for 5 minutes.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Add 1 cup flour and mix well.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Add the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, and knead until the dough is smooth and stretchy, about 5-7 minutes. (Add more flour if the dough is too sticky or add a bit more water if the dough is too dry).
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Place the dough in a greased bowl. Cover loosely with a towel and let the dough rise in a warm place until it has doubled in bulk.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Divide the dough into 12 pieces. Roll each piece into a smooth ball.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Place the balls of dough several inches apart on a greased baking sheet. Flatten the dough balls gently with the palm of your hand.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Beat the egg with 1 tablespoon of water and brush the rolls with the egg wash.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Cover the rolls loosely with plastic wrap and let them rise for 45 minutes to an hour.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Preheat the oven to 400 F. Just before baking the rolls, prick each one lightly with a fork in 3 places. Brush rolls again with egg wash if desired.
3b38125c-1cd6-4483-b7c0-e3af34e0f839 Lower the oven temperature to 350 F and bake the rolls for 20-25 minutes or until they are light golden brown.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Put the potatoes into a steamer basket over a large pot filled 2/3 of the way to the top with water (make sure water isn't touching the bottom of steamer basket).
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Heat the water over medium heat until it is boiling, cover with a lid and steam the potatoes until they are tender when pierced with a fork, 20 to 30 minutes depending on the size of potatoes. Check occasionally and refill the water level in the pot as needed.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Remove from the heat, cut each potato in half, and let them cool until they can be handled.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Heat 1 to 2 tablespoons oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until onions are soft, about 3 to 4 minutes.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Add the Goya seasoning and cook, stirring frequently, for several minutes more. Remove from heat and set aside.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Peel the potatoes and press them into a ricer or mash them until smooth. Add the seasoned onions to the potatoes and mix well. Add the cheese and mix well.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Season the potato mixture with salt and pepper to taste. The potato mixture should be firm enough to shape pieces of it into balls, like dough. If the mixture is too wet and sticky, mix in some flour until it has the right consistency.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Shape the potato mixture into round patties, about 3 inches in diameter and about 1/2-inch thick.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Heat the remaining oil, or as much as needed, in a heavy skillet.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Cook the potato pancakes in batches over medium-low heat, about 3 minutes per side, until they are golden brown.
08593e86-daf0-4260-8687-3a95f0c001d4 Keep the potato pancakes warm in the oven, about 200 F, until ready to serve. Serve with salsa de mani.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Gather the ingredients.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Cook one of the eggs in boiling water until hard-boiled and set aside. Reserve the other egg.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the unpeeled potatoes until they are tender when pierced with a fork.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 While the potatoes are cooking, cook the onions, garlic, and aji pepper in the vegetable oil until soft and fragrant.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Add the cumin and paprika to the onions and cook 2 minutes more, stirring.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Add the beef broth and the raisins and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes more, or until most of the liquid is gone.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Stir in the green olives, if using.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Season mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat and let cool.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 When the potatoes are cooked, drain them in a colander.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 When they are cool enough to handle, peel them, and then mash the potatoes thoroughly (or pass them through a potato ricer).
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Season the mashed potatoes with salt and pepper to taste. Chill the potatoes uncovered for several hours, or overnight.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Once the potatoes are very cold, stir the reserved egg into the mashed potatoes until well mixed.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Peel the hard-boiled egg and chop into about six pieces.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 With floured hands, place about 1/4 cup of mashed potatoes in one hand, and make a well in the center.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Fill the well with 1 to 2 tablespoons of the beef mixture and a piece of hard-boiled egg.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Mold the potatoes around the beef, adding more potatoes if necessary to fully enclose the filling, and shape the whole thing into an oblong potato shape, with slightly pointy ends, about the size of a medium potato.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Repeat with the rest of the mashed potatoes. Coat each stuffed "potato" generously with flour.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 In a deep skillet or deep-fat fryer, heat 2 inches of oil to 360 F.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Fry the potatoes in batches until they are golden brown.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Drain them on a plate lined with paper towels.
b9b02b37-ac31-4f4c-9bc1-640b1adf2698 Keep the potatoes warm in a 200 F oven until ready to serve.
d2e473d6-1ee3-4f06-8277-3fde2d1eba3a Quinoa is often pre-washed before packaging, which should be stated on the box. If not, rinse quinoa thoroughly and let dry.
d2e473d6-1ee3-4f06-8277-3fde2d1eba3a Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
d2e473d6-1ee3-4f06-8277-3fde2d1eba3a Add 1/2 teaspoon of the vegetable oil if desired (this will help the salt adhere to the grains later if you are going to eat them like popcorn, but it's not necessary for popping them). Add about 1/4 cup of grain, just enough to cover the bottom of the pan with a single layer. Stir grains with a wooden spoon as they pop—you will hear a sound and the grains may jump out of the pan. Amaranth grains pop very dramatically and change from dark yellow to white, while quinoa grains have a more subtle pop and turn a toasted brown color.
d2e473d6-1ee3-4f06-8277-3fde2d1eba3a Once the grains have mostly popped, remove them from the heat and transfer to a plate to cool. Watch quinoa especially closely and remove it from the heat when it is golden brown and toasted before it starts to burn.
d2e473d6-1ee3-4f06-8277-3fde2d1eba3a Continue to pop the grains in batches. Toss popped grain with salt and serve.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Preheat the oven to 350 F. Line a 9-inch square baking pan with aluminum foil. Lightly grease the foil with vegetable oil.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Place 4 tablespoons vegetable oil, maple syrup, peanut butter, and brown sugar in a microwave-proof bowl or measuring cup. Microwave gently on low heat for 30 seconds or so, or until ingredients can be whisked together easily. Whisk in the vanilla and the salt.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Mix the oats and quinoa flakes together in a bowl. Coarsely chop the nuts and dried fruit, and stir them into the oat mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Add the liquid mixture to the oat mixture and stir until the dry ingredients are well coated. The mixture should be sticky and should start to clump together. If it doesn't, and it seems dry and crumbly, add more maple syrup to achieve the desired consistency.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Press the mixture down firmly into a baking pan. Grease a small piece of aluminum foil and use it to compress the mixture down into the pan as smoothly and firmly as possible.
d89c0fa4-36e7-4697-b330-bf1ed1c1b2fc Place pan in the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes, until grains appear toasted and smell fragrant. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Finish cooling pan in the refrigerator, and for best (least crumbly) results, wait until the mixture is well-chilled before cutting it into bars.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Cook the quinoa in 2 cups of water for 10 to 15 minutes, until the water is absorbed. Cool to room temperature.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Cook the oatmeal in 1/4 cup water and 1/4 cup milk until the liquid is absorbed. Let cool.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Place 3/4 cup warm water in a large bowl or bowl of a standing mixer and sprinkle the yeast over the water. Let the yeast rest for 5 minutes.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Stir the honey, vegetable oil, powdered milk and sourdough starter (if desired) into the yeast mixture with a wooden spoon or with a dough hook on low speed if you are using a mixer.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Add 1 cup of the bread flour and the salt and stir well.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Add the cooked quinoa and oatmeal and stir.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Add the whole wheat flour and 1 cup more of the bread flour and stir.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 When the dough starts to get stiff, turn it out onto a floured surface and begin to knead. If you are using a standing mixer, continue to knead with the dough hook.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Keep adding flour and kneading until the dough is smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes with a mixer, or 10 to 15 minutes by hand. The dough should feel slightly sticky but should not be wet and slack. You should be able to form it into a ball, and it should hold its shape.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Lightly oil a large bowl with vegetable oil and place the dough into the bowl, turning to coat it lightly with the oil. Cover loosely with plastic wrap.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Let the bread dough rise in a warm spot until it doubles in size, about 2 hours.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Oil a large loaf pan, 11 x 6 inches.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Punch down the dough and shape into a ball.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Pat and flatten into an oval shape about the length of the bread pan.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Fold the long sides in and tuck them underneath as you place the bread into the pan, so that the top surface of the bread is smooth and without seams.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Brush the top of loaf very lightly with water and sprinkle with quinoa seeds.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Let the dough rise in warm place until it has almost doubled in size.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Preheat the oven to 400 F.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 When the oven is hot, place the bread in the center of the oven.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Throw a handful of ice cubes into the bottom of the oven to create steam.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Bake for 30 minutes.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Cover the bread loosely with foil if the top is getting too brown and bake 15 minutes more. Bread should sound hollow when tapped.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Let the bread cool in the pan for 15 minutes.
5460b070-e017-4433-9f61-48fffe0cf400 Remove the bread from the pan and let cool completely.
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f Rinse the beans and soak them overnight in water.
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f Drain the beans, and cover them with fresh water (or chicken stock or beef stock if desired). Add chopped bell pepper. Bring the beans to a simmer on the stove, and cook them over low heat until they are just tender.
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f If using bacon, cook it in a heavy skillet until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and reserve for another use. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the bacon fat remaining in the skillet and cook them over low heat until they are soft, translucent and fragrant. (If not using bacon, cook the onion and garlic in a couple of tablespoons of olive oil).
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f Add the cumin and the brown sugar to the onions and continue to cook until browned, soft and fragrant.
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f Once the beans are tender, remove two cups of the cooked beans and process them in a blender with onion mixture. Add the blended beans and onion back to the rest of the beans. According to taste, season with salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce (optional).
0d16f883-948f-4417-9cdf-ec67b8f2dc7f Continue to cook beans until they are very tender, adding water if necessary or letting​ the excess water boil away until the desired texture is reached.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Gather the ingredients.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Place the anise seeds in a pot with 1 1/2 cups water and bring to boil. Remove from the heat, cover, and let cool to lukewarm.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Add the yeast, the anise seed water from previous step (including the seeds), and the sugar to the bowl of a standing mixer. Let rest 5 minutes.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Add the all-purpose flour, vegetable shortening or butter, and the salt and mix on low speed with the dough hook attachment until well blended.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Slowly add the bread flour and continue to knead. Knead the dough for about 5 minutes until it is smooth and elastic and pulls away smoothly from the sides of the bowl. Add a couple more tablespoons flour if the dough seems too sticky.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Place the dough in an oiled bowl and let rise for one hour.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Punch down the dough and separate into golfball size pieces (about 35 grams each). Roll each piece into a ball. Cover the balls with plastic wrap and let rest for 5 minutes.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Flatten each ball into a slightly oval shape, about 3 inches wide and 4-5 inches long, using a rolling pin if necessary.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Starting at one end of the oval, roll dough up into a spiral. Place seam-side down on a baking sheet.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Mix 1 egg with 1 tablespoon water and brush the tops and sides of rolls with egg mixture. Let rolls rise in a warm place for a half hour.
26d9af76-0aa1-4616-8bb2-827f4d1742b3 Bake the rolls in a preheated oven for 12 to 25 minutes until they are golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Gather the ingredients.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Scrub potatoes and cook them in a large pot of boiling water until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain and cool.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Clean aji peppers of their seeds and roughly chop them. Cook the peppers, onions, and garlic in the vegetable oil over medium heat, until everything is soft and the onions are translucent, about 5-7 minutes.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Place the cooked onion mixture, the cream cheese, the queso fresco cheese, and four of the saltine crackers in a blender or food processor.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Process the mixture until smooth, adding a little bit of the milk at a time, until the mixture has the consistency of a milkshake or a very thick cream. If mixture seems too liquid, thicken it with a few more saltine crackers.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Peel and cut the potatoes into bite-size pieces. Peel and chop the hard boiled eggs. Chop the white and green parts of the scallions (reserve the green parts for garnish). Dice the red bell pepper.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Gently toss the potatoes with the chopped eggs, the white parts of the scallions, the diced bell pepper, and the cheese sauce. Chill the potato mixture thoroughly, until ready to serve.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Sauté the bacon in a skillet until crispy. Drain the bacon slices on paper towels until cool, then crumble the bacon.
22cf3cf7-c95b-4b37-be62-adc5b1ee0236 Just before serving, garnish the potato salad with crumbled bacon and the remaining green onions.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Peel the yuca root and cut it into 3 inch long pieces.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Add the yuca to the boiling water and cook for about 30 to 40 minutes, until the yuca is very tender and can be easily pierced with a fork. It should be fall apart when poked with the fork.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Drain the yuca in a colander. Remove as many of the woody stems from the center of the root as possible. Pass the yuca through a potato ricer, or force it through a colander, to remove any remaining fibrous strings.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Season the mashed yuca with salt and pepper to taste. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Place 2 tablespoons of mashed yuca in the palm of one hand. Make a small well in the middle, and place a piece of cheese in the well. Wrap the mashed yuca around the cheese, and roll between your hands to make a round ball. Repeat with the remaining mashed yuca.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 In a deep skillet or deep fat fryer, heat 2 inches of vegetable oil to 360 degrees. Fry the yuca balls in batches until lightly golden. Drain on paper towels.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Crack 1 egg into a bowl and whisk lightly with a fork. Process the bread with the crackers.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Roll each ball in the egg and then in the bread/cracker crumbs, until well coated with crumbs.
3ae232a6-a761-4188-b3a4-cc0949d4bbb9 Fry the yuca balls a second time, just until they are golden brown and crispy. Drain on paper towels and serve warm with huancaína sauce for dipping.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake sweet potatoes until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from oven and let cool.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Prepare the empanada dough according to the recipe and let rest while sweet potato is baking.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Brown bacon in a large skillet over medium heat. When bacon is cooked, removed and cool on a plate. Reserve 1 tablespoon of bacon fat in the skillet, and discard remaining fat.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Thinly slice the onion and place slices in the skillet with the cumin, brown sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook onion over low heat until dark golden brown and fragrant.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Peel and mash the baked sweet potato and place in a bowl. Add the caramelized onions, coarsely chopped bacon, lime juice, and cheese (cut into small cubes). Season filling with salt and pepper to taste.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Divide empanada dough into 10 balls. On floured surface, roll each ball into a 5-inch diameter circle.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Place 1-2 tablespoons of the sweet potato filling in the center of the dough. Fold dough over and seal and crimp edges.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Whisk egg with a little bit of water and brush empanadas with egg wash. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown.
fba91c58-2d6b-4992-9843-47862475060b Serve warm or at room temperature. Reheat empanadas in oven or microwave.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Prepare empanada dough according to your chose recipe. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and let it rest at room temperature for one hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Place the sausages in a skillet, and cover them halfway with water. Cook the sausages until the water has evaporated then continue to cook until all sides are browned and the sausages are cooked through.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Use a spatula to crumble the sausages, and brown them in the skillet for a few minutes longer. Remove sausages from the heat, and set aside to cool.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Place the onions, cumin, and chopped peppers in the same skillet, adding a bit of vegetable oil if needed. Sauté the vegetables until softened and fragrant.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Add the potatoes and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth to the skillet with the vegetables, and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add more liquid in small amounts if necessary, and continue to cook just until the potatoes are just tender.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Stir the sausage into the potato mixture, and let the filling cool. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Preheat the oven to 375 F.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Divide the empanada dough into about 12 pieces (for medium-large empanadas), and roll each piece into a circle.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Fill each circle of dough with a couple of tablespoons of filling. Wet the edges of the dough lightly with water and fold the circle of dough in half, sealing the filling inside. Press the edges firmly to seal.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Fold the edges over in a decorative braid.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Brush the empanadas lightly with the egg yolk, and place them on a baking sheet. Bake empanadas for 25-20 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
bf42ba16-84ba-417e-a966-6bd7524d93b9 Serve empanadas warm or at room temperature.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Gather the ingredients.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Preheat the oven to 350 F.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Mix milk, salt, vegetable oil, and butter in a pot, and bring to a boil. As soon as it boils, remove from heat.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Stir tapioca flour into the milk and butter mixture.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Stir in the eggs and the cheese, and mix well.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Let mixture cool for 15 to 30 minutes so that it will be easier to handle. (You can chill it in the refrigerator for 15 minutes or so).
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 With floured (tapioca flour) hands, shape the dough into golf ball-size balls and place them on a baking sheet.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Bake rolls for 20 to 25 minutes, until they are puffed up and golden. They will rise slowly and puff up mostly in the last 5 or 10 minutes.
6e40e266-60bc-4595-9209-97b2a6a9a006 Serve warm.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Gather the ingredients.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Scrub the potatoes and place in a large pot of boiling, salted water. Boil until tender when pierced with a fork. Drain potatoes and let cool slightly.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Finely chop the shallots or onion. Chop the white part and an inch or two of the green part of the scallions into 1/2 inch lengths. Finely chop the rest of the green parts of the scallion and reserve for a garnish.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Melt the butter in a large skillet. Sauté the 1/2-inch pieces of scallion, the shallots, the cumin, and the chile powder in the butter until soft, about 5 minutes.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Add the diced tomatoes and cilantro, and cook until the tomatoes are soft and fragrant. Add the tablespoon of flour and stir briefly.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Stir in the cream and cheese, and heat until sauce just comes to a boil and cheese is mostly melted. Remove from heat.
4fda839d-242f-4791-b437-085f51c159db Slice potatoes into halves or wedges, and arrange on a platter. Pour sauce over potatoes. Garnish with chopped green onion.
ee4ff6e5-c7e3-4cfd-b300-a833f62714a1 Remove the flesh from the avocado, dice, and place in a bowl. Toss with a pinch of salt and the vinegar. Mash until creamy. Add the green pepper and onion and mix.
ee4ff6e5-c7e3-4cfd-b300-a833f62714a1 Add the garlic and chili pepper (if using) and mix to combine well.
ee4ff6e5-c7e3-4cfd-b300-a833f62714a1 Add the vegetable oil, chopped tomato (if using) and the cilantro or parsley and combine.
ee4ff6e5-c7e3-4cfd-b300-a833f62714a1 If you prefer a smoother guasacaca, place all the ingredients in a blender or food processor, and process until smooth.
ee4ff6e5-c7e3-4cfd-b300-a833f62714a1 Season with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste.
08df747f-c66c-4641-b7ad-0b269d3f1b6e Bring a pot of salted water to a boil and cook the corn kernels until they are just tender. Remove the corn to a bowl of ice water to cool.
08df747f-c66c-4641-b7ad-0b269d3f1b6e Cook the carrots and the lima beans together (in the same pot of boiling salted water) until they are crisp-tender. Drain them and place them in the ice water with the corn for at least 5 minutes.
08df747f-c66c-4641-b7ad-0b269d3f1b6e Drain the chilled vegetables well and toss them with remaining ingredients. Let the salad marinate for a couple of hours in the refrigerator if possible before serving.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Make filling: Slice the onion very thinly. Place the sliced onions in a skillet with the olive oil or palm oil, sprinkle with salt and chile powder, and cook on low heat until they are soft and golden brown (about 15 minutes).
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Add the shrimp and sauté until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Make the fritters: Thoroughly drain the black-eyed peas and place them in the food processor. Roughly chop the onion and garlic, and add it to the peas.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Remove the seeds and white parts from the inside of the chile pepper and add to the processor.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Process mixture just until very well-blended, adding a tablespoon or two of water or broth if needed.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Add flour by the tablespoon, until the mixture is stiff enough to hold a shape. Divide into 15 pieces, and shape into balls or ovals with the palms of your hand.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Heat 2 inches palm oil and/or vegetable oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Fry several fritters at a time until browned on all sides. Drain fritters on a plate lined with paper towels. Fritters can be kept warm in a 200-degree oven.
8610684e-bbd8-4bd2-953f-97f16ddcbcc1 Split fritters in half and fill with a spoonful of the onion and shrimp mixture. Serve warm.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Gather the ingredients.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Preheat oven to 350 F.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Peel butternut squash, then cut in half lengthwise and remove seeds (and the fibrous material around the seeds).
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Separate seeds from the squash, and rinse well. Place seeds in a shallow pan with 1 tablespoon butter and 1/2 teaspoon salt and toast seeds in the preheated oven until dark golden brown and crispy, stirring once or twice, about 10 to 12 minutes. Remove seeds from the oven and set aside to let cool. Note: This step is optional but encouraged.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Chop squash into 1/2 inch cubes. Peel and dice onion. Peel the sweet potato and chop into 1/2 inch cubes. Wash spinach, dry thoroughly and roll it up tightly in a bunch. Slice spinach crosswise to make thin ribbons.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Place vegetable oil and remaining 1 tablespoon of butter in a heavy stockpot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook, stirring, until onion is soft and fragrant.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Add the squash, sweet potatoes, cumin, cinnamon, and sugar to the skillet and cook, stirring often until vegetables are lightly browned.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Add the chicken stock, season with salt and pepper, then simmer vegetables over low heat until they are tender (about 15 minutes).
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Once squash and sweet potatoes are cooked through, use a slotted spoon to transfer the vegetables to a blender (reserve cooking liquid). Add coconut milk and lime juice to the blender and process until it's smooth.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Add blended mixture back to the soup and whisk gently over low heat until evenly heated through. Stir in spinach ribbons and heat for 1 minute more. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
257010ec-cd07-4012-84f5-686f4d54d40d Serve soup warm garnished with the toasted seeds. Enjoy!
a6237aa8-248a-410b-8e95-34a1f914759d Soak the thinly sliced onions in salt water for 10 minutes. Drain and let dry.
a6237aa8-248a-410b-8e95-34a1f914759d Mix the sliced onion with the rest of the ingredients in a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let the salsa marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes before serving.
a6237aa8-248a-410b-8e95-34a1f914759d Store salsa in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Scrub and wash the potatoes.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted water.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Bring to boil, and cook until the potatoes are just tender, about 20 minutes.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Drain potatoes and let cool.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Stir the chimichurri sauce into the mayonnaise.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 When potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut them into 1 inch cubes.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Toss potatoes with chimichurri mixture until well mixed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7cc288ec-1d16-4e4c-97b0-212458df6e73 Chill salad until ready to serve.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Gather the ingredients.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 In a medium bowl, whisk the garbanzo bean flour with the salt, 3 tablespoons of the olive oil, the Parmesan cheese (if using) and a generous amount of ground black pepper.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Whisk in 1 3/4 cups of water until the mixture is well blended. Set the batter aside for about 30 minutes at room temperature to let the garbanzo flour absorb some of the water.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Preheat the oven to 450 F. When it is hot, place the remaining 1/4 cup olive oil in a 12-inch pizza pan. Heat the pan in the oven until very hot.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Gradually stir remaining water into the batter mixture until it is thin enough to pour. Remove the hot pizza pan from oven, and immediately pour the batter into the pan. The batter should make a thin layer, about 1/4 inch. Place the pan back in the oven and bake until fainá is golden and crispy about 8 to 10 minutes.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Remove the pan from the oven.
e96528ae-c3fc-4b33-9960-0c1325ba4590 Cut the flatbread into pieces and serve hot.
cdfaa697-8427-47cb-b27c-b1bf86f6e9ca Peel the onion and slice it in half. Place each half cut side down, then carefully slice the onion crosswise into very thin half-moon slices. Place onion slices in a bowl of salted water and let them soak for about 20 minutes. Drain onions in a colander and briefly rinse them with fresh water. Pat dry with paper towels.
cdfaa697-8427-47cb-b27c-b1bf86f6e9ca Chop the tomato and place in a bowl. Add the juice of 1 lime and the olive oil. Add the onions and toss everything together well. Taste for seasoning, adding more lime juice if desired and seasoning with salt and pepper to taste.
cdfaa697-8427-47cb-b27c-b1bf86f6e9ca Arrange salad decoratively on a plate. Garnish with chopped cilantro.
cdfaa697-8427-47cb-b27c-b1bf86f6e9ca The salad can be covered with plastic wrap and stored in the refrigerator for up to 12 hours.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Gather the ingredients.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Bring the apple cider to a boil, and simmer until liquid is reduced to 3/4 cup. Set aside and let cool.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, whisk together 1 cup sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, vegetable oil, vanilla, and eggs.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c In a separate bowl, whisk together flour. quinoa flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Add sour cream to egg and sugar mixture. Whisk in apple cider, then whisk in the dry ingredients, stirring until just mixed. Fold in raisins and grated apple.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Line muffin tin with muffin papers. Fill muffin tins to the top. Sprinkly the top of each muffin with about 1 tablespoon of turbinado sugar. Place muffins in the oven and turn the temperature back to 350 degrees.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Bake until muffins are domed and spring back to the touch, about 18-25 minutes.
c867b925-07bb-409b-bed8-f98429ad247c Remove from oven and let cool before removing muffins from pan.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Gather the ingredients.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add the lima beans and the packet of Sazón Goya seasoning and return to a boil. Simmer beans for 8-10 minutes, or until desired tenderness.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Drain beans well and let cool for 5 minutes. Add beans to a food processor with 2 tablespoons olive oil and the cilantro.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Process beans and cilantro for 30 seconds or so. Add lemon juice, salt, pepper, cumin and process until smoooth, adding more olive oil if mixture seems too dry. Taste for seasoning and add more salt, lime juice, or pepper to taste.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Serve with chips or vegetables for dipping, or on sandwiches.
a252d8d5-086f-4352-b2ae-bef4ce735c21 Store dip in the refrigerator, in a lidded container, covered with a thin layer of olive oil. (Dip keeps for 3-4 days).
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Gather the ingredients.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 In a large bowl, mix all of the dry ingredients together.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Add 1 1/4 cups water and the milk. Stir and knead until the mixture is very smooth. Don't worry if the dough appears wet.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Let the mixture rest, covered, for about 5 to 10 minutes, to give the cornmeal time to absorb some of the liquid. (The dough should be smooth and easy to handle, without sticking excessively to your hands. If the dough seems too dry, you can add a little bit more water or milk.)
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Knead the dough for several minutes and let it rest again for 5 minutes. (The dough should be moist enough that you can shape it into patties without forming lots of cracks around the edges. If the dough is too wet to handle, add a small amount of masarepa, knead until smooth, and let the dough rest for 5 minutes more.)
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Take pieces of the dough and shape them with your hands into round disks, about 3/4 inch thick and 3 to 3 1/2 inches in diameter.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 When shaping the arepas, repair any cracks along the edges with your fingers (moistening your fingers with water will help). If the dough is cracking a lot as you shape it, knead some more liquid into the dough until it can be shaped into disks without forming large cracks.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Lightly grease the surface of a large heavy skillet (cast iron works well) with vegetable oil and heat the skillet over medium heat.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Place the arepas into the skillet in batches, and turn the heat down to medium-low.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Cook until the arepas are lightly browned on each side—about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
61209cb9-41ee-47f4-b3f2-4d44b5c46ed4 Serve and enjoy!
bcaefa39-f325-4c53-9b7e-b642dd0d0b3e Gather the ingredients.
bcaefa39-f325-4c53-9b7e-b642dd0d0b3e Heat the water and dissolve the salt in it. Remove from heat. When water is cool enough to stick your finger in, proceed with the chimichurri.
bcaefa39-f325-4c53-9b7e-b642dd0d0b3e Put everything except the olive oil into a food processor and pulse to combine. You can puree it or leave it chunky, as you prefer.
bcaefa39-f325-4c53-9b7e-b642dd0d0b3e With the motor running, drizzle in the olive oil and buzz for 30 seconds to a minute. Allow it to marinate for a few hours before serving.
bcaefa39-f325-4c53-9b7e-b642dd0d0b3e Enjoy!
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg, flour, buttermilk, sugar and a generous pinch of salt. Add some water gradually, enough to make a thick, smooth batter. The batter should not be too runny or it will not adhere to the plantain slices. Set the batter aside to rest for 15 minutes.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 Slice the ends off of the plantains. With a sharp knife make a slit in the skin of the plantain from one end to the other. Pull the skin off.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 Slice the plantain diagonally into slices about 3 inches long, and about 1/3 inch thick.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 Place the plantain slices into the batter and stir to coat them.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 In a heavy pot, deep skillet, or deep fat fryer, place the oil to a depth of about 2 inches. Heat over medium-high heat to about 350 F, or until a drop of batter sizzles well and browns lightly.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 Carefully cook the plantain in the oil (in batches if necessary) until golden brown on both sides (turning once), about 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt.
4f59bfce-e55f-4843-952d-ef7c8eeb34f4 Serve warm with peanut sauce for dipping.
ba1640dc-5452-420c-aff3-7d6652cd4ccb Sauté the bacon until crispy. Remove bacon and reserve for another use, but leave the bacon drippings in the pan.
ba1640dc-5452-420c-aff3-7d6652cd4ccb Add the chopped tomatoes, chopped scallions, and cumin to the pan. Sauté them in the bacon fat until they are soft, about 5 to 8 minutes.
ba1640dc-5452-420c-aff3-7d6652cd4ccb Add the beans (including liquid) to the pan, sugar, water, and the chicken bouillon. Bring to a boil, and simmer for 10 minutes more, until most of the water has evaporated and the beans have thickened.
ba1640dc-5452-420c-aff3-7d6652cd4ccb Remove from heat and stir in the chopped cilantro. Serve with rice.
4f82d6f1-c2c3-4a30-9e43-d1c3ecfff3c3 Place the coconut milk in a heavy saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil.
4f82d6f1-c2c3-4a30-9e43-d1c3ecfff3c3 Simmer the coconut milk, uncovered, until the liquid has evaporated and the coconut solids start to separate from the oil. Continue to cook, stirring constantly, until the coconut solids have turned a dark golden brown color.
4f82d6f1-c2c3-4a30-9e43-d1c3ecfff3c3 Stir the rice and the raisins into the pot with the coconut milk. Add the water, the salt, and the sugar, and mix well.
4f82d6f1-c2c3-4a30-9e43-d1c3ecfff3c3 Bring the water to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer the rice, covered, for about 15 to 20 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the rice remain on the stove for another 5 to 10 minutes, covered.
4f82d6f1-c2c3-4a30-9e43-d1c3ecfff3c3 Fluff the rice and serve.
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Peel the potatoes and cut them in half. Cook the potatoes in the boiling water until they are very tender when pierced with a fork.
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Carefully drain the potatoes, then return them to the pot over medium-low heat. Add the butter and mash the potatoes with a potato masher while cooking them over the stove, letting the steam escape. When the potatoes seem dry and start to come together in a sort of "dough", remove them from the heat. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Set aside until cool enough to handle. ​
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Cut the cheese into 1-inch cubes. If you are mixing two different cheeses, you can also grate the cheese.
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Take about 1/2 cup of the mashed potatoes and press into a flat disc in the palm of one hand. Place a piece of cheese in the center, and then wrap the mashed potatoes around the cheese, completely enclosing it.Shape the potatoes with your hands into the approximate form of a potato. Repeat with remaining potato mixture.
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Crack the eggs into a shallow bowl and whisk well to mix. In a separate shallow bowl, mix the flour, panko bread crumbs, salt, pepper, cumin, and smoked paprika (if using).
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Dip the potato croquettes into the egg to coat them, letting the excess drain off. Dip them into the seasoned bread crumbs. fully coating the croquette. Repeat with remaining croquettes.
e55f618f-10f0-4640-8481-10e69820981b Heat several inches of oil in a saucepan or deep sauté pan to 350 degrees. Cook the croquettes in batches, turning them as needed, until they are golden brown. Carefully remove the potatoes from the oil and drain them on a paper towel-lined plate briefly before serving.
489d14d5-4f32-41ea-83ce-de9c2e3787e0 Gather the ingredients.
489d14d5-4f32-41ea-83ce-de9c2e3787e0 To a saucepan, add the quinoa and cover it with the water. (If using quinoa flakes instead of raw quinoa, skip this step). Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes, covered. Turn off the heat and let quinoa sit, covered, for 10 minutes.
489d14d5-4f32-41ea-83ce-de9c2e3787e0 Check your bread machine directions for the correct order to add the ingredients. Add the buttermilk, bread flour, whole wheat flour, oats, butter, sugar, honey, yeast, and salt (in an order specified by the manual) to the bread machine, including the cooked quinoa (or quinoa flakes).
489d14d5-4f32-41ea-83ce-de9c2e3787e0 Program the machine for a whole grain loaf and let the bread machine cycle and bake.
489d14d5-4f32-41ea-83ce-de9c2e3787e0 Let the bread cool for at least 15 minutes before slicing. Enjoy!
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Gather the ingredients.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Use a sharp knife to cut the pointy tips off of each end of the plantains.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Score cuts through the skin down the length of the plantain in several places.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Peel the skin off the plantains, then slice each one in half lengthwise.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Slice each piece in half lengthwise again, resulting in four long slices from each plantain.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Heat the oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat and fry the plantain slices until dark golden brown on each side.
88a2f957-22bd-492f-8b7b-c0670636b036 Drain the slices on a paper towel and sprinkle with salt. Serve warm and enjoy!
20643aca-b590-4985-b37b-dc229fb25b00 Place the chopped onions, tomatoes, green onions, green pepper, garlic, olive oil, cumin, and sazón goya (or seasoning of preference) in a large skillet with the olive oil.
20643aca-b590-4985-b37b-dc229fb25b00 Cook mixture over medium heat, stirring often, until the vegetables are soft and fragrant, about 10 minutes.
20643aca-b590-4985-b37b-dc229fb25b00 Add the cilantro and continue to cook for about 5 more minutes, until the mixture is very soft and well mixed. Remove from heat and let cool.
20643aca-b590-4985-b37b-dc229fb25b00 Hogao can be stored for up to a week in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Gather the ingredients.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Melt the butter and palm oil in a skillet over medium-low heat.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Add the onions and cook until very soft and golden, about 10 minutes.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Stir in the manioc flour and cook, stirring, for 3 to 4 more minutes until well mixed and evenly toasted and lightly browned.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Stir in optional black olives and/or hard boiled eggs if desired.
8a46b6c7-c970-49b2-853b-dc1fed78b699 Serve and enjoy!
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Gather the ingredients.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Place flour(s) in a bowl. Mix in the 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Add the warm water slowly, stirring as you go, until the dough starts to come together. Keep stirring, adding a little more water if the dough is dry, until the dough forms a ball.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Turn the dough out onto the counter and knead for a few minutes, adding a little flour if it is too sticky. The dough should be soft but not sticky enough to adhere to your hands or the counter.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Let the dough rest for 10 minutes, covered with a damp cloth.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Roll out the dough into a large circle, about 1/4-inch thick. Spread about 1 teaspoon vegetable oil over the surface of the dough. Roll the dough up into a long roll.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Slice the log of dough into 8 to 10 pieces. Roll each piece out flat into a 6-inch circle. Let the circles rest, covered with a damp cloth, for 5 minutes.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Heat a flat, heavy griddle or skillet (a cast-iron skillet or crepe pan works well) over medium-low heat.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Roll the first circle of dough out as thin as possible (to about an 8- to 9-inch circle).
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Add about 1 teaspoon oil to the skillet and add a circle of dough. Cook 1 to 2 minutes, until the bread puffs up and turns light brown on the underside. Slide the roti to the side of the pan and quickly flip to brown the other side, cooking for about 1 to 2 minutes more.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Remove from the pan and place roti in a colander to cool. Cover roti with a damp towel while you cook the rest; this will help keep them from becoming hard. Add more oil to the skillet as needed.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Brush the finished roti with melted butter before serving, if desired.
68a22886-9e15-4a0d-ad26-479c14ce9871 Serve and enjoy.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Place the milk and the corn kernels in a blender and pulse briefly until the corn is coarsely ground.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Pour the corn/milk mixture into a saucepan and add the butter. Heat over medium heat until milk just comes to a boil. Remove from heat and let cool for 2 minutes.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Add the masarepa to a large heat-resistant bowl. Whisk in the crumbled cheese. Slowly pour the hot milk mixture into the masarepa, stirring with a wooden spoon.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Continue to stir mixture until it's cool enough to handle, then knead gently with your hands until you have a smooth homogeneous dough.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Season with salt to taste, and knead.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Shape the arepas by taking about 1/4 cup of the dough and forming it into a ball. Flatten it between your palms into a pancake shape, smoothing cracked edges with your fingers. Flatten pancake until it's about 1/3 inch thick and about 4 inches in diameter. Repeat with remaining dough.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Melt a tablespoon of butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Cook the arepas in batches until golden brown and crispy on both sides–about 4 minutes per side.
13a37d6b-3679-44f8-9ebf-e99812a462a8 Top the arepas with a thin slice of farmers cheese while still hot or place a slice of cheese between two arepas. Serve warm.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 If using fresh passionfruit, cut each one in half and scrape the pulp into a microwave safe bowl. Heat the pulp in the microwave for 30 seconds. Strain the pulp through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing with a spoon to extract all of the pulp and juice from the seeds. Discard seeds and reserve juice.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 Place the passionfruit pulp (fresh or thawed frozen pulp), vinegar, sugar, and crushed garlic in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-low heat.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 Simmer sauce for about 5 minutes, until the sauce reduces and thickens.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 Remove from heat and season with salt (and pepper if desired) to taste.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 Sauce may be stored in the refrigerator for up to one week.
c2fb9621-10e4-43d2-a5ef-045b84a9bfd7 Note: To make a dessert sauce, omit the garlic, the vinegar, the salt, and the pepper, and increase the sugar to 1/2 cup.
c544b48f-761b-4473-95c7-83350d3e63f7 Peel and finely chop the onion and place in a bowl.
c544b48f-761b-4473-95c7-83350d3e63f7 Mince the garlic and add the onion. Finely chop the cilantro and add to the bowl.
c544b48f-761b-4473-95c7-83350d3e63f7 Stir the red chili pepper paste into onion and garlic mixture. Add the olive oil and red wine (or red wine vinegar) to taste.
c544b48f-761b-4473-95c7-83350d3e63f7 Season mixture with salt and pepper and add lime juice to taste.
c544b48f-761b-4473-95c7-83350d3e63f7 Store pebre in the refrigerator for up to one week. It will taste spicier the day after you make it.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Gather the ingredients.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Preheat oven to 400 F.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Line a 12 x 18-inch baking pan with foil.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Scrub potatoes clean. Cut each potato in half, and cut each half into four quarters.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Toss the potatoes with the chimichurri sauce, and spread them out in a single layer in the pan.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Bake for 25 minutes, then check for doneness. A fork should be able to easily pierce the biggest pieces of potato.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b When the potatoes are golden brown and slightly crispy on the outside, and soft on the inside, remove from the oven. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
459fcc0d-35df-49a5-82f6-7a02571aef6b Serve warm and enjoy!
e6ff3fd0-1175-45fb-944d-b233707a9185 With a sharp knife, make two cuts through the skin of the tomatoes in the shape of an "x". Place the tomatoes in a pot of boiling water for 1 minute. Remove and let cool, then peel skin from the tomatoes.
e6ff3fd0-1175-45fb-944d-b233707a9185 Seed and chop two of the tomatoes, and set aside. Seed and finely chop the remaining tomato, and set aside in a separate bowl.
e6ff3fd0-1175-45fb-944d-b233707a9185 Peel the garlic cloves, and place them in the mortar (or in a food processor or blender). Add the salt, peppercorns, and oregano, and grind everything together to make a smooth paste.
e6ff3fd0-1175-45fb-944d-b233707a9185 Peel and chop the onion, and add it to the bowl. Seed and roughly chop the chili peppers, and add them to the onion/garlic mixture. Grind (or process) the mixture to a smooth paste.
e6ff3fd0-1175-45fb-944d-b233707a9185 Add the two chopped tomatoes to the mixture. Add the wine (to taste) and olive oil. Grind (or process) until smooth. Stir in the remaining finely chopped tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Gather the ingredients.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Peel and dice the potatoes and beets into 1/2 inch cubes.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Place the potatoes in a steamer basket, and steam over boiling water until tender when pierced with a fork. Remove from heat and let cool.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Steam the beets in the same way and let cool.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Cook carrots and peas in salted water according to package directions, then drain and cool.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Chop white and green parts of green onions and place in a large bowl. Chop the celery and add to the bowl along with the chopped red onion, the potatoes, carrots, and peas.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Whisk the mayonnaise, lime juice, cumin, mustard, relish, and garlic salt together and toss with the potato mixture.
d3dcb219-6d7f-43a8-9d05-23a0af0f9f06 Keep salad chilled until ready to serve. Just before serving, gently toss in the beets and cilantro. Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves and garnish with hard boiled eggs if desired.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Cut butter and shortening into small pieces and place in a heatproof bowl of a standing mixer. Bring the milk just to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Pour hot milk over shortening and butter and stir until melted. Let cool slightly. Add sugar, salt, and 1 cup flour to butter/milk mixture and stir. Add eggs and stir well.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Add yeast and mix well. Add rest of flour and mix.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Using dough hook attachment, knead dough until smooth and stretchy, adding more flour if necessary. Knead for 5 minutes. The dough should be soft, and slightly sticky.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Place dough in a lightly greased bowl and let rise in a warm place until double in size, about 2 hours, or chill overnight in the refrigerator.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Punch down dough and divide into 4 pieces. Roll one piece out into a 10-inch circle. Using a pizza cutter, cut dough into 6 equal triangles, or pizza slices.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Take 1/4 pound of the sliced ham, and cut it into thin strips. Divide the ham among the 6 triangles, placing it on top of the wide part of the triangle.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Roll the triangles up toward the point, keeping the ham inside, and place the rolls point side down on a baking sheet, curving them slightly to form a crescent shape.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Repeat with remaining dough. Brush rolls lightly with melted butter, then let rise in a warm place until doubled.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Preheat oven to 375 F. Mix egg white with 1 teaspoon sugar. Bake rolls for 10 minutes.
8c604389-ddb0-4628-9c31-1ccf80f8d888 Remove, brush with egg white mixture, and return to the oven. Bake about 10 minutes more, until golden brown.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup warm water.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Place flour in the bowl of standing mixer and stir in salt and sugar, using the dough hook attachment.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Add yeast mixture and 1/2 cup milk and mix with dough hook. Add more water, 1 tablespoon at a time, until dough comes together. Continue to knead until dough is smooth, elastic, and not sticky, about 10 minutes.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Add lard and knead until dough is smooth again.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let rest in a warm place until doubled in size.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Roll dough out on a floured surface until it's 1 to 2 centimeters thick. Dust dough with flour and fold in half. Roll out again and repeat folding two more times, letting dough rest at intervals to let the elasticity in the dough relax.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 When the dough is all rolled out for the last time to 1 to 2 centimeters thickness, let it rest for 5 minutes. Use biscuit cutters or cut circles of dough and place them on a greased cookie sheet. Use the tines of a fork to make two rows of decorative indentations across the top of the dough.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Preheat oven to 400 F.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Cover rolls loosely and let rise until doubled in height, about 30 minutes.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Bake hallullas until golden brown and puffy, about 20 to 25 minutes.
7ce7bd64-731c-4334-99bf-1c9082dd8594 Remove and cool slightly before serving.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Gather the ingredients.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Preheat oven to 400 F. Grease a cookie sheet.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Mix the two flours and the sugar in a bowl.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Stir in the grated cheese and the eggs. Mix well with a wooden spoon. Taste for salt, and add salt as needed.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Knead dough until smooth. If the dough seems too dry, add a few teaspoons of milk or buttermilk. The dough should be soft and pliable.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Let dough rest for about 10 minutes, covered with plastic wrap.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Pull off sections of dough and roll into balls that are slightly larger than golf balls. Or, to shape the dough into rings (rosquillas), first roll a piece of dough into a cylinder, then join the ends together to form a circle. The rolls do not have to be perfectly smooth—they will puff up during the last several minutes of baking.
88f0906e-76c2-4cc1-8a40-c95aa37f1d87 Place rolls on a prepared cookie sheet and bake for about 20 minutes or until golden in color and puffed. Serve warm.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 Gather the ingredients.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 In a large pot, combine the milk, whipping cream, buttermilk, and salt. Stir over medium heat until the temperature reaches 190 F (or nearly a boil). Remove from heat.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 Stir in the vinegar, one tablespoon at a time. Small curds will begin to form. Stir gently for 5 minutes or so, then let the mixture cool for 10 more minutes.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 Line a large colander with 2 to 3 layers of cheesecloth. Slowly pour the milk mixture into the colander, letting the whey (clear liquid) drain away into a bowl.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 When most of the whey has drained off and the cheese is cool enough to handle, lift the edges of the cheesecloth up and twist, wrapping the cheese securely inside the cheesecloth. Squeeze off excess whey.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 Hang the cheesecloth "bag" over the sink (use a clip to hang it from the faucet, for example) and let the whey drain for about an hour.
0b2e66c3-f637-4e69-bfd0-0a6518dc2123 Once the cheese is well-drained, store the cheese in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Alternatively, you can press the curds by following the instructions below.
80d8091f-44d2-4013-a99b-85de155dce1c Wash the collard greens well. Remove the largest stems, then gather bunches of the leaves together, and roll them up into a bundle. Thinly slice the bundles crosswise, cutting the leaves into very thin strips.
80d8091f-44d2-4013-a99b-85de155dce1c Heat the olive oil in a heavy skillet (cast iron works well) or wok over medium heat. Add the garlic and salt, cooking and stirring until the garlic is golden and fragrant.
80d8091f-44d2-4013-a99b-85de155dce1c Add the greens, and sauté 3 or 4 minutes until they are bright green in color and starting to soften.
80d8091f-44d2-4013-a99b-85de155dce1c Season greens with more salt and pepper to taste, and serve warm.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 In a large skillet, saute the cumin seeds in vegetable oil for 2 minutes or until golden.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 Add the minced garlic, chili pepper (optional), and onion; cook until soft.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 Peel the potatoes and cut them into 1/2-inch cubes.
