bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 Add the potatoes, curry powder, turmeric, ground cumin, and chicken broth and cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 Continue to cook, adding small amounts of water from time to time to keep the potatoes from sticking–until tender.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 After the potatoes are tender, cook 2 to 3 minutes more or until the outsides of the potatoes are slightly crispy and golden brown.
bb5a1b63-aa04-4137-8f1d-79e723f61516 Serve warm.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Gather the ingredients.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Place the lima beans in a large pot and cover beans with at least 3 inches of water. Let soak overnight.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Drain and rinse beans. Cover beans with fresh water, add 2 teaspoons salt to the water, and bring water and beans to a boil.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Lower heat and cook beans at a simmer for one to two hours, checking for doneness after an hour. When they are ready, the beans should be firm but tender.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Drain beans and let cool.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Slice onion into thin julienne strips. Soak the onions in saltwater for 10 minutes, then drain and let dry. Dice the tomatoes.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Whisk together the olive oil, vinegar, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Toss the olive oil mixture with the lima beans, onions, and tomatoes.
b019a0d4-2520-4ca2-8375-676ac3d8a401 Garnish with chopped parsley and serve. Enjoy!
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Melt 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a heavy soup pot.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and optional Aji Amarillo Paste. Sauté onions over low heat until soft, fragrant and translucent.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 While the onions are cooking, peel the potatoes and cut into 1-inch cubes. Set aside.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 When the onions are soft and golden, add 1 cup of the chicken stock.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Remove mixture to a blender and process until you have a smooth puree. Set aside.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Add the potatoes to the soup pot along with 1 tablespoon butter. Sauté until potatoes are fragrant and just start to turn golden.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Add onion liquid back to the pot with the potatoes, along with another cup of chicken stock and 2 cups water.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Bring liquid to a simmer, season with salt and pepper to taste, and cook potatoes until they are very tender about 20 to 25 minutes.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Mash the potatoes thoroughly in the pot with a potato masher.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 In a small bowl, whisk the egg together with the cream and milk. Whisk a cup of the hot soup mixture into the milk and cream, then add it all to the soup, whisking to blend.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Whisk in the grated cheese until melted. Season soup with salt and pepper to taste.
8fec26b3-a5e2-4d91-8e15-938a66c14ce0 Serve soup hot, garnished with chopped avocado and crumbled queso fresco cheese.
53184442-53f0-4c03-80e2-878c8740dfa5 Wash and dry the onions and cilantro, and remove stem and seeds from the roasted chile peppers (recipe here). Remove stems from cilantro.
53184442-53f0-4c03-80e2-878c8740dfa5 Roughly chop the scallions and peppers, and place them in a food processor or blender with the cilantro leaves. Process in short spurts until vegetables are well minced.
53184442-53f0-4c03-80e2-878c8740dfa5 Place vegetables in a bowl, and stir in the lime juice, cumin, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
53184442-53f0-4c03-80e2-878c8740dfa5 Store aji in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 Place the chopped onion in a small bowl with the juice of 1 lime and season lightly with salt. Set aside to marinate while the potatoes cook.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 Cook the potatoes in boiling salted water until soft. Peel the potatoes once they are cool enough to handle, then pass them through the finest disk of a potato ricer (or thoroughly mash them). Set aside.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 If using a fresh chili pepper, remove the seeds and coarsely chop the pepper. Place in a food processor or blender, along with the juice of the remaining 3 limes, the garlic, 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, and salt and pepper to taste. Process until smooth.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 Stir the lime/chili mixture into the potatoes, adding it in parts and tasting after each addition, until potatoes are seasoned to your liking. Stir in the remaining 3 tablespoons vegetable oil and season potatoes with more salt and pepper if needed. If using the jarred chili pepper paste, add the paste to potatoes 1 tablespoon at a time, until potatoes are seasoned as desired.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 To poach the chicken, fill a pot large enough to fit the chicken breasts in one layer with a couple inches of cold water; season with salt and pepper. Add chicken breasts and cook at a low simmer until just cooked through about 15 minutes. Shred the cooked chicken, place in a bowl, and mix with the mayonnaise and the marinated onions. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 Generously oil a springform pan with vegetable oil. Press half of the mashed potato mixture into the bottom of the pan. Use a small offset spatula or knife to spread the potato mixer into an even layer. Cover with the chicken salad in a smooth layer. Top the chicken salad with slices of avocado. Layer the other half of the potato mixture on top and smooth the potatoes with a knife or offset spatula.
0c8c292a-0357-4b63-8841-bd05b9f221f9 Decorate the top with parsley leaves, slices of hard-boiled eggs and sliced olives if desired. Serve chilled.
33961758-ac10-409e-ac4f-286d65020b60 Peel and coarsely chop the garlic. Heat the oil in a small skillet and sauté the garlic over medium-low heat until garlic is fragrant and just starting to turn golden. Remove from heat and let cool in the skillet with the oil.
33961758-ac10-409e-ac4f-286d65020b60 Coarsely chop the scallions.
33961758-ac10-409e-ac4f-286d65020b60 Add the garlic and oil to a blender or food processor, along with the scallions. Add the mayonnaise, aji amarillo, huacatay, and cilantro. Process until smooth.
33961758-ac10-409e-ac4f-286d65020b60 Season with salt and pepper to taste, and add more huacatay or aji amarillo if desired. Keep refrigerated until ready to serve.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Gather the ingredients.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Cut the passion fruits in half. Scrape the pulp and seeds into a small saucepan.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Heat fruit pulp over medium-low heat, stirring frequently. Heat the pulp almost to boiling, then remove it from the heat.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Strain the pulp through a fine sieve or colander.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Discard the seeds and let the juice cool.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Put the passion fruit juice, olive oil, lime juice, vinegar, honey, and salt in a blender or food processor and blend until the mixture is smooth.
d4aade68-b744-4001-aa83-203878eddbbb Store the salad dressing in the refrigerator for up to one week. Stir or shake before using.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Prepare empanada dough according to the recipe. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 10 minutes.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Grate the mozzarella and cheddar cheeses and place them in a medium bowl. Add half of the Parmesan cheese and 1/2 cup of the marinara sauce and mix well.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Divide the empanada dough into about 20 small pieces (approximately 50 g each) and gently roll each piece into a ball.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 On a lightly floured surface, take one ball of dough and roll it out into about a 4-5 inch diameter circle. Place one tablespoon of the cheese filling and one pepperoni (or another filling of choice) on the middle of the dough circle. Gently fold the circle in half to form a half-moon shape, sealing the edges firmly together with your fingers. Fold the edge over itself decoratively (see how to fill and shape empanadas).
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Place the empanada on a cookie sheet. Repeat with remaining balls of dough.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Mix egg yolk with 1 tablespoons water. Lightly brush egg mixture over tops and sides of the empanadas. Sprinkle empanadas with remaining grated Parmesan cheese.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Place empanadas in the oven and bake until puffed, shiny, and golden brown - about 20-25 minutes.
baa7a36f-8493-4d6d-b3a4-def5cf60b1f0 Serve warm with marinara sauce for dipping.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Gather the ingredients.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Place the warm water in the bowl of a stand mixer. Sprinkle the yeast over the water and let stand for 5 minutes.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Add 1 cup of the flour, the butter, and egg, and mix well using the dough hook attachment.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Add the softened butter and another cup of flour and mix well.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Add the remaining ingredients and knead until smooth, adding a bit of extra flour if the dough is too sticky. When well kneaded, the dough should be soft, shiny, and smooth.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Place the dough in an oiled bowl. Cover with plastic wrap, set in a warm location, and let rise until doubled in bulk, about 30 minutes.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Divide the dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll half of the dough into a large rectangle about 10 x 12 inches.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Brush the dough with 1 tablespoon of the melted butter. Place half of the ham slices over the dough, leaving a 1-inch border all around.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Sprinkle half of the raisins and half of the olives around over the ham.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Tightly roll up the dough lengthwise starting with the long edge, sealing the last part of the dough to the roll with some water.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Place roll, seam side down, on a parchment-lined baking sheet, and tuck the ends under slightly. Repeat with the other half of dough.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Mix the egg yolk with a teaspoon of sugar and brush the mixture onto the rolls with a pastry brush.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Lightly cover the rolls with oiled plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for about an hour.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Bake bread at 350 F for 30 to 40 minutes, until golden brown.
d4604429-092e-4c26-b911-17244cdaabf5 Remove from oven, and let it cool slightly before slicing.
ee4008fc-429f-4824-a441-af40380b641e Place the whole wheat flour, cake flour (or all-purpose flour), sugar, and salt in a medium bowl and whisk well.
ee4008fc-429f-4824-a441-af40380b641e Cut the butter into small pieces and add to flour. Use your fingers or a pastry cutter to cut the cold butter into the flour, until the butter pieces are the size of small peas.
ee4008fc-429f-4824-a441-af40380b641e Use a fork to quickly whisk in the sour cream and 1/4 cup buttermilk until you have a ragged dough. Add a bit more buttermilk if the dough is not coming together. Turn dough out on a counter and knead a few times, folding it over itself, until it's just mixed. (add more flour if it is too sticky).
ee4008fc-429f-4824-a441-af40380b641e Wrap dough in plastic wrap and press it into a flat disk. Place in the refrigerator to chill for at least an hour before rolling it out. Dough can be kept chilled for up to 2 days, or frozen for 1-2 months. Makes enough dough for 8 medium-large empanadas.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Gather the ingredients.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 In a large bowl, mix the masa harina with the water and salt, stirring well. Add more water if necessary to obtain a soft dough that does not crack around the edges when flattened.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Let the dough rest, covered with plastic wrap, for about 15 minutes.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 If using the refried beans and/or the pork, place in a blender or food processor and process until smooth. The consistency should be like a paste.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Divide the dough into about 6 pieces.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Lightly oil your hands to keep the dough from sticking to them (just a small amount of vegetable oil will do). Form each piece of dough into a ball, then make an indentation in the ball.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Place the cheese, beans, pork, or a combination of fillings in the indentation, and carefully wrap dough around the filling to seal.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Flatten the ball into a disk, about 1/4-inch thick, being careful to keep the filling from leaking out of the edges. This can take a little practice.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Wipe a very small amount of oil onto the surface of a heavy skillet (cast iron works well). Heat the skillet over medium heat, and place the pupusas in the skillet.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Once the bottom of the pupusa is browned, flip over and cook the other side, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Remove from heat and serve warm with a side of pickled cabbage slaw (curtido) and tomato sauce (salsa roja).
1f71ce4c-55b8-4235-9389-b72ee6951bc9 Enjoy!
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Gather the ingredients.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Preheat oven to 400 F.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e In a saucepan, melt butter over medium-low heat.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Whisk the flour into the melted butter and increase the heat to medium. Cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Whisk the milk into the flour/butter mixture and bring it to boil, stirring. The sauce will thicken slightly.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Whisk 2 eggs into mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 to 2 minutes more or until sauce has thickened.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Add grated cheese and parmesan and stir until melted. Remove from heat and add cayenne pepper and salt to taste.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Roll out 1 sheet of puff pastry dough on a floured surface to 12 inches square. With a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut dough into 12 3-inch-by-4-inch rectangles.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Mix the egg yolk with the water and brush the edges of half of the rectangles with the egg yolk mixture.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Place a piece of ham in the center of each rectangle that has been brushed with the egg yolk mixture. There should be an edge of dough all around the ham. Top ham the ham with 2 tablespoons of the cheese mixture.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Cover the ham and cheese with one of the plain rectangles and firmly press down around the edges to seal.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Repeat with the other sheet of puff pastry. Pastries may be frozen at this point or kept in the refrigerator for up to 6 hours before baking.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e When ready to bake, prick the top of the empanadas several times with a fork and brush tops lightly with the egg yolk mixture.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Bake 20 minutes or until puffed and golden brown.
bc022e40-8aa0-467a-8e87-68e7b3dc237e Serve hot or at room temperature.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Gather the ingredients.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Sift the flour into a bowl. Stir in 1 teaspoon of the salt and the sugar.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Blend the chilled butter and lard or shortening into the flour mixture with a pastry cutter or with 2 knives until fairly well blended.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Whisk the egg yolks with 3/4 cup water. Stir in the 1/2 cup of the water-egg mixture, a little bit at a time, until the dough starts to come together smoothly.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Keep kneading the dough, adding more of the water-egg mixture as needed (you may need a few tablespoons extra of water), until the dough is smooth. The dough will seem a bit shaggy until it has thoroughly chilled. Taste for salt and add more if needed.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Cover the dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 1 hour. When ready to use, the dough should be soft and smooth, not elastic. If you poke a hole in the dough with your finger, the indentation should remain.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and roll into desired thickness before cutting.
64a10f6f-7570-4c22-b93d-5cb603f60dda Use in your desired recipe and enjoy.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Gather the ingredients.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Prepare one recipe of empanada dough, and set aside at room temperature.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Finely chop the garlic.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Wash the spinach and remove the stems. Roll up the spinach leaves in bunches and slice crosswise into 1/2 inch strips (a rough chiffonade).
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the garlic and chile powder and sauté, stirring until garlic is golden brown.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Add the spinach (in batches if necessary) and cook briefly until spinach is wilted and soft.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Remove from heat and drain spinach in a colander. Let spinach cool briefly.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Grate the mozzarella cheese and stir into the spinach with the ricotta cheese and the parmesan. Season spinach mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Divide empanada dough into 8 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a 6 to 8-inch diameter circle. Add about 1/4 cup of filling to the center of the dough circles, and fold the dough over the filling to make a half-circle. Pinch the edges of the dough together firmly to seal them, then crimp the edges decoratively.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Place the empanadas on a baking sheet. Whisk the egg briefly, then brush egg wash over the empanadas.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Bake the empanadas for about 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden brown and slightly puffed.
fd2e89c7-0de6-4a0c-98d3-581f65b08238 Serve warm or at room temperature.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Gather the ingredients.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Place the bulgur wheat in a heatproof bowl.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 In a small pot, bring the beef broth or water to a boil.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Remove from heat and pour over the bulgur wheat.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Let the wheat rest for 1/2 hour.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Make the filling by placing 2 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet, and sauté half of the chopped onions, all of the minced garlic, all of the cinnamon, and all of the nutmeg.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 When onions are fragrant and soft, add 1/3 of the ground beef. Cook, stirring until the ground beef is well-browned.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Stir in the parsley and cook 1 to 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Drain the bulgur wheat in a colander, pressing down on the wheat with the flat side of a spoon to press out all of the excess liquid.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Place the bulgur wheat in the bowl of a food processor with the remaining (uncooked) ground beef, remaining raw onions, and mint leaves. Add 3/4 teaspoon salt and sprinkle generously with freshly ground black pepper.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Process ground beef mixture until the mixture is very smooth, like a dough.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 If you have time to chill both the uncooked beef mixture and cooked filling for several hours, it will be easier to shape the kibe.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Take golf ball-size balls of the uncooked beef mixture and press them flat into the palm of your hand.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Place 1 tablespoon of the cooked beef mixture in the middle.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Then close the "dough" around the filling and seal well.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Shape the balls into elongated football-like ovals, with pointed ends. Place kibe on a baking sheet until ready to fry.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Heat several inches of oil in a deep pot to 350 F.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Gently lower the kibe into the oil, working in batches, and cook until very dark brown and crispy.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Drain the kibe on paper towels.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Serve kibe warm with lime wedges and tahini sauce for dipping.
ef10e4c4-e45c-4b8a-b6f9-b320dbe0e0a9 Enjoy!
a7a4a9f5-d5b9-4583-baa2-97450e2db53e Cut the pork into several large pieces and place the meat in the slow cooker with 1 cup salsa, the cumin, salt, and pepper to taste.
a7a4a9f5-d5b9-4583-baa2-97450e2db53e Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours (or 4 hours on high) or until pork is fork tender.
a7a4a9f5-d5b9-4583-baa2-97450e2db53e Remove pork from slow cooker, reserving liquid, and shred finely with a fork or using a food processor (fitted with the plastic blade).
a7a4a9f5-d5b9-4583-baa2-97450e2db53e Place shredded pork and reserved liquid in a large skillet and saute until liquid evaporates and pork starts to brown slightly. Stir in remaining salsa until desired consistency.
a7a4a9f5-d5b9-4583-baa2-97450e2db53e For making pupusas, add pork and salsa back to a ​food processor, fitted with metal blade, and process with short pulses until finely ground.
37f85596-a5a3-43fe-a7d0-2434f69855ec Cut pizza into slices.
37f85596-a5a3-43fe-a7d0-2434f69855ec Top each slice of pizza with a generous slice of fainá.
37f85596-a5a3-43fe-a7d0-2434f69855ec Enjoy!
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Gather the ingredients.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Cut the beef into 1 1/2-inch pieces and place the pieces in a nonreactive bowl or dish.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Mash or crush the garlic with a heavy utensil, or with a mortar and pestle. Add a little water if necessary to make a paste.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 In a small bowl, mix the crushed garlic, 1/4 cup of the vinegar, 1/4 cup chile pepper paste, 1 tablespoon cumin, 1 tablespoon salt, and 2 teaspoons freshly ground pepper.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Pour the marinade over the beef and mix well.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Cover and marinate the beef overnight in the refrigerator. If you are pressed for time, marinate the beef for at least 1 hour at room temperature.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Prepare the grill.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Place the pieces beef onto the skewers (about 4 pieces on each skewer, depending on size).
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Make a basting mixture of 1/2 cup vegetable oil, 1/4 cup vinegar, and a pinch of cumin.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Grill the skewers for about 5 minutes on each side, or to the desired doneness. Baste the meat several times during cooking.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Serve the anticuchos with rice and corn on the cob.
4e9356b9-c44e-48d6-ab22-3d9437e00ed5 Enjoy!
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Mix flour, salt, and baking powder in a bowl. Add 2 tablespoons butter and 2 tablespoons shortening or lard and mix into the flour with your fingers until well blended.
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Add milk gradually, stirring and then kneading gently as you go, until the mixture forms a smooth dough (add more flour if mixture becomes too wet).
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Roll dough out to about 1/4 inch thickness, and use a round cutter to make 3 1/2 inch circles. (Or separate dough into about 10 pieces, shape each piece into a ball, and flatten each ball into a pancake about 1/4 inch thick). Poke a hole in the center of each with your finger.
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Add enough vegetable oil (or melt enough shortening or lard) in a small skillet to have a depth of about an inch of fat, and heat until fat sizzles when the dough is added. Fry breads in batches until golden brown on both sides, turning them once.
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Drain fried tortas on paper towels and sprinkle with sugar while still hot.
88bca515-35eb-499d-96cf-1c74b35c9bef Serve warm.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Gather the ingredients.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Place the sausages in a skillet and add enough water to cover the bottom of the skillet to 1/2 inch. Cook over medium heat until the water has evaporated, turning sausages once.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Remove the sausages from the skillet and slice (almost) in half lengthwise, leaving the two pieces attached.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Add 1 tablespoon of olive oil and place sausages in the skillet, split open and flattened. Cook over medium heat until well browned on both sides.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Split each bread roll, spread with mayonnaise, mustard, and other desired condiments and serve warm.
d42f59ef-fe14-47ac-8a60-dcf4413c6a07 Enjoy!
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Gather the ingredients.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Make the empanada dough and let it chill for several hours or overnight.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Preheat oven to 400 F.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Sauté the onion and garlic in the olive oil on low heat until onions are soft and golden, 5 to 10 minutes.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Turn the heat up to medium and add the spinach. Cook, stirring, until spinach is wilted and soft, about 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Add the flour to a saucepan. Whisk in the milk gradually until mixture is smooth.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Add the butter and place over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring constantly until mixture just comes to a boil and thickens.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Remove from heat and whisk in the eggs. Return to heat and cook, stirring until mixture comes to a boil and thickens. The sauce will be very thick, like a paste.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Remove from heat and stir in the cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Chop the cooled spinach and onion mixture. Stir chopped spinach and onions into the cheese sauce.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Roll out 1/2 of the dough very to 1/4 inch thick. Cut the dough into 4 to 5-inch rounds, using a large cookie cutter, bowl, or coffee can. Knead the scraps into a ball and let the dough rest, covered, while you roll out the other half of dough. You should end up with about 20 to 24 rounds of dough, depending on the size.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of filling in the middle of a dough round. Brush edges of the circle with water. Fold the round in half over the filling, and press down hard along the edges to seal.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Starting at one end of the pressed-down edge, fold the edge towards the middle and press down. Move your fingers over 1/2 inch and fold the edge into the middle again. Continue around the sealed edge of the empanada, folding the edge over itself, to make a twisted rope effect.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Bake the empanadas for 10 minutes, then turn the temperature down to 350 F and bake for 10 to 15 minutes more. The empanadas should be golden brown when done.
a7e3ae55-1948-4bd4-9584-8687ec5364ce Enjoy!
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Prepare empanada dough according to your chose recipe. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, and let it rest at room temperature for one hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Place the sausages in a skillet, and cover them halfway with water. Cook the sausages until the water has evaporated then continue to cook until all sides are browned and the sausages are cooked through.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Use a spatula to crumble the sausages, and brown them in the skillet for a few minutes longer. Remove sausages from the heat, and set aside to cool.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Place the onions, cumin, and chopped peppers in the same skillet, adding a bit of vegetable oil if needed. Sauté the vegetables until softened and fragrant.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Add the potatoes and 1/2 cup of the chicken broth to the skillet with the vegetables, and cook until the liquid has evaporated. Add more liquid in small amounts if necessary, and continue to cook just until the potatoes are just tender.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Stir the sausage into the potato mixture, and let the filling cool. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Preheat the oven to 375 F.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Divide the empanada dough into about 12 pieces (for medium-large empanadas), and roll each piece into a circle.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Fill each circle of dough with a couple of tablespoons of filling. Wet the edges of the dough lightly with water and fold the circle of dough in half, sealing the filling inside. Press the edges firmly to seal.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Fold the edges over in a decorative braid.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Brush the empanadas lightly with the egg yolk, and place them on a baking sheet. Bake empanadas for 25-20 minutes, or until puffed and golden brown.
862e7038-f739-4a4e-b599-16d2ab63b71e Serve empanadas warm or at room temperature.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Make filling: Slice the onion very thinly. Place the sliced onions in a skillet with the olive oil or palm oil, sprinkle with salt and chile powder, and cook on low heat until they are soft and golden brown (about 15 minutes).
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Add the shrimp and sauté until shrimp are pink. Remove from heat and season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Make the fritters: Thoroughly drain the black-eyed peas and place them in the food processor. Roughly chop the onion and garlic, and add it to the peas.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Remove the seeds and white parts from the inside of the chile pepper and add to the processor.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Process mixture just until very well-blended, adding a tablespoon or two of water or broth if needed.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Add flour by the tablespoon, until the mixture is stiff enough to hold a shape. Divide into 15 pieces, and shape into balls or ovals with the palms of your hand.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Heat 2 inches palm oil and/or vegetable oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Fry several fritters at a time until browned on all sides. Drain fritters on a plate lined with paper towels. Fritters can be kept warm in a 200-degree oven.
51846428-7dd2-45b8-8869-5ccd9451a3ab Split fritters in half and fill with a spoonful of the onion and shrimp mixture. Serve warm.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Gather the ingredients.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Heat the oil in a large, heavy-bottomed skillet over medium heat.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Add cancha corn kernels and heat, shaking the pan from time to time, until kernels start to pop.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Cover the pan loosely with a large lid so that the corn kernels don't fly out of the pan as they pop, and continue to cook, stirring frequently​ until the kernels have stopped popping and are deep golden brown, about 10 minutes.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Remove from heat and toss the toasted corn with salt. Serve warm or at room temperature.
1e1dd519-b0fa-43ba-b1b3-4957b3c9383c Store cancha in an air-tight container.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Gather the ingredients.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Split the French rolls in half lengthwise and spread the inside lightly with mayonnaise if desired.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Divide the jamon among the four rolls and place inside rolls with lettuce.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Add 1/4 cup salsa criolla to each roll.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4af2477b-9a92-4c29-a415-274c3b1a68dd Serve and enjoy!
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Gather the ingredients.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, and sugar.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Gently mix the vegetable shortening into the flour.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Place the milk and water in a saucepan and heat until almost boiling.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Stir the hot liquid into the flour mixture. Add more water (1 tablespoon at a time) if the mixture seems too dry and crumbly, or add more flour if the mixture is too wet and sticky.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Knead dough gently until well mixed and homogenous.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Divide dough into 16 portions, and roll each piece into a ball. Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Grate or finely chop cheese.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Roll each ball of dough into a 6- to 7-inch circle.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Place 1 ounce of cheese in the center of each dough circle.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Fold the dough in half over the cheese to form a semicircle.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Press down firmly along edges to seal.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Roll the edge inward over itself and press down again to seal.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Crimp edge decoratively with a fork, pressing to seal.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 In a deep-sided skillet, pot, or deep-fat fryer, heat several inches of vegetable oil to 350 F. Fry empanadas in batches, turning at least once, until golden brown.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Drain empanadas on paper towels.
43b3af3a-6a4d-417e-a947-64d271a51133 Empanadas can be kept warm in a 200 F oven for up to 1 hour before serving. Serve warm.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Gather the ingredients.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Remove the tamales from their wrappers, typically cornhusks or banana leaves.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Leave them as is or mix the tamales all together to shape them into smaller appetizer-size tamales for frying. Shaping the leftover tamales into balls works best when they are very cold. Shape the mixed tamales into bite-size balls about the size of a golf ball.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Beat the egg in a small bowl with a teaspoon of water until well-mixed.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 In a large shallow bowl, whisk together the flour, masa harina, cumin, garlic salt, pepper, and parsley or cilantro.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Dip each tamale or bite-size ball into the egg mixture, letting the excess drain off, and then into the flour mixture. Repeat with remaining tamales or tamale balls.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Heat 1 to 2 inches of vegetable oil in a heavy pot with tall sides over medium-high heat to 360 F.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Fry the tamales or tamale balls, in batches if necessary, until they are deep golden brown.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Place them on a plate covered with paper towels to cool and sprinkle them with coarse salt.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Serve warm with a dipping sauce.
57b9e340-4694-4acc-8b3f-b98dc5f52305 Enjoy!
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Mix the masarepa with the salt (and pepper if using) in a medium heatproof bowl. Add the hot water and the melted butter and mix well. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest for 10 minutes. Add a little more water if needed, if mixture seems dry and crumbly. You should be able to form pieces of dough into balls easily, without many cracks in the dough.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Reserve 2 tablespoons of dough. Divide the remaining dough into 4 pieces, and roll each piece into a smooth ball. Dampen your hands with water to help prevent cracks in the dough when rolling it.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Place one ball between 2 small ziplock bags, or 2 pieces of plastic wrap. Flatten the ball with the bottom of a heavy pan or skillet until it is about 3-4 inches in diameter and about 1/3 inch thick. You can neaten the edges of the circle with dampened fingers.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Heat about an inch of vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat, just hot enough so that a piece of dough sizzles gently.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Fry the arepas for a couple of minutes on each side, until golden.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Remove from heat and place arepas onto a plate lined with paper towels.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 When the arepas are cool enough to handle, slice into the side of the arepa with a thin sharp knife in the same way you would split open an English muffin. Hollow out a space in the arepa without slicing all the way through.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Crack an egg into a small ramekin. Sprinkle the egg with salt and pepper lightly if desired. Pour the egg into the hollowed out arepa. Seal the opening with some of the reserved dough.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Return the arepa to the hot oil and fry for 2 to 4 minutes more. Cook the arepa less if you like a runny egg and more if you prefer the egg to be more well done. Repeat with remaining arepas.
eb45194b-160c-4988-adae-4b465ce61d07 Remove from heat, season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve warm.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Gather the ingredients.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a In a medium bowl, whisk the garbanzo bean flour with the salt, 3 tablespoons of the olive oil, the Parmesan cheese (if using) and a generous amount of ground black pepper.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Whisk in 1 3/4 cups of water until the mixture is well blended. Set the batter aside for about 30 minutes at room temperature to let the garbanzo flour absorb some of the water.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Preheat the oven to 450 F. When it is hot, place the remaining 1/4 cup olive oil in a 12-inch pizza pan. Heat the pan in the oven until very hot.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Gradually stir remaining water into the batter mixture until it is thin enough to pour. Remove the hot pizza pan from oven, and immediately pour the batter into the pan. The batter should make a thin layer, about 1/4 inch. Place the pan back in the oven and bake until fainá is golden and crispy about 8 to 10 minutes.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Remove the pan from the oven.
13a88070-cdd9-48c6-8fdd-1f1f2691859a Cut the flatbread into pieces and serve hot.
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 Slice the avocados as thinly as possible and sprinkle with lime juice. Sprinkle the tomato slices with salt and pepper. Trim crusts from bread.
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 For each sandwich, start with a slice of bread spread with mayonnaise. Layer avocado slices thinly on top of the bread.
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 Spread both sides of another slice of bread with mayonnaise and place it on top of the avocado.
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 Spread the chicken salad or egg salad (hardboiled eggs mashed with mayonnaise, salt & pepper) on top of the bread, and then add a tomato slice on top of the chicken salad.
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 Top with another sliced of bread (spread on one side with mayonnaise).
2ad1cda0-1559-4fcb-b338-1229bdd16876 Slice the sandwiches into triangles and serve.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Gather the ingredients.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Prepare hogao by heating olive oil in a large stockpot. Add garlic, tomato, onions, cumin, goya seasoning, and cilantro and sauté over medium heat, stirring, until onion is very soft (about 12 to 15 minutes). Season with salt and pepper to taste.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Remove hogao from pot and set aside in a separate bowl. Add the beef bouillon cubes to the pot.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Slice the beef into strips and add to the pot. Cover the meat with water, and bring to a boil.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Simmer beef until very tender when pierced with a fork, about an hour.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Peel and quarter potatoes and add to the beef, adding more water if necessary to cover the potatoes. Simmer until potatoes are very tender. Remove pot from heat and let the meat and potatoes cool in the broth.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Remove meat and potatoes into a separate bowl and set aside. Strain the broth into a large measuring cup and reserve.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Place the masarepa into a large bowl. Stir 1 cup of the reserved broth into the masarepa, along with 2 1/4 cups of hot water and the 2 teaspoons sugar.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Season mixture with salt and pepper and set aside for 10 minutes.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Finely chop the meat and potatoes. Stir the reserved hogao into the meat and potatoes and mix thoroughly, adding a little of the beef broth and slightly mashing the potatoes.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Roll the masarepa dough into about 40 golfball-size balls.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Working with one ball of dough at a time, flatten each ball into a 4-inch circle between 2 sheets of plastic wrap.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Place a teaspoon or so of filling in the middle of the dough circle.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Fold the circle in half to make a half moon shape that encloses the filling. Seal the edges with your fingers. Repeat with all of the balls of dough.
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Preheat vegetable oil to 350 F. Fry empanadas in batches until they are golden brown (about 5 minutes).
30751ddd-dac1-4523-be35-0be05d3f805b Drain on paper towels. Serve empanadas warm with aji sauce.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Place milk, butter, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan. Bring just to a boil, then slowly stir in the flour with a wooden spoon until you have a stiff batter.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Continue to stir over heat for 2 to 3 minutes more, until well mixed, then remove from heat and set aside to cool.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Place the chicken breasts in a larger saucepan and cover with water or chicken stock. Cover, bring to a gentle boil and poach chicken until it's just cooked through about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool, reserving cooking liquid.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Shred chicken into very small pieces when cool enough to handle (you can use a food processor with the plastic blade for this).
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Cook the onion, garlic, and bell pepper in a couple of tablespoons of vegetable oil until they are soft and fragrant.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Add the shredded chicken to the vegetables with 1 cup of the reserved chicken broth and the cube of chicken bouillon. Cook, stirring until most of the water is absorbed or evaporated.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Stir 2 tablespoons of flour into the chicken mixture and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the milk and cook until mixture is thickened and creamy. Remove from heat and stir in the cheeses. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Knead the milk and flour dough lightly, adding a little more flour if necessary, until smooth. Pinch off a small piece and roll it on a lightly floured surface into a 4-inch circle (about 2 mm thick). Continue with remaining dough, stacking the circles of dough as you go. (Or roll out half the dough into a large rectangle and cut circles with a large round cookie or biscuit cutter, then repeat with the other half of the dough).
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Place about 1 tablespoon of the chicken mixture inside each circle of dough, and fold in half to close. Seal edges firmly.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 In a shallow bowl, whisk the eggs together with a 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon sugar. Place the bread crumbs in another shallow bowl.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Dip each pastry into the egg wash, and then into the bread crumbs. Set aside on a plate.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Heat 2 inches of oil in a heavy skillet with tall sides to 350 F.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Fry the risoles in batches until they are golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.
7c7af7d5-6273-44a8-bf8b-7e67a93d0d54 Risoles may be kept warm (or reheated) in a 200 F oven for up to an hour. Risoles may be prepared and breaded, then refrigerated for several hours before frying.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Gather the ingredients.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b In a large bowl, mix all of the dry ingredients together.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Add 1 1/4 cups water and the milk. Stir and knead until the mixture is very smooth. Don't worry if the dough appears wet.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Let the mixture rest, covered, for about 5 to 10 minutes, to give the cornmeal time to absorb some of the liquid. (The dough should be smooth and easy to handle, without sticking excessively to your hands. If the dough seems too dry, you can add a little bit more water or milk.)
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Knead the dough for several minutes and let it rest again for 5 minutes. (The dough should be moist enough that you can shape it into patties without forming lots of cracks around the edges. If the dough is too wet to handle, add a small amount of masarepa, knead until smooth, and let the dough rest for 5 minutes more.)
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Take pieces of the dough and shape them with your hands into round disks, about 3/4 inch thick and 3 to 3 1/2 inches in diameter.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b When shaping the arepas, repair any cracks along the edges with your fingers (moistening your fingers with water will help). If the dough is cracking a lot as you shape it, knead some more liquid into the dough until it can be shaped into disks without forming large cracks.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Lightly grease the surface of a large heavy skillet (cast iron works well) with vegetable oil and heat the skillet over medium heat.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Place the arepas into the skillet in batches, and turn the heat down to medium-low.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Cook until the arepas are lightly browned on each side—about 3 to 4 minutes per side.
2fd88d8d-8dcd-4ebc-884a-72dc6ec4299b Serve and enjoy!
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Melt the butter with the shortening and let cool.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 In a large bowl, stir together the flour and salt. Stir in the cooled butter and shortening with a fork.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Stir in the egg yolks, and mix well. Add the buttermilk gradually until the mixture starts to come together. Knead briefly until dough is smooth.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Wrap dough in saran wrap and let rest on the counter for 30 minutes to an hour.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Melt butter and oil in a skillet on medium heat. Sauté optional bacon pieces until crispy, then remove to paper towels. Add the onions and sugar to the skillet and sauté until golden and translucent. Add the hearts of palm and sauté a few minutes more.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Stir in the flour, then add the milk and lower heat slightly. Cook, stirring until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in the olives. Stir in the farmer's cheese and bacon bits, if using. Set aside to cool.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Preheat the oven to 350 F. Divide dough into 12 pieces. Roll out 10 of the pieces into circles large enough to line the bottom and sides of a standard muffin tin. It may help to roll the dough, then let it rest for a few minutes, then roll it out the rest of the way. The rest lets the elasticity in the dough relax and helps it to maintain its shape.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Line 10 muffin tins with dough circles, pressing them into the bottom and sides of the pan. Divide the filling between the 10 lined muffin tins.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Roll out the remaining two portions of dough and cut circles to match the diameter of the muffin tins. Place the circles on top of the filling, and pinch around the edges to seal them with the dough lining the tin. Seal them well so that the filling doesn't leak out during baking.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Bake pastries for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden brown.
e014c09d-0b7f-475d-b1e1-22f3eef35978 Serve hot and enjoy.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Prepare the empanada dough and let it rest for 1 hour, or overnight in the refrigerator.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Mix the pork bbq, aji sauce and grated cheese together in a bowl.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Divide the empanada dough into 18 pieces, and roll each one into a ball. Roll each ball of dough out into a 6 to 7 inch diameter circle, and let dough circles rest on the counter for 5 minutes.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Preheat the oven to 350 F.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of filling in the middle of a circle of dough, and fold dough over to make a half circle. Press the edges of the dough together firmly around the filling.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Brush the pressed edge of the semicircle with a little bit of water, and fold the edge over itself, pinching and crimping as you go to make a braid-like effect. (See How to Fill and Shape Empanadas).
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Place the empanadas on a baking sheet, 1 to 2 inches apart.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Mix the egg yolk with 1 tablespoon water and brush the mixture over the entire surface of each empanada.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Bake the empanadas until they are golden golden brown and puffed, about 25 minutes.
62374057-a497-483e-a4cb-2ac505e6296a Serve warm or at room temperature. Store empanadas in the refrigerator. Empanadas can be wrapped in foil and reheated in the oven at 325 F for 10 minutes.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Gather the ingredients.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 In a deep fryer or skillet, heat several inches of vegetable oil to 360 F.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 In a small bowl, stir the cinnamon into 1/2 cup sugar and set aside.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and 3 tablespoons sugar.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Stir in the eggs and 1/2 cup buttermilk with a wooden spoon. Add more buttermilk, slowly, until mixture has the consistency of a very thick cake batter.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Stir in the baking powder.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Using two teaspoons (or a small cookie scoop), scoop a generous teaspoon of batter and carefully drop it into the oil, using the second spoon to help scrape the dough off of the first one.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Repeat with several more teaspoons, but do not overcrowd the doughnuts or they will stick together.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Cook the doughnuts, turning occasionally, until golden brown on all sides.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Remove doughnuts from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain briefly on paper towels.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Roll the doughnuts in the cinnamon sugar while still hot.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Cook the rest of the doughnuts in batches.
6759772e-cda5-4b55-ba7e-5b6832a379d2 Serve and enjoy!
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Stir the cilantro, lime juice, and garlic into the mayonnaise.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Heat the arepas for a few minutes in a 350-degree oven, or warm them briefly in a skillet.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Heat the pulled pork in the microwave or on the stove.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Split the arepas in half, in the same way you would split an English muffin, but do not slice all the way through—leave the two halves attached at one end.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Spread the inside of arepas with 2 teaspoons of the garlic mayonnaise.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Fill each arepa with 2-3 tablespoons of the beef mixture.
4a7eca41-0870-4eb5-bb78-830d6b617937 Serve arepas warm. Filled arepas can be wrapped in foil and chilled until ready to serve, then reheated in the oven (still wrapped in foil).
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Gather the ingredients.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Add the tapioca starch to a medium bowl. Add the water gradually, 2 tablespoons at a time, stirring with your fingers as you go. The mixture will form clumps that you can break into smaller clumps with your fingers.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Keep stirring and adding water gradually until the entire mixture is in the form of medium to small clumps. You will know if you add too much water because the mixture will start to flow like a thick liquid. If that happens, add a little more starch until you find a good balance.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Pass the moistened starch through a very fine sieve into a clean bowl. Use a wooden spoon to stir the starch in the sieve to help it pass through.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Working quickly, evenly sprinkle the sifted starch over the entire skillet in a thin layer. Let the crepe cook for about 30 seconds, or until the crepe slides easily in the pan.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Flip the crepe over with a spatula or by tossing it in the air and catching it with the skillet. Cook for 30 to 40 seconds and remove to a plate. Wipe the skillet clean after each crepe and repeat.
f21cf4db-1057-451b-9e50-3a71ad2f1c08 Fill the crepe with your desired fillings and fold in half or roll it up. The crepes should be served warm because they will stiffen as they cool.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon slices until they are crispy. Set aside on paper towels to cool.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f If you're using steaks, drain the excess bacon fat out of the skillet. Slice each fillet in half crosswise to make 2 thin steaks from each.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Sprinkle with coarse salt and black pepper. Use a mallet to pound the steaks even thinner.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Heat the skillet over medium-high heat until hot and place steaks on the skillet. Cook for about 2 minutes per side, or until they reach the desired doneness. Place on paper towels to cool.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Wipe the skillet clean. Melt the butter over medium heat and fry the eggs sunny-side up until they are done to your preference.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Preheat your broiler.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Spread the inside of the buns with ketchup and mayonnaise. Place the lettuce pieces on the bottom halves of the buns.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Top with each sandwich with 2 slices of bacon, a slice of beef, a slice of ham, a slice of tomato, and a slice of mozzarella.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Place the uncovered sandwiches under the broiler briefly to melt the cheese. Keep a close eye on the sandwiches so the cheese doesn't burn.
b154b704-1f5e-4123-894d-f37000eb3f9f Remove the sandwiches from the oven and place a fried egg over the cheese, then top with the other half of the bun. Serve immediately.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Gather the ingredients.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Cut the beef into 1-inch pieces and season with salt and pepper.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Heat a heavy skillet with 1 to 2 tablespoons of oil, and sauté the beef over high heat until just browned. Add the garlic, soy sauce, and Worcestershire sauce and cook for 2 to 3 minutes more, or until the desired doneness. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Split sandwich rolls lengthwise.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Place shredded lettuce and tomato in rolls.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Divide beef among the four rolls, placing it on top of the lettuce. Drizzle with guasacaca and any other desired sauce, and top with potato sticks.
8477eaf5-ecae-444a-b943-d85a95ce3ca2 Serve and enjoy!
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Preheat oven to 350 F. Prepare cookie dough and roll out on a floured surface to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut 1 to 1 1/2 inch round cookies, and place them on a baking sheet. Bake cookies until just barely golden brown. Remove from oven and let cookies cool on the baking sheet. You should have between 30 and 40 cookies.
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Fit a large piping bag with a 1/2-inch wide round tip. Fill bag with half of the dulce de leche. If you don't have a bag and tip, you can place the dulce de leche in a ziplock bag, seal the bag, then snip off one corner of the bag with scissors, making a 1/2 inch opening.
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Pipe dulce de leche onto each cookie in a cone shape, squeezing the dulce de leche out so that it reaches the edges of the cookie then gradually lifting and decreasing the pressure as you lift the tip of the piping bag so that dulce de leche forms a generous cone shape, about 1 to 2 inches tall. Refill piping bag as needed, and top all of the cookies with dulce de leche.
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Place cookie sheet with cookies in the freezer for at least one hour.
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Place the chocolate in a large heatproof bowl over a pot of gently simmering water, making sure that the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Melt the chocolate, stirring occasionally. Work with one type of chocolate at a time, if you plan to dip the cones into different kinds of chocolate. (If you would like to temper the chocolate, which gives it a nice shine and snap, learn how to temper chocolate).
ab7567e1-249b-4488-80ec-cd6b2afa1ced Working in small batches, use a fork to dip the frozen cookie/dulce de leche cones into the melted chocolate, covering them completely and letting excess chocolate drip back into the bowl before placing cookies upright on a piece of wax paper. You can use a second fork to gently slide the cookies off of the dipping fork. Repeat with remaining cookies. Allow chocolate to cool and harden before serving. Cookies will keep for several days or store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Preheat oven to F.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 In the bowl of a standing mixer, add the cake mix, 3 eggs, 2 egg whites, 1/3 cup vegetable oil, 1/3 cup buttermilk, and 1/3 cup water. Mix for 2 minutes or until well blended.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Line the bottoms of 2 9-inch cake pans with wax paper, and divide the cake mix between the 2 pans.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, until the center of the cake springs back when lightly pressed.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Let cakes cool 10 to 15 minutes in the pans. Run a knife around the edge of the cakes and flip them out of the pans. Set aside to cool.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 While the cakes are baking, make the mousse: Sprinkle the gelatin over the water and set aside for 5 minutes. Microwave for 15 seconds or until gelatin is dissolved (do not overheat). Whisk the melted gelatin into the passion fruit pulp and set aside.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Make the cake soaking syrup: Bring 3/4 cup passion fruit pulp and 3/4 cups sugar to a boil. Boil for 1 minute, and remove from heat. Let cool and set aside. When cool, stir in 2 tablespoons rum.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Make the Italian meringue: Add egg whites to the clean bowl of a standing mixer. In a saucepan, bring 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil. Boil for 3 to 4 minutes, until the syrup starts to thicken and the bubbles are popping slowly.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Until the whisk attachment, beat the egg whites until soft peaks form.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Slowly add the hot sugar mixture to the egg whites. Pour syrup in a thin stream down the side of the bowl to prevent splattering. Work carefully to avoid burns.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Beat the meringue on high speed for 2 minutes, then reduce the speed to low and continue to beat so that the meringue will cool.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 While the meringue cools, beat one cup of whipping cream until very soft peaks form. Do not overbeat.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Fold the passion fruit/gelatin mix gently into the egg whites. Do not overmix.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Whisk a small amount of the meringue/passion fruit mixture into the whipped cream, then gently fold all of the whipped cream back into the meringue mixture.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Slice each cake layer in half horizontally, so that you have 4 layers. Line the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan with a circle of wax paper. Butter the inside of the springform pan.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Place one cake layer, cut side up, in the bottom of the springform pan. Brush the cake with 1/4 of the syrup. Spread 1/3 of the mousse over the cake.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Cover mousse with another cake layer, and brush the cake with syrup. Spread another 1/3 of the mousse over the cake.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Continue to layer, ending with the fourth cake layer. Press cake down gently into the pan. Brush top of cake with syrup. Chill thoroughly, at least 4 hours to overnight.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Pop the side of springform pan off of cake in one quick motion. Gently lift ring off, leaving the cake on base.
a41bc3cc-a7b0-415d-ad76-009d640057a9 Add sugar to two cups chilled whipping cream, and beat until stiff peaks form. Stir in vanilla. Spread whipped cream around sides of the cake and on top. You can also use a pastry bag with a star tip to pipe the whipped cream onto the top of the cake. Decorate with fruit, and serve chilled.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 Gather the ingredients.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 Lightly grease an 8-inch square cake pan and line the bottom of the pan with parchment paper. Crumble the cookies, not too finely.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 In a medium saucepan, melt the chocolate chips, butter, and corn syrup over low heat, stirring often, until smooth. Remove mixture from the heat and stir in a pinch of salt and vanilla. Stir in the 2/3 cup coconut and the crumbled cookies. Spread chocolate mixture evenly into the prepared pan, and place in the freezer until firm.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 Preheat the oven to 300 degrees. Toast the remaining 1/3 cup of coconut until lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Watch the coconut carefully to prevent burning. Once it is lightly browned, remove coconut from the oven and set aside to cool.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 In a small saucepan over low heat, melt 2 tablespoons of shortening. Add the white chocolate chips and stir over low heat until melted. Spread the white chocolate mixture evenly over the chocolate mixture. Sprinkle the toasted coconut over the top, pressing it in lightly so that it adheres to the white chocolate.
9df7b092-595e-4924-b481-ee16322e6051 Chill until firm, then slice the turron into rectangular pieces to serve. Store turron tightly wrapped in the refrigerator, and let it come to room temperature before serving.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Gather the ingredients.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e In a medium pot, place the milk and cream with the cinnamon stick. Bring almost to a simmer, then remove the pan from the heat and let it cool.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Preheat the oven to 325 F. Place the sugar in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar melts and turns a medium caramel brown.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Carefully pour the caramel into a 10-inch cake pan with tall sides, or into a 12-cup ring mold. Swirl the caramel evenly around the bottom of the pan, holding the edges of the pan with a towel (the pan may become very hot, even on the edges). The caramel will harden as it cools and may crack, which is fine.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Place the caramel-coated cake pan inside of a larger roasting pan with sides that are at least 2 inches high. Place a teapot full of water on the stove to boil.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Place the dulce de leche in a microwave-proof bowl. Heat it in the microwave briefly until the dulce de leche is very soft and spreadable.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e In a large bowl, whisk the eggs.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Add the dulce de leche and condensed milk, and whisk until well mixed.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Remove the cinnamon stick from the milk and cream mixture, and whisk it into the egg mixture. Stir in the vanilla, and add a pinch of salt to taste.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Carefully pour the egg mixture through a sieve into the caramel coated cake pan.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Place the roasting pan, with cake pan inside, into the oven. Slide the oven rack out slightly, then fill the roasting pan with the boiling water until it reaches halfway up the side of the cake pan. Slide the oven rack back in place, and close the oven door.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Bake the flan for 1 hour to 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until it has an internal temperature of around 180 F (use a thermometer to take the temperature in the middle). The flan will still seem jiggly in the middle, but it will firm up as it cools.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Remove the flan from the oven, then let the flan cool in the water bath for about 10 minutes. Remove it from the water bath, and let it cool another 10 minutes. Loosen the edges of the flan with a knife, then flip the flan out onto a serving platter.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Serve flan warm, cold, or at room temperature.
da936b30-333b-4bc9-bcb7-fc8e18d4934e Enjoy!
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Gather the ingredients.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Cut the bread into about 16 slices, each about 3/4-inch thick and ideally oval or round in shape.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Place the bread slices in a shallow baking dish, in one layer if possible. If the bread is not very stale, let the sliced bread dry out in the open air overnight if possible.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Place the milk (or wine), cinnamon sticks, sugar, and pinch of salt in a pot over medium heat. Bring mixture to a boil and let the mixture simmer for 1 to 2 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Remove cinnamon sticks.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Pour milk mixture over the sliced bread, distributing the liquid evenly over all of the pieces. Let bread soak for 20 to 30 minutes, allowing it to soak up as much of the milk as possible.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Heat a couple of inches of olive oil in a large heavy skillet until oil is hot enough that it sizzles gently when a piece of bread is adding to it. Cover a large plate with a layer of paper towels.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Whisk the eggs together in a medium bowl until very well mixed.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Use tongs to pick up a piece of the milk-soaked bread (handling it gently) and dip it into the egg, coating both sides with egg, and allowing the excess to drip back into the bowl.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Place the bread into the oil and cook until well-browned on one side.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Flip the bread and cook until both sides are golden brown, then​ carefully transfer rabanada to the plate lined with paper towels. Repeat with remaining slices of bread, cooking several simultaneously if the skillet is large enough.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Mix the cinnamon and sugar and sprinkle mixture over both sides of the cooked rabanadas. If you would like to also coat the rabanadas with a sugar syrup, heat equal parts honey or maple syrup with water and quickly dip each pastry into the hot sugar syrup.
d67a1035-1a13-4d8d-83f9-f73dc06edeae Serve rabanadas warm or at room temperature with extra honey.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Whisk together the flour, powdered sugar, salt, and baking powder in a medium bowl.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, almond flavoring, and lemon zest. Add the liquid ingredients to the dry mixture and stir briefly. Add the softened butter and work it into the dough with your fingers until well mixed (dough will be stiff).
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Add the Pisco, 1 tablespoons at a time, kneading the dough after each tablespoon, until you have a smooth, pliable dough. It should not be too crumbly.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Cover the dough with plastic wrap and let rest for 15 minutes.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Preheat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a heavy pot with deep sides to 350 F.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e On a lightly floured smooth surface, roll out half of the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch. Cut strips of dough into rectangles, approximately 2 inches wide by 4 inches long (a pizza cutter works well for this).
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Make a 1-inch long slit in the middle of each rectangle, and pull one end of the rectangle through the slit, creating a sort of bowtie/knot shape (or torn underwear, depending on your perspective). Keep the pastries covered with plastic wrap until you are ready to fry them. Roll out the remaining dough and cut and shape into cookies.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e Fry the cookies in the oil, working in batches as needed, until they are golden brown on both sides. Turn them at least once. Carefully remove them from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle them with powdered sugar while they are still warm.
c7f4c288-68fa-49b8-a3ac-3864cb3ccd8e These cookies are best the day that they are made, but will keep in an airtight container for 2 to 3 days.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Cut the panettone into one-inch square cubes, and place them in a large bowl.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Prepare the rum syrup: Place the sugar, water, cinnamon stick, pinch of salt and lime juice in a small saucepan and bring to boil. Simmer gently for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Stir in the rum and the vanilla.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Spoon the syrup over the cubed pieces of panettone, and stir to make sure all the cake soaks up some syrup. Set aside.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Make the rum custard: Place the egg yolks in a heat-proof mixing bowl. Add the sugar, cornstarch, and a pinch of salt and whisk vigorously until mixture becomes pale yellow.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Add 1 cup of cream and 2 cups of milk to a large saucepan, and heat until it just starts to come to a boil. Gradually pour the milk mixture into the egg/sugar mixture, whisking constantly.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Return entire mixture (milk, eggs, sugar) to the saucepan and cook over medium-low heat, stirring, until mixture thickens and turns glossy about 5 minutes.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Remove from heat and stir in the butter and vanilla. Let cool for 5-10 minutes, then stir in the rum. Cover with saran wrap and chill mixture in the refrigerator for about 15 minutes, or until ready to assemble trifle.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Place the whipping cream in a large bowl and stir in the sugar. Whip cream until slightly stiff. Whisk 1/2 of the whipped cream into the custard. Set aside the rest for the top of the trifle.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 In a glass bowl or trifle dish, place a layer of the cubed panettone, using about 1/3 of the cubes. Add 1/3 cup of the diced pineapple and 1/3 cup of the orange segments. Cover fruit with 1/3 of the custard mixture. Repeat layers two more times, ending with a layer of custard.
04ba3c91-1114-4006-a142-4a89a2943a62 Spread the remaining whipped cream over the top of the trifle. Decorate the trifle with assorted fruit, such as more pineapple and orange, bananas, kiwi, grated coconut, pomegranate seeds, strawberries, blueberries or raspberries. Chill until ready to serve.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Preheat the oven to 300 degrees. Place the shredded coconut in a shallow baking dish and toast in the oven, stirring occasionally, until golden brown. Once cool, place the coconut in a food processor and pulse briefly to finely chop (or chop by hand). Set aside.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Place the milk in a small saucepan with the cream of coconut and the sugar. bring the mixture to a simmer, then remove from heat.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Place the butter in the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the dough hook attachment. Pour the warm milk and sugar mixture over the butter and let cool briefly. When the mixture has cooled enough that it is just warm to the touch, sprinkle the yeast over it and set aside for 5 minutes, or until yeast looks foamy.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Add the eggs, 1 cup of flour, the salt, the vanilla, and the coconut flavoring, and mix on low speed until flour is incorporated. Add 3 more cups of flour, 1 cup at a time, and mix well. Knead for 5 minutes on medium speed. Add additional flour as needed to make a smooth, stretchy, slightly sticky dough.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Transfer dough to an oiled bowl and cover loosely. Set dough aside to rise in a warm place for about an hour.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe While the dough rises, prepare the filling: Place the condensed milk, 3 tablespoons butter, cream, toasted coconut, and a pinch of salt into a small saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat until mixture just comes to a simmer. Simmer for 3-4 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and let cool briefly before adding the coconut flavoring. Set aside to cool.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Shape the braided ring: Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and divide the dough into 3 equal pieces. Roll each piece out into an approximate 5-inch x 8-inch rectangle. Take half of the cooled filling and divide it among the 3 rectangles, spreading it in a line in the center of the rectangle, leaving a 2-inch border on the long sides and a 1-inch border on the short side. Roll each piece of dough into a cylinder, enclosing the filling. Set aside to rest for 5 minutes.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Extend each piece of dough into a long cylinder by rolling it on the counter, with your hands starting in the middle and rolling out to each side. Let rest briefly, then roll again, until cylinders are about 24 inches long.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Loosely braid the 3 pieces of dough (see how to braid bread dough), then attach the ends to form a ring. Place the ring on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover loosely and let rise in a warm place for 45 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Crack the egg into a small bowl and mix with 1 tablespoon of water. Brush the egg wash over the braid.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Bake the bread until it is golden brown and puffed, about 40-45 minutes. Remove from heat and brush with remaining filling while the bread is still hot from the oven.
3ea7ff3d-8725-4d90-a338-ee3ce962dabe Serve warm or at room temperature.
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 Place the evaporated and condensed milks in a heavy-bottomed pot with the corn syrup. Add the cinnamon sticks, baking soda, and a pinch of salt if desired. (Salt doesn't always appear in traditional dulce de leche recipes, but it intensifies the flavor).
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 Cook the mixture over medium-low heat, stirring continuously with a flat-edge wooden or silicone spoon until the water begins to evaporate into steam. Keep stirring to prevent the mixture from sticking to the bottom of the pan, where it can burn. Adjust the temperature as necessary to keep the pot just barely simmering.
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 As the mixture slowly starts to thicken and darken slightly in color, be patient and keep stirring. The entire process takes 30 to 45 minutes.
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 Continue cooking, stirring constantly, until the pot erupts in big slow bubbles and the mixture looks very thick. At this point, you should test the consistency. Lift the spoon up out of the mixture and let some of the sauce drizzle back onto the surface of the dulce de leche. If it forms a ribbon that does not disappear after 10 seconds or so, the sauce is ready. You can also check by dragging the spoon along the bottom of the pot. You should be able to see the bottom for a few seconds before the thickened caramel closes in on itself and covers the bottom again.
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 Remove the pot from heat and let it cool for 5 minutes. Take out and discard the cinnamon sticks, and stir in the vanilla.
e9a74bb1-510f-471a-bae5-de6e1ee455e2 Let the dulce de leche cool completely before you use it in a recipe or serve it.
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 Whisk the 2 tablespoons of whipping cream together with the condensed milk and set aside.
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 Add the all-purpose flour, sugar, salt, baking soda, and baking powder to a 12-ounce mug. Whisk the dry ingredients together.
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 Add the buttermilk, vegetable oil, and vanilla to the mug and mix them into the dry ingredients until everything is well mixed. (You can also mix the ingredients together in a separate bowl, and then add the cake batter to the mug—slightly less messy, but you end up with an extra bowl to wash).
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 Place the mug in the microwave and cook for 45 to 90 seconds (depending on the strength of the microwave), or just until the cake is puffy and just springs back gently to the touch. Do not overcook.
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 Remove the cake from the microwave and let cool for 3 to 4 minutes.
