Pierce cake with a wooden skewer in multiple places, then pour the condensed milk/whipping cream mixture over the cake. Top cake with whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream, sprinkle with cinnamon and enjoy immediately.
2ce1aa84-0229-4518-bc13-d45cce246e95 The cake will keep in a refrigerator for 2 to 3 days but is best enjoyed warm.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Gather the ingredients.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Place the orange juice in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer and cook until liquid is reduced to 1/2 cup. Set aside to cool.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease 2 8-inch baking pans, and line the bottom of pans with parchment paper or wax paper.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e In a standing mixer, beat butter with sugar until fluffy and well mixed.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Add eggs one at a time to the butter/sugar mixture, beating well after each.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Whisk the flour, salt, lime zest and baking powder together.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Stir the buttermilk and the vanilla into the reserved orange juice.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Add the dry ingredients to batter alternately with the liquids until just mixed.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Divide batter between the 2 pans.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Bake cakes until they spring back lightly when just touched, and a toothpick placed in the center comes back clean, about 25 to 30 minutes.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Cool the cakes on a rack.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Heat the jam gently in the microwave until it has a spreading consistency.
7fdbeae5-dab7-4354-9b46-313af4f8a08e Remove the cakes from pans. (If using dulce de leche, split each cake in half horizontally and spread the dulce de leche between the two halves, then place them back together again). Place one cake layer on the serving plate, and spread the jam over the cake. Top with the second cake layer. Dust the top of the cake with powdered sugar.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Mix the dry ingredients (flour, salt, baking powder, and sugar) together in a medium bowl.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Cut the butter into pieces, and mix butter into dry ingredients using a pastry cutter or 2 knives, until well blended.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Stir egg, egg yolk and milk together and add to flour mixture, blending gently with a fork until dough comes together. Knead a couple of times to just barely mix the dough, which should not be too crumbly nor too wet. If needed, add an extra tablespoon or so of flour or milk.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Wrap dough in plastic wrap and chill for at least 30 minutes.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Add dulce de membrillo (and pineapple preserves and raspberry jam, if using) to a small pot, with 1 to 2 tablespoons of water.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Heat over low heat, stirring frequently until mixture has melted enough to be smooth and have a spreadable consistency. (add a little more water if necessary). Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Preheat oven to 350 F. Butter a 9-inch tart pan with a removable bottom.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Roll out about 3/4 of the dough on a floured surface into a circle large enough to line the bottom and sides of the tart pan. Place the dough in the pan. Spread the filling evenly over the dough.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Roll the remaining dough into a circle, and cut thin strips of dough, using them to make a lattice pattern over the top of the tart.
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Brush the tart lightly with an egg wash (1 egg thinned with 1 tablespoon water), and bake until golden brown (about 30 minutes).
c815df55-bd8f-471d-919d-fae528a99786 Sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired, or brush with an apricot glaze. Serve warm or at room temperature.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd With a pastry brush, paint melted butter inside all of the molds of 2 mini-muffin pans.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Sprinkle sugar liberally over all of the molds, then turn the pans over and tap out the excess.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Preheat the oven to 350 F, and heat a pot of water on the stove.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Cream the butter with the sugar and the salt until fluffy.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Make sure the egg yolks and egg are at room temperature (you can warm them very briefly in the microwave if necessary). Add the eggs one at a time, blending well after each. The batter should be smooth. Stir in the coconut flavoring and the vanilla.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Fold in the fresh coconut. (If coconut is not finely grated, process it in a food processor or blender first).
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Place each cupcake pan inside of a large pan with sides, like a roasting pan. Fill each mini cupcake mold almost full with batter.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Pour the hot water into the larger pan to a depth of about 3/4 of an inch, so that the muffin pan is sitting in a water bath, being careful not to let water splash into the batter. It sometimes helps to put the pans in the oven first, and then pour the water into the bottom pan, so that the water doesn't slosh around as you are moving the pans to the oven.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Bake custards for about 15 minutes, or until they are firm to the touch and light golden brown.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Let cool for 15 minutes on a rack. To remove custards, run a knife around the edge to loosen them from the pan and then gently flip them or lift them out. If they will not come out easily, chill them first.
56e776e8-568e-45d0-80cb-8d0ca4b149cd Serve chilled.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Gather the ingredients.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Preheat oven to 350 F.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Line the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan wIth parchment paper.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 In a standing mixer, beat the eggs with 2 2/3 cups of the sugar until light in color and thick, about 5 minutes. Stir in 1 tablespoon vanilla and the almond extract.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Sift the flour with the baking powder and salt.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Fold the dry ingredients into the egg and sugar mixture, alternating with the buttermilk. Fold gently and do not overmix.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Spread the batter into the pan.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Bake for 30 to 40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean, and cake just starts to spring back to the touch.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 While the cake is baking, prepare strawberry filling: Rinse 1 pound of strawberries, remove stems, and cut strawberries in half.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Place them in a saucepan with 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons corn starch. Heat strawberries over medium heat, mashing them gently and stirring them with a spoon. Bring to a boil and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Remove from heat and strain through a fine mesh sieve, using a spatula to force strawberries through, into a bowl. Let cool.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 When the cake has cooled for about 5 minutes, use a skewer to poke holes all over the surface of the cake.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Whisk together the condensed milk, the evaporated milk and 1 1/2 cups of the cream, and pour over the hot cake.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Refrigerate cake for 2 to 3 hours or overnight, until chilled.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Beat remaining 1 1/2 cups of whipping cream with 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and a pinch of salt until stiff peaks form. .
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Leaving cake in pan, spread strawberry filling over the top of the cake.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Spread the whipped cream over, covering the strawberry filling.
f679183d-326d-48e9-b5a4-d987cbf20526 Decorate cake with strawberries and blueberries. Keep chilled until ready to serve.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 In a small bowl, stir the yeast into the 2 tablespoons warm (not hot) water. The mixture should turn foamy after a few minutes. Set aside.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Add 3 cups of the flour, brown sugar, and salt to the bowl of a standing mixture. Use the dough hook to mix well.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Add the melted butter, eggs, yeast mixture, vanilla, anise (if using) and buttermilk to the flour mixture. Knead with dough hook until mixture is smooth, shiny and pulls away from the sides of the bowl, about 5 to 8 minutes, adding the extra 1/4th cup of flour if dough seems too wet.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Transfer the dough to a lightly oiled bowl (the dough will be sticky) turning the dough to coat it lightly with the oil. Cover dough with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about an hour. Punch down the dough and chill it for several hours in the refrigerator (or overnight) to make it easier to handle.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Roll dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 3/4 inches. Cut 2-inch rounds of dough with a biscuit cutter and place them on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper that has been dusted with flour. Re-roll scraps of dough and cut more rounds.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Cover dough rounds loosely with plastic wrap and lets them rise until puffy (while the cooking oil is heating).
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Stir the 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 In a heavy skillet or pot with tall sides, heat several inches of oil to 350 F. Drop the rounds of dough into the hot oil (working in batches), and fry them until they are puffed and golden brown on both sides, turning them as needed (about 3 to 4 minutes).
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Remove the doughnuts from the oil with a slotted spoon and cool briefly, then roll each cooked doughnut in the cinnamon sugar mixture. (alternatively, you can dust doughnuts with powdered sugar).
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Warm dulce de leche gently in the microwave to soften it. Place dulce de leche in a pastry bag fitted with a piping tip with about a 1/4 inch diameter opening. Make a small hole in the side of each doughnut with the piping tip, and squeeze a couple of teaspoons of dulce de leche into the middle of the doughnut. Roll doughnuts once more in the cinnamon sugar and serve.
69c3e49a-cc60-4f6e-b0b7-396592b12be1 Note: Doughnuts can be reheated in a 300 F oven to restore freshness.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Pour the condensed milk into your heaviest pot. Stir in the cocoa powder and the salt.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Cook, stirring constantly, over low heat. Keep the mixture barely at a boil to prevent burning and sticking.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Cook for 10 to 15 minutes, stirring constantly until the mixture becomes very thick and shiny and starts to pull away from the bottom and sides of the pan.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Remove from the heat and stir in the butter and vanilla.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Chill in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes. With buttered hands, roll the mixture into 1-inch balls.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Roll each ball in the chocolate sprinkles and place in a paper cup.
c32aaa8a-20a9-4e65-9d61-b8a3c740de9b Chill until ready to serve.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Gather the ingredients.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Preheat the oven to 350 F.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Butter a 9-inch springform pan and line the bottom with a circle of parchment paper.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Place the softened butter in the bowl of a standing mixer.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Add the sugar and beat until creamy.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Add the eggs, one at a time, and beat until mixed.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Add the vanilla and mix briefly.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d In a small bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and salt.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Add the dry ingredients to the butter/egg mixture and beat until just mixed.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Press the dough into the prepared springform pan, pressing it evenly along the bottom and up the sides of the pan.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Prick the bottom with a fork in several places.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Chill in the freezer for 10 to 15 minutes.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Bake the crust for 15 minutes.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Remove from the oven.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d While the crust is pre-baking, prepare the crumb topping.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugars, and salt. (add 1 teaspoon of cinnamon if desired).
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Slowly add the melted butter while stirring with a fork, until mixture breaks up into even crumbs.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Spread the fruit filling over the pre-baked base.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Sprinkle the crumb topping evenly over the fruit.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, or until crumb topping is lightly browned.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes before releasing pan.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Dust with powdered sugar before serving.
c78da103-84c5-4744-8dac-bef07aa6d57d Serve and enjoy!
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Mix graham cracker crumbs with the two sugars, the melted butter, and a pinch of salt. Press the crumb mixture firmly into a 9-inch pie pan, covering the bottom and up sides of the pan.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Bake pie shell for 10 minutes, until golden brown.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 In a blender or food processor, purée the mango with the lime juice and the passion fruit pulp until smooth.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Whisk together fruit purée, condensed milk, eggs, and pinch of salt.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Pour the fruit mixture into the pie shell and return it to the oven.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Bake for about 15- 20 minutes more, or until the filling is just set and the center of the pie does not move when the pie pan is jiggled.
2de11c5e-57d7-4d4f-98eb-5125d4307189 Chill the pie for several hours or overnight. Serve pie chilled with whipped cream and slices of fresh mango.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Butter the sides of a 9 or 10-inch springform pan and line the bottom of the pan with a circle of wax paper. Preheat the oven to 350 F.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Make the crumb topping: Mix 1/2 cup flour, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup light brown sugar, cinnamon, and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Cut the cold butter into small pieces and add to the flour mixture. Mix butter into the flour and sugar with your fingers, rubbing the butter and dry ingredients together until the butter is well blended and the mixture is crumbly, like a very coarse meal.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Peel and slice the 2 ripe bananas into very thin slices and set aside.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Mash the 4 very ripe bananas in a small bowl. Add the oil, water, eggs, and vanilla and whisk to mix well.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 In a large bowl, whisk the dry ingredients (2 cups sugar, 2 2/3 cups flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon baking soda, 1 teaspoon salt) together.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Add the banana mixture to the dry ingredients and mix well.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Place the batter into the prepared pan. Layer the banana slices on top of the batter, then sprinkle the crumb mixture over the banana slices.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Place cake in the oven and bake until the crumb mixture is golden brown and the cake springs back to the touch in the center (or when a wooden toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out dry), about 45 to 50 minutes.
feab46f1-28cf-4120-a566-d54956caf2a7 Remove cake and cool on a rack for 15 minutes. Remove the ring and serve warm or at room temperature.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Line an 11" x 17" jelly roll pan with wax paper. Preheat oven to 350 F.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Sift the flour with the salt, almond meal, and baking powder, and set aside.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Place the egg whites in a (very clean) bowl of a standing mixer and beat until soft peaks form.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Add 1/4 cup of the sugar and continue to beat until stiff peaks form. Transfer beaten egg whites to a clean bowl.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Add the egg yolks with the remaining 1/2 cup sugar to the mixing bowl, and beat until pale yellow and tripled in volume, about 5 minutes. Add the vanilla and mix well.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Fold the dry ingredients gently into the egg yolk mixture until just blended, then carefully fold in the egg whites. Spread batter evenly into the prepared jelly roll pan.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Bake cake until it is golden and just starts to spring back to your touch, about 8 to 10 minutes. Do not overbake, or it will be difficult to roll.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Loosen the edges of the cake by running a knife around them, then turn the cake out onto a dish cloth that has been dusted with confectioners sugar. Peel off the wax paper, and dust top of the cake with more confectioners sugar.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Roll the cake up carefully in the dish towel and let it cool in the rolled-up position.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Place cold whipping cream in a large bowl and beat until medium-firm peaks form. Whisk in 2 tablespoons sugar and a touch of vanilla if desired. Whisk 1/4 cup of the whipped cream into the dulce de leche to lighten it, then fold dulce de leche mixture back into the rest of the whipped cream.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Unroll cake and spread whipped cream/dulce de leche mixture over the cake. Reroll cake, wrap with the dishcloth or saran wrap, and chill for 1 to 2 hours or overnight.
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Once the cake is thoroughly chilled, place it on a cutting board, unwrapped. Prepare caramel glaze according to the recipe, using only 3 cups confectioners sugar. While the icing is still warm, pour it over the cake, letting it run down the sides until covered. Remove excess icing from bottom of the cake and let set. Slice off ends of cake to neaten the edges (an extra treat for the chef!)
eca23af5-e46a-422f-aabc-8a38e3c99830 Chill cake until ready to serve.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Preheat oven to 350 F.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Place the cornstarch, flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl and mix briefly.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Cut the butter into small pieces and add to the flour mixture, blending with your fingers until the mixture is smooth.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Add the powdered sugar, vanilla, and Pisco, and mix with your hands until the dough is homogeneous and smooth (add another tablespoon or two of Pisco if the dough is too crumbly to form a ball). Let the dough rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Roll out dough to 3/8" thickness, and cut into 2-inch circles.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Place cookies on baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Bake cookies for 10 to 15 minutes, until they are barely golden brown. Let cookies cool 5 minutes, then transfer to rack to cool completely.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 To fill the cookies, spread one cookie with dulce de leche and top with a second cookie. Roll the edges in the coconut.
aad91331-d8e1-465c-93d5-6d0096c3fe14 Store in an airtight container.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Place the condensed milk, butter, pinch of salt, and 2 egg yolks (reserve egg whites) in a small saucepan. Heat over medium-low heat, stirring, until mixture thickens and turns a light caramel color, about 15 minutes. Be very careful to stir constantly towards the end of the cooking time, as the mixture will stick to the pot and burn easily. Stir in vanilla and set aside to cool.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 In a small bowl, mix the flour, baking powder and salt together. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Grease a large baking sheet with butter.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Place all 4 egg whites (reserve remaining 2 egg yolks) in the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. Beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Add sugar gradually while still beating, until stiff peaks form. Add egg yolks and beat to mix.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Carefully fold the dry ingredients into the egg whites, until just mixed. Place batter in a pastry bag fitted with a wide round tip. Pipe 2-inch diameter circles of batter, spaced about an inch apart, on the baking sheet. (or use a spoon to spread batter into a 2-inch circle).
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Bake cookies for 6-8 minutes, until puffed and light golden brown. Remove from oven and trim edges from cookies with a 2-inch cookie cutter if desired. Transfer cookies to a cooling rack while they are still warm, or they will stick to the pan.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Spread the bottom of one cookie with 1-2 teaspoons of the filling. Top with another cookie. Repeat with remaining cookies.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 In a small saucepan, bring 2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup water to a boil. Boil for 1-2 minutes, or until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool for several minutes. Use a fork to dip the cookies in the sugar glaze, then place them on a cooling rack to dry. Do not wrap cookies in paper until they are dry to the touch.
4cf8d857-979a-4287-8abf-dab783ba4105 Store cookies in an airtight container, or wrap them in tissue paper to give as gifts.
99710c01-7e71-4763-ac80-3d1908b79e5b Preheat the oven to 350 F. Grease a bundt pan or angel food cake pan lightly with butter or vegetable oil.
99710c01-7e71-4763-ac80-3d1908b79e5b Place all of the ingredients except for the powdered sugar in a blender. Blend until well mixed.
99710c01-7e71-4763-ac80-3d1908b79e5b Pour mixture into prepared pan. Place cake pan in the oven and bake for 35 to 45 minutes, or until the cake has risen and the middle of the cake springs back to the touch.
99710c01-7e71-4763-ac80-3d1908b79e5b Remove cake from oven and let cool in the pan for 5 to 10 minutes. Loosen cake from the sides of the pan with a knife, then invert the cake onto a plate. Place the cake right side up, and dust with powdered sugar before serving.
99710c01-7e71-4763-ac80-3d1908b79e5b Wrap cake well with plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator up to five days.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Gather the ingredients.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Preheat the oven to 250 degrees (F). Spread the almond meal and the 2 cups of flour onto a rimmed baking sheet. Toast the almond meal and the flour for 20-30 minutes, or until almond meal is fragrant and very lightly browned.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Remove toasted mixture from the oven and transfer to a bowl to set aside to cool. Spread the coconut on the baking sheet and return to the oven. Toast the coconut until lightly browned, stirring often. Remove from the oven and let cool. Once it's cool, process the toasted coconut in a food processor until it is very finely ground.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Place the softened butter in the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Add the powdered sugar. Starting on a low speed, beat the butter and sugar together until light and creamy. Add the salt, the vanilla, and the coconut flavoring and mix well. Add the toasted dry ingredients (flour, almond meal, and coconut) and mix well. The mixture should be very crumbly, but it should clump together easily when squeezed in your hand.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Wrap dough in plastic wrap and chill for 30 min to an hour. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface to about 1/3 inch thickness. If the dough is too crumbly, lightly dampen your hands and knead the dough briefly. Cut the dough into cookies - either squares or circles - and place them on a ​parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12-14 minutes, or until golden brown. Sprinkle cookies with powdered sugar while still warm.
95dd55f4-6878-4845-b0a3-7d1736946aa2 Store cookies in an airtight container.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Gather the ingredients.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Preheat oven to 350 F. Grease and dust with flour the bottom and sides of a 10-inch springform pan and line the bottom of the pan with a circle of wax paper.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Whisk dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, and salt) together.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Cream butter with brown sugar and cider. Add egg and beat well.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Mix in dry ingredients and applesauce.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Pour batter into springform pan.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Bake until cake springs back lightly to touch and a toothpick comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Remove from oven and let cool for 5 to 10 minutes.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Melt butter in a small saucepan. Add 1 tablespoon apple cider and the dulce de leche and stir with a whisk over low heat until the smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Whisk in confectioners sugar and pinch of salt. If necessary, add 1 to 2 tablespoons more apple cider to thin the glaze so that it can be spread it over the cake.
057fdf89-d801-4316-ba8f-b911c817568a Remove springform ring from the cake, and drizzle cake with dulce de leche glaze while still warm.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Gather the ingredients.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Peel and core the quince, and cut into large wedges.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Place the fruit in a pot and cover with water.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Add the lemon juice.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Bring the water to a boil and cook the fruit until it's very soft.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Drain and let cool for 5 minutes.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Process the fruit in a food processor or blender until it is smooth, about the consistency of applesauce.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Measure the fruit – you should have about 2 cups – and place it in a heavy-bottomed pot.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Add sugar equal to three-fourths of the amount of fruit and stir the sugar into the fruit. (If you have 2 cups of fruit, add 1 1/2 cups of sugar.) Add a pinch of salt.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Bring the sugar and fruit to a low boil and simmer, stirring frequently, on low heat.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Cook slowly, keeping the mixture barely at a boil and stirring often to prevent burning, until the mixture thickens.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Continue to cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is a thick paste that stays together in a ball. The mixture should seem stretchy and almost dry. The fruit will change color and become a bright orange-red.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Pour into a lightly oiled dish and let cool.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Slice when firm.
eae0a6f2-77f5-45d1-a94e-ba41a8e1d06d Fruit paste will keep for several weeks, covered, in the refrigerator.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Roughly chop the nuts. Soak the nuts, raisins, and candied fruit in the rum overnight. Drain the nuts and fruit and reserve the rum.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Cream the butter with the brown sugar.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Gradually beat in the five egg yolks, molasses, and honey.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Sift the flour with the cinnamon, pie spice, and baking powder and add to the batter, alternating with the reserved rum. Stir in nuts, raisins, and fruit.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 In a separate, clean bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites gently into the batter.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Pour the batter into a 9 x 5-inch bread pan, or into a 10-inch diameter by 2-inch cake pan.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Bake for 45 minutes, then check the cake. A toothpick inserted in the center should come out clean. If the cake is not done, return to the oven and check every 10 minutes until the toothpick comes out clean.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 To make the icing, place 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar in a bowl. Whisk in orange juice 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency, is reached. Icing should be slightly runny.
a579fa44-ea7c-4de1-a89b-23b49232c1b5 Drizzle icing over top of the cake, and decorate with raisins and nuts.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Gather the ingredients.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Preheat the oven to 250 F.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Spread the flour and the almond meal evenly onto a baking sheet. Toast the mixture in the oven, stirring from time to time, until it is fragrant and very lightly browned. Remove the mixture from the oven and let the flour and almond meal cool completely.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Place the softened butter in the bowl of a standing mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Add the powdered sugar and mix on low speed until the butter and sugar are well blended.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Beat butter-sugar mixture on medium speed until it is soft, light, and fluffy.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Add the salt, the anise extract, and cinnamon. Mix well.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Add the toasted and cooled flour-almond mixture gradually, mixing after each addition. The mixture should come together as a crumbly dough. If it is so crumbly that it won't stick together when you squeeze a handful, add another 1 to 2 tablespoons of softened butter.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Wrap the cookie dough in plastic wrap and chill for 30 to 60 minutes.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Preheat the oven to 350 F. Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1 cm or thicker, if desired (some people prefer these cookies 1/2-inch thick or more).
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Cut 3-inch diameter circles of dough and place them on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Re-roll the dough scraps and cut more cookies until you have used all of the dough.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Bake the cookies for about 15 minutes, or until they start to brown lightly around the edges. Remove from the oven.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Sprinkle the tops of the cookies generously with powdered sugar while the cookies are still warm.
f5116882-31ee-42fc-958b-6ef284fd90ef Serve and enjoy!
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Gather the ingredients.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Add the flour, salt, and sugar to the bowl of a food processor and pulse briefly.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Add the butter, cut into 1 tablespoon pieces and the cream cheese (also cut into pieces) to the bowl and pulse several times, just until mixture starts to come together.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Add the vanilla and pulse twice more briefly.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Turn dough mixture out onto a piece of plastic wrap. Bring dough together into a disc, wrap with plastic, and chill for at least 2 hours or overnight.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Roll out dough on a floured surface, to a thickness of about 1/4 to 1/8 inches and cut into 2-inch squares with a sharp knife.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Place a small dab of dulce de leche (a little less than a teaspoon) on half of the squares.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 To cover the squares with the dulce de leche, wet one finger and run it around the edge of the pastry dough with the dulce de leche.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Top it with another square of pastry, and pinch edges together, extending them slightly as you do.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Repeat until all of the pastries have "tops."
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Take a sharp knife and trim the edges of the pastries slightly, so that they are perfect squares.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Chill pastries well, at least one hour.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Preheat oven to 350 F.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Mix cinnamon with the brown sugar. (Raw cane sugar is a great option as well because it has large granules which sparkle more.)
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Whisk the egg yolk with a teaspoon of water.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Press the edges of the chilled pastries together with the tines of a fork, being careful not to pierce the filling.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Brush the pastries with egg yolk, and sprinkle with the cinnamon sugar.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Bake pastries for 10 to 12 minutes, until puffed and golden brown.
51bce5a2-31ff-48d8-8cdd-b0afade172a4 Serve and enjoy!
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Preheat the oven to 350 degrees (F).
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Grease a 12 cup bundt, tube, or angel food cake pan well with butter or vegetable shortening.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Place the cake mix in the bowl of a standing mixer. Add cocoa powder, milk, sour cream, 3 eggs, vegetable oil, vanilla, and a pinch of salt, and mix well.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Place the condensed milk, evaporated milk, 3 eggs, vanilla, and salt in a blender and pulse until well blended.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Gently warm the dulce de leche in the microwave to soften it, and then mix it with the caramel sauce. Place half of the caramel/dulce de leche mixture in the bottom of the baking pan. Reserve the remaining half.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Pour the chocolate cake batter into the pan. Pour the condensed milk/egg mixture into the pan (you do not need to mix the 2 batters). Cover pan with an oiled piece of aluminum foil.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Set the baking pan inside the roasting pan. Place the pans in the oven, then carefully fill the roasting pan with 1-2 inches of hot water.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Bake cake for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until cake springs back to the touch. Carefully remove pans from the oven (avoid sloshing/spilling the hot water).
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Let cake cool completely in the pan, or chill cake in the pan until cool.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Remove foil from the pan, and gently tap the pan on the counter. Gently loosen the edges of the cake from the sides of the pan. Invert a large plate over the top of the pan, then flip the pan so that the cake can slide out of the pan and onto the plate.
4545d76e-1a98-48e8-8374-aec60a5f3555 Heat the remaining caramel sauce/dulce de leche mixture and drizzle it over the cake. Decorate the cake with chocolate sprinkles, if desired.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Gather the ingredients.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Sift all the flour and set aside. This process will get rid of small particles and will air the flour for a nicer rise.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f In a small-sized pot, heat the milk on low heat until it's warm to the touch, about 100 F. Remove from heat.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Stir the yeast into the milk and add 1 cup flour. Mix well and set aside, covered, for 15 to 20 minutes.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f In the bowl of a large food processor, place the butter, sugar, salt, eggs, yolks, vanilla, orange juice, and orange and lemon zest. Pulse until the butter is mixed in and broken up and the mixture looks curdled.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f After 20 minutes, add the yeast mixture to the food processor and pulse briefly.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Add the remaining flour, one cup at a time, and pulse until the dough starts to come together.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Pour the dough (it will be sticky and wet) onto a lightly floured counter and sprinkle nuts, if using, and raisins on top. Use a dough scraper or a large spatula to fold and knead the dough, adding a little extra flour if necessary, until dough is well mixed and smooth, but still sticky.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Shape the dough into a ball using floured hands, and place it inside a 6- to 7-inch diameter panettone mold, bread pan, or coffee can.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Brush the top of the dough with melted butter and then place it in a warm place to rise for 3 to 4 hours until it is almost doubled in size.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Preheat the oven to 350 F. With a very sharp knife, make a cross-shaped cut on top of your dough, and then brush it with a beaten egg.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Bake the panettone until it has risen, is golden brown, and sounds slightly hollow when you tap on it gently, approximately 40 minutes.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Remove from oven and let cool off a little on a cooling rack without unmolding it.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Unmold and drizzle with glaze if desired.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Cut in slices and serve warm with softened unsalted butter on the side.
8ffc205c-e458-4bdc-b6b9-432d966b927f Enjoy!
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Gather the ingredients.
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Soak raisins for several hours (or overnight) in the rum.
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Add the rice, water, milk, cinnamon, cloves, and salt to a saucepan and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer, stirring often—until the rice is completely cooked and the liquid is mostly absorbed.
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Remove the cinnamon stick and the cloves. Add the evaporated milk and the sugar, and continue to cook over at a low boil, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens (about 20 to 30 minutes). Drain the raisins (reserve rum if desired) and stir them into the rice mixture. Cook for several minutes more.
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Remove from heat and stir in some of the reserved rum if desired. Let rice cool for five minutes, the stir in the vanilla.
516ad5b0-48f2-47d3-8625-6cf74e7aac71 Serve cold or at room temperature, sprinkled with cinnamon. Enjoy!
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Preheat oven to 200 F. To prepare the meringue: Beat the egg whites and cream of tartar until stiff peaks start to form. Gradually add the sugar and continue to beat until peaks are very stiff and sugar is dissolved. Beat in the vanilla and a pinch of salt.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper. Use a pastry bag (or a ziplock bag with one corner cut off) to pipe small dollops of meringue onto the parchment, a little bit smaller than Hershey's kisses. Or pipe the meringue in strips which can be crumbled once they are cooked and used to decorate the outside of the cake.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Bake meringue pieces for at least and hour and a half, until they are dry and completely crispy. Keep meringues in an airtight container or closed oven until ready to use.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Prepare sponge cake recipe or angel food cake in two 9 inch cake pans and bake. Cool completely in pans, then remove carefully.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Peel and slice peaches and place sliced peaches in a strainer over a bowl. Toss peach slices with 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar. Let peaches rest for about 20 minutes, reserving the peach juice that drains into the bowl.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Bring 1 cup water, 1 cup sugar, and reserved peach juice to a boil, and simmer until sugar is dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Stir in vanilla, a pinch of salt, and optional rum or vodka, if desired.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Stir 2 tablespoons sugar into the whipping cream and whip until medium-stiff peaks form. Stir vanilla into the whipped cream, and refrigerate until ready to assemble the cake.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 To assemble cake: Flip sponge cakes upside down and brush each cake generously with the peach syrup, soaking the cakes.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Place one cake layer right side up on a serving platter. Spread some whipped cream over the cake, then crumble some of the meringue pieces and sprinkle the crumbled meringue (about 1/2 cup) over the whipped cream. Add a generous layer of peach slices (reserving some to decorate the top of the cake), then top with the second cake layer.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Spread whipped cream on the sides and top of the cake. Press meringue "kisses" or meringue crumbs into the side of the cake, and decorate the top of cake with peach slices, more whipped cream, and/or more pieces of meringue.
bcdddf86-526f-494d-a50e-5796e14f4f54 Chill cake thoroughly before serving.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Place the dried fruit in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Set aside to cool.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Add the purple corn to a large pot and cover with 10 cups of water.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Chop the pineapple into small bite-size pieces and reserve. Add the pineapple rind to the pot.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Quarter the quince (or substitute a green apple) and add to the pot, along with the cinnamon sticks and the cloves.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Bring water to a boil, and boil uncovered for about 30 minutes, until liquid is a deep purple color and the quince is very soft.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Strain the liquid, and return to pot. Discard the corn, quince, cinnamon sticks, cloves, and pineapple rind.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Separate 1/2 cup of the liquid into a small bowl. Stir the cornstarch into the separated liquid until completely mixed and set aside.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Add the sugar, pineapple pieces, and a pinch of salt to the liquid remaining in the pot. Peel and dice an apple and add to the mixture along with the rehydrated dried fruit.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Bring mixture to a boil and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until apple is soft.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Whisk the cornstarch mixture into the simmering mixture and continue to cook, stirring constantly, for about 5 minutes more or until mixture has thickened.
24afd3c3-a538-42ca-9fb9-541d156e08ff Remove from heat stir in the lime juice. Serve chilled or at room temperature, sprinkled with cinnamon.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Soak the raisins in the rum (overnight if possible).
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Preheat the oven to 325 degrees.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Butter a 9-inch round cake pan, or 9-inch square brownie pan, and line bottom of the pan with wax paper or parchment.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Finely grate the manioc root (easily done in a food processor). Stir the coconut and grated cassava together with the cinnamon and sugar in a large bowl.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, coconut milk, vanilla, almond extract, and salt.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Stir the liquid ingredients into the coconut mixture. Stir in the melted butter. Stir in the raisins and the rum.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Pour the batter into the prepared pan (or graham cracker crust if using).
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Bake for 1 hour, until golden brown on top.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Run a knife around the edge of the pan while the cake is still warm, then let cool in the pan.
c6e98295-1101-4522-8e3d-3a74db6cfc1f Cut into small squares or slices and serve. This cake is delicious warm or cold, with a dollop of whipped cream.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Make the Sponge: Place 1 1/2 cups flour, 2/3 cup water, 2 tablespoons apricot jam, and 1 teaspoon yeast in a small bowl and whisk together. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and set in a warm place to rest for 3 hours.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Make the Dough: In the bowl of a standing mixer, add the sponge, 3/4 cup flour, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1 teaspoon yeast. Use the hook attachment to knead the dough until the mixture is smooth and stretchy, about 3-5 minutes.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Add 3 egg yolks, one at a time, and knead until dough is smooth, shiny, and stretchy.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Cover dough with plastic wrap and allow to rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 2 hours.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Return dough to the mixer, and add salt, vanilla, lemon and orange flavoring, honey, and 1 teaspoon yeast. Knead for 1 minute.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Add 3 egg yolks and knead until incorporated. Add the 12 tablespoons of softened butter, one tablespoon at a time. Knead until dough is soft, shiny and very stretchy, about 5 minutes. The dough should pull away from the sides of the bowl.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Toss the chopped raisins, cherries and pecans with 2 tablespoons of flour. Add them to the dough and knead briefly, until just mixed in.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 The next morning, turn the dough out onto a floured surface and shape into a ball. Place dough inside of a 6-inch diameter panettone mold, or use a clean, buttered coffee can lined with parchment paper. Make a small cross in the top of the dough with scissors.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Let dough rise in a warm place until tripled in size, which may take several hours since the dough is cold from the refrigerator.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Preheat the oven to 375 F for 30 minutes.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Place the panettone in the oven, and lower the oven temperature to 325 F.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Bake the panettone for about 1 hour, until it has risen high and springs back a little when pressed on top (like a muffin).
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Let panettone cool in the pan on a rack.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Make icing (optional): Melt 2 tablespoons butter, and whisk into 1 cup powdered sugar. Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, a pinch of salt, and 1 to 2 tablespoons of milk until desired consistency is reached. Drizzle icing decoratively over top of panettone.
86d3fcd8-3b90-4027-b5b5-044e1f241872 Store panettone wrapped in plastic for up to 1 week.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Gather the ingredients.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Place the cornstarch in a small bowl. Slowly whisk in 1 cup of the milk (or more if needed) until cornstarch is well incorporated and you have a smooth mixture. Pour the remaining milk into a heavy saucepan. The cornstarch has a detectable flavor at first, which goes away once the natilla is thoroughly cooked.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Grate the panela and add it to the milk mixture (or add the brown sugar and molasses).
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Add the baking soda, cinnamon sticks, and salt. Whisk to mix well.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Heat the milk-sugar mixture over medium-low heat, stirring, and bring just to a boil. Take out the cinnamon sticks and cloves.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Whisk in the milk-cornstarch mixture and continue to cook, stirring constantly, until it starts to thicken. Stir in the coconut, if using.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Cook the mixture until has thickened enough that you can see the bottom of the pan for several seconds when you stir (do not let it come all the way to a boil), about 10 to 12 minutes. Stir constantly so that the cornstarch doesn't clump, and the mixture doesn't burn.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Add raisins and/or nuts if desired, and remove from heat. Stir in the butter and vanilla.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Pour the mixture into a greased 8-inch square glass pan or in any greased mold. Refrigerate until firm.
544e8b2c-0d05-40e9-b96a-a908fb25cf12 Sprinkle natilla generously with powdered sugar. Cut into 3-inch rectangular pieces to serve.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Gather the ingredients.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad In a deep fryer or skillet, heat several inches of vegetable oil to 360 F.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad In a small bowl, stir the cinnamon into 1/2 cup sugar and set aside.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad In another bowl, mix together the flour, salt, and 3 tablespoons sugar.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Stir in the eggs and 1/2 cup buttermilk with a wooden spoon. Add more buttermilk, slowly, until mixture has the consistency of a very thick cake batter.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Stir in the baking powder.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Using two teaspoons (or a small cookie scoop), scoop a generous teaspoon of batter and carefully drop it into the oil, using the second spoon to help scrape the dough off of the first one.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Repeat with several more teaspoons, but do not overcrowd the doughnuts or they will stick together.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Cook the doughnuts, turning occasionally, until golden brown on all sides.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Remove doughnuts from the oil with a slotted spoon and drain briefly on paper towels.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Roll the doughnuts in the cinnamon sugar while still hot.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Cook the rest of the doughnuts in batches.
c2b3280c-3fe0-49d2-8740-538ddae49cad Serve and enjoy!
False False

LatinAmericanRecipes ID recipeIngredient
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 2 medium to large poblano peppers
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 2 cups (1/2 liter) salsa verde (homemade or from a jar)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 1 small bunch fresh cilantro
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 1/2 cup Mexican crema (or sour cream)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d Oil for frying (optional)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 8 to 10 corn tortillas (cold, preferably leftover from the day before)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 3 to 4 cups chicken (cooked, shredded)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 1 1/2 cups mixed vegetables (cooked and well-drained, such as carrots, green beans, peas, corn kernels)
1b40434d-55bd-424f-a29c-db19da01975d 8 ounces (225 grams) shredded cheese (Chihuahua, Mexican Manchego, or some other kind that melts nicely)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 1/4 medium onion (diced)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 1 1/2 cups uncooked long-grain white rice
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 3 cloves garlic (finely chopped)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 2 1/2 cups chicken broth (homemade, canned, or made from bouillon cubes/powder)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c 1 cup tomato puree
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Optional: 4 heaping tablespoons fresh parsley (finely chopped)
c6760851-414b-4b53-b1af-fefde8773e4c Optional: 1/2 cup chopped vegetables (carrots, green beans, bell pepper, peas, etc.)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (or pork lard)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 1/4 cup onion (chopped)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 2 garlic cloves (diced)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 1 fresh serrano chile (or jalapeño chile, seeded and diced)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 3 cups fresh tomatoes (peeled and diced)
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c 1 tablespoon dried oregano
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Optional: 1/2 teaspoon ground dry chile
d8598e6d-8779-4362-8d88-c9000640057c Salt (to taste)
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 1/4 cup of olive oil
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 5 cloves of garlic, peeled and chopped
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 2 cups of seeded and diced tomatoes
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 1 medium-sized onion, sliced
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 4 pickled jalapeño peppers (canned or jarred), chopped
5381029c-fe7f-4b9f-8859-7b9cd6e634b1 5 green olives, coarsely chopped
